story:
Thank you to ABC, NBC, CBS, FOX News and 214 other news outlets for sharing our story!

 

So far we have interviewed... 

...and many more celebrities to be interviewed!

 

 

Born in 1932, Pat Morita battled spinal tuberculosis at the age of two. Morita spent nine years at a sanitarium in a body cast battling for his life. The day of his release he was escorted by FBI agents to join his family at Gila River interment center in Arizona but the reunion proved to be difficult. The Morita family moved to Fairfield, California after the war. He helped his father at his Chinese restaurant in Sacramento that they owned. Later, he landed a job with an aerospace firm. Around the time he was thirty, Morita abandoned his corporate career to be a comedian. He struggled for many years as a stand-up comic known as the “Hip Nip” in the nightclub circuit. Morita appeared in several TV series in the 1970s, including Sanford and Son, M.A.S.H, Welcome Back Kotter, Hawaii Five-O and many more. Later, Morita joined the cast of the 1970s sitcom Happy Days, he left the series after the first season to star in the short-lived comedy Mr. T and Tina; one of the first television shows to have an Asian American lead character. In 1982, Morita returned to Happy Days for its final season. In 1984, Morita saw his career reach new heights with his iconic role playing Mr. Miyagi in The Karate Kid that earned him a Golden Globe and an OSCAR nomination.

 

We've done it before and we'll do it again! Kevin Derek and Oscar Alvarez are teaming up again for their 3rd project. Our previous Documentary The Real Miyagi starring: Dolph Lundgren, Steven Seagal, Michael Jai White  and many others was the winner of 6 International Film Festival Awards for best documentary feature and is now available on NETFLIX 

IMDB LINK

 

TRAILER 

 

"Brilliant Film". "5 Stars" -Bobby Blakey -Dallas Movie Examiner 

"I highly recommend this film" -Paul Kazee - Meniscus Magazine

"Entertaining from the get go" - Ian Murphy - SCREEN PICKS

"The Real Miyagi is a superb documentary"- Eric S. Boisvert - Fantasia

"A new documentary looks back at Demura's astonishing, influential life.

Jen Yamato - The Daily Beast

 

 

 

Kevin attended Columbia College in Hollywood, California, earning his Bachelor of Arts degree in Motion Pictures in 1990.

Kevin has extensive experience in the movie industry both as producer, director and editor. Kevin’s first credit as a producer was The Ultimate Game, an action adventure, produced for the video market that sold worldwide. 

Derek also directed two documentary films about martial arts called Empty Hand  that premiered at the Academy Awards accredited film festival DOC NYC, and The Real Miyagi, about the man behind the biggest action star legends in Hollywood such as Bruce Lee and Chuck Norris starring Steven Seagal, Dolph Lundgren, Micheal Jai White and many others which has won 6 international awards. 

Derek is currently The Festival Director for the prestigious Irvine International Film Festival. Last year alone, 11 of the festival’s Official Selections were shortlisted for the Academy Awards, with nine OSCAR nominations between them. Seven-time Emmy winning actor Ed Asner (Up, The Mary Tyler Moore Show) and Academy Award winning director John G. Avildsen (Rocky), both of whom received Lifetime Achievement Awards at IIFF.

Interview with the L.A. Times

Oscar began his career in the entertainment industry as an actor. It was his time as an actor when he realized his true calling was behind the camera.

In July of 2004, he had an amazing opportunity to work with OSCAR Nominated Director, David O. Russell (Joy, American Hustle, Silver Linings Playbook, The Fighter) and came aboard his Iraq war documentary, SOLDIERS PAY as Production Manager.

Oscar continued on as Head of Production for the shooting of all the I HEART HUCKABEES supplemental materials, foreign and domestic, including the Jon Brion music video, KNOCK YOURSELF OUT with Mark Wahlberg/Jason Schwartzman, and the Dustin Hoffman/Lilly Tomlin infomercial, HOW AM I NOT MYSELF?  All the while, Oscar managed and oversaw the day-to-day operations of David O. Russell’s production company, KANZEON.

In 2011, Oscar teamed up with documentarian, Kevin Derek to produce the award winning feature documentary film, EMPTY HAND currently written up in Black Belt Magazine as “A MUST SEE...the first real Karate movie in years".

In 2012, Oscar teamed up with Producer, Todd Jeffery to create a cerebral comedy short film by Writer/Director, Dustin Thomas Cartmill called THE WOLF starring Zach Cregger, Caitriona Balfe and Frank Rautenbach.

In 2013, he teamed up again with Kevin Derek to produce his second feature documentary film, THE REAL MIYAGI featuring Dolph Lundgren, Steven Seagal, Michael Jai White, Tamlyn Tomita, Fumio Demura and the late Pat Morita.

In 2014, Oscar teamed up again with Producer/Writer/Director, Todd Jeffery in his Feature Thriller, NO ESCAPE starring Gabe Fazio (The Place Beyond the Pines) and BoJesse Christopher (Point Break) which is currently in post production.

The two documentary films produced by Oscar about martial arts did great in the festival circuit. Empty Hand  premiered at the Academy Awards accredited film festival DOC NYC and The Real Miyagi  has won 6 International Awards. 

Evelyn Guerrero , The wife of Pat Morita. She started her theatrical career at a young age and came from a show business family, as a result met Pat as a young girl. Her aunt Sally Marr was grooming Pat as a stand up comic at the time, but little did Evelyn realize she would one day marry Pat years later.

Evelyn went on to pursue a successful career of her own. Some of her credits includes "Bound by Honor" opposite Benjamin Bratt,  she starred in 3 Cheech and Chong films:  "Nice Dreams", "Next Movie" and "Things are Tough All Over", Guest starred in the Jean-Claude Van Damme film "Inferno" other notable credits include Luis Valdez series "Fort Figueroa",TV series, "I Married Dora", "Star Trek the Next Generation"and Series regular on TV series "Dallas"

She also guest starred on numerous episodic and T.V. series such as:  Hill St. Blues, Baretta, Police Woman, Quincy, Remington Steele, Matt Houston, Frank Cannon, The Colby's, Trapper John,  Santa Barbara, General Hospital,  Facts of Life and Chicken Soup, to name a few.

A Member of SAG, AFTRA and Equity. Studied with Stella Adler and Ralph Waite and a member of the Los Angeles Actors Theater

"It was Pat's dying wish to his wife, Evelyn to have his biography published or made into a film. So it's been her quest to full fill this promise."

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Our Perks can make a great Holiday Gift!  

Now you can support our campaign AND gift your perk to anyone in the world!

Here is the Custom Pat Morita Documentary T-Shirts and Postcard front and back.

 

Rare collectors items with an Original Signature by Pat Morita.

It's truly a one of a kind. Pat typically didn't sign headshots or movie posters, so they are very rare!
Each signed item will come with a Certificate of Authenticity from the Pat Morita Estate!
Full sized posters are 27"x41" and headshots are 8"x10". 

 

Miyagi Shirts!  Limited sizes and amounts available!

 

Gifts from our previous documentary! 

11x17 Movie Poster

 

WHAT WILL MY CONTRIBUTION PAY FOR?

This may be the only documentary film done on his life, but it's still an independent feature, which means small budgets will be stretched as far as they will go. We want to produce the best documentary possible to preserve his legacy.

As far as our funding goal, we are only asking for the bare minimum of what is needed to get this shot and in the can.

Pat Morita's family and colleagues that we need to interview live all over the United States. These are production costs and some of the money we raise will help to pay for travel expenses.

We plan on filming this project with 4K resolution cameras, so it's appealing to different distribution platforms, because that's where the technology is headed. Soon all TV stations are going to broadcast in 4K, and we want to be in line with what these distributors are looking for.

A big portion of the budget is for clearing the rights to studio footage that will make the final cut of the documentary film. Pat Morita has appeared in over 200 films and T.V shows combined. We need to pick wisely depending on the story and our budget, what we can afford.

In addition, your contribution will be used to pay for post production editing, sound mixing and music clearances.  This chart will help you understand how the funds raised will be allocated.

 

WHAT IF YOU RAISE MORE THAN 50K?

50K will definitely jump start our project!  We'll be able to finish shooting the documentary and get us into the post-production phase.
 
If we raise more than 50K "great" because then our "STRETCH GOAL" kicks in.  We can begin raising more funds for post, and start dealing with the negotiation process with the big studios regarding the astronomical cost of footage that we need to clear to be able tell his story properly. Pat has been in so many movies and TV shows, and we would like to incorporate those clips into the film, but it is VERY EXPENSIVE. We need to choose wisely and use our "STRETCH GOAL" to achieve this.
 
Finally, any additional money we raise in our "STRETCH GOAL" would help in promoting the film, so that we can have a limited theater release in LA and NYC to be able to get it qualified for Academy Award consideration.
 
 

WHERE WILL THE FILM BE RELEASED?

Our goal is to distribute Pat Morita's documentary film on NETFLIX and other VOD platforms like our previous doc, The Real Miyagi.  We had a lot of success and we were able to make it available worldwide for everyone to enjoy.

 

 

We understand that not everyone can contribute, but this film is for everyone. If you are unable to financially back this project, Pat Morita: Long Story Short, then we ask that you please help by sharing the campaign across all of your social media networks.  The more "Backers" we have and the more awareness we can build will definitely help us get closer to meeting our goal.  It's SO IMPORTANT to have this support from all of you.  We can't do it alone. Without everyone's effort it would be impossible, so we want to thank you in advance! GO TEAM PAT!

You can find us on Facebook so please SHARE our campaign now.

We’ve already received a massive amount of support from some very influential people in the film community, but their voices are not enough. Your support means more than anything to us, and we know that it would have meant the world to Mr. Morita. Please help us celebrate his life!
 
 

Frequently Asked Questions

 

What if you don't reach your funding goals?

Our goal is to execute our vision on telling Pat's story! This film will be made regardless, but we don't want to cut corners or compromise the picture in any way. Any funds not raised through IndieGoGo will be raised from private investors and other platforms. Our previous documentary, The Real Miyagi raised 50% of our budget via Indiegogo, and the rest came from a private Canadian investor who found us and helped close the gap. Thank you Pat Nevraumont, Executive Producer of The Real Miyagi!  In short, we don't want to slow down the process and kill the momentum, so that's why meeting our goal on Indiegogo is vital!

 

When will you start the documentary?

We have already begun a little bit of shooting. We are estimating about 4 months of filming. Then, we will begin the post-production process.

 

When will we receive the physical Perks?

All physical perks such as T-Shirts, Posters and Postcards will be mailed out ASAP, so that you can receive them before THIS holiday next month of December 2016!

 

When will we be able to get the digital download and the DVD of the film?

Legally, we would be able to provide the downloads once we have secured a distribution deal. Once the deal is made we would send you the link to download the film 10 days before the general public.

 

What happens if I move to a different address? How can I change my delivery address?

About the progress of the shipment, it will be announced in advance. You can then tell us if your address has changed.

 

 

Have questions? Email us 

Website: www.PatMoritaTheMovie.com

Link to the IMDB Page

story:
Hello,

My Name is Ben Zimmerman and I am an aspiring film maker living in Los Angeles, California. Since I was a boy I have had a passion for cinema, particularly works of fantasy. This year, I have been given an opportunity to direct a short film on a subject of my choosing. I am taking the opportunity to share my own work of fantasy. I have an incredibly talented production team already at work on pre-production for this project, but we need your help to make it a reality.

 About the Film- 

Longline- After deserting his post, a former soldier of a powerful kingdom is captured by a group of scavengers who attempt to turn him in for reward money.

Synopsis- In the land of Orneth, the great the northern kingdom known as Kishea has conquered most of the surrounding lands and enslaved its people.  After helping several civilians escape imprisonment, former soldier, Borin Quinnen abandons his post and escapes to another continent. After wandering in the desert for two days, Borin is picked up by a group of scavengers who have also escaped the tyranny of the northern kingdom. The scavengers decide to make their way across the desert and turn Borin in for reward money, leaving him to either escape or face certain death upon his return. 

 Why We Need Your Help-   
It is no secret that filmmaking is an expensive endeavor and it is no exception with a film of this aesthetic. Works of unrealistic fiction require many tools to create the world and a convincing environment in which the characters can roam. This is a form of period piece and we need your help, our audience, to acquire appropriate funding to make this film all it can be.
We currently have three producers on board for this project who have broken down our budget and concluded this film will take at least $25,000 to bring to life. 

This crowd funding endeavor will be split into the two campaigns. One, for pre-production/development, one for production.  

This campaign goal is in the amount of $12,500

Though this is a large figure, I believe it is attainable.
 Not a cent of funding will be used for any means unrelated to this project and will be used for (but no limited to) the following:

- Hiring a professional Cinematographer to bring the light and the color of our world to life and create stimulating visuals for our audience. 
-  A production designer to create and craft our sets and sculpt the environment our characters will live in.
- Transportation for our cast and crew.
- A costume designer and prop master to bring out the unique personality and tone to the characters.    
- A stunt coordinator to ensure realistic and vigorous scenes of combat that our heroes will encounter.
- Location fees in order to to bring our world to life and display the most beautiful setting possible on the screen.
-ETC.

Even if the full funding goal is not reached, every cent will go to the film. 

 Director's Statement-
 I once read a quote that said, “Fantasy is not a way to escape reality, but a means to understand it.” The most powerful works of fantasy have moved us not only because of the far off lands and mystical events, but because we were able to relate to the characters. I feel that escapist cinema is one of the most powerful ways to explore humanity and invites the audience into a world that they are meant to belong in for a few hours. As a fan of great fantasy epics, I feel it is important to give an audience a sense of hope and empathy in the world you create as a filmmaker. I have often found myself looking to far off, fictional lands when I need a sense of belonging and when the real word does not make sense. The key to helping your audience get lost in your world is to ground them with relatable characters who possess human elements. As a filmmaker and audience member, I want the audience to relate to my characters and learn things about themselves and others in a medium that they may not expect. Often times we need a way of understanding life, and sometimes the best way to do that is to look at the world through a different set of eyes. 

The Importance of Our Audience-
No film is made only for a the filmmaker. Ultimately the ones we make films for are our audience. The audience are the ones who will hopefully be inspired and entertained by our work. 

My production team and I cannot make this film without you, and we have no purpose in making this film without you, which is why we want to give you the best story and world we can possibly put on the screen. With your contribution, this dream can be a reality.

This is a large undertaking with many moving parts, and it is as much a risk for us, the production team, as it is for our audience and investors. With your help; however, I truly believe our dream is achievable.

Other Ways to Help-
Every little bit helps in reaching our goal, but if you cannot contribute financially, please spread this page around. Nothing you do to make noise about our film is useless. :) 

I want to thank everyone who took the time read over this campaign, and all our supporters. My production team and I plan to give you the best film we can.

A full visual breakdown can also be viewed in this article, including descriptions of our characters and story. 

Thank you all for your support.
Ben Zimmerman - Director/Writer

Works of unrealistic fiction require many tools to create the world and a convincing environment in which the characters can roam. This is a form of period piece and we need your help, our audience, to acquire appropriate funding to make this film all it can be. We currently have three producers on board for this project who have broken down our budget and concluded this film will take at least $25,000 to bring to life. This crowd funding endeavor will be split into the two campaigns. One, for pre-production/development, one for production.  This campaign goal is in the amount of $12,500Though this is a large figure, I believe it is attainable. Not a cent of funding will be used for any means unrelated to this project and will be used for (but no limited to) the following:- Hiring a professional Cinematographer to bring the light and the color of our world to life and create stimulating visuals for our audience. -  A production designer to create and craft our sets and sculpt the environment our characters will live in.- Transportation for our cast and crew.- A costume designer and prop master to bring out the unique personality and tone to the characters.    - A stunt coordinator to ensure realistic and vigorous scenes of combat that our heroes will encounter.- Location fees in order to to bring our world to life and display the most beautiful setting possible on the screen.-ETC.Even if the full funding goal is not reached, every cent will go to the film.  Director's Statement- I once read a quote that said, “Fantasy is not a way to escape reality, but a means to understand it.” The most powerful works of fantasy have moved us not only because of the far off lands and mystical events, but because we were able to relate to the characters. I feel that escapist cinema is one of the most powerful ways to explore humanity and invites the audience into a world that they are meant to belong in for a few hours. As a fan of great fantasy epics, I feel it is important to give an audience a sense of hope and empathy in the world you create as a filmmaker. I have often found myself looking to far off, fictional lands when I need a sense of belonging and when the real word does not make sense. The key to helping your audience get lost in your world is to ground them with relatable characters who possess human elements. As a filmmaker and audience member, I want the audience to relate to my characters and learn things about themselves and others in a medium that they may not expect. Often times we need a way of understanding life, and sometimes the best way to do that is to look at the world through a different set of eyes. The Importance of Our Audience-No film is made only for a the filmmaker. Ultimately the ones we make films for are our audience. The audience are the ones who will hopefully be inspired and entertained by our work. My production team and I cannot make this film without you, and we have no purpose in making this film without you, which is why we want to give you the best story and world we can possibly put on the screen. With your contribution, this dream can be a reality.This is a large undertaking with many moving parts, and it is as much a risk for us, the production team, as it is for our audience and investors. With your help; however, I truly believe our dream is achievable.Other Ways to Help-Every little bit helps in reaching our goal, but if you cannot contribute financially, please spread this page around. Nothing you do to make noise about our film is useless. :) I want to thank everyone who took the time read over this campaign, and all our supporters. My production team and I plan to give you the best film we can.A full visual breakdown can also be viewed in this article, including descriptions of our characters and story. Thank you all for your support.Ben Zimmerman - Director/Writer

story:
One Foot In

#women1footIN 

This documentary wants to raise awareness of the challenges expat women face when building a life in the US. 

We are giving a voice to women who want to share their stories and the impact that immigration laws have on their lives. 

Did you know that more than 70% of H1B visas go to men? The laws are for both men and women but the latter pays a higher price. In this documentary we will explain to you why.

We asked subject experts for their opinions and we asked expat women to tell us their inspiring stories of resilience. 

We want to shed a light on the side effects of the broken immigration system and hidden gender bias behind the immigration laws. 

Help us complete this documentary and create a social impact.

What Inspired Us

I am Chiara Townley and I am originally from Italy. I wrote my first book, called "2 years 4 months 2 hours", because I wanted to share the love story that brought me to the United States. After I was reunited with my love, I found another big obstacle: the Immigration laws. 

As soon as I had one foot in the United States I started to hear many inspiring and challenging stories from expat women. 

These stories deeply touched me and inspired me to write a book so these voices could be heard. Enrica Cavalli, an experienced video producer from Italy, was also very touched by these stories and offered her help to create a documentary to make these voices be heard.

 

How You Can Help

  1. Back the Project: to help us complete the documentary and raise awareness. Even just $5 goes a long way! 
  2. Help us Spread the Word: Even if you can't donate, sharing the link in your social networks with your family and friends means a lot to us. #women1footIN
  3. Follow Us:  check us out in Facebook and Twitter for more information and updates.
  4. Connect With Us: If you want to tell us your story or you have any questions send us an e-mail at expatwomenusa@gmail.com

story:
Benny Laubach has touched the lives of many.  He was truly a one of a kind man with an infectious sense of humor and humble heart that will not be forgotten.
We are family and friends of Benny and his family in Texas.   This fund is in honor of him and to offer support to those he loved unconditionally.  The funds will contribute to the costs associated with funeral arrangements, specifically the expense of his headstone and to alleviate accruing cost during this time for his beloved wife Sherry and their family.

story:
Drone Flight Battery: It’s the significant part for the drone to provide you every enjoyable flight.

It is essential to store and maintain your flight battery correctly and properly to avoid damage or injury.

That’s why we created the Adaptom3 SE, a smart battery management safety guard for DJI Phantom3 series.

Adaptom3 SE is a smart adapter, specially created to help you correctly store and maintain your Phantom 3 series flight batteries. It makes your battery maintenance and storage process easier, faster and safer.

1. Two modes designed to better suit your individual needs in discharging the battery:

1) Full-discharging function: the battery can be fully discharged by using this function.

                                      

◊ Fully discharges your flight battery before carrying it on an airline flight.

◊ Fully discharges your battery to proceed with some deep charge-discharge cycles, so as to increase the optimal performance of your new battery or stored battery which has a “passivation” problem.

2) Conditioned auto-discharging function: the battery will automatically discharge to its nominal voltage.


◊ Discharges the flight battery to its nominal voltage(15.2V) prior to storing or transporting it.

2. Extensive Function:

Adaptom3 SE changes your battery into a power bank to charge USB devices!

With Adaptom3 SE, the power can be reused when the battery needs to be discharged, even the Remaining Juice of the battery can be used to full charge an iPhone 6S though the battery does not support a flight anymore.

1. Compact Design

Adaptom3 SE consists of a simply designed housing and a discharging management PCBA board.

2. Plug & Play


How does it work?

Adaptom3 SE requires a simple connection with your DJI Phantom3 Flight battery and an external USB device to work with, such as the provided 10W USB light and your smartphone...

Why Adaptom3 SE?

1. Battery maintenance and storage:

a. Battery should be discharged to a safe level (35%-50%) for a long-term storage to ensure the battery safety and extend the battery life.

b. “Passivation” presents a problem if a new battery( or stored battery) repeatedly recharged without a periodic full discharge. Hence battery needs some deep charge-discharge cycles to improve its optimal performance before practical application.

Otherwise, battery level may drop during flight and affect the safety of your drone flight. Failure to use or store the battery in a proper safe way could cause serious injury or damage to your drone or other property.

2. Traveling with your drone(Battery in airplane)

High capacity battery is prohibited to carry on an airline flight unless it is fully discharged ahead of time.

For safety, when you have to travel with your drone, the battery should be first discharged to a level that is allowed to carry or deliver, thus avoiding serious injury and damage (property damage/collateral Damage) caused by battery explosion or fire in the course of transit.

You might have been learning “how to” tutorial videos or tips & information about battery maintenance, storage and tricks and have been looking an easy way to correctly store and maintain your flight batteries, that being said, there was no such way that we can access to easily.

We gonna fix this with Adaptom3 SE!

TELESIN team had created a safe and fast way for Phantom3 users to store and care their flight battery pretty easily.

With plug and play feature and standard USB compatibility, Adaptom3 SE enables users to discharge batteries with any USB devices, and it only takes few hours for the whole process.  In short, Adaptom3 SE is specially designed for every Phantom3 users at affordable price!

Adaptom3 SE is an innovative departure from the current battery discharging board in the market. Tiny, but powerful and versatile.

It is not just designed to bring your battery life up but also power up your life with the extensive charging function! This allows you to reuse the "discharged power" optionally, so that you can save power as possible as you can.

BE SMART & BE GREEN

             -Discharge your battery and charge your devices simultaneously.


About TELESIN

We are a team of inventors, engineers, and photography enthusiasts.

TELESIN has been working on making accessories for branded sports cameras (GoPro) for 3 years, we are committed to making innovative products easy to use and accessible to everyone and creating new way for users to fully utilize and/or protect their devices.

With 3 years’ experience of producing GoPro and other action cameras accessories and seeing the market demands, we decided to expand our product line to provide innovative accessories for DJI drone series.

Adaptom3 SE first came about as an idea last year to improve on the current DJI battery discharging board and making it a completed product for Phantom users to use it as convenient as possible.

From Designing and Engineering, to Manufacturing and Quality Control, we are equipped with experience of the whole process to develop a brand new and exciting product to better suit your needs, we definitely are able to deliver Adaptom3 SE with features as claimed.  

Like else innovative products and ideas TELESIN successfully brang to the global market, we gonna make Adaptom3 SE one of those among our great product as well!

This is just the beginning, we have tremendous aspirations to keep developing series of DJI products to excite you.

FAQs

1. Does Adaptom3 SE compatible with any Battery of DJI drones?

At this time only DJI Phantom3 series is supported. We are planning to design a series for other models of DJI drones in future development of the product.

2. Will the Adaptom3 SE damage my battery in any way?

No, we have completed months of laboratory and repeated tests to ensure the Adaptom3 SE does not damage your battery in any way.

3. Does Adaptom3 SE include a DJI Phantom3 battery ?

No, Adaptom3 SE does not include DJI P3 battery. You must have your own DJI Phantom3 battery to use Adaptom3 SE.

4. How long does it take to fully discharge my DJI P3 battery with Adaptom3 SE ？

It only takes few hours (around 6 hours) to fully discharge a full battery with provided 10W USB light, and about one hour to fully discharge a "Low Batery".

5. What will I receive exactly if I pledge now?

You will receive a Adaptom3 SE, and a 10W USB light.

6. What payment options do I have?

You can pay via credit card or PayPal. Select a perk and you'll see the available payment methods at checkout.

7. I paid for the wrong perk. How can I get a refund?

No worries. While the campaign is live, you can follow these steps here.

8. How much is the shipping and handling?

We provide FREE shipping to WORLDEWIDE. An extra shipping fee of $5 USD will be charged with the Adaptom3 SE Pro Kit for other countries except China.

When ordering your Adaptom3SE, you're responsible for assuring the product can be legally imported to the destination country. Any local taxes, duties and VAT taxes in the local country will be the responsibility of the backer not TELESIN.

9. How will my order be shipped?

All orders will be shipping with the most suitable premium courier and that will vary  from country to country. All shipments will arrive packaged in our premium retail packing with protection to ensure your Adaptom3 SE arrives in good condition.

10. Which countries do you ship to?

We ship to all countries excluding the following which have been flagged by courier services as restricted or high risk: Belarus, Cote d'Ivoire, Cuba, Democratic Republic of the Congo, Iran, Iraq, Lebanon, Liberia, North Korea, Sierra Leone, Sudan, Syria & Zimbabwe. If you would like a shipment to any these countries we will make alternative arrangements that may cost more, however we cannot guarantee the shipment's arrival.

11. When will you be shipping Adaptom3 SE?

We expect to ship out all of our Adaptom3 SE by August 2016.

12. What is the warranty policy for Adaptom3 SE?

Adaptom3 will be covered underone-year warranty. We will accept 1 for 1 exchange for any faulty product within the period of 1 week after you received it.

13. Distributors/Resellers?

You can first purchase Adaptom3 SE here on INDIEGOGO for initial samples and email us at sales01@telesin.cn  or sales02@telesin.cn

with your details, and we will follow up from there.

14. Any other questions or concerns?
We are just an email away.
Please feel free to shoot us a message to service@telesin.cn

story:
Bina McLoughlin

“She was a queen by name and nature.”

“She was one hell of a woman.”

Only Bina McLoughlin, who dazzled a small region of Ireland for 70 years as the “Queen of the Connemara” could elicit such colourful and conflicted descriptions.

Dressed in flowing colourful shawls with dark black ringlets and a booming voice, Bina McLoughlin seems like a character from a different era – or straight out of a fairytale.

She was such a dominant figure in the region of Country Galway, Ireland where she lived (and eventually died) that she became known as the "Queen of Connemara". Visitors to the cottage were entertained by a never-ending supply of stories and a great repertoire of ballads. What is perhaps most interesting about her, however, is that many locals were convinced that she had the ability to hex them with curses. Callers to the radio station she occasionally appeared on would beg her to lift her spells.

Bina was the part shepherdess, storyteller, ballad singer, actress, local celebrity, animal lover, political aficionado and – some say – even a witch. She was as loved as she was feared. A true enigmatic personality. 

The Legend of Bina McLoughlin: Queen of the Connemara

This is the first narrative account of the woman’s extraordinary life on the Maab Turk mountain in Country Galway, Ireland. Much more than a biography, Queen of the Connemara is an expose of a vivid life shrouded in mystery, magic and hidden money. Regarded as both enchanting and enchantress, many locals believed she had the power to curse them and often called into a local radio station on which she occasionally appeared to beg her to lift her curses. 


Bina had many famous friends, including a close friendship with the minister,Eamon O Coiv, who is the grandson of the famous,Eamon De Valera. Minister Coiv let her use a cottage of his when her house burned down. After her death in 2001, she left her entire estate to him (worth millions) but he declined it. Many who knew her were shocked to discover the hidden wealth of a woman they thought they knew.

THE PLAN

We have laid the ground work. All is fully set for the film production. Our plan is to finance the whole film ourselves, using crowdfunding and soft money as well as any other money that will allow us to be completely independent, allowing us to make and distribute the film exactly the way we believe it needs to be made.
We want to be dependent on nobody but our fans, friends and followers out there. We did our best and spent all of our energy in trying to finance the film. We were almost forced to cut corners and to compromising a bit. We had maintained the authenticity of the story.  The integrity of the story is intact. We don't want to be coerced to alter the story. We don't want to spend many years waiting, trying to come up with the money. We want to keep all the control over the production and distribution to ourselves.


TIMELINE

We will commence work on the script immediately, and we have the intention of getting it finished. The final draft of the script will be ready by the end of 2016. The first draft will be ready by the middle of 2015. We plan on concluding the shooting by 2017.

story:
Let's give life back to the families of people with serious diseases

While India is famous for many things, a not so known fact is about the rising number of terminal diseases including cancer, kidney and heart diseases in many Indian cities. Doctors consider this is due to poor living conditions and lack of awareness of proper food habits among many people.

Among the Indian states, the small South Indian state of Kerala tells a scary story of sufferings and deprivation due to terminal illnesses. 

For example a 2015 data indicates that one in 135 people in the Kottayam region in the state of Kerala in India falls victim of cancer each year. Overall, there are around 35,000 new cancer patients each year in the state of Kerala alone, and over 100,000 prevalent cases annually with most of them under extreme financial stress and struggling to treat their disease.

Government resources and support system to help such people are inadequate. Many government hospitals have inadequate facilities and support systems for poor patients. 

Many people who manage to secure treatment in heavily populated government hospitals often sleep rough on footpaths and bus station benches while visiting distant towns where these hospitals are located. 

Many households of people with terminal illness in several regions in Kerala especially small business owners and farmers live under the threat of losing their livelihood as well as their loved ones due to the enormous cost of treatment and inadequate insurance arrangement. They often fall victims of debt from money lenders and eventually lose their businesses and homes. Due to this pathetic situation, many opt not to treat and surrender to death in agonising pain.  

Many mediocre people who lead a decent life and work hard, die poor after a few months or years of treatment. Often their dependants become homeless and struggle to lead a decent life as their homes and other assets are sold or confiscated by money lenders from whom they borrowed money for the treatment of their loved ones.


About the K.S Raju Foundation

K.S Raju Foundation was established to help such people with terminal illnesses and their families. 

K S Raju a veteran businessman from the small town of Pala in the state of Kerala in India surrendered to cancer on 4 March 2016. He was a generous human being who helped many around him. He was very particular to ensure the left hand didn’t know the right hand’s givings. His survivors came to know about his generocity to many only after his demise.

In Raju’s case there was only a 10 weeks period between diagnosis of this dreadful disease and his demise. But in this short journey Raju and his family encountered the hard realities of financial stress and uncertainties in the lives of the dependent employees of his business. 

They also witnessed the plight of many unfortunate fellow human beings fighting with similar conditions.  

That said, Raju was fortunate to have two sons whom he educated well to be independent of his small business - one an executive within the Australian Government and the other an IT Professional in Australia. 

They supported their father for his treatment and funded the business to address some challenges it had to face in the absence of its guiding spirit. 

But the whole experience of the survivors of Raju in their hard times provided them a clear understanding of the gruesome fate of many others in the region facing similar conditions, with no such help that Raju and his employees received. 

What would the KS Raju Foundation do to address the problem? 

The Foundation aims to ease the financial burden on people with serious illness by providing for their treatment thereby protecting them from falling victims of debt trap and homelessness.

Where the seriously ill person is the soul earner of a family, the Foundation will support the family by supporting the survivors to earn a living and provide interim support to meet living cost and children's education.

The foundation will partner with like-minded charity organisations in the region to develop free decent accommodation around government hospitals for poor patients from distant places visiting these hospital for treatment.  

The organisation will also engage social workers to provide emotional support for patients and their families and help them comeback to life without losing their homes and livelihood. On-the ground presence of volunteer social workers at the Government Hospitals would ensure the most eligible people are identified and assisted financially with the resources available to the Foundation.  

Funding Plan 

Full ongoing profits from Raju's surviving business after a small employee ownership share has been committed to this project. This would support a small number of people (2-3 people)

Your help today will help many more to face the challenges posed by serious illness and help them comeback to life. 

Returns from a highly secure endowment fund and other securely managed assets of $2.5 million will support around 90 people and their families each year. This means your one-off support today will help over 300 people including family members of seriously ill people each year. (An example of returns from the fund:  interest offered by private and public sector banks in India for fixed deposit and bonds is around 10%. Interest on a $2.5 million fund would be sufficient for basic support for around 90 families each year, which would help around 400  people out of poverty each year. 

From our experience, we understand that assistance over a period of 12-18 months would enable a family to overcome their financial stress due to treatment cost and other uncertainties (each family's circumstances varies, but generally support over this period would help come back to life in most cases). This means the target funding would help more than 1000 people over the next four years. 

The Foundation will ensure that the entire funds reach target recipients. 

Concluding Plea

The Foundation kindly request your soul hearted support for this project. Your generosity today means life for many for many years to come. 

We kindly request you to join hands with us to help hundreds and hundreds of people and their families suffering from the burden caused by serious and terminal diseases and give life to people around us. 

Key Foundation members

Sebastian Mathew

The President of the Foundation (unpaid voluntary position) is a Commonwealth of Australia Public Servant for over 10 years. He currently works as the Director of a unit advising the Australian Government’s Senior Economic Ministers on the national Budget matters. Sebastian has committed time to establish the network of volunteers and operational arrangments to roll out the services of the Foundation in India.
Email: sebastian.mathew@iinet.net.au

Joseph Raju

The Vice President and Public Officer (unpaid voluntary position) is an Information Technology Consultant. He has been engaged in several private and public sector projects. Joseph has also committed time to assist in the roll out of the works of the Foundation.  
Email: joseph.raju8990@gmail.com

The foundation also include over 20 volunteer members currently to assist with its work.
story_txt:
Let's give life back to the families of people with serious diseases
While India is famous
for many things, a not so known fact is about the rising number of terminal diseases
including cancer, kidney and heart diseases in many Indian cities. Doctors consider
this is due to poor living conditions and lack of awareness of proper food
habits among many people. 
Among the Indian states, the small South Indian
state of Kerala tells a scary story of sufferings and deprivation due to
terminal illnesses. 
For example a 2015 data indicates that one in 135
people in the Kottayam region in the state of Kerala in India falls victim of
cancer each year. Overall, there are around 35,000 new cancer patients each
year in the state of Kerala alone, and over 100,000 prevalent cases annually
with most of them under extreme financial stress and struggling to treat their
disease. 
Government resources
and support system to help such people are inadequate. Many government
hospitals have inadequate facilities and support systems for poor
patients. 
Many people who manage
to secure treatment in heavily populated government hospitals often sleep rough
on footpaths and bus station benches while visiting distant towns where these
hospitals are located. 
Many households of people with terminal illness in
several regions in Kerala especially small business owners and farmers live
under the threat of losing their livelihood as well as their loved ones due to
the enormous cost of treatment and inadequate insurance arrangement. They often
fall victims of debt from money lenders and eventually lose their businesses
and homes. Due to this pathetic situation, many opt not to treat and surrender
to death in agonising pain.  
Many mediocre people who
lead a decent life and work hard, die poor after a few months or years of
treatment. Often their dependants become homeless and struggle to lead a decent
life as their homes and other assets are sold or confiscated by money lenders
from whom they borrowed money for the treatment of their loved ones.

story:
Short Summary

Afrikin Fest is an African inspired festival aimed to attract the best chefs, rum and wine connoisseurs, musical and fine artists, thought leaders and innovators from around the world to the infamous cultural hub of Miami, Florida. 

Miami will be completely transformed through fascinating sights, smells, and sounds during this weekend celebration from November 18-20, 2016.

The event proceeds will benefit Give Me Dignity, an organization that raises awareness about and provides resources for survivors of Childhood Sexual Abuse (CSA).  


What We Need & What You Get

  • We are raising $125,000 for festival costs which include, but are not limited to: production, promotion, talent, venue, and other related expenses.
  • The funds will also foster development of an app to enhance the festival experience. The app will enable event patrons to view a map of the festival grounds, food villages, the list of performers and set times, the ability to add favorites, and create a personalized schedule that can be shared via social media.
  • We appreciate and will accept any donation amount you can offer, and we are happy to provide event perks for donors who make contributions starting at $225.


The Impact

Afrikin Fest goes beyond music and art to highlight the ingenuity, economic, and social opportunity of one of the world’s fastest-growing regions - Africa. 


TALKS

Talks and workshops will be presented by influencers in technology, education, international relations, activism and business, in an effort to connect you to industry leaders that represent the diaspora.


CUISINE

We’re creating a culinary experience that will rival any food festival and wine tasting. We’re curating the finest in African cuisines, topping off the experience with cooking demonstrations by celebrity chefs.


INNOVATION

Innovation is key, and this will be evident by the companies and products that will be present at our exhibitions and as vendors throughout Afrikin Fest weekend. We’re talking trailblazers, up-and-comers of the diaspora who have identified gaps in the market, developed solutions, have a presence in the marketplace and are ready to present their ideas to investors to take them to the next level.


MUSIC & ART

A musical and artistic experience will still be had, with world-class performers and art installations that will remind us of our history and encourage us to take hold of our future.

The event will simultaneously highlight the importance of the Black Dollar, which continues to rise as the percentage of people of color within the middle class increases.

ULTIMATELY...

The event proceeds will benefit Give Me Dignity, an organization with a resounding voice against childhood sexual abuse (CSA). 60% of Black girls experience sexual abuse before the age of 18, and 30% of Black women with documented histories of childhood sexual abuse are sexually assaulted in adulthood (Sexual Abuse and the Code of Silence in the Black Community, Cherise Charleswell, 2014).  We recognize our responsibility to better the lives of others and the communities we serve, and this event will inspire others to do the same. 


Other Ways You Can Help

  • Get the word out and make some noise about our Indiegogo campaign!
  • Make sure to use the Indiegogo share tools after you make your donation.

Thank you very much for assisting us in our mission to advance the ingenuity, economic and social opportunity of the world's fastest growing region!

story:
Short Summary

We're Sophie and Fiona - identical twins who are a creative team. Seeing some of the shocking effects of the EU Referendum we thought we'd put our conceptual brains to good use, to try and help repair some of the damage that the Brexit has caused to our communities.

We want to create a range of accessories and tees that you can wear to show your solidarity and support for diversity in the UK.  Regardless of how you voted in the Referendum, you can make a difference by helping to fund this project. In return you'll get a tee, badge, wristband or bag to show that you vote IN with love and OUT with hate. These will  be posted to you within 10 days of the funding deadline, after we get printing and packaging them up for you. Delivery is FREE!

To truly make a difference, for every tee or accessory you fund, we will make a donation to Migrant Help UK - a charity who offer support, guidance and accommodation to  migrants across the UK.  www.migranthelpuk.org

So please help fund it, wear it and share it.


What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise funds to create the 'IN with love OUT with hate' range. So simply pick a level of funding to receive the tee or accessory you would like.

  • £2 funding for a Badge
  • £5 funding for a Wristband
  • £7 funding for a Doggy Bandana
  • £10 funding for a Tote Bag
  • £12 funding for a Cropped Tee
  • £15 funding for a Men's Tee
  • £15 funding for a Woman's Tee

The main costs we need to cover will be the printing, packaging and posting. We estimate that to kick start our first print run of tees and accessories we will need £3000. But the more funding we get, the more we can make and the more support, love and donations we can spread.

story:
Start Putting Your Visions, Dreams and Plans Into Action.

Join the DO BIG THINGS movement: DOBIGTHINGS.net

Help us spread the word on Social Media using the campaign hashtag #DOBIGTHINGS! Connect with us on Facebook, Twitter & Instagram!

DO BIG THINGS, 

Are you living or are you just surviving? 

Maybe you're like the 70% of Americans who hate getting up every single day and going into a job they despise? Maybe you feel you're not living with purpose and passion? Perhaps you have a great idea for a business, but want to play it safe so you're not acting on it? Or maybe you have tried or have see others try and fail, so you're scared of taking action? 

My fellow visionaries, I was there too! Monday mornings were the worst day of the week. Every Sunday evening I went to bed knowing that the next day I had to get up and help someone else fulfill their dreams while mine stayed hidden in the background. I was scared of failure and had the same concerns you do about money and taking care of my family. 

Our Story

My good friend Travis felt the same way, but just like him we knew if we did nothing we both would continue to be miserable and never fulfill our lives purpose. We both knew if we did not try, it would be worse than staying and just surviving. We had our own legacy we wanted to leave and desired to have a positive impact on the world around us.  That's when we both started living. We took actions and started doing BIG THINGS. 

Les Brown has famously said it best. "The graveyard is the richest place on earth, because it is here that you will find all the hopes and dreams that were never fulfilled, the books that were never written, the songs that were never sung, the inventions that were never shared, the cures that were never discovered, all because someone was too afraid to take that first step, keep with the problem, or determined to carry out their dream."

Do you want to take your vision to the grave with you? I don't believe so...Neither did Travis or I. Though life is not perfect, and this entrepreneurial action-taking journey has not been easy, it's definitely been worth it. Travis and I are right in the middle of our endeavors and have both experienced difficulties as well as rewards. But the important thing is, we are in the game!

Travis is the creator of “Live Yes, And!”. He is a Performance Coach, Speaker, Improvisational actor, Podcast Host and he recently published his first book “3 Words for Getting Unstuck: Live Yes, And!”  

I'm the founder of The Sales Evangelist, a Sales Trainer, an award-winning Speaker and Host of "The Sales Evangelist" podcast. 

We all need a little help

Knowing how difficult this journey can be, when we connected we wanted to create a way to help others like you overcome your challenges and take action. Both of us were passionate about creating  an event to offer the inspiration, education and community support to take action and DO BIG THINGS.  

Our goal is to make it a unique conference by having a mastermind collaborative aspect built in. Attendees would have the opportunity to have a plan in place before they leave after the two-day event. Our 12 amazing speakers have taken action and can offer specific plans on how you can start doing your own BIG THINGS. 

As you may know, this is not an easy task, but we are not going to let a little difficulty hold us back. We know as we come together as a community, we can make this happen in November. 

What We Need & What You Get

We have found a really cool location in the heart of West Palm Beach called the EMKO. It's not a stuffy hotel conference room, but rather a unique creative environment. It's close to downtown, the airport, and of course the beach. We purposely want to keep the event small this year and will only be offering 120 tickets MAX live at the event!

To pull this off we need about $8,800 to secure the facility, paying for equipment, creating marketing/promotional products, T-Shirts, AV production and logistics. 

Here is a breakdown of the event: 

Wednesday Nov 2, 2016:

  • 9am-12pm-VIP Workshop 
  • 6pm-8:30pm-VIP Dinner

Thursday Nov 3, 2016:   

  • 8am-11:15am-Welcome Session and Speaker Presentations 
  • 11:20am-12:00pm-Collaboration Masterminds
  • 12:00-1:00pm-Lunch
  • 1:00pm-4:00-Speaker Presentations 
  • 4:15-5:00pm-Collaboration Masterminds
  • 7:00pm-9:00pm-Improv Show and Networking (Did I mention Travis is part of an Improv crew) 

Friday Nov 4, 2016:       

  • 8am-11:15am- Speaker Presentations 
  • 11:20am-12:00pm-Collaboration Masterminds
  • 12:00-1:00pm-Lunch
  • 1:00pm-4:00-Speaker Presentations 
  • 4:15-5:00pm-Collaboration Masterminds
  • 5:00pm-5:30-Closing Ceremony and Video 

As we mentioned above, our goal is to help you DO BIG THINGS. Whatever portion you're able to contribute, it will help us, even if we don't hit our goal. 

Why You Should Join

This whole event and the DO BIG THINGS movement is bigger than all of us. We can't do it alone. Speaking from experience, I was fortunate to have a mastermind group and mentors to support me when I initially started out.

Our goal is to give you a head start. We don't want you to have to try to reinvent the wheel and while making the same mistakes we have made along the way. 

As you join us, you will get access to the following:

  • Education from world-class, action-taking entrepreneurs and industry leaders
  • Become a member of a small mastermind of like-minded people
  • Develop a clear plan of action to implement your idea or entrepreneurial venture
  • Attend a networking get together at the conference 
  • Have fun at the improv show
  • Join a community of motivated actions-takers who will help you DO BIG THINGS!

Risks & Challenges

As Mark Zuckerberg stated, "The biggest risk is not taking any risk... In a world that's changing really quickly, the only strategy that is guaranteed to fail is not taking risks".  

Are there going to be risk with this project? Yes, but that's what life's about. If we had not taken the risk of leaving our corporate jobs and doing our own thing, Travis and I would not be here putting on this event today.

I have organized large events and assisted on the leadership team for TEDx Delray Beach. There are many different things that can go wrong, but that is why Travis and our team are working tirelessly to ensure all the measures are in place for a successful outcome. We promise to be accountable to you and the DO BIG THINGS community. 
 

Other Ways You Can Help

There are many ways you can assist us. Here are a few:

  • Contribute and back the event in some way...every little bit counts. 
  • Spread the word on your social media and amongst family and friends.  
  • Become an official DO BIG THINGS Evangelist and spread the word about the event (Drop us an email and ask us how).
  • Volunteer for the actual event. 
  • Sponsor the event, or help us find potential sponsors. 
  • Becoming one of our Collaboration Mastermind Group Facilitators.

Doing BIG THINGS takes a lot of people. Are you willing to help us?

1:00pm-4:00-Speaker Presentations 

4:15-5:00pm-Collaboration Masterminds

7:00pm-9:00pm-Improv Show and Networking (Did I mention Travis is part of an Improv crew) 


Friday Nov 4, 2016:       

8am-11:15am- Speaker Presentations 

11:20am-12:00pm-Collaboration Masterminds

12:00-1:00pm-Lunch

1:00pm-4:00-Speaker Presentations 

4:15-5:00pm-Collaboration Masterminds

5:00pm-5:30-Closing Ceremony and Video 


As we mentioned above, our goal is to help you DO BIG THINGS. Whatever portion you're able to contribute, it will help us, even if we don't hit our goal. 

Why You Should Join
This whole event and the DO BIG THINGS movement is bigger than all of us. We can't do it alone. Speaking from experience, I was fortunate to have a mastermind group and mentors to support me when I initially started out.
Our goal is to give you a head start. We don't want you to have to try to reinvent the wheel and while making the same mistakes we have made along the way. 
As you join us, you will get access to the following:

Education from world-class, action-taking entrepreneurs and industry leaders
Become a member of a small mastermind of like-minded people
Develop a clear plan of action to implement your idea or entrepreneurial venture
Attend a networking get together at the conference 
Have fun at the improv show
Join a community of motivated actions-takers who will help you DO BIG THINGS!


Risks & Challenges
As Mark Zuckerberg stated, "The biggest risk is not taking any risk... In a world that's changing really quickly, the only strategy that is guaranteed to fail is not taking risks".  
Are there going to be risk with this project? Yes, but that's what life's about. If we had not taken the risk of leaving our corporate jobs and doing our own thing, Travis and I would not be here putting on this event today.
I have organized large events and assisted on the leadership team for TEDx Delray Beach. There are many different things that can go wrong, but that is why Travis and our team are working tirelessly to ensure all the measures are in place for a successful outcome. We promise to be accountable to you and the DO BIG THINGS community.  

Other Ways You Can Help
There are many ways you can assist us. Here are a few:

Contribute and back the event in some way...every little bit counts. 
Spread the word on your social media and amongst family and friends.  
Become an official DO BIG THINGS Evangelist and spread the word about the event (Drop us an email and ask us how).
Volunteer for the actual event. 
Sponsor the event, or help us find potential sponsors. 
Becoming one of our Collaboration Mastermind Group Facilitators.

Doing BIG THINGS takes a lot of people. Are you willing to help us?

story:
Never Alone - Story

Bella and her younger sister (Flo) loose their sister (Maddy) in tragic fall. Flo remembers the conversation with Maddy about Moving on and keeping strong, Flo is determined to make her sister proud. Bella finds it more challenging especially when Maddy comes back as a ghost, but only in Bella's eyes, will Bella ever be able to move on, and will it cost the relationship with her family?


Who am I?

- Hi! I'm Liv, A 14 year old actress and film-maker!

I know you may be thinking that I'm too young to write and direct a film but I am a highly ambitious and determined girl, and I already have a experience acting and in-front of the camera!

I've had this idea for quite a while now and it's too important to me to only go half-way! That's why we need your help!

I've been acting since I was tiny and have been writing stories since I was 5! I'm very excited about working on this short film and casting it too!

I've been trying to earn money towards this film, but there's just not enough! Please help me make "Never Alone" amazing! We need you help!


Where is the money going?

The production costs of making a movie, Transport, Catering, Filming, Costume  and Set all add up to make a huge amount! That's why we need your help to make this film amazing!

To add on to all that we have to convey Maddy as a ghost (Difficult!) 

We will have to re-shoot the film twice, once with the ghost and once without and layer it to create a transparent effect! But to do that, we need money! So please, please, please help us!

We could have an average set or average filming quality, but we want to go all the way and we need your help to go there!

This film will be entered for short films nationally and INTERNATIONALLY! But once again we need your help!

We want to shoot this film in 4K but that is financially very expensive, if you want this film to be the best it can be then support our film!


Cast and crew:

I will keep you posted as we hold auditions!

BEN TAYLOR HEWITT = DIRECTOR OF PHOTOGRAPHY (DoP)

Ben has helped throughout the script writing process and will be the director of filming/camera-man. 

Ben has had a lot of experience filming wedding/promotional video's, and I feel very privileged to have him filming this short.

LIV MAIDEN (ME!) = WRITER/DIRECTOR/PRODUCER

There's already a section about me above! 

DAN/SUSIE MAIDEN = PRODUCER'S

My Parent's have been so helpful throughout this process! I could not do it without them! Their always supporting me in everything I do!

IAN MAIDEN = EXECUTIVE PRODUCER

Ian Maiden has recently been an executive producer of the BBC's Swallows and Amazons, and has been incredibly generous in helping me with this film: Thank you!


Risks and Challenges:

- I understand all the risks and challenges of this project, but ultimately it will not stop us from getting this film finished!

Sometimes, locations let you down at the last minute, crew and cast could get sick and the weather can change! But this will not stop our film from going ahead!

The ghost will be quite hard to portray: But their are loads of ways of conveying a ghost, but please help us do it the best way!


- Come and join in this project!

story:
Hi, 

my name is Maureen, 22, and I'm a Msc student in Filmmaking at the University of Glasgow, Scotland. Oh, and I'm French by the way. ^^ One of the reason I chose to join this course was to improve my skills in filmmaking, discover new practices, and let's be honest, the key point was that I will have to make a movie for my degree instead of a 200 pages paper (I learned  later that I still have to write a paper but, hey, I'm still making a movie!)

Why am I so excited about this? Well, I come from a theoretical background where you are told how great this or this director is but we never really get the chance to show our own skill or even our own vision of what cinema should be. It's safe to say then that until this year I was mostly self taught in the art of filmmaking.  It's also safe to say now, that i learned more since the beginning of this course than in 3 years of undergrad studies. Well, I learned something different, something new and I now have the chance to express myself and share my vision of cinema.

And now it's time to actually talk about my project! Behind the Mask is a movie about cosplay. What is cosplay? Most people don't know what this is. Some think it's a practice filled with sexual meaning, others just dismiss it as a childish hobby for immature adults and troubled teenagers. Sure, it can be, but it's also much more than that. If you don't know, cosplay is a portmanteau of the words "costume" and "play". The cosplayers create or reproduce a costume that could be based on a character from a tv show, anime, manga, video game, novel, movie or comics and wear this costume mostly during social events such as fan conventions, and act as the character they are cosplaying as.

So, why do I want to make a movie about cosplay?

Well, a few documentaries and tv shows treat of this subject but unfortunately they only focus on "bankable" aspects of cosplay, and stereotypes. What i can reproach to these documentaries or tv shows is maybe a lack of insight on the subject. They're only looking only at the surface, or at the most visible or remarkable parts of the subject and making it a generality. Why do I want to make something different? Because I'm a cosplayer.

With Behind the Mask I want to share an inside look of the world of cosplay and the work of passionate cosplayers. reasons to cosplay can vary from one individual to another, and it's like asking a person why she likes metal music instead of opera for example. ( what do you like? Personally, I like both) Passion is a really subjective matter and with this film and the cosplayers I chose to work with, I want to show that cosplay means diversity and could be more than a passion for some: for some, it's an art.

Cosplay is a reaaaally vast subject though, 

and I had to narrow it down to one particular fandom to do a good job at exploring it and showing it in detail. I chose to focus on The Walking Dead. ok, first, because I'm a massive fan, and i had to make a choice anyway, but i really think that the themes and subjects developed on the show are also represented in the Walking Dead cosplay community. it's not all about zombies and stuff and thangs, you"ll see.

For this adventure, 6 cosplayers are joining me in Glasgow to film Behind the Mask where we're gonna shoot most of the footages needed for the documentary and the fiction part that will reproduce the atmosphere of our favorite tv show.

Did I say documentary or fiction? Both. This project is a docufiction, which means, by using interviews, observational footages and fiction shots i am blurring the limits between professional and amateur work, fans and idols, reality and fiction, cosplay and cinema, proving once and for all, that cosplay is in fact an art worth considering.

The Team

So you can match faces and names

   Alfie Boynton

    Don Rhule

   Paul Farrer

   Laura McPherson

   Maureen Six


Now, let's talk about money!

To be fair, i've never worked on a film with a budget and always managed to get things done with the help of friends and family, favours, trust and sometimes a bit of fairy dust. But this time, I intend to raise £1,150 to make this project a reality.

Why £1,150? Up to 10% will go to the plateform and paypal as a commission.

A really small part of the budget will also be used to reimburse the expenses of the crew filming during Walker Stalker con London, event that took place a bit before i launch this campaign.

15% will go for the perks offered to the contributors of this campaign.

The rest of the budget, the biggest part, will be used to cover the expenses for the rest of the filming that will take place in Glasgow, in July. It will cover the travel and accommodation expenses for the cosplayers and the crew joining me in Glasgow, catering, extra make up and additional equipment hiring.  

The more we have, the better of course. Reaching our financial target will allow us to hire good equipment and services and provide an enjoyable experience for everyone involved in this project.

Of course, i know that not everyone can afford to help the project financially, but if our enterprise interested you, if you want to see this movie happen, if you want this idea to go farther don't hesitate to talk about it and share this campaign with everyone you know! 

I have the idea, we've got the passion, and you've got the power to make it a reality!

story:
UPDATE VIDEO
Saturday 30th April, 2016

(check 'updates' tab above for today's updates).

What we know so far, courtesy of Drew... Please donate!! Thanks :)

Simply "like" our FaceBook page (click here)

and you will get a FREE onscreen credit in the movie!

------------------------------------------------------------

"Haven"- a feature documentary film
by Drew Cullingham & Andrew Mackay


Now that you've watched the opening video, we are very excited that you are considering helping us raise the funds necessary for this project.  Before you read any further, we need you to know that we plan to use this campaign in the actual movie and make frequent references to it, as the campaign will have essentially "IndieGoGo'd" our project into existence.

'Haven' - Monsters or Tax Dodgers?

We want to investigate...

The cornerstone of any decent investigatory drama is when you peel away at the unknown.  We know some facts about Haven, but not much.  Traditional internet searches return practically nothing on the subject, and we feel that is an unprecedentedly advantageous potential starting point for a documentary.

Here is the limited information we have painstakingly gathered so far...
  • Haven is an island approximately twenty-three miles from the United Kingdom mainland.
  • Coordinates: 49°29'41.2"N+5°22'28.8"W
  • The island's population is thought to be circa 110.
  • Reports suggest that the median age of the locals is 75; consequently, we can reasonably derive that the majority of its inhabitants are at least of pensionable age, if not fast approaching it.
  • The ONS (Office for National Statistics) does not have Haven registered, and so actual raw census data is unavailable.  We have tried contacting Haven via the usual authority channels, but they have yet to reply.  This could change, however, as our endeavors continue.
  • Forensic online research tools we have employed have failed to return anything of value to aid our fact-gathering, although we have found some semi-reliable history on Haven dating back to the late 15th century (and which is exclusively available to you if you are able to contribute financially - see perks that contain "The History of Haven" digital download).

The Filmmakers

We are Drew Cullingham and Andrew Mackay - two British, independent filmmakers.  Our background is in film, and we believe we are the best fit for creating this important work.

Andrew Mackay (left) & Drew Cullingham

Haven will be a feature documentary where we serve as both the full crew and stars of the show, which has helped us remain economical in two ways:

1: We need not expend any budget on crew, as we are the crew.

2: We have a wealth of experience behind us, collaboratively and independently.

Andrew Mackay

Interviewer / sound

An author, playwright and filmmaker, Andrew has made two feature documentaries, one feature film (The Scared of Death Society) and dozens of shorts.  He is most widely known for writing, editing and directing 'The Making of Mutant Chronicles', which can be found on DVD and BluRay of 'Mutant Chronicles', starring John Malkovich, Thomas Jane and Ron Perlman.  He also played a monk in the film which is somewhat ironic, given the nature of Haven's history!  The documentary attracted rave notices and has been widely regarded as among the best of its type.

Please visit Andrew's IMDB page here for more information.

Drew Cullingham

Camera / editor

Writer, director and editor Drew Cullingham has worked on various features, including 'Umbrage: The First Vampire' (aka 'A Vampire's Tale'), starring Doug Bradley and distributed by Lionsgate, 'Monk3ys', which won best micro-budget film at Raindance and best film at The Yellow Fever Independent Film Festival, and 'Black Smoke Rising'.

Please visit Drew's IMDb page here for more information.

We first collaborated on the feature-length horror movie, 'The Devil's Bargain' (2014), and have co-written two screenplays together.

Haven is a project we are extremely passionate about. In order to get there and convince (and hopefully not coerce!) the locals to contribute, we need to - literally - get there.  This is where you come in...

What We Need & What You Get

Simply put, for this feature-length film we need £9,275.00. Actually, we need £9,274.55 - but we've taken the liberty of rounding up. We have costed this project right down to the last fraction of a penny.  A significant portion of the budget enables us to actually travel to the island and stay for approximately two weeks.  If we cannot do this, then there simply is no film - and so we sincerely appreciate any financial generosity you are able to contribute to our campaign.

Here's how our budget breaks down


All figures in GBP
Subsistence - 900.00
Travel - 1,000.00
Accommodation - 750.00
Equipment Rental - 2,500.00
Visual Effects (VFX) & Grading - 500.00
Sound Design & Mix - 1,000.00
Marketing & Social Media - 1,000.00
Publicity & Hire - 800.00
"Honoring" Perks - 200.00
Design (incl. screener production) - 625.00

TOTAL: 9,275.00

*We have our own editing facilities, and so do not require funding for this element.

Why put yourselves at risk to make this documentary feature?

There's simply no doubt about it in our minds - due to the blatant absence of information on the island (and resultant social ignominy) Haven is certainly documentary material precisely because it is unknown!  Even we as filmmakers are unsure of what we will find when we eventually make our way into their territory.

In summary:

  • We are making 'Haven' because we feel that there must be a reason why the island is shrouded in mystery and lacks any fundamental information.  Its mystery is unbound and undiscovered, and we sincerely believe that we are the most suited film making duo to do the film justice.
  • We believe our fantastic perks on the right-hand panel are unique and attractive for those wishing to become a part of truly innovative film making.  This campaign features in the film frequently, as we are making no bones about how we got financed: in fact, quite the contrary - we are embracing it!  This is good news for anyone that contributes, as they will also share in the rewards. This is a true (some may say "meta") injection of reality into the project. We are operating as economically viable as we possibly can.  We only really need to cover our expenses, subsistence and non-negotiable elements such as equipment rental, travel, accommodation and modest publicity capital, in order to fully realize the project's potential and do it justice.
  • Should we fall short of our goal we will still make the film, anyway.  We will have to make financially comparable readjustments to allow for us to make it, though.  We really need to hit our target in order to produce a film of quality, and which meets consumer's expectations.  And because, quite frankly, you are the customer - you already possess a salient understanding of the need for quality on a micro budget feature film - and this can only occur if we reach our modest target.

The Risks

Of course, we will acknowledge that our primary perceived "risk" is that we visit Haven, find nothing and return home with little to excite anyone.  This is why we are approaching the film as an investigative piece.  We are quite sure we'll find something, whether it be a heartwarming local community living on the fringes of society or something resembling a modest "pre-funeral home" whose inhabitants are marching inexorably toward the inevitable.

At the very least we will have explored and put to rest any misconceptions that Haven may have earned itself.  Our film will have (one way or another) put Haven on the map and ends its unnecessary quantity as 'unknown' once and for all

Contrarily, of course, it may be that Haven is harboring something far, far more sinister than we could have possibly imagined.  But only Drew thinks that, and he's quite obviously wrong.

The biggest risk, of course, is that we do not make the film and some other, less experienced chancers beat us to it because they managed to secure funding... we cannot let that happen.

We're excited as to what we'll find there...

We are aiming to produce a documentary not unlike the very best of Michael Moore (Bowling for Columbine) or Nick Broomfield's (Kurt and Courtney) output.

By far the biggest Unique Selling Point of Haven is the fact that we are going in 'raw' and making frequent references to how we got funded (i.e. this page, and you, dear contributor) and using it as a through-line for the narrative.  We're not aware of any other online crowdfunding campaigns who have done the same thing for a film they plan to make, so this is very exciting! 

Incidentally, if you know someone who currently resides on Haven - or someone who may have even the most tenuous of connections - please email us directly at haventhefilm@gmail.com

Approach us!

We want you to get in touch with us!  And we will respond...

  • 'Like' us at FaceBook (click here)
  • Follow us on Twitter @haventhefilm
  • Email us directly at haventhefilm@gmail.com
  • Spread the above frequently to everyone you know!

Remember: If you visit this campaign page frequently, you will see our exclusive content and updates on our progress continually with reports, findings and arrangements for filming.  Don't get cut out of the loop!

A Call to Action.  How you can help...

Simply "like" our FaceBook page - which will earn you a free onscreen credit on the film itself! - and push the message out an all your available platforms. The further our message reaches, the more likely we are to be discovered by someone who can donate some money to our cause.  And please tell your friends that if they do the same, then they will get a credit... and so on...

It's a perk we can afford for you - and your friends, and their friends etc - to have as a way of saying thank you for spreading the word.

Please spread the word and help us make Haven a rousing success!

Thank you - and we look forward to bringing you Haven very soon!
Andrew Mackay & Drew Cullingham
