Andrew Mackay
Interviewer / sound
An author, playwright and filmmaker, Andrew has made two feature documentaries, one feature film (The Scared of Death Society) and dozens of shorts.  He is most widely known for writing, editing and directing 'The Making of Mutant Chronicles', which can be found on DVD and BluRay of 'Mutant Chronicles', starring John Malkovich, Thomas Jane and Ron Perlman.  He also played a monk in the film which is somewhat ironic, given the nature of Haven's history!  The documentary attracted rave notices and has been widely regarded as among the best of its type.
Please visit Andrew's IMDB page here for more information.

Drew Cullingham
Camera / editor
Writer, director and editor Drew Cullingham has worked on various features, including 'Umbrage: The First Vampire' (aka 'A Vampire's Tale'), starring Doug Bradley and distributed by Lionsgate, 'Monk3ys', which won best micro-budget film at Raindance and best film at The Yellow Fever Independent Film Festival, and 'Black Smoke Rising'.
Please visit Drew's IMDb page here for more information.
We first collaborated on the feature-length horror movie, 'The Devil's Bargain' (2014), and have co-written two screenplays together.
Haven is a project we are extremely passionate about. In order to get there and convince (and hopefully not coerce!) the locals to contribute, we need to - literally - get there.  This is where you come in...


What We Need & What You Get 

Simply put, for this feature-length film we need £9,275.00. Actually, we need £9,274.55 - but we've taken the liberty of rounding up. We have costed this project right down to the last fraction of a penny.  A significant portion of the budget enables us to actually travel to the island and stay for approximately two weeks.  If we cannot do this, then there simply is no film - and so we sincerely appreciate any financial generosity you are able to contribute to our campaign.
Here's how our budget breaks down


All figures in GBPSubsistence - 900.00Travel - 1,000.00Accommodation - 750.00Equipment Rental - 2,500.00Visual Effects (VFX) & Grading - 500.00Sound Design & Mix - 1,000.00Marketing & Social Media - 1,000.00Publicity & Hire - 800.00"Honoring" Perks - 200.00Design (incl. screener production) - 625.00
TOTAL: 9,275.00
*We have our own editing facilities, and so do not require funding for this element.
Why put yourselves at risk to make this documentary feature?
There's simply no doubt about it in our minds - due to the blatant absence of information on the island (and resultant social ignominy) Haven is certainly documentary material precisely because it is unknown!  Even we as filmmakers are unsure of what we will find when we eventually make our way into their territory.
In summary:
 We are making 'Haven' because we feel that there must be a reason why the island is shrouded in mystery and lacks any fundamental information.  Its mystery is unbound and undiscovered, and we sincerely believe that we are the most suited film making duo to do the film justice.
We believe our fantastic perks on the right-hand panel are unique and attractive for those wishing to become a part of truly innovative film making.  This campaign features in the film frequently, as we are making no bones about how we got financed: in fact, quite the contrary - we are embracing it!  This is good news for anyone that contributes, as they will also share in the rewards. This is a true (some may say "meta") injection of reality into the project. We are operating as economically viable as we possibly can.  We only really need to cover our expenses, subsistence and non-negotiable elements such as equipment rental, travel, accommodation and modest publicity capital, in order to fully realize the project's potential and do it justice.

Should we fall short of our goal we will still make the film, anyway.  We will have to make financially comparable readjustments to allow for us to make it, though.  We really need to hit our target in order to produce a film of quality, and which meets consumer's expectations.  And because, quite frankly, you are the customer - you already possess a salient understanding of the need for quality on a micro budget feature film - and this can only occur if we reach our modest target.


The Risks
Of course, we will acknowledge that our primary perceived "risk" is that we visit Haven, find nothing and return home with little to excite anyone.  This is why we are approaching the film as an investigative piece.  We are quite sure we'll find something, whether it be a heartwarming local community living on the fringes of society or something resembling a modest "pre-funeral home" whose inhabitants are marching inexorably toward the inevitable.
At the very least we will have explored and put to rest any misconceptions that Haven may have earned itself.  Our film will have (one way or another) put Haven on the map and ends its unnecessary quantity as 'unknown' once and for all
Contrarily, of course, it may be that Haven is harboring something far, far more sinister than we could have possibly imagined.  But only Drew thinks that, and he's quite obviously wrong.
The biggest risk, of course, is that we do not make the film and some 
other, less experienced chancers beat us to it because they managed to 
secure funding... we cannot let that happen.
    We're excited as to what we'll find there...
We are aiming to produce a documentary not unlike the very best of Michael Moore (Bowling for Columbine) or Nick Broomfield's (Kurt and Courtney) output.By far the biggest Unique Selling Point of Haven is the fact that we are going in 'raw' and making frequent references to how we got funded (i.e. this page, and you, dear contributor) and using it as a through-line for the narrative.  We're not aware of any other online crowdfunding campaigns who have done the same thing for a film they plan to make, so this is very exciting!  Incidentally, if you know someone who currently resides on Haven - or someone who may have even the most tenuous of connections - please email us directly at haventhefilm@gmail.com
Approach us!



 We want you to get in touch with us!  And we will respond...
 'Like' us at FaceBook (click here)
 Follow us on Twitter @haventhefilm

Email us directly at haventhefilm@gmail.com
Spread the above frequently to everyone you know!


Remember: If you visit this campaign page frequently, you will see our exclusive content and updates on our progress continually with reports, findings and arrangements for filming.  Don't get cut out of the loop!
    A Call to Action.  How you can help...

Simply "like" our FaceBook page - which will earn you a free onscreen credit on the film itself! - and push the message out an all your available platforms. The further our message reaches, the more likely we are to be discovered by someone who can donate some money to our cause.  And please tell your friends that if they do the same, then they will get a credit... and so on...It's a perk we can afford for you - and your friends, and their friends etc - to have as a way of saying thank you for spreading the word.Please spread the word and help us make Haven a rousing success!Thank you - and we look forward to bringing you Haven very soon!Andrew Mackay & Drew Cullingham

story:
"One felt that they was something unreal about leave. I m bound to say that I got myself into a state of mind where it was the trenches that were the real world and it was London, and my family that was unreal, that I couldn’t understand or find or custom myself to."

Charles Carrington, WW1 Veteran

Introduction

My name is Byron Kirk, I am a 29 year old former soldier, veteran of the Iraq and Afghanistan war, and university educated photographer.

At the age of 17, I was working as a horse guard in Central London. It was 2004, only months after the invasion of Iraq. My regiment was split into two; a ceremonial side, based in Knightsbridge and an armoured side based in Windsor.

The way it often worked, is that soldiers spent 2 years on ceremonial duty, followed by 2 years armoured. This pattern would then be repeated throughout a soldier’s career.

Whilst the armoured side sounds like the more stressful of the two, it certainly wasn’t.

People forgot about you in Knightsbridge, the hours were long and hard, and required more bullshit then brains. Soldiers from other regiments, friends who were on active tours across the world, would joke, "what do you even do there" or "aren’t you wasting taxpayers money?"

We were at the beginning stages of what we all know now to be a fierce 6-year conflict in Iraq. For many young people, who had joined the army only to serve in a war, it was difficult. What is the point of being here I would regularly ask myself, I just want to fight.

I was down the stables one day and my SGT, who I didn’t know to well, was shouting at a horse. He said something along the lines of "I wish I with the lads in Iraq" before storming off on a premature tea break.

I didn’t think much of his outburst, especially considering the fact that I didn’t even know him to well. All I knew was that he was upset, and its best for the new lad (i.e. me) to stay clear.

Later that night - around 3am - that same SGT, under the influence of alcohol, walked back down into the stables and hung himself with a ceremonial bright chain. He was found by the night guard, hanging in his office.

The following day, the Sun newspaper, reported that he had taken his life due to the accumulation of parking tickets. I don’t know whether that’s true or not, but for years after, those words "I wish I was the lads in Iraq" echoed in my thoughts.

His death does not fit into the media's assumption that veterans will only kill them selves as a direct result of traumatic experience in war... In fact, if his statement "I wish I was with the lads in Iraq" had any bearing on his suicide, it would imply, that some veterans will feel saddened, or deeply lost, by an indication that they may not serve in a frontline role, and may even take their own life as a result.

And that’s how I became interested, in the concept of suicidal masculinity.

Suicidal Masculinity

Its not as complex as it sounds, young men aspire to be heroes but often the hero dies; his youthfulness remains, and only the good is preserved. To die in war, is to be canonised as a civil saint, a man or a woman, pure and immortal.

Now, most of you may already understand, that the act of martyrdom, is a common theme in Palestine, and that children, of all ages are encouraged by multiple outlets to die "heroes" by taking their own lives.

But this phenomenon exists in our own culture, in-fact you could say we are pretty good at it. We encourage it in myths, legends, nursery rhymes and even popular culture.

Its a common cliché, what that we all recognise, that at some point in the film, the hero will die.

But what happens when the hero doesn’t die? Well they come home, they age, they lose functionality and eventually, when all is forgotten, they die, perhaps lonely and afraid, a shadow of their former, apparent selves.

A friend of mine once told me, that he was worried about this process and that he could cheat it all by taking his own life now. If he could find the bollocks to kill himself, then perhaps he would be remembered, as a casualty of war; a hero in most peoples eyes.

Its important that we talk about that. I don’t doubt that people, including veterans think differently. Some returning from war may feel displaced or lost by trauma, isolation or in an inability to transition. But what we cannot do is ignore those, who like my friend above, feel as though they is glory in death, when they is nothing else in life to achieve.

So what’s the plan

Well, so far I have written 10,000 words on the subject but I'd like to do more.

I want to create a photo documentary (in book form, for the time being), which introduces my thesis on the matter.

I have a concept, and am in the process of contacting those I need to speak with. I have a map of locations I wish to photograph, and have researched this to the point where I can almost recite my findings.

I hope to complete it in time for this year’s remembrance service (11th November 2016) and hope that it may encourage some sort of discourse on the subject.

I have a lot to do, in a relatively short space of time, I have photos to take, places to be and people to meet, but am limited on funds.

In total, I estimate, that I will need to raise £4500 to get what I need done.

The project will take 5 months to complete. 1 month in fundraising, and a further 4 months to document.

Funds raised will cover:

  • Travel
  • Administration (Rent, Gas Electric)
  • and research

Support wit Bitcoin

Bitcoin Address: 1KWTr8x1pPYCAv8ckxM4pV3RAMzsFa4oXH

Further benefits of this project.

I have spent a lot of time already on this project and have made multiple sacrifices.

I’m hoping to apply for a masters degree later in the year, and would like to be able to present this work within my portfolio.

I want to further my professional understanding of the above-mentioned concept.

By contributing today, you not only help a former soldier raise awareness about a relatively, unknown phenomenon, you also help him transition into bigger and better things.

Thank you all for your time, I hope at the very least, that I have peaked your interest in this subject.

If you'd like to chat, please feel free to contact me at: info@byronkirk.com

Byron Kirk

story:
We are the Modern Explorers, a group of open-minded amateur film-producers and travellers (Please click for more about the people involved) who make videos for youtube about various topics but with focus on the ancient civilization field. We created this project to show the online community 2 newly discovered ancient sites comparable to the Nazca Lines in Peru, in the mysterious giant geoglyphs carved into the deserts of Jordan and Kazakhstan. We wish to explore these highly significant pieces of evidence that have been written about online but with limited investigation and only low-resolution visuals. If geoglyphs like this exist on opposite sides of the globe then maybe the creators were in communication, or part of the same civilization and maybe glyphs of this size were created to communicate with beings in or from the sky so some form of technology or advanced spiritual awareness was involved. With your support we can create a beautiful film to add to the growing body of evidence which is helping to substantiate the idea that an ancient, advanced and global civilization existed in our past.

What We Need & What You Get

We have asked for £5000 as a contribution towards the cost of the entire filming project, although it will probably cost more in reality. We need at least 3 of us to fly to both countries, we need money to travel to the various areas where the geoglyphs are found, to stay in hotels so that we can charge batteries etc. We feel flying over the glyphs is essential and we would really like to get some expert opinions on the glyphs, which will be much easier if we can offer some sort of payment. If there is any money left over after all of that, although doubtful, then it will be put into buying some graphics or animation for the film. If we don’t reach our entire goal then we will still make the film but will have to miss some of the above, either the experts, the flights, the post-production goodies or all of them.

Any donator is welcome to a pdf copy of Mick’s e-book and anybody who donates over £150 will be put in the credits as a co-producer.

If you are struggling for spare cash at the moment then there are other ways you can help. Please share this on any social media outlets that you use as maybe your friends or family would be interested and able to help. We at Modern Explorers also encourage people to get involved with any of our filming projects (there are ideas of how you can help on our website), we always need help with research; maybe you know of other giant geoglyphs around the world, if you do please contact us.

Thank You for reading and please help us if you can.

story:
BE A HERO! PLEASE HELP US!

  • To protect social and human values.
  • To protect the Amazon rainforest.
  • To protect the indigenous people of the Amazon.
  • To protect the ancient wisdom and spirituality of the native tribes of the Amazon Rainforest.
  • To protect the invaluable healing and spiritual plants of the Amazon Rainforest.

  • To show all humans their true inner values. 
  • To transform our material greed into inner harmony.
  • Please support us now!
  • Join us and venture deep on a journey to see what lies INSIDE OF US!

 

THE INSIDE OF US

A film by Jan Rajnoha & Oldrich Tamas

Documentaries about the possibility of another perspective - our collective perception of the reality of life.


  • The issue of global character - human values
  • Social issues - protecting people living in the Amazonian rainforest
  • Environmental issues - protecting the Amazonian rainforest
  • Humanity - helping people find their inner values

PLEASE SUPPORT US NOW!


The project of a lifetime

We live in the heart of Europe. We have been creating movies all our lives. This project is everything we could ever dream of filming. 

6 documentary films to help people find their inner value

Our goal is to help people find their inner value. We want to help people once again live in peace and harmony with themselves and with all the energy throughout the universe. We have prepared 6 movies that will help people to find themselves. We want to show them the way to inner peace and greater values. We have been working on this project for more than 2 years now. 

We have already invested nearly 100,000 dollars

We have invested all of our savings - nearly one hundred thousand dollars. We are now finishing the first movie and we really need your help.
 


We are out of money, but we still believe we can complete the project and help everyone around the world find inner peace. 

Help us finish the first movie and start the next one

Please help us finish the first movie and start making the next five movies. From this budget, we will be able to finish the first movie and start the complete filming and production of the second one.

Thank you so much for your help!

Thank you so much for any help you can offer. We would be very grateful to you. We have done our best and now we hope that you will support us and join us on our journey INSIDE OF US! Support us! 

Charitable work

If we manage to cover all the costs and investments involved in filming, production, post-production, and marketing the film from these crowdfunding activities, we plan to intensively support charitable activities associated with protecting human rights and the rainforests. Our goal is to sell our film online and thus support established and proven charitable organizations, focusing on human rights and the protection of rainforests.

Our vision is to attract viewers to raise awareness of current issues
that affect the world and each of us...

"As for the basic things, we know nothing. Only when we admit this can we return to harmony."
Carl Gustav Jung

Red Digital Cinema

Genre: Documentary
Footage: 72 min. / ( 6 movies )
Format: 1920 x 1080 Full HD / 25 fps
 

Broadcast: TV / CINEMA
Language: EN
Target group: No special focus
Technics: RED Digital Cinema ( + Canon 5D MKIII )
Optics: Carl Zeiss + Canon Optics

Our plan

Start date: November 2013
Delivery of the first movie: Premiere spring / Summer 2016 - crowdfunding
Delivery of the second movie: Shooting 2016 / Premiere 2017 - crowdfunding 
 

Delivery of the third movie: Shooting 2017 / Premiere 2018
Delivery of the fourth movie: Shooting 2018 / Premiere 2019
Delivery of the fifth movie: Shooting 2019 / Premiere 2020
Delivery of the sixth movie: Shooting 2020 / Premiere 2021
 

Protect our independence

This film is entirely independent - not a part of any corporate, endowment, or sponsorship agreement! Our aim is the purity of creative ideas. Although we are just "a few steps from our goal," we no longer have the capacity to release any further funding. Although we are striving to ensure the highest possible production quality, we are forced to do everything on a shoestring budget. We have shot scenes on 3 continents and use the very latest technology. Considering our resources and the instability of our country, what we have achieved is a major "miracle."  We hope that you can help us now. Thank you for any support you can give us.
 


Reaching out to an international audience 

Our goal is to reach out to audiences around the world. The concept of the project has already been presented at MIPTV in Cannes. Around the globe, we have been highlighting new human values and the need to protect the rainforests at the following:

  • KM Plus Media - TV distribution 
  • nationwide television broadcasts
  • international film festivals
  • art house cinemas
  • Internet screenings
  • charitable public lectures
  • global conferences
  • any other distribution channels we can find.

Structure of our budget

  • Pre-production
  • Production
  • Shooting
  • Editing
  • Post-production
  • Sound design and music score
  • Grading
  • Finishing

Locations of the first movie

  • South America / Peru (Amazon)
  • South America / Ecuador (Amazon)

  • USA / New York
  • Europe / Switzerland
  • Europe / The Czech Republic 

Summary of the first movie

It is a documentary on life in the Amazon rainforest and about the wisdom and values professed by its indigenous inhabitants, in contrast with our so-called Western civilization. 
 

Importance of the rainforest

The film seeks to introduce the beauty of the world's largest rainforest but also touches upon the mysteries of the messages that are still to be found while revealing the dire threats to this precious place, which is important for the entire planet.

Journey of discovery

Zerock Oner, as the mysterious protagonist, embarks on a journey of discovery. Seeking escape from life in Western society that he finds so frustrating, he tries to find answers to some fundamental questions in our lives. Why, when mankind is so technologically advanced, is our planet still in such an alarming state? How can we change this situation?
 

The power of natural healing

In the footsteps of the wisdom of the indigenous tribes, the power of natural healing, and mystical shamanism, we set out to explore the borders of altered states of consciousness known in our everyday reality. 

With the help of the mysterious lianas of death, we are immediately confronted face to face with ourselves. Perhaps there are answers to our questions.
 

Featuring international stars

The film features the Czech-born American psychiatrist, Dr. Stanislav Grof, Ph.D., Swiss anthropologist and author of The Cosmic Serpent, Dr. Jeremy Narby, and quantum theorist Dr. Amit Goswami, Ph.D.
 

Synopsis of the first movie

The film The Inside Of Us tells its story in two arcs. On the one hand, the commentary presents specific information about the environment while, on the other, the film also follows the personal story of Zerock Oner, our main character. Zerock is portrayed in an unusual way and is shown in the film more as a shadow, silhouette, or a voice, and through him we explore a new way to see reality.

The bustle of city life

The story of Zerock begins amid the chaos, stress, and hustle and bustle of city life. Zerock feels dissatisfied with his life and the environment, grasping to find answers to the fundamental questions of our lives. But his search is fruitless, and so he resolves to venture out into the unknown - on an adventure to seek the wisdom of the indigenous peoples of the Amazon. 
 

Current issues facing the rainforest

During his travels, he witnesses the current issues facing the rainforest and learns more about the traditional way of life of its indigenous people who are treated unjustly by the authorities. The film explores the symbiosis of the indigenous people living in harmony with nature and their ancient healer, a life which is closely linked to the use of highly psychoactive substances.

Controversial issues

These controversial issues in the film are explored with the help of many researchers involved in scientific studies. Dr. Jeremy Narby is a world-renowned anthropologist who has studied these indigenous cultures in their own environment for many years. Dr. Stanislav Grof, a psychiatrist specializing in the study of expanded states of consciousness, and quantum theorist Amit Goswami, who tells us about how all living beings and inanimate matter are interconnected. The film highlights the contrast between a natural way of life and life in Western society.
 

Through the film, we learn about

The issue of the Amazon as a whole, about native Amazonian traditions and healing, about Swiss scientists who conduct research in the Amazon rainforest, seeking medicinal plants. We will get to meet the heads of communities, where native Amazonian law and oppression are discussed. We get the chance to observe ourselves through a sacred medicine called Ayahuasca in a Peruvian treatment center. We get to visit well-known as well as yet unexplored places in these many beautiful locations. 
 

A visual treat

The film is made for a wide range of audiences. We are planning to accompany the audio and visual scenery with interviews from scientists, academics, and theorists; however, these will only be general, with no deeper analysis that could affect anyone's freedom of choice or philosophy. It is all made for a discerning audience looking for a visual treat. 
 

Comments from experts

  • Prof. Klaus C. Dibiasi (Presidente de Global Connections) / Peru - Austria
  • Dr. Amit Goswami, Ph.D. (theoretical quantum physicist) / USA
  • Dr. Jeremy Narby (anthropologist and writer) / Switzerland

  • Dr. Stanislav Grof, Ph.D. (psychiatrist) / USA
  • Jatunk Shunk (lawyer - indigenous rights activist) / Ecuador
  • Indian communities
  • Poll (Amazonia - Europe - USA)

Testimonies from

  • Psychologists
  • Quantum physicists
  • Medicine experts
  • Ecologists
  • Anthropologists

Concept of THE INSIDE OF US

The Inside Of Us is a series of six documentary films from different parts of the world. The entire project is subtitled "The possibility of another view of our collective perception of the reality of life." Through these films, we explore places where people live in symbiosis with nature while highlighting the contrast with life in technologically advanced countries.

Addressing current issues

In each episode, we address a different current issue of global importance with the aim of drawing attention to that issue from a different perspective. We want to enable audiences to form their own opinions of these issues after watching the film. At the same time, our desire is to encourage a sense of belonging with nature and everything around us. 

Looking for answers

In the starring role, Zerock Oner sets out on a journey of discovery, seeking answers to his questions. The project is subtitled "The possibility of another view of our collective perception of the reality of life," through which the author plans to outline the deeper significance of things that are less well explored.

Food for thought

The project will contain a number of stimuli intended to give viewers the chance to reflect, pose a series of questions, and then present several possible guidelines, while the answers are entirely up to the viewer. 

Authenticity

Information will be conveyed by imagery mixed with authentic sound and the traveler's thoughts. The film will present proof of the reality of true phenomena, and it is possible that it could cause considerable controversy.

Positive atmosphere of the film

From a dramatic perspective, great emphasis will be placed on the overall positive atmosphere and good vibe of the film. The final outcome will not elicit negative reactions such as anger or feelings of guilt or regret but just the opposite of those emotions. 

On a very personal level

The uniqueness of the image linked guarantees close contact with the native population and the experience from the places that we have on a very personal level, which allows us to avoid the usual clichés and present an unprecedented view of the exotic corners of our planet, which has a vast moral, spiritual, and material value and promises inimitable audio and video passages. The documentary will be mostly pictorial accompanied by commentary.
 

Filming locations

The filming locations are carefully selected so that they are abundant in the natural phenomena of different species (rainforests, mountains, sandy plains, the depths of the deep) as well as in the spiritual aspects of being and the ancient traditions of the indigenous people.

  • Amazonia Project / South America - Amazon / USA / EU
  • Journey of the Ancestors I. / Mexico / USA / EU
  • Journey of the Ancestors II. / Gronland / EU
  • Kingdom of Indonesia / Borneo / EU
  • Africa Project / Africa / USA / EU
  • Samadhi / Nepal / EU

Film crew

Project coordinators: Jan Rajnoha & Oldrich Tamas - R&T PRODUCTION, Ltd.
Producer: Jan Rajnoha & Oldrich Tamas
Script and theme: Jan Rajnoha
Directed by: Jan Rajnoha
Production and Media Communications: Jan Rajnoha & Oldrich Tamas
 

DOP: Jan Rajnoha / Jiri Vagner
Sound: Pavel Neuberger, Lubos Mnuk
Casting: Jan Rajnoha
Video - post-production: Merge Studio / SPON post-production & VFX house Sound - post-production: BEEP - Sound Post-production
Sound designer: Lukas Tvrdon / Samuel Jurkovic
Music: Karel Antonin
Editor: Vit Kratochvile / Jan Rajnoha / David Chvatal
Animation / VFX: Vit Kratochvile / Filip Hepnar
 

Jan Rajnoha - director

Entrepreneur, director, filmmaker, and editor. He entered the world of media at an early age, thanks to sports. Later, at the age of eighteen he began working as a cameraman and editor for national TV in the Czech Republic. During his career he has worked with a wide range of Czech and foreign media and gained experience in an advertising agency. He has shot a variety of music videos, commercials, and promotional films for important people and companies. He has been involved in the creation of documentary and fiction feature films. He founded an agency specializing in film and complete advertising. He has assisted in the development of several television shows about fashion, music, health, and nature. Through his political experience in the Czech Republic, he has also worked with Czech public television. He and Oldrich Tamas established R & T Production, Ltd., where their shared love of nature gave them the idea of making a series of remarkable documentary films titled "THE INSIDE OF US."
 

Oldrich Tamas - producer

Entrepreneur, journalist, radio, and television personality, founder of the "Good Mind" foundation and the "Good Mind Film Festival - tales of common happiness.“ He is a producer and director of films and documentaries about social themes. As a presenter and journalist, he has experience in public and commercial TV stations nationwide in both the Czech Republic and abroad. At the same time, he has worked for several radio stations, including the top radio stations in the Czech Republic - Evropa 2 - and has worked a long for one of the most popular radio stations, Frekvence 1. In the following years, he created his own work in the form of a number of documentary projects. He is currently working on a documentary about people who have undergone treatment for malignant cancer. It is also worth mentioning that he has an instructional comprehensive social theater project for primary schools.

A separate chapter involves his two feature films, shot with mentally-handicapped people. This work also served as a kind of art therapy for those actors. First, he worked on the screenwriting and also on the production of the dream-like documentary film "The World is Beautiful,“ which was awarded the Jury Prize and the Spoken Word Prize at the International Mental Power Prague Film Festival in 2012. The second part of this body of artistic work involved the producing and co-writing of a fairy tale to fairy tale, To "the Fairy Tale.“ Another side of his career involves the creation of an entirely new international film festival in the Czech Republic. The festival "Good Mind - stories of ordinary happiness“ was a response to current global and domestic affairs, including contemporary film making and paved the way for a range of filmmakers who do not aspire to create professional art or who are not interested in presenting violent, sharply political or otherwise offensive scenarios. 
 

Ing. Tomas Moravek - marketing

Award-winning Manager of the Year, winner of the European LABEL Prize for teaching the blind, an enthusiastic help to such a valuable project.

Ing. Tomáš Morávek graduated from the Faculty of Informatics and Management at the University of Hradec Králové. He has spent his entire career in strategic and managerial positions, focusing on marketing and project management. He has always been enthusiastic about managing projects with a deep sense of value. He spent 15 years as the director of the EUROPEAN EDUCATION CENTRE and 3 years building the ONLINE language e-learning platform. So far, almost 70,000 people have received an education thanks to his work. He holds numerous awards, including the prestigious European LABEL Prize.
 

Dr. Amit Goswami, Ph.D. - expert

The theoretical quantum physicist Dr. Amit Goswami is a revolutionary among a growing body of renegade scientists who, in recent years, have ventured into the domain of the spiritual in an attempt both to interpret the seemingly inexplicable findings of curious experiments and to explore ideas about the existence of a spiritual dimension of life. 
 

A prolific writer, teacher, and visionary, Dr. Goswami has appeared in the movies What the Bleep Do We Know!?, Dalai Lama Renaissance, as well as the award-winning documentary, The Quantum Activist.
 

Dr. Jeremy Narby - expert

Dr. Jeremy Narby (Montreal, 1959) is an anthropologist and writer. Narby grew up in Canada and Switzerland, studied history at the University of Canterbury, and received a doctorate in anthropology from Stanford University. Narby spent several years living with the Ashaninca in the Peruvian Amazon, cataloging indigenous uses of rainforest resources to help combat ecological destruction. 


Narby has written three books, as well as sponsored an expedition to the rainforest for biologists and other scientists to examine indigenous knowledge systems and the use of Ayahuasca in gaining knowledge. Since 1989, Narby has been working as the Amazonian projects director for the Swiss NGO, Nouvelle Planète.  

Dr. Stanislav Grof, Ph.D. - expert

Stan Grof, M.D., Ph.D. is a psychiatrist with more than fifty years' experience researching the healing and transformative potential of non-ordinary states of consciousness. His groundbreaking theories influenced the integration of Western science with his brilliant mapping of the transpersonal dimension. On October 5, 2007, Dr. Grof received the prestigious VISION 97 award presented by the Dagmar and Václav Havel Foundation in Prague. He is one of the founders and chief theoreticians of Transpersonal Psychology and received an Honorary Award for major contributions to and the development of the field of Transpersonal Psychology from the Association for Transpersonal Psychology in 1993. Dr. Grof is also the founding president of the International Transpersonal Association (ITA) and was its president for many years.


He has organized large international conferences throughout the world and continues to lecture and teach professional training programs in Holotropic Breathwork and transpersonal psychology. Currently, Dr. Grof is a Professor of Psychology at the California Institute of Integral Studies (CIIS) at the Department of Philosophy, Cosmology, and Consciousness in San Francisco, CA, and at Wisdom University in Oakland, CA. Dr. Grof was born in 1931 in Prague, where he received an M.D. from Charles University and a Ph.D. (Doctor of Philosophy in Medicine) from the Czechoslovakian Academy of Sciences. Between 1960 and 1967, he was principal investigator in a psychedelic research program at the Psychiatric Research Institute in Prague, Czechoslovakia.

Experience an expedition in the Amazon!

We would like to offer the partners and sponsors of our film an amazing experience organized especially to suit your needs - A UNIQUE AND UNFORGETTABLE EXPEDITION IN THE AMAZON. You will meet real shamans, coming from as yet unseen cultures and will be healed using an ancient medicine that the local native inhabitants are striving to protect. We apologize, but your airfare is not included in the expedition package. We will be happy to help you with everything else! 

What will you receive as our partner/sponsor?

  • An extraordinary and unique expedition to the Amazon (excluding air fare).
  • Gifts from Peru.
  • The chance to meet us in person.
  • The chance to attend the official premiere.
  • The opportunity to participate in international conferences.
  • An exclusive listing in the credits, on the DVD, posters and all promotional materials, including the website and corporate identity.
  • Communication throughout the project.
  • Online advance premiere of the film.
  • An original and signed DVD.
  • An original and signed poster. 
  • Gratitude and excellent karma.
  • Other bonuses we will come up with while developing the project.

PLEASE HELP US NOW!

PLEASE SHARE OUR CAMPAIGN WITH YOUR FRIENDS ON SOCIAL MEDIA!

PUBLIC RELEASE

Breath-Taking Documentary About Amazon Rainforest Needs Support On INDIEGOGO

The Inside Of Us is a unique documentary by a heroic filmmaking team from The Czech Republic, and it needs funding on INDIEGOGO. Told through the feelings of the Amazon Rainforest’s indigenous people, the film starkly shows the destruction of the people’s culture, homes, and their source of precious medicines. The Inside Of Us stresses the importance of the Amazon Rainforest, and its social value to Western society. Rather than outrage, The Inside Of Us aims to guide viewers toward awareness and action to protect the Amazon Rainforest and its people. 

To keep The Inside Of Us independent, the filmmakers ask for public help on INDIEGOGO.  They have personally invested nearly $100,000 while refusing lucrative contract offers. A free preview of the first 10 minutes of The Inside Of Us is available to journalists and potential donors.

The Inside Of Us features three renowned scientists: theoretical physicist Amit Goswami, anthropologist Jeremy Narby and psychiatrist Stanislav Grof. Producer Oldrich Tamas is the winner of the International JURI Prize from a prestigious Czech film festival.  Tamas’ artistic collaborator, Jan Rajnoha, directs the film. The Inside Of Us was shot in 5 countries on 3 continents. Filming began in 2013 in the Amazon Rainforest of Peru and Ecuador in South America, in North America in New York, and in Europe’s Switzerland and The Czech Republic. Using cutting-edge technology, The Inside of Us is top-quality viewing.

The filmmakers choose to remain independent, refusing to accept any private-sector funds that would interfere with the artistic control of The Inside Of Us. Ambitious international plans are underway for The Inside Of Us. The film will be distributed to some 300 TV stations worldwide. Screenings will be held at major international festivals. Anyone funding The Inside Of Us via INDIEGOGO will have access to free online pre-premiere screening.

The Inside Of Us project will be 6 films, highlighting some of the most precious environmental, human and social values on Earth. Future plans include shooting the lush jungles of Borneo, shedding more light on Nepal’s earthquake victims, and introducing people to Diamond Way Buddhism. Now, the filmmakers request the public help them complete the first film, The Inside Of Us. Part One calls for protecting the human and cultural values of the Amazon Rainforest. Further support is needed to start shooting the next part, which will feature the unique relics and ancient wisdom of Mexico.

The Inside Of Us is a powerful documentary, chronicling the life of a man who leaves modern Western civilization, travelling the world seeking answers to life’s burning questions. He arrives in the Amazon Rainforest, where he shows the alarming destruction of our planet, the need to protect the ancient wisdom of shamans, and illustrates a new path of consciousness to one’s inner harmony.

Now, the filmmakers have launched a 60-day campaign on INDIEGOGO to raise $340,000. Every donor is rewarded; larger donations give people the chance to enjoy an expedition to the Amazon Rainforest to experience ancient cultures and the wisdom of local shamans. Tomas Moravek heads the fundraising. He is the winner of the Manager of the Year Award and holds the European LABEL Prize for teaching the blind. Contact Tomas anytime at tom@insideofus-doc.com to ask to see the first 10 minutes of the film free of charge.

 THE INSIDE OF USA film by Jan Rajnoha & Oldrich Tamas


Documentaries about the possibility of another perspective - our collective perception of the reality of life.

PLEASE SUPPORT US NOW!



The project of a lifetime
We live in the heart of Europe. We have been
creating movies all our lives. This project is everything we could ever dream of
filming. 



6 documentary films to help people find their inner value
Our goal is
to help people find their inner value. We want to help people once again live in peace
and harmony with themselves and with all the energy throughout the universe. We
have prepared 6 movies that will help people to find themselves. We want to
show them the way to inner peace and greater values. We have been working on
this project for more than 2 years now. 





We have already invested nearly 100,000 dollars
We have invested all of our savings -
nearly one hundred thousand dollars. We are now finishing the first movie and
we really need your help. 




We are out of money, but we still believe we can complete
the project and help everyone around the world find inner peace. 



Help us finish the first movie and start the next one
Please help us finish the first movie and start making the next five
movies. From this budget, we will be able to finish the first movie and start the complete filming and production of the second one.


Thank you so much for your help!

Thank you so much for any help you can offer. We would be very grateful
to you. We have done our best and now we hope that you will support us and join
us on our journey INSIDE OF US! Support us! 






Charitable work
If we manage to cover all the costs and investments involved in filming, production, post-production, and marketing the film from these crowdfunding activities, we plan to intensively support charitable activities associated with protecting human rights and the rainforests. Our goal is to sell our film online and thus support established and proven charitable organizations, focusing on human rights and the protection of rainforests.






Our vision is to attract viewers to raise awareness of current issuesthat affect the world and each of us...

"As for the basic things, we know nothing. Only when we admit this can we return to harmony."
Carl Gustav Jung

Our plan

Delivery of the third movie: Shooting 2017 / Premiere 2018Delivery of the fourth movie: Shooting 2018 / Premiere 2019Delivery of the fifth movie: Shooting 2019 / Premiere 2020Delivery of the sixth movie: Shooting 2020 / Premiere 2021 

Protect our independence
This film is entirely independent - not a part of any corporate, endowment, or sponsorship agreement! Our aim is the purity of creative ideas. Although we are just "a few steps from our goal," we no longer have the capacity to release any further funding. Although we are striving to ensure the highest possible production quality, we are forced to do everything on a shoestring budget. We have shot scenes on 3 continents and use the very latest technology. Considering our resources and the instability of our country, what we have achieved is a major "miracle."  We hope that you can help us now. Thank you for any support you can give us. 


Reaching out to an international audience 


Our goal is to reach out to audiences around the world. The concept of the project has already been presented at MIPTV in Cannes. Around the globe, we have been highlighting new human values and the need to protect the rainforests at the following:




KM Plus Media - TV distribution  

nationwide television broadcasts


international film festivals


art house cinemas


Internet screenings


charitable public lectures

global conferences


any other distribution channels we can find.

Summary of the first movie
It is a documentary on life in the Amazon rainforest and about the wisdom and values professed by its indigenous inhabitants, in contrast with our so-called Western civilization.  



Importance of the rainforest
The film seeks to introduce the beauty of the world's largest rainforest but also touches upon the mysteries of the messages that are still to be found while revealing the dire threats to this precious place, which is important for the entire planet.






Journey of discovery

Zerock Oner, as the mysterious protagonist, embarks on a journey of discovery. Seeking escape from life in Western society that he finds so frustrating, he tries to find answers to some fundamental questions in our lives. Why, when mankind is so technologically advanced, is our planet still in such an alarming state? How can we change this situation? 



The power of natural healing

In the footsteps of the wisdom of the indigenous tribes, the power of natural healing, and mystical shamanism, we set out to explore the borders of altered states of consciousness known in our everyday reality. 


With the help of the mysterious lianas of death, we are immediately confronted face to face with ourselves. Perhaps there are answers to our questions. 




Featuring international stars

The film features the Czech-born American psychiatrist, Dr. Stanislav Grof, Ph.D., Swiss anthropologist and author of The Cosmic Serpent, Dr. Jeremy Narby, and quantum theorist Dr. Amit Goswami, Ph.D. 

Synopsis of the first movie

The film The Inside Of Us tells its story in two arcs. On the one hand, the commentary presents specific information about the environment while, on the other, the film also follows the personal story of Zerock Oner, our main character. Zerock is portrayed in an unusual way and is shown in the film more as a shadow, silhouette, or a voice, and through him we explore a new way to see reality.



The bustle of city life

The story of Zerock begins amid the chaos, stress, and hustle and bustle of city life. Zerock feels dissatisfied with his life and the environment, grasping to find answers to the fundamental questions of our lives. But his search is fruitless, and so he resolves to venture out into the unknown - on an adventure to seek the wisdom of the indigenous peoples of the Amazon.  

Current issues facing the rainforest
During his travels, he witnesses the current issues facing the rainforest and learns more about the traditional way of life of its indigenous people who are treated unjustly by the authorities. The film explores the symbiosis of the indigenous people living in harmony with nature and their ancient healer, a life which is closely linked to the use of highly psychoactive substances.




Controversial issues


These controversial issues in the film are explored with the help of many researchers involved in scientific studies. Dr. Jeremy Narby is a world-renowned anthropologist who has studied these indigenous cultures in their own environment for many years. Dr. Stanislav Grof, a psychiatrist specializing in the study of expanded states of consciousness, and quantum theorist Amit Goswami, who tells us about how all living beings and inanimate matter are interconnected. The film highlights the contrast between a natural way of life and life in Western society. 


Through the film, we learn about


The issue of the Amazon as a whole, about native Amazonian traditions and healing, about Swiss scientists who conduct research in the Amazon rainforest, seeking medicinal plants. We will get to meet the heads of communities, where native Amazonian law and oppression are discussed. We get the chance to observe ourselves through a sacred medicine called Ayahuasca in a Peruvian treatment center. We get to visit well-known as well as yet unexplored places in these many beautiful locations.  



A visual treat

The film is made for a wide range of audiences. We are planning to accompany the audio and visual scenery with interviews from scientists, academics, and theorists; however, these will only be general, with no deeper analysis that could affect anyone's freedom of choice or philosophy. It is all made for a discerning audience looking for a visual treat.

First, he worked on the screenwriting and also on the production of the dream-like documentary film "The World is Beautiful,“ which was awarded the Jury Prize and the Spoken Word Prize at the International Mental Power Prague Film Festival in 2012. The second part of this body of artistic work involved the producing and co-writing of a fairy tale to fairy tale, To "the Fairy Tale.“ Another side of his career involves the creation of an entirely new international film festival in the Czech Republic. The festival "Good Mind - stories of ordinary happiness“ was a response to current global and domestic affairs, including contemporary film making and paved the way for a range of filmmakers who do not aspire to create professional art or who are not interested in presenting violent, sharply political or otherwise offensive scenarios.  


Ing. Tomas Moravek - marketing
Award-winning
Manager of the Year, winner of the European LABEL Prize for teaching the blind,
an enthusiastic help to such a valuable project.Ing. Tomáš
Morávek graduated from the Faculty of Informatics and Management at the
University of Hradec Králové. He has spent his entire career in strategic and
managerial positions, focusing on marketing and project management. He has
always been enthusiastic about managing projects with a deep sense of value. He
spent 15 years as the director of the EUROPEAN EDUCATION CENTRE and 3 years
building the ONLINE language e-learning platform. So far, almost 70,000 people
have received an education thanks to his work. He holds numerous awards, including
the prestigious European LABEL Prize. 

Dr. Amit Goswami, Ph.D. - expert





The theoretical quantum physicist Dr. Amit Goswami is a revolutionary among a growing body of renegade scientists who, in recent years, have ventured into the domain of the spiritual in an attempt both to interpret the seemingly inexplicable findings of curious experiments and to explore ideas about the existence of a spiritual dimension of life.  
A prolific writer, teacher, and visionary, Dr. Goswami has appeared in the movies What the Bleep Do We Know!?, Dalai Lama Renaissance, as well as the award-winning documentary, The Quantum Activist. 


Dr. Jeremy Narby - expert
Dr. Jeremy Narby (Montreal, 1959) is an anthropologist and writer. Narby grew up in Canada and Switzerland, studied history at the University of Canterbury, and received a doctorate in anthropology from Stanford University. Narby spent several years living with the Ashaninca in the Peruvian Amazon, cataloging indigenous uses of rainforest resources to help combat ecological destruction. 

Narby has written three books, as well as sponsored an expedition to the rainforest for biologists and other scientists to examine indigenous knowledge systems and the use of Ayahuasca in gaining knowledge. Since 1989, Narby has been working as the Amazonian projects director for the Swiss NGO, Nouvelle Planète.  



Dr. Stanislav Grof, Ph.D. - expert


Stan Grof, M.D., Ph.D. is a psychiatrist with more than fifty years' experience researching the healing and transformative potential of non-ordinary states of consciousness. His groundbreaking theories influenced the integration of Western science with his brilliant mapping of the transpersonal dimension. On October 5, 2007, Dr. Grof received the prestigious VISION 97 award presented by the Dagmar and Václav Havel Foundation in Prague. He is one of the founders and chief theoreticians of Transpersonal Psychology and received an Honorary Award for major contributions to and the development of the field of Transpersonal Psychology from the Association for Transpersonal Psychology in 1993. Dr. Grof is also the founding president of the International Transpersonal Association (ITA) and was its president for many years.

He has organized large international conferences throughout the world and continues to lecture and teach professional training programs in Holotropic Breathwork and transpersonal psychology. Currently, Dr. Grof is a Professor of Psychology at the California Institute of Integral Studies (CIIS) at the Department of Philosophy, Cosmology, and Consciousness in San Francisco, CA, and at Wisdom University in Oakland, CA. Dr. Grof was born in 1931 in Prague, where he received an M.D. from Charles University and a Ph.D. (Doctor of Philosophy in Medicine) from the Czechoslovakian Academy of Sciences. Between 1960 and 1967, he was principal investigator in a psychedelic research program at the Psychiatric Research Institute in Prague, Czechoslovakia.



Experience an expedition in the Amazon!
We would like to offer the partners and sponsors of our film an amazing experience organized especially to suit your needs - A UNIQUE AND UNFORGETTABLE EXPEDITION IN THE AMAZON. You will meet real shamans, coming from as yet unseen cultures and will be healed using an ancient medicine that the local native inhabitants are striving to protect. We apologize, but your airfare is not included in the expedition package. We will be happy to help you with everything else! 


What will you receive as our partner/sponsor?


An extraordinary and unique expedition to the Amazon (excluding air fare).

Gifts from Peru.

The chance to meet us in person.
The chance to attend the official premiere.

The opportunity to participate in international conferences.


An exclusive listing in the credits, on the DVD, posters and all promotional materials, including the website and corporate identity.

Communication throughout the project.
Online advance premiere of the film.
An original and signed DVD.

An original and signed poster. 

Gratitude and excellent karma.

Other bonuses we will come up with while developing the project.





PLEASE HELP US NOW!
PLEASE SHARE OUR CAMPAIGN WITH YOUR FRIENDS ON SOCIAL MEDIA!




PUBLIC RELEASE
Breath-Taking Documentary About Amazon Rainforest Needs Support On INDIEGOGO

The Inside Of Us is a unique documentary by a heroic filmmaking team from The Czech Republic, and it needs funding on INDIEGOGO. Told through the feelings of the Amazon Rainforest’s indigenous people, the film starkly shows the destruction of the people’s culture, homes, and their source of precious medicines. The Inside Of Us stresses the importance of the Amazon Rainforest, and its social value to Western society. Rather than outrage, The Inside Of Us aims to guide viewers toward awareness and action to protect the Amazon Rainforest and its people. 

To keep The Inside Of Us independent, the filmmakers ask for public help on INDIEGOGO.  They have personally invested nearly $100,000 while refusing lucrative contract offers. A free preview of the first 10 minutes of The Inside Of Us is available to journalists and potential donors.
The Inside Of Us features three renowned scientists: theoretical physicist Amit Goswami, anthropologist Jeremy Narby and psychiatrist Stanislav Grof. Producer Oldrich Tamas is the winner of the International JURI Prize from a prestigious Czech film festival.  Tamas’ artistic collaborator, Jan Rajnoha, directs the film. The Inside Of Us was shot in 5 countries on 3 continents. Filming began in 2013 in the Amazon Rainforest of Peru and Ecuador in South America, in North America in New York, and in Europe’s Switzerland and The Czech Republic. Using cutting-edge technology, The Inside of Us is top-quality viewing.

The filmmakers choose to remain independent, refusing to accept any private-sector funds that would interfere with the artistic control of The Inside Of Us. Ambitious international plans are underway for The Inside Of Us. The film will be distributed to some 300 TV stations worldwide. Screenings will be held at major international festivals. Anyone funding The Inside Of Us via INDIEGOGO will have access to free online pre-premiere screening.

The Inside Of Us project will be 6 films, highlighting some of the most precious environmental, human and social values on Earth. Future plans include shooting the lush jungles of Borneo, shedding more light on Nepal’s earthquake victims, and introducing people to Diamond Way Buddhism. Now, the filmmakers request the public help them complete the first film, The Inside Of Us. Part One calls for protecting the human and cultural values of the Amazon Rainforest. Further support is needed to start shooting the next part, which will feature the unique relics and ancient wisdom of Mexico.

The Inside Of Us is a powerful documentary, chronicling the life of a man who leaves modern Western civilization, travelling the world seeking answers to life’s burning questions. He arrives in the Amazon Rainforest, where he shows the alarming destruction of our planet, the need to protect the ancient wisdom of shamans, and illustrates a new path of consciousness to one’s inner harmony.

Now, the filmmakers have launched a 60-day campaign on INDIEGOGO to raise $340,000. Every donor is rewarded; larger donations give people the chance to enjoy an expedition to the Amazon Rainforest to experience ancient cultures and the wisdom of local shamans. Tomas Moravek heads the fundraising. He is the winner of the Manager of the Year Award and holds the European LABEL Prize for teaching the blind. Contact Tomas anytime at tom@insideofus-doc.com to ask to see the first 10 minutes of the film free of charge.

story:
A Little about Us.

Hamba Kahle is a short film that is written and directed by Renessa Mahabeer.

This film has a strong production team from various backgrounds, which is composed mainly of women  who have joined forces to create this truly special film. We have a very talented cinematographer from Mexico, Marina San Martin who has a unique cinematic style and is a great asset to this team.

The producers of this film are Renessa Mahabeer, Kgomotso Mashilo and Isabel Catalán Sada. We have sourced a well accomplished cast to bring this story to life.

This global cast and crew are excited about shooting this film and we need your help to make this film a reality.

Hamba Kahle is a film that plays into themes that everyone can relate to. Our main character, Sandi is in her early twenties and is living in the city of Johannesburg. She gets a call from her sister back home, her father is ill and she has to rush to his side.

When Sandi gets home, we realise that not only has she not been home in many years, but she left the village with many unresolved issues. This film follows her path down the lane of self discovery and forgiveness. When it comes to family, the bond runs deep.

Our team comes from all over the world. We relate to the feeling of being away from home and all that comes with it. Home is not just a house that you live in, it is also about your history, culture, memories and relationships.

Being away from home is a lonely experience, it also gives you a greater appreciation of your home and your family. In this film, we explore all of these themes, as well as the concept of self forgiveness and acceptance. 

This film is incited by heartbreaking circumstances that makes our audience appreciate what is really important in life. We often overlook the important things in life when we get wrapped up in busy lifestyles and superficial goals. This movie strips away the layers to get down to the core values and emotions we all have.

How you can Help.

This short film is a great cinematic movie that appeals to all generations, nationalities and backgrounds. With your help, we can breathe life into this film.

In order to make this film, we need to raise our production costs and this is where you can contribute to our dream of making this film come true. 

  • With your pledges, you will enable us to hire our  gear, pay our amazing actors, get unique costume and art design, and get provisions for a week's worth of shooting.
  • Each donation will have a wonderful reward such as Hand made African blankets, as well as personalised gifts from our well-known cast and many more! Please have a look at our rewards!.
  • In  the case that we are unable to reach our target, all the money will go into the bare basics of the film. Our cast will make this film because they are passionate about the story and they believe in this film. The money that we raise will be invested into gear rental first, as all of the crew are travelling and working pro bono.

The Impact

Sandi, our main character, returns home to find the wreckage that she caused when she left. Sandi left home in an immature and selfish manner. Many years later, she is forced to return home and face the consequences of her actions. She is filled with fear and regret but she decides to do what is needed for herself and her loved ones. This story is about growing up, facing your past to make peace, and repairing your soul by fixing your relationships.

  • Family and friendship is important to all of us and it helps us mould who we are, We have placed this universal story into a small African village which further exemplifies that no matter where in the world we are from, we all have the same emotions.
  • This short film is directed by the very talented and experienced director, Renessa Mahabeer. She is a working industry professional that has a vast background in everything from short films to broadcast television and music videos.

Risks and Challenges

One of the most imminent challenges of this short is its budget which we can only achieve with the help of amazingly generous contributors who believe in our story as much as we do. For a short film, this is a conservative budget and we have full faith that with your help, we will reach our target.

  • We believe we have a story that will resonate with a global audience, this film reminds people what is really important in life.
  • We are using social media and industry contacts to market this film and bring attention to our story, 
  • We aim to raise awareness of this film and reach out to people so that they get as excited about this film as we are.

Other ways you can help!

Any penny counts, but so does getting the word out! 

The best way to help would be to pledge to our campaign but there is more that you can do.

  • You can share our Indiegogo campaign on social media and follow our Facebook page on https://www.facebook.com/HambaKahletheshortfilm , Twitter @Hamba_Kahle1 and Instagram @hambakahlefilm for updates and information about our film!
We cannot wait to make this film and we want you to be a part of it.
The Hamba Kahle Team.

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Logline

Sodom & Gomorrah is a modern, gay retelling of The Odd Couple, following two brand new friends working together to hack it in the gay-borhoods of Los Angeles despite their differing expression of their homosexuality in their day-to-day lives. 

Summary

Sam, an over-the-top, full-fledged participant in gay culture, yearns to find a place where he isn’t the “odd gay out”, while his best friend and roommate, Geoff, is much more reserved and pragmatic, and unfamiliar with many typical gay cultural touchstones. 

Working in tandem, Sam and Geoff offer one another support as they come face to face with difficult realities and personal shortcomings while starting their new careers and lives in West Hollywood. In the web series adaptation of the pilot, we will humorously explore the different experiences of being gay through the interaction of these two characters. 

Team

Tom Young

Tom Young, writer and producer ofSodom & Gomorrah, is on the cusp of receiving his MFA in Writing and Producing for Television at Loyola Marymount University. Hailing from the heteronormative suburbs of Portland, Oregon, he enjoys writing satirical comedy with an emphasis on LGBT narratives and characters. Previous credits include the co-created web seriesStarstuck,in addition to working at MTV, Starz, Esquire, and Retrofit Films. He is proud to be an active member of the West Hollywood Soccer Club, the premiere gay soccer club in the country.  


Casey Leach

Casey Leach will star as Sam in Sodom & Gomorrah. A native of Tallahassee, Florida, is a recent graduate of Florida State University, having received his Bachelor of Fine Arts in Acting in May of 2015. A classically trained stage actor with a passion for film, he's thoroughly enjoying the opportunities that living in Los Angeles brings. In addition to acting, he also writes and directs, and is currently producing the web series "Zoo-mentary" alongside some fellow Florida State alumns. If you can't find him on set, you'll probably find him drinking: cold brew at Steampunk Coffeebar + Kitchen, a protein shake after the gym, or a glass of whiskey at the Chimneysweep Lounge. Fun thing he's "proud" of: while in school, he took a semester in London, studying Shakespeare, Playwriting, and Dramatic Combat.

He is currently managed by RSA Talent and represented by ABA Talent.


Ryan Fisher

 Ryan Fisher will star as Geoff in Sodom & Gomorrah. Ryan hails from Toronto, Canada. A graduate of the acting program at the University of Toronto joint with Sheridan College, Ryan is currently at the Groundlings Comedy School. 
Past TV: The Mentalist (CBS). Online: Jake, "The Spinoffs" and “Openly Jake” (RushIt Network). Past Theatre: Laertes, “Hamlet” (Archway Studio Theatre), Hortensio, "The Taming of the Shrew" (Queer Classics, Encore Award in Hollywood Fringe), Lysander, "A Midsummer Nights Dream" (Urban Bard), The Hustler, "Being at Home with Claude" (Toronto Fringe), Kate/Sly, "The Taming of the Shrew" (Theatre Erindale). 
This spring he will return he the stage performing as Sophie's Choice in the West Hollywood hit "Streeptease" (Sinking Village Prod.) @ryanlesliefisher

Jonathan Talbert

Jonathan Talbert is a 3rd year grad student in LMU’s Writing and Producing for Television program and is our director. Originally from Chicago, Jonathan wants to work as a television showrunner, making directing and producing “Sodom & Gomorrah” from its inception great practice!

Fun thing he's "proud" of: Jonathan has collaborated previously on a web series with Tom Young called “Starstruck” and is looking forward to continuing that experience on this new show. As a filmmaker, Jonathan’s produced and directed two features “Nowheresville” and “Spare Change” as well as another webs series, “Starstruck”. You can view Jonathan’s full filmography on his website: www.jonathantalbert.com It contains links to all of my past projects!


Brittney Creamer

Brittney is a first year grad student at LMU, studying Writing and Producing for Television. She is assisting the team with fundraising and social media and is thrilled to be working on her very first web series! Brittney wrapped her first short film, The Milliner, in November and is currently interning with NBC Universal. Fun thing she's "proud" of: Britt loves strumming "Puff the Magic Dragon" on her ukulele.

Tom Goss

Tom is an unabashed romantic, known for his expressive and personal songs about love and longing and is our composer. A self-taught musician and songwriter, Tom has performed to tens of thousands in the United States and Europe, and has been heard on ABC, HBO and several independent films. An dynamic performer, Tom has performed over 1,000 shows, in 100 cities and 5 countries.

His newest single and music video, "Breath and Sound," garnered world-wide attention for it's inventive and evocative storytelling through dance, generating over 130,000 views in it's first week of release. His previous videos have tackled Transgender rights, body image, DADT and marriage equality and have been featured in Upworthy, HuffingtonPost, PinkNews, Univision, The Advocate, Out, LOGO, Towleroad, Queerty and After Elton. Combined, his music videos have racked up over 5 million views worldwide.
www.tomgossmusic.com         

"Tom Goss...uses his music videos to share important messages." - Upworthy

"Moving...Incredible" - The Huffington Post
"Addictive and upbeat" - MuseMuse
"Heartfelt winner" -On Tap Magazine


Daniel Martinez Jr. 

Daniel Martinez Jr. may have spent the last 6 years living in San Franscisco
, but he’ll always be from San Jose, CA (#siliconvalley). Daniel is casting for "Sodom & Gomorrah". Currently a first year MFA student in the Writing and Producing for Television program at LMU, Daniel is also a part time actor whose goal is to write, produce, and star in his own show(s) – he wants to learn it all! As an actor, Daniel has been featured in the web series “Cost of Living” as well as a commercial for Yik Yak. Fun thing he's "proud" of: Daniel was a core extra for the film “Steve Jobs” and fangirled HARD when he got to see Kate Winslet and Michael Fassbender up close. Even though Seth Rogen had lunch with the extras and sat at the same table, Daniel was too afraid to talk to him.

www.danielmartinezjr.com


Elias Ontiveros

Elias is from Ventura, CA and is working on locations and permits for “Sodom & Gomorrah”. Elias has so much fun in pre-production as a producer and screenwriter and is always up for new experiences. One day Elias hopes to create his own network and/or production company. Fun thing he's "proud" of: Elias reinterpreted Toy Story as a live-action black comedy about mental patients in an insane asylum.

YouTube: SincerelyEarnest


David Schottky, Jr. 


DJ is from Sacramento and a graduate of Loyola Marymount University. Currently a freelance editor, DJ will be in the “Sodom & Gomorrah” editing room and lend a hand on set. DJ directed and edited the short documentary Scomparendo and the short film The Clocks Don't Work. Fun thing he’s “proud” of: DJ once edited The Truman Show to play like Arrested Development!

vimeo.com/davidschottkyjr


What We Need 

As an MFA thesis project, the student is responsible for funding their own project. While we have access to camera and lighting equipment, there's quite a bit that the student has to shoulder. We'll be shooting for five days and your donation will contribute to the costs of: 

  • Location permits
  • Craft services for cast & crew
  • Production design
  • Transportation 
  • Post-production expenses

The Impact

A thesis project acts as an initial calling card when a student launches their career in the entertainment industry. Through collaboration with other students and young professionals, we have an opportunity to showcase our creative voice and ambition. Our budget is modest, but the talent we've pulled together is dedicated to delivering a polished product. 

And we're unique. With a focus on LGBT characters and narrative, we hope to bring an honest and refreshing portrayal of friendship in the gay community, a perspective that is often left out of mainstream entertainment.

What You Get

Not only do you get to be a part of an exciting project, but we have plenty of fun swag to show our appreciation! Don't forget to check out the Sodom & Gomorrah perks! Here's peak at the goods: 


 


Other Ways You Can Help

Share the love! Shout Sodom & Gomorrah from the rooftop! Social media is a powerful marketing tool and any additional eye balls will help us reach our goal.
