If you can't find him on set, you'll probably find him drinking: cold brew at Steampunk Coffeebar + Kitchen, a protein shake after the gym, or a glass of whiskey at the Chimneysweep Lounge. Fun thing he's "proud" of: while in school, he took a semester in London, studying Shakespeare, Playwriting, and Dramatic Combat.
He is currently managed by RSA Talent and represented by ABA Talent.


Ryan Fisher



 Ryan Fisher will star as Geoff in Sodom & Gomorrah. Ryan hails from Toronto, Canada. A graduate of the acting program at the University of Toronto joint with Sheridan College, Ryan is currently at the Groundlings Comedy School. 
Past TV: The Mentalist (CBS). Online: Jake, "The Spinoffs" and “Openly Jake” (RushIt Network). Past Theatre: Laertes, “Hamlet” (Archway Studio Theatre), Hortensio, "The Taming of the Shrew" (Queer Classics, Encore Award in Hollywood Fringe), Lysander, "A Midsummer Nights Dream" (Urban Bard), The Hustler, "Being at Home with Claude" (Toronto Fringe), Kate/Sly, "The Taming of the Shrew" (Theatre Erindale). 
This spring he will return he the stage performing as Sophie's Choice in the West Hollywood hit "Streeptease" (Sinking Village Prod.) @ryanlesliefisher


Jonathan Talbert



Jonathan Talbert is a 3rd year grad student in LMU’s Writing
and Producing for Television program and is our director. Originally from Chicago, Jonathan wants to
work as a television showrunner, making directing and producing “Sodom &
Gomorrah” from its inception great practice! 
Fun thing he's "proud" of: Jonathan has
collaborated previously on a web series with Tom Young called “Starstruck”
and is looking forward to continuing that experience on this new show. As a
filmmaker, Jonathan’s produced and directed two features “Nowheresville” and “Spare
Change” as well as another webs series, “Starstruck”. You can view Jonathan’s full
filmography on his website: www.jonathantalbert.com It
contains links to all of my past projects!


Brittney Creamer



Brittney is a first year grad student at LMU, studying Writing and Producing for Television. She is assisting the team with fundraising and social media and is thrilled to be working on her very first web series! Brittney wrapped her first short film, The Milliner, in November and is currently interning with NBC Universal. Fun thing she's "proud" of: Britt loves strumming "Puff the Magic Dragon" on her ukulele.

Tom Goss



Tom is an unabashed romantic, known for his expressive and personal
songs about love and longing and is our composer. A self-taught musician and songwriter, Tom has
performed to tens of thousands in the United States and Europe, and has been
heard on ABC, HBO and several independent films. An dynamic
performer, Tom has performed over 1,000 shows, in 100 cities and 5 countries.

His newest single and music video, "Breath and Sound," garnered
world-wide attention for it's inventive and evocative storytelling through
dance, generating over 130,000 views in it's first week of release. His
previous videos have tackled Transgender rights, body image, DADT and marriage
equality and have been featured in Upworthy, HuffingtonPost, PinkNews,
Univision, The Advocate, Out, LOGO, Towleroad, Queerty and After Elton.
Combined, his music videos have racked up over 5 million views worldwide.


www.tomgossmusic.com         

"Tom Goss...uses
his music videos to share important messages." - Upworthy
"Moving...Incredible"
- The Huffington Post
"Addictive and upbeat" - MuseMuse
"Heartfelt winner" -On Tap Magazine

Daniel Martinez Jr. 


Daniel Martinez Jr. may have
spent the last 6 years living in San Franscisco, but he’ll always be from San
Jose, CA (#siliconvalley). Daniel is casting for "Sodom & Gomorrah". Currently a first year MFA student in the Writing
and Producing for Television program at LMU, Daniel is also a part time actor
whose goal is to write, produce, and star in his own show(s) – he wants to
learn it all! As an actor, Daniel has been featured in the web series “Cost of
Living” as well as a commercial for Yik Yak. Fun thing he's "proud" of: Daniel was a core
extra for the film “Steve Jobs” and fangirled HARD when he got to see Kate
Winslet and Michael Fassbender up close. Even though Seth Rogen had lunch with
the extras and sat at the same table, Daniel was too afraid to talk to him. 
www.danielmartinezjr.com


Elias Ontiveros


Elias is from Ventura, CA and is working on locations and
permits for “Sodom & Gomorrah”. Elias has so much fun in pre-production as
a producer and screenwriter and is always up for new experiences. One day Elias
hopes to create his own network and/or production company. Fun thing he's "proud" of: Elias
reinterpreted Toy Story as a live-action black comedy about mental patients in
an insane asylum.
YouTube: SincerelyEarnest


David Schottky, Jr. 


DJ is from Sacramento and a graduate of Loyola Marymount University.
Currently a freelance editor, DJ will be in the “Sodom & Gomorrah” editing
room and lend a hand on set. DJ directed and edited the short documentary Scomparendo and the short
film The Clocks Don't Work. Fun thing he’s “proud” of: DJ once edited The Truman Show to play like Arrested
Development!
vimeo.com/davidschottkyjr


What We Need  As an MFA thesis project, the student is responsible for funding their own project. While we have access to camera and lighting equipment, there's quite a bit that the student has to shoulder. We'll be shooting for five days and your donation will contribute to the costs of:   Location permits
Craft services for cast & crew
Production design
Transportation 
Post-production expenses
   The Impact A thesis project acts as an initial calling card when a student launches their career in the entertainment industry. Through collaboration with other students and young professionals, we have an opportunity to showcase our creative voice and ambition. Our budget is modest, but the talent we've pulled together is dedicated to delivering a polished product. 
And we're unique. With a focus on LGBT characters and narrative, we hope to bring an honest and refreshing portrayal of friendship in the gay community, a perspective that is often left out of mainstream entertainment.
What You Get
Not only do you get to be a part of an exciting project, but we have plenty of fun swag to show our appreciation! Don't forget to check out the Sodom & Gomorrah perks! Here's peak at the goods: 



 





    Other Ways You Can Help 
Share
the love! Shout Sodom & Gomorrah from
the rooftop! Social media is a powerful marketing tool and any additional eye balls will help us reach our goal.

story:
Short Summary

Do you believe in love at first sight? Can you find real love through social media and app technology? Bae @ First Swipe,  a brand new web series, will tell the stories of Black millennials dating in the digital age. Set in Washington, DC it showcases the heart of the city from historic U Street, to the ever changing H Street NE.

Bae @ First Swipe is more than a web series - it's a movement and a chance to be part of changing the way Black people are seen in the media. We don’t see young Black people in lead roles so instead of demanding it from networks, we are going to do it ourselves! This show is about Black relationships and how Black millennials are achieving their goals for careers and success in a post-graduate society.

Your funds will help us tell this story and change the narrative about Black characters. We need more outlets of expression. Our youth need to see more people that look like them in the media.

What We Need & What You Get

We need $15,000 to finish the first season of Bae @ First Swipe. We have devoted a lot of time, money, effort, and love to get this program off the ground. Now we need your help to see it through.

Every donation goes directly toward supporting this series. There are various costs that go into making a web series. Our expenses include:

·  Paying the Actors

·  Paying the Crew

·  Renting rehearsal space

·  Feeding the crew

·  Marketing

·  Editing

·  Equipment costs

·  Location permits

·  Legal fees

·  Insurance

·  Transportation

Your donation can go a long way! Here's how we will put it to use:

·  $1500 can pay for a day of filming

·  $1000 can pay for a day of filming with half the cast or monthly legal fees

·  $500 can pay for half a day of editing

·  $250 can help pay for five actor’s daily stipend for filming

·  $200 can pay for food for the cast and crew for a day

·  $100 can pay for food for half the cast and crew

·  $50 can pay for one actor’s daily stipend for filming

·  $25 pays for travel on a filming day

·  $10 pays for one meal for a crew member or actor

We appreciate each and every donation you give to our web series. We know you work hard for your money and we realize that it means a lot that you choose to donate to our series.

We want to show you our appreciation. Here are some of the ways we want to say Thank you!

-A T-shirt and a special thank you message from the cast of Bae @ First Swipe

-A ticket to the series premiere of Bae @ First Swipe

-A VIP ticket to the series premiere of Bae @ First Swipe and a special meet and greet with the cast and creative team

-A Chance to have your special dating or relationship story featured in an episode in our series

It takes a community to make this show possible and with your help this series can really grow and provide more positive and variety of images of Black culture.

The Impact

My name is Amanda Rhodes and I am the Creator and Executive Producer. I recently attended a fundraiser in support of a non-profit aimed at empowering and educating Black girls. The event included a panel of young Black women in high school and early college talking about their frustration about how they are perceived and seen in the media. Their voices and frustrations reminded me of the importance of this show and more importantly, this campaign. I am inspired to tell the stories these young ladies can relate to. 

We need to give our people, especially our youth, images of people that represent them, both young and old. It’s our responsibility, because no one else will do it for us. 

I have worked in production in the entertainment industry for the past 8 years from Arena Stage in Washington, DC to Sundance Film Festival in Utah. I helped tell a lot of stories. However, I realized that now I want to tell my story about being young and Black living in the Washington, DC area and how much dating has changed from the time my parents were growing up.

People always talk about the struggle of your 20s and this is captured in a variety of shows, but never from the Black perspective.

Risks & Challenges

Any project has it's has it's risks and challenges, but I believe that our team has done enough planning and is driven enough to overcome them. Your donation will help make this enormous task a little easier, and we thank you for that!

Other Ways You Can Help

Can’t donate this time? That’s okay!

We’ll see you on the next one. In the meantime spread the word! Share this page. Tell people about our website. Follow us on Facebook and Instagram. Join the conversation. Donate services if not funds.

We can all do something in some small way to make and impact. Never doubt how your impact can make a difference.

story:
“The Hoia-Baciu Forest – Truth or Legend” travel documentary 


About the documentary: 
“The Hoia-Baciu Forest – Truth or Legend”  is the first professional travel documentary ever made about the Hoia-Baciu Forest. Deep in Transylvania, an area long-associated with vampiric legend and horror, lie almost 300 hectares of dense woodland, called The Hoia-Baciu Forest. The place is believed to be the most haunted forest in the world. 

For over 60 years, it’s been told that this place makes you see and feel inexplicable things, it makes your cameras malfunction and it gives you the shivers as soon as you step into it. No wonder paranormal lovers all over the world strive to come here as often as they can. It is almost impossible to make the difference between the truth and the legends told about this place.


This is why we are in the process of making the first professional travel documentary about the Hoia-Baciu Forest. The touristic potential of this forest is huge and nobody has ever exploited it so far. Each year, hundreds of foreigners come here in search of paranormal experiences. Even if they don’t experience anything unusual, they still notice that the forest is strange. Almost all trees here are scabby, twisted and bizarre. The documentary will include remakes of stories told by people who say they have experienced strange phenomena while visiting the forest. There will also be included some testimonies of Romanian and foreign tourists that claim to have lived inexplicable moments, but also interviews with locals and different researchers.  All these will be shot using high performance devices. The final editing will not include misrepresentations, but it will still be captivating. 

The aim of the project is to create a professional touristic documentary, that can be compared to the most wanted documentaries abroad. Part of the money gained from selling the documentary will be used for cleaning the forest and supplying touristic guidance on wooden panels in the forest. 


Who are we and what do we do? 

The people involved in this project are all professionals. The producer of this film (Cosmin Giurgiu) has 8 years of experience in tourism promotion, 15 years in video production and 4 years in aerial filming. He owns Transylvania’s most visited website, www.ghidvideoturistic.ro. He enjoys promoting travel destinations more than traveling itself. He is responsible for all video concept and content.

The associate producer of the documentary (Laura Calugar) is an experienced TV journalist, that took this personal project as a challenge. She is responsible for all English and Romanian texts in the documentary, but also scripts, stories and interviews. 

Alex Surducan and Marius Lazin run an NGO that promotes different activities in the Hoia-Baciu Forest. They also organize private tours in the forest and greening actions in the woods. They love this forest and its bizarre trees and they are striving each day to protect and promote it. They are responsible for all documentation needed.


How can you help? 

The documentary will most probably become the most wished-for souvenir of Romanian and foreign tourists. It will include images of the forest in all seasons, so the production will last until the end of 2016. There will be night and day scenes. The techniques used will be similar to those of an artistic documentary. The script will strictly take into account the stories of the people who visited the forest. There will be no embellishment, mystification or manipulation. 

Anyone can help promoting this unique place. We know a lot of you are curious about it already, especially because the Hoia-Baciu Forest is worldwide known due to the first UFO ever captured on a camera (the picture was taken by military-technician Emil Barnea in 1968).  

In order to provide tourists quality video souvenirs, we need your help. We need 20,000$ to be sure that this documentary will be ready to sell by the beginning of this December. The documentary will be shot all year because we want to capture the forest’s aspect in every season, so we’ll be working and needing funds for 10 months. We have most of the equipment necessary, but we still need more. With your help, we can raise money for:


·  Sound Mixing

·  Color Correction

·  Music

·  Car maintenance

·  Design and printing

·  German, French and Hungarian translations

·  Web design

·  Outdoor equipment

·  Night filming equipment

·  And the list goes on...


We are really enthusiastic about this project and with your help, we can make Transylvania and the Hoia-Baciu Forest one of the most visited places in the world. www.lonelyplanet.com nominated Transylvania as the best travel destination in 2016. Be part of this travel experience! Your generosity will contribute to developing a high quality product that any tourist will be excited to own. Moreover, your kindness will help keep the forest clean as we plan to organize greening actions during the summer.  


The impact:

We've already gotten the attention of media on this. They are asking us about the project each day and they are writing tens of stories about this. The media understands the need of internationally promoting one of Transylvania’s biggest assets. Tourism in Transylvania is increasing and we need to keep up the good work. Romanians have lots to recover in order to shine among the most visited sights in the world. This documentary is striving to put Transylvania and Romania on the map of any tourist. He will not only experience the unexperienced, but he will also take with him part of the forest, as a video-souvenir. 



Other ways you can help :

Even if you are short on money, you can help with no costs. Please get out there and be noisy about our campaign. Feel free to use the Indiegogo share tools - post to social media regularly! Talk about it with friends, family and like-minded folks and give them the link. Or if you really want to help, contact bloggers, journalists and travel lovers and show them info about our cause!

Whether you post, share, email, check our website (www.hoiabaciuforest.ro) you can and will make the difference. 

Your help is essential to us! THANK YOU SO MUCH!

story:
Short Summary

Key + Colors Productions is an upcoming film production platform committed to telling the ugly, yet beautiful stories of people of color. Our goal is to provide quality, diverse, and  engaging content.

"Made with Magic," is the first film under Key + Colors and we would love for you to be involved in the creative process. As a contributor, you will help make this film possible. Our vision is to not only influence,  but to impact the hearts through the stories we tell.  We're telling our stories, our way. 

What We Need & What You Get

We are trying to raise $1,500 for this project. 

These funds will go towards:

  • Camera Equipment
  • Lighting
  • Props
  • Location
  • Crew
  • Food
By donating, we have a lot of amazing perks in store for you including: 
  • Personalized thank you. 
  • Exclusive Updates.
  • Free admission to private Memphis or Los Angeles screening. 
  • Meet & Greet with cast and crew. 
  • Custom "Made with Magic," merchandise. 
  • Executive Producer credit. 

The Impact

We believe that there thousands of stories that deserve and need to be told surrounding people of color and we intend to tell them in an authentic way.  We believe that our stories have the potential to not only impact lives, but also the hearts of others. 

Risks & Challenges 

One of the biggest challenges we foresee in this process is TIME. In the next 30 days we plan to fully fund and film "Made with Magic," which is a huge task we're taking on, but definitely believe we can do.

Other Ways You Can Help

There are also other ways that you can help us out: 

  • Prayers. 
  • Spread the word to anyone who might be interested in the project. 
  • Email me us with any questions or concerns at madewithmagicfilm@gmail.com.

story:
We are Sanlaap North America, an anti-trafficking organization that has been fighting human trafficking in India for the past six years. Our work begins in the red light districts of India, where we work with the Indian police to rescue young girls - between the ages of five and fifteen - who are the unfortunate victims of human trafficking. Once rescued, their life begins anew. We welcome them into our shelters, where they are provided intensive therapy, medical care, education, and most importantly, a safe home. We are raising $52,000 for the 2016 living costs of the nearly two hundred incredible girls who live at our shelters and consider us their family. 100% of your donation will be used to fund meals, education, and medical care for the girls in our shelters. 




Testimonials from our rockstar donors (via greatnonprofits.org):

"I'm very proud to be a donor and advocate of their work. What stands out most to me is their passion and commitment to really make an impact on the ground, an impact that is felt and experienced by the girls they are working to save. I trust what they do and how they do it, which is particularly important for me as a donor, I look forward to continue supporting their work and to see how expansive they become in the years to come." - aradwan27

"A great organization and a worthy cause - absolutely should be the first destination for someone looking to get involved in making the world a better place!" - chelsea.adelaine

"It is quite impressive what Sanlaap has been able to do in India. They are a well run, transparent, and organized group, accomplishing much with efficient resource allocation. I would highly recommend anyone to invest their time and money working with this group. They are truly making a difference for people who desperately need it." - sg1420

 

As featured in: 



Zesa Gift Set Samples: 
What is Zesa? 
Zesa is our vocational education and retail program. Zesa teaches vocational skills and financial literacy to trafficking survivors and girls at high risk of being trafficked. Graduates are employed by Zesa to handcraft products for sale and 100% of the profits are used to help them rebuild their lives. You can learn more at www.zesa.org.

story:
Cinema Tropical Is Turning 15!

Cinema Tropical, the acclaimed non-profit media arts organization and the premier presenter of Latin American cinema in the U.S., is celebrating its 15th anniversary in 2016..

Our Story

Founded in 2001 with the mission of distributing, programming and promoting what was to become the biggest boom of Latin American cinema in decades, Cinema Tropical brought U.S. audiences some of the first screenings of films like Amores Perros and Y Tu Mamá También.

Through a diversity of programs and initiatives, Cinema Tropical is thriving as a dynamic and groundbreaking 501 (c)(3) non-profit media arts organization experimenting in the creation of better and more effective strategies for the distribution and exhibition of foreign cinema in this country.

For 15 years now, with the limited financial resources of a small non-profit, we have fulfilled our mission and we're proud of the success we've achieved, of the liaison we've built with many of the country's premier cultural institutions, and of the relationship we've built with the thousands of people around the US who consult our website as well as our weekly newsletter and special notices when planning their evenings out. It is, indeed, a pleasure to serve you.

We Need Your Support!

Despite the fact that Latin America has been producing some of the most exciting and groundbreaking cinema in the past few years, most of the films made in the region are still not getting distribution in the US, and have only very limited windows in the film festival circuit.

Cinema Tropical is totally committed in making sure these films get the visibiltiy and attention they deserve. Please help us continue our mission of bringing more Latin American cinema to the United States.

In return for your support, we pledge to continue to act as a critic, curator, spokesman, importer, purveyor and promoter of Latin American cinema in this country.

We'll continue with our popular film programs such as Music+Film: Janeiro in New York Series, Indocumentales, the Cinema Tropical AWARDS, and special film series. 

We'll continue to provide our weekly newsletter with the listing of all what's playing in New York City and Los Angeles, as well as continue TropicalFRONT, our news blog about what's been going on with Latin American cinema.

¡Gracias!

story:
Nostalgia, lies, love and loss.

My Heart Is All I Have is an homage to the golden age of Hollywood, and the Golden age of the movie musical– it is the embodiment of a lifelong love. 

The film is about people living unfulfilled lives, trapped as who they think they should be and learning to let go of that facade and love, with honesty and compassion.

As an international student, I left Britain in 2012 to pursue a BFA in Film and Television at the Savannah College of Art and Design. My love for film was born through years of laughing, crying and singing along to the great melodramas and musicals of the 30s and 40s. I always felt as though nothing has ever reached those rose-tinted heights since and by hook or by crook I had to take people back there.

Fortunately enough I have a remarkable crew of talented and creative individuals who are working diligently to bring this film to life, seasoned producers, cinematographers, editors, choreographers, costume designs and more– the gang's all here!

Where will your money go?

- On screen talent  (actors, dancers, extras, transportation, hotels, food).

- Securing locations (rental, insurance, crew transportation).

- Creation of original costumes and production design materials, props, trinkets, posters, all to ensure an authentic look.

- Writing and recording of the original score by the Pasadena Roof Orchestra,  a beautifully realised cinematic suite that harkens to the unforgettable sounds of times gone by.

-Technicalities (advanced equipment rental, hard drive space, software, copyright licenses, festival submission fees, marketing, distribution).

Of course you won't go unrewarded. As well as our eternal love and gratitude you'll receive beautiful perks for your contribution. These include a copy of the film before it's festival release, your name in the credits, a copy of the original soundtrack, the poster of the film as seen in the film and much more!

Of all the short films in all the towns in all the world, why fund mine?

Don't grovel Rick, I'll show you why– because we have some of the most dedicated, hardworking, and professional young visionary talent pouring all their passion into this film.

Co-Writer & Director – Jordan Hill (as seen below with his very proud Mum)

"Born a century too late." The melancholic hope of 1930s and 40s cultural history is a passion I accrued from many an afternoon spent listening to the endless songs and stories of my Grandparents. Sadly, I lost my Grandmother to an 8 year battle with cancer but I honoured her memory in one of my early films For Judith. Following this I made a second version of the film in 3D.

Judith, my grandmother, introduced me to the hollywood classics that would come to shape me as I became a young man with a burning passion for that bygone era of cinema. I became a filmmaker because I adored the power of sound and images on the soul, their power to truly shake, challenge and change each and everyone of us, alone in the dark. It’s a universal language that transcends any and all words and gives us pure honest empathy.

Losing someone so dear is a remarkably transformative experience, but pain births the most impactful art. Loss and grief have become integral themes in all my work. To love, to miss, to honour, to make proud. Below are some of my previous works, for more please visit my website.



Producer – Jaime Coombe

"I am so excited to work with Jordan again on such a passionate and ambitious project. Jordan and I first worked on For Judith together a few years ago, and our friendship and work relationship blossomed from the start. We reunited for For Judith 3D, as well as a multitude of other projects including a commercial and a documentary. After completing A Slice of Lemon, Jordan immediately began creating his most exciting piece yet – My Heart Is All I Have. It has raw emotion that offers us a glimpse into the tragedy and beauty of life. We hope to make the greatest film we possibly can, and wrap up our four delightful years as young, undergraduate filmmakers."

Co-writer & Producer – Jake Fahey

"Ever since our first class together at SCAD in 2012 we have worked on over five films together in the past four years. What draws me to this project, and to film in general, is story. Cinema is the most visceral medium that conveys story with the hypnotic use of sight and sound. With experience and craft, we strive to develop this enduring story of hope and love into a heartfelt and emotionally driven picture."

Director of Photography – Albert Dantzer

As the director of photography for My Heart Is All I Have, Albert is looking forward to drawing heavily on the classic Hollywood style in the shot design for this film, particularly the Busby Berkeley inspired dance sequence. He has worked with Jordan on several occasions, twice as cinematographer.

Editor – Brittany Bierly

Brittany Bierly is the editor of My Heart Is All I Have. Her goal for this project is to recapture the classic Hollywood style of editing. She has been an assistant editor for The Boombox Saints and has also helped produce two horror movies, The Dead Rose and Wraith. She is looking forward to broadening her editing styles by working on this project.

Post-Sound Designer – Haley Bowers 

"After meeting Jordan’s glowing personality and hearing of his success as a director, I was honored to be asked to be part of the sound design team for his film. Reading the script and listening to demo music, I believe my production and post-production sound ideas can bring this film to life. Foley and sound effects are what I love to create and edit. I love the way films come to life through sound design. It gives such an open and creative means to designers to create worlds that do not exist and sweeten scenes to give an emotional edge solely based on what you can hear. This film has a different story than I would normally design for which gives me a great opportunity to work with new ideas and expand my knowledge of sound."

Costume Designer – April Hornbuckle

"As a costume designer, I have a deeply rooted love for the past decades. My mother and grandmother were my first fashion icons as a child and their classic, feminine, and yet simplistic style is a founding rock in my designing, and my appreciation of the past stems from that upbringing. After being presented with the script of My Heart is All I Have, I was immediately drawn into, not only the wonderful story and characters, but the homage the film was giving to such a beautiful time in history. I look forward to being able to really pull from that golden era that I've admired so much through the years to design for such a fabulous film."

Let's face the music and share!

Without a doubt this is a remarkably ambitious undertaking but I have absolute confidence in the entire team's ability to create something truly unique whilst being whole heartedly faithful to its history.

Your trust and commitment is the priceless necessity that will be the key to bringing this fantastic project to fruition. 

Please join in the excitement by spreading the word– rally your nearest and dearest. 

Share with all your might across the internet, with your friends, neighbours and colleagues, tell everyone it's time for a new good old-fashioned romantic musical, it's time for the golden age to shine again!

Thank you infinitely and all the best, as ever.

story:
Short Summary

LLC ”Telestudio New City” is private Belarusian company which performs its activity in creation (production) of intellectual property objects - author’s TV programs, feature-length and short documentaries, fiction films and programs.  ”Telestudio New City” mostly focuses on the social subjects. In 2011 our company appeared to be an author and creator of TV project comprising a cycle (21 series) of TV programs about children with special needs “Everyone has the right to be different” by joint support of UNICEF in Belarus and Belarusian National TV Company ( http://special.unicef.by/video/). In 2013 ”Telestudio New City” produced feature-length documentary “It is from bitter flowers that a bee collects honey” about people with special needs in Belarus (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HJItBw8AgNs). In 2014 we produced the short documentary “Eco-Souls”. The film is about advantages of environmentally responsible package (eco bags) in front of plastic one. But also this is a story about Belarusian enterprise “ArtIdea” which employs people with heavy combined disabilities who produce eco bags. In 2015 the film “Eco-Souls” has been presented on the few International festivals - Human rights Film Festival in San Sebastian (Spain), Festival du Film Environnemental 2015 (France), etc. (https://vimeo.com/122026872 ).

New project - Documentary  about life of deaf people in Belarus is aimed to defend rights of the people with hearing disabilities. Creation of audiovisual product is one of the best ways to bring information and problems to the society. The film is planned to be demonstrated on the main channels of Belarusian TV and their websites, international festivals, Internet, social events. It will attract maximum audience. Films about people with hearing disabilities in positive way of problem’s solving will increase tolerance of society to people with disabilities and develop of the barrier-free environment.

Problem description: Problem of social adaptation of the people with disabilities is one of the most important sides of the general integration problem in Belarus. This aspect is studied very little. For the people with hearing disabilities most typical special needs are: communication; free access to objects of social, cultural and other fields; education possibilities; job placement; comfortable life conditions; accessibility to TV programs (sign language interpretation); creation of Republican Center of acceptance and transfer of messages from persons with hearing problems to the emergency services; development of international cultural connections and others. The problem for this category of people with disabilities consists of multiple social, mental and physical barriers in society as result of insufficient information and knowledge about their special needs. Some problems for people with this kind of disability are common around the world, so the film shown on the different international events can be useful in other countries.

Project partners:

1.  Belarusian Non-governmental Association of deaf people;

2.  Belarusian National TV Company;

3.  Non-governmental organization “Filmmakers Union of Belarus”.

Target group: deaf people, their environment, general viewing audience, governmental and legislative institutions.

Basic aim: to increase tolerance of society to people with disabilities and develop the barrier-free environment for them such as special facilities and inclusion them in society.

Derived project objectives:

1. To give information about life of the people with hearing disabilities by means of audiovisual works;

2. To demonstrate the problems of the people with hearing disabilities;

3. To show possible positive way of solving of the problems;

4. To attract maximum general viewing audience including governmental and legislative institutions in Belarus that can influence and improve the situation in our country regarding people with special needs.

5. To develop TV broadcasting for people with hearing problems in terms of sign language interpretation.

6. Sharing experiences of the people with hearing disabilities between different countries.

Total project budget: 8 740$

Requested contribution: 7 440$

Input of staff and resources: 1 300$

Duration of the project: 5-6 months

In the film we will appoint the main sourses of financing and make references about sponsors!

story:
The Reason

Look guys, I've been back and forth on whether or not to do this about a dozen times, and after a nights sleep and some serious consideration, I've decided to give it a shot. I've been working hard lately, teaching myself how to shoot, edit and upload(yes, I'm a redneck and even this was difficult at first), video vignettes, matches, interviews and clips for great wrestlers, promotions and of course, myself. The problem with being new, is that I forgot a few things on the over $3000 shopping list.(Forget, can't afford, whichever sounds better. Credit is pretty sweet, right? Ugh!) 

Help me support great wrestlers, promotions and other indie wrestling business's!

What I Need...

  • Slider Dolly
  • Wide Angle Lens
  • Microphone Wind Muff

What You Get...

  • Any donation automatically gets an autographed 8x10 of me.(Maybe it'll be worth a lot one day?)
  • Any donation $50 or more, will get the signed photo and their choice of 2 tickets to any 1 event I'm scheduled to be on, or a free t-shirt!(First come first serve for the shirts)
  • Tons more perks like 1 Month Free Training to become a wrestler, Free Photo Shoots for Wrestlers, and even discounts on wrestling gear!
  • Check out the perks ----->

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Even if you can't, or maybe just don't want to donate, please share this with your friends and spread the word!

story:
Hello, all! My name is Pernell Langhorne III. This is my third year as a film student at Regent University in Virginia Beach. My Disney Bad Blood Music Video is about a young girl named Kairi from the hit video game, Kingdom Hearts. Kairi is faced with the betrayal of her friend, Naminé, and must assemble the Disney Princesses you all know and love to fight against a threat that could destroy them all. 

This project is not only important to me but to everyone that is involved. It will provide a chance for us as film students to branch out and do something different to perfect our skills and have a valuable asset in our resumes. This also gives a chance for the character in the game, Kairi, to be more important because she has not received the credit she deserves. Our team believes that no woman, within any platform, should be left unnoticed and undermined. 

Our goal is to raise $1000 for food, wardrobe, sets, and travel costs. We are having beautiful, handmade costumes and props being crafted and there are some pretty awesome perks included with your donations! 

Spread the word and let everyone know about this music video so that it can go viral! We want Taylor Swift herself to share it! Updates, pictures, and videos will also be posted during our journey because we want you to be a part of the process. There is a determined and passionate cast and crew behind this and we want to do our absolute best with this project. So please, help us bring the magic of Disney's Kingdom Hearts and the epicness of Taylor Swift's "Bad Blood" to reality!

story:
Short Summary

We are passionate film crew that are looking for people to fund our short film set in post apocalyptic 80's Britain.

The film follows the life of a woman evolving to live in a post apocalyptic world and making decisions that is essential to stay alive.

This is a very professional production and to achieve the best result possible we need your help to help us fund for things such as Actors, Set design, Location, VFX, Food and Distribution. 

What We Need & What You Get

We need you to fund this film, anything you can give is plenty for us. whether it is £1 or £100, anything you give will push the film to be the best it can be.

In return we are also giving you perks such as premiere tickets, hand crafted props and Executive Producer credits.

The Impact

We believe we have a great script and film,  we want the film to be seen by people all around the world. Any help you give us will ensure that the film gets one step closer to being the best it can.

Other Ways You Can Help

Any help is appreciated, please get in touch. Anything from catering to props.

story:
This campaign is now closed. Thank you to everyone that donated. As you may know, we didn't reach our goal, but that's alright. Every dollar you donated helps us pay for our expenses. Remember the viewing is invite-only, so if we don't personally know you, you may not be able to watch the film. We will contact our invitees in the coming months regarding viewing. Thanks again for your support and have a great day!

 

Due to the fact that the filmmakers and actors are minors, the film will not be available for the public to view. The viewing will be invite-only. We are extremely sorry for any inconvenience this may cause.

 

Summary

Bob Poolman leads a double life as a single father and the head of the CIA. When he must protect his daughter, Jennifer Poolman, from an attack but can’t rescue her himself, he sends his best spy, Sam Cage, to get her. Before Bob has the chance to see Jennifer, she becomes the target of an enemy organization named ADAFT. When ADAFT strikes, Jennifer courageously protects herself. But when she stumbles upon something she shouldn’t have seen, she must try to escape with her life and find her father.

 

Who We Are

Hello! We are Max and Lucas, teen filmmakers, and creators of Spy Secrets. We've been working on this for about four years now and have spent many hours tweaking the script, discovering locations, inviting actors, and finding our vision for the film. Now, we just need your help to make this film a reality. With your help, it'll be incredible.

 

What We Need

We're ready with the story, and now we need some equipment. Right now, we are seeking $8,000. This will go towards renting equipment (Sony FS5), feeding our cast and crew, purchasing props and costumes, and post-production costs. And don't you worry, any money you donate will only be spent on this film!

 

What You’ll Get

If you donate to our campaign you'll receive some awesome stuff! Check out the perks on the right for more info. You can get a personal shout out on our Twitter page, official shooting script, end credits, exclusive digital poster, and signed postcard! If we don't reach our goal the film will still be made, but we may have to cut some corners. Please help us out and donate today!

 

The Impact

If this campaign goes well, you'll make a tremendous impact on us. This is going to be an epic short film and we are incredibly excited to bring it to you! Please help us prove that age doesn't matter, and young people can do amazing things. Mark Twain once said:

Age is an issue of mind over matter. If you don't mind, it doesn't matter. 

We are counting on you, don't let us down.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're tight on cash, there are definitely other ways you can help! Share this campaign with your family and friends or through your social circles. Be sure to use the hashtag #SpySecrets. Click here to tweet!

story:
BIG LOVE TO ANNASOPHIA ROBB FOR SHARING HER PASSION FOR MY MOM AND THE GIRL 

AnnaSophia Robb

We have an awesome opportunity to help support ‪#‎mymomandthegirl‬ . It's going to show a new perspective on ‪#‎alzheimers‬. Please join me and lend what you can, even if it's just your voice. http://www.whosay.com/l/JQgbyps


My Mom and The Girl is proud to announce our latest partnership with The Handshake Foundation 

The partnership supports THF's on-going mission to inspire young talent and career aspirations. Students will be given an opportunity to get practical and hands on experience as a set PA. And anyone will tell you, PA’s on a film set work hard and learn a lot.  WIN-WIN!! AND - there' more!!  Students selected will receive a financial grant through THF to continue their studies. Interested students should complete the application and return it by April 4. We are SO EXCITED and look forward to mentoring new talent!! Big Thanks to the THF founder MARK HELLER!!!! 

And if you haven't yet, check out the wonderful article from journalist/writer Lorraine Devon Wilke on the Huffington Post. 

*Thanks to Richard Rossi for a fabulous interview on his talk show on Blog Talk Radio! Listen to his AMAZING prediction for My Mom and The Girl at 16:22!!

It takes a village. With your help and the help of organizations like UsAgainstAlzheimer's and Alzheimer's Greater Los Angeles, My Mom and The Girl is possible.


We are so proud to announce that a percentage of your donations to the production of My Mom and The Girl will be shared with our AMAZING Fiscal Sponsor UsAgainstAlzheimer's which is making giant steps towards finding a cure for Alzheimer's and has made it possible for your donations to be tax deductible. It's a win-win-win for UsAgainstAlzheimer's, My Mom and The Girl & You!!! 

NOW, THE WHO, WHAT, WHY & HOW

THE WHO

So, who the heck we are? We are Go Girl Media, and as writers and producers, my partner, Don Priess, and I, Susie Singer Carter, consider ourselves fortunate to have worked on a variety of television and film projects and collaborate with wonderfully talented people like (and here comes the "name dropping/hoping to impress you" part)  Bryan Cranston, Jon Voight, Shia LaBeouf, Helen Hunt, Dennis Quaid, Max Brooks and Kenan Thompson, to name a few. 

            Here's a quick splashy sizzle of some of our work. 


THE WHAT

MY MOM AND THE GIRL is a true story based on an odd encounter my East Coast mother, who suffers with Alzheimer's, shared one evening on the streets of East L.A. The story takes off after dinner with family and friends takes a dark turn and my mother is led to a proverbial crossroads where three very disparate - desperate -women are unpredictably pulled back into the light. It's a funny, poignant and surprisingly rich story where apparent disabilities can be seen as gifts.

                                          

It's a story that elicits the same response from everyone who hears it:                  

                         

THE WHY

A few years ago my 82-year-old mother and love of my life, Norma Holzer, was diagnosed with Alzheimer's disease and, as for so many families in America, ours was thrown into a nightmare of fear, guilt, obligation and confusion. I quickly discovered that most people are afraid to face, let alone embrace, a situation as abhorrent as Alzheimer's, and as a result, I was my mom's designated - make that only - caregiver.  Awful, right?

  

Well, not exactly...  Even though my mother’s decline has been devastating, by embracing it, I have received countless unexpected gifts of insight, understanding and joy filled with humor, music and a whole lot of love. 

This led me to think, "I DO need to film this story!" And so I am! 

I want to replace fear with clarity and inspire a new conversation that includes gratitude and joy. 

 

THE HOW

With Badass Superpowers: Irony and Humor, an Amazing Team and You!

My Mom and The Girl is rich in Irony and Humor, elements that reign supreme when it comes to neutralizing stereotypes, giving social critique and instigating transformation by holding up a mirror and forcing us to confront realities that we prefer to ignore. (Think All In The Family, Blackish, Fresh Off The Boat and Derek.)

OUR TEAM

We are so excited and honored to have Valerie Harper to play the role of Nanny, my mom. When Valerie and my mom met at the Silverado Beverly Place (in my opinion, the BEST assisted care facility in Los Angeles), it was crystal clear we could not have found anyone better. What a day!!

  

SHOW US THE LOVE   

                                                                         

THE WHERE

We need a minimum of $60,000 to produce and distribute My Mom and The Girl. Where do your funds go and just what do they support?

Our budget includes film industry standards like wages for our crew, equipment, travel expenses, marketing/promotion, editing, sound/color correction, and more!!

Below you can see just how we expect to put your funds to work in this picture of me wearing what is known as a “Hat Of Distribution”. (It’s not really known. But I do love a great hat.) 

 

Other Ways You Can Help!!

If now is not a good time for you to contribute financially, we totally understand!! But we would LOVE it if you could help us to spread the word by using the Indiegogo share tools and by joining in the conversation on Twitter, Instagram and Facebook using #mymomandthegirl!!

stereotypes, giving social critique and instigating transformation

to ignore. (Think All In The Family, Blackish, Fresh Off The Boat and Derek.)
OUR TEAM

We are so excited and honored to have Valerie Harper to play the role of Nanny, my mom. When Valerie and my mom met at the Silverado Beverly Place (in my opinion, the BEST assisted care facility in Los Angeles), it was crystal clear we could not have found anyone better. What a day!!

  





SHOW US THE LOVE   

                                                                         


THE WHERE


We need a minimum of $60,000 to produce and distribute My Mom and The Girl. Where do your funds
go and just what do they support?

Our budget includes film industry standards like wages for our crew, equipment, travel expenses, marketing/promotion, editing, sound/color correction, and more!!
Below you can see just how we expect to put your funds to work in this picture of me wearing what is known as a “Hat Of Distribution”. (It’s not really known. But I do love a great hat.) 




 
    
Other Ways You Can Help!!

 If now is not a good time for you to contribute financially, we totally understand!! But we would LOVE it if you could help us to spread the word by using the Indiegogo share tools and by joining in the conversation on Twitter, Instagram and Facebook using #mymomandthegirl!!

story:
Short Summary

Hey everyone!

My name is Evan Hara and I am a student/film director in Dallas, Texas. I've been doing films for a number of years and have won and entered many different film festivals. Now I think it's time for me to take it up a notch. I have been working on this film for about a year now writing and planning. I really have a passion for sci-fi films in particular because I love how they can make you question reality and life in general. By helping me make this film, I will be able to submit to Sundance Film Festival along with many others. This will also be a massive achievement on my resume for film college! 

What We Need & What You Get

For this film, we will need $22,000. Almost half of the budget will go toward our space ship. We will be building the interior of a rocket ship to film all of our space scenes. About 1/3 of the budget is going toward all of our actors and the rest will go toward make-up, props, costumes, etc. We have many scenes where we will have to hang our actors in a green room to simulate floating in space! If we don't reach our goal, then I would shorten the length of the film and make everything work with the budget we get. The story must still be told!

The Impact

Your donation will make a huge difference to me and to all of the people watching this film. At the end of this film people will seriously be questioning and thinking about life itself and what the meaning could be. The universe is such a mysterious thing that nobody truly understands. Hopefully by watching this film, you will be able to really think about the possibilities about the true nature of the universe. Many of my other films have been successful for instance: The Fearless Five (starring Alex from Target), The Bronins: 24 Hour Video Race, and Modeling a Dream. Modeling a Dream is the video posted to this page to give you a little idea of the feel for this film. Many of the colors and styles of filming will translate into The Boundary.

Risks & Challenges

One problem we will have to face is the floating in space look. We will have to hang our actors in green rooms to create the illusion of zero gravity. Another huge challenge we face is building a rocket ship from scratch. We will have to make a realistic-looking ship made out of easily obtainable materials. It couldn't be that hard right? I mean, It's not rocket science...

Other Ways You Can Help

If you like the idea, please tell your friends, family, co-workers, pets, anyone you want! It'd help us out a TON if you could spread the word to help us raise the money we need.

story:
What are we trying to do?

Curling here in Metro Atlanta has come a long way thanks to the sacrifices of so many dedicated individuals. We are a small group of passionate curlers who want to make sure that we continue with this incredible foundation of teamwork and enthusiasm. We're using these strengths to take the next steps in the evolution of curling in Georgia which includes building the first dedicated curling facility!



Up until now curling in Metro Atlanta has been limited to arena ice, which means we were sharing ice with hockey teams, ice skaters, and other events. Ice for skating and hockey is very different than curling ice. It is smoothed and filled with a Zamboni to make it relatively level. However, curling ice is prepared differently.


Having a dedicated curling facility will allow us three important elements:
  • A safer curling environment with properly managed curling ice groomed specifically for the sport - level, pebbled, and Zamboni-free!
  • More scheduling flexibility which will allow us to offer more curling to the surrounding community in the form of "Learn to Curl" clinics, multiple leagues, corporate events and community outreach.
  • The ability to develop nationally competitive teams. Curling is an inclusive sport and there are competitive opportunities for players at all levels and all ages. 



The best part about this project is that it has both present and future benefits. In the short term, we will be able to grow club membership and promote competition at all levels. In the long term, we will be able to positively influence the community by promoting social integration, teamwork, and interest in physical activity regardless of age or ability.

We're So Close and Now We Need Your Help

We were able to raise enough money to secure a lease and pay for the initial construction project. We completed most of the work ourselves to reduce our capital costs.



Our sand base has arrived and we're now just weeks away from flooding the rink and curling on amazing ice! 

However, we still need funding to pay for new equipment (stones, brooms, sliders, etc,), make repairs to donated equipment, and to cover miscellaneous construction costs. So we are reaching out to you to in the hope you can provide us with the help we need. Every donation you make will go towards opening the club and getting the community excited and involved in the best sport ever -- CURLING!!

And we're going to give you some pretty neat stuff for helping us out. Just select a perk!



Other Ways You Can Help


  • "Hurry hard!" and share this page by word of mouth!
  • Share this page on all forms of social media. The more people we can reach, the greater chance we have of reaching our goal. Indiegogo has share tools to help you help us!
  • Share our Facebook page with your friends. The more people we can get following us, the greater chance for success we will have.
  • If you can't donate monetarily but still want to help, we can always use a helping hand at the facility with our continuing renovations. 
  • Visit us once we're open! We will be happy to introduce you to the amazing sport of curling or simply shake your hand for taking the time to check out all of our hard work!

Share this page on all forms of social media. The more people we can reach, the greater chance we have of reaching our goal. Indiegogo has share tools to help you help us!
Share our Facebook page with your friends. The more people we can get following us, the greater chance for success we will have.
If you can't donate monetarily but still want to help, we can always use a helping hand at the facility with our continuing renovations. 
Visit us once we're open! We will be happy to introduce you to the amazing sport of curling or simply shake your hand for taking the time to check out all of our hard work!

story:
Note: This campaign will continue after the 60 days - and unlike Kickstarter - we will not lose the money if we do not reach the goal - every dollar will make it towards this film project!


Living a Life of Joy or Drudgery Comes Down to

  A Matter of Perspective

http://amatterofperspective.us

Short Summary

Light Symphony Productions is dedicated to the mission of capturing reflections of God’s goodness and the beauty of his creation, while weaving stories that touch hearts and inspire acts of service and love.


www.LightSym.com

The team at Light Symphony is proud to introduce:
 A Matter of Perspective
- A short narrative fictional film  based on original story and screenplay by Jeff Gerke.  Starring Rich Swingle--known for his lead roles in Providence and Indescribable, as well as contributions in over 20 films.

________________________________________

When a businessman’s discontentment nearly costs him his career, he is awakened to the treasure he's had all along.

A Matter of Perspective is a story about a middle-aged Christian gift company administrator who has drifted from the vibrant, contagious faith that he once had, and somehow has become dissatisfied.  Even while living and working in a breathtaking rural community in Southern Oregon, he continued to grow bitter until one day, during a pivotal moment, he is shamed into the realization that he is missing all of the joy and contentment that God has for him.  After a second chance, he is awakened to the immense treasure he possesses and the beauty of his beloved hometown.

____________________________________


Your support will greatly assist us in bringing this pivotal story to screen in a dynamic way.  Contributions of any size will help to deliver this transformative message of hope and renewal by funding the following:

     1. Talented actors

     2. Crew transportation and meals

     3. Screenplay

     4. Film equipment rental

     5. Music score

     6. Other various expenses of production 

Our vision is to produce a cinematic quality film that moves people to a life of gratitude and appreciation, helping them to influence others with joy. Rich Swingle has been spreading the love of God through media for many years, and we are pleased that he will be taking on this role to demonstrate God's love and renewal through this touching story.

As a bonus for your support, you will receive exciting gifts as our way of saying thank you for your partnership!


The Team

Meet the cast and crew working together on this film.

Lead Actor/Consultant

Rich Swingle has been featured in over 20 films, performs one-man plays, and teaches workshops around the world. For more information, visit: http://RichDrama.com

Supporting Actor/Production

Rhonda Roscoe began acting at age 10 and hasn’t stopped since.She earned her undergraduate degree in Performance Studies, which led her to Los Angeles to pursue the performing arts in film.She was privileged to act in several film productions while, at the same time, maintaining and improving her live acting on stage
Supporting Actor

Tim Kaiser was born on January 30, 1954 in Detroit, Michigan, USA as Timothy William Kaiser. Tim began film acting after he semi retired at age 56. He is known for Christmas Grace (2013), The Parricidal Effect (2014), Star Trek: Horizon (2015), and Rather to be Chosen (2015). He is the third born of ten children. Tim grew up in East Detroit

Producer/Director

​Mike Hill has been involved with video and short film production for the past 30 years, specializing also in leadership and strategic planning. www.lightsym.com

Director of Photography/Co-producer

Ethan Hill, having been immersed in technology and photography, began to study and craft short family films as a teenager, and has greatly developed his expertise in film, specializing in cinematography and editing. www.lightsym.com

Screenplay

Jeff Gerke is an award-winning book editor, multi-published novelist, professional artist, Writers Digest author, graphic designer, book typesetter, and internationally acclaimed fiction teacher.  http://www.jeffgerke.com/

Music Score

Ron Ochs holds a B.A. in Piano Performance from Southern Oregon University and a Piano Technology degree . He is also currently employed as a pianist for the Tony award winning Oregon Shakespeare Festival, in their 2016 production of Twelfth Night. Ron received  positive reviews from the Wall Street Journal through his involvement with the festival in My Fair Lady ​2013.  Visit his website at:   http://www.symphonox.com/home.html

The Impact

"I found this story in the book - Stories for the Heart II by Mulnomah Publishers Inc. (2001). We loved reading these books while camping as a family and this story touched me deeply. I so related to the lead character who had become stagnant in life and faith. I was missing the joy all around me and found myself grumbling at everything. In a way, Garreth's second chance gave me a second chance, and I have tried to live my life with a daily renewal period, visiting the trough of God's storehouse of love and joy--the Bible--every day. I have often reflected on this character and the lessons he learned and I knew I wanted to share this story with others with the sincere prayer that it would touch their lives as much as it has mine." Mike Hill - Producer


Other Ways You Can Help

Follow
Even if you can't support us, we would love for you to stay up to date and follow this project - please head to our website: http://amatterofperspective.us and subscribe for email updates.  Follow our other projects at www.lightsym.com.

Join
Another way you can help is to audition for a minor acting role, as an extra, or to help out on the crew. Head to:  http://amatterofperspective.us to submit your audition reel or crew member application.

Pray
The most important way you can help is by praying for us: that we would live a life of joy while filming this great story; that the funding would be received to help us carry on to completion; that this film would impact more lives than we could ever imagine through a wide distribution audience; and that we would give God all of the glory.

Share
And lastly don't forget to share this - with anyone who might be interested!

Soli Deo Gloria!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Tobias Poensgen and I am an actor, director, producer and screenwriter. I am passionate about Irish history and the country's struggle against British rule. As part of the centenary 1916 Easter Rising commemorations, I am making The Forgotten One, a short film about the final days of Thomas Kent, the "unknown" hero of the Easter Rising and the only one of the 16 men executed outside Dublin. 

The Forgotten One follows Thomas Kent after his capture and through his final days of imprisonment and Court Martial proceedings. The film brings to life the protagonist, his thoughts and emotions during those final days. It also shines a light on the Irish struggle for independence against British rule and the atmosphere of those troubled times.

This is a story that needs to be told and my team and I will make a great and touching short film. I am asking for your financial support to help fund the film, perhaps because you have an interest in Irish history, perhaps you feel passionate about the struggle for freedom or you just want to support the making of a film that needs making. 

Please, help make this film with your donations, you will be proud of having supported us!

What We Need & What You Get

Making a good short film requires funding and we want to make a great one. Good and professional cast and crew need paying and the locations, costumes, sound, lighting and everything needs to be great. 

I am used to tight budgeting and financial control, so everything has been costed out. We need to raise €10,000 to make a high quality film. After all, you which will be used for 

  • Cast and crew fees and expenses
  • High quality post production
  • Equipment hire (cameras, sound, lighting)
  • Locations (we will shoot at two original locations in Cork)
  • Transport (to and from locations)
  • Make-up
  • Costumes (we will use original uniforms and clothing)
  • Props (a few real-looking rifles and other items)
  • Catering (cast and crew need feeding)
  • Entry fees for film festivals (yes, this film will get great international exposure!)
PERKS - We have created some very beautiful artwork for the film and have available a selection of posters and high quality t-shirts. In addition, you can get copies of the script as well as the original 1916 Court Martial transcript. And there is more! We will also make available extended versions of the film with the unedited Court Martial proceedings.
I really count on your enthusiasm and financial support for The Forgotten One. In the unlikely event of us not reaching the funding goal, we can of course trim the budget, which means trimming the quality of the movie. 

The Impact

Your donation will help bring to life Thomas Kent, one of the key characters of the 1916 Easter Rising - an event that profoundly changed the course of Irish history and paved the way for independence from Great Britain. You will help give the event and the times the international exposure they deserve.

If you donate to the making of this film, you will not only contribute to a high quality picture, but also help mark an important point in history.

Risks & Challenges

Donating your hard earned money to the making of a film carries some risk and I want to reassure you that your trust will be well placed. The key members of the team all have decades of film making experience and we will be working only with professionally trained actors. We're only shooting indoors and hire only the best equipment to avoid any issues on the day.

Other Ways You Can Help

Your donation will be crucial to making this film. If you cannot donate, please make sure you share this campaign with as many people you know. 

Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

THANK YOU!!!

story:
Hello there indie-film watchers. Thank you for keeping the art of filming alive, without you the art would not be able to survive. 


With the technology of today making films has never been easier, but still costly, and the story of this hero should be heard. Selene is a hero to the people of Tucson, although none of the residents even know it. Selene seeks out and hunts the lowest of low, rapists and abusers. With the help of a close friend Selene finds the best time and place to take out her target, but she doesn't kill them, she rips every piece of humanity and dignity out of them. Make them suffer as their victims have. Keeping this review spoiler free, I’m sure there will be a many cheering her on when she locates her newest target Dominic. A horrible example of a human being with a track record for seducing and hurting women.



Production for this film will start May 13th and wrapping May 27th. The crew are standing by with all the instructions they need to start making the awesome happen. Although they are all eager and excited for this project, money for materials, traveling, locations, gear rental and most importantly food are all needed. Also without your donations, how will you get the awesome behind the scenes Blu-Ray!  Or even better, have a chance to hangout on the set with us to see the magic that is movie making. A few of you may even help make on set decisions as producers and executive producers.


If anyone has any questions please feel free to contact the team at selenethefilm@gmail.com and keep up to date with our social media posts and our website selenetheseries.com

story:
Hey! You’ve made it this far so for us that’s already a great help. We’re asking for your help to make this film so in return it’s only fair if I tell you a little bit about who we are and what we’re doing.

We are 5 students on the MA Filmmaking course at Goldsmiths College. Aside from the usual experience of making films at weekends with our mates, between us we have
 
experience working for the BBC

had a film screened at Tate Modern

picked up best film award at Siddharta film festival

and made countless films for commercial outlets and sports TV - if you want to know us even better why not have a look on our website?

We’re asking for your help to make Gadget a sci-fi short film set in a near-future world dominated by artificial intelligence. It’s the story of one man who tries to form an emotional connection without technology, but instead is forced to confront his own isolation and human vulnerability.

It’s a story we really care about and, more importantly, we think it’s a story that has a real relevance to our everyday reliance on technology and the impact this has on us as people.

We want to make a film that really does justice to the story. We’ve put in £2,500 of our own money and we started this campaign to top up that amount so we can make a film that people love and care about. We want to make people stop and think about our relationship with technology and social media. If you want to be part of that too this is how you get involved.

OK let’s talk specifics. This is how your donation will be spent:




Cast

The most important feature of any film is the performances on the screen. We want a cast who can really carry the story and bring it to life. Your donations will enable us to work with a casting director to find the best actors to fill these roles and make sure they get paid for their hard work on set.

Camera

With no camera there is no film. Gadget is using some amazing locations, but filming on the streets of London at night isn’t easy. Your donations will enable us to use the Panasonic Varicam 35. It’s a pretty serious piece of kit that will allow us to shoot in low light conditions with no grain on the image and all in beautiful 4K.

Locations

Talking of locations… Filming on location is always more trouble than in a studio. But who needs a nice warm studio with adjacent green room? With your support we’ll have a van and enough hot tea to survive an arctic winter.

Props

Our sci-fi is going to be more like Her than Star Wars but nevertheless we need a lot of key props to really define the world of the story. Your support will help us create a 2031 bachelors flat for our hero, Neem, and most importantly will enable us to make ubiquitous smart glasses that no self respecting future citizen would be without.

Music

Music is a key part of any film but it’s a tricky one to master, bad music can completely change the mood and meaning of a film. This usually happens when music is composed after everything else is finished. With your help we want to involve our composer way back in pre-production and all the way through to post-production. By the time they write the final score they’ll know the film inside out and be in a perfect position to perfect an essential element of the film.

Visual Effects

No sci-fi film would be complete without some CGI wizardry right? We want to show our hero’s smart glasses interface through some amazing POV shots. That stuff needs to be designed, tracked and composited - and we have very high standards.

Thank you once again for looking at our project. We have some pretty special rewards to say thank you for your involvement. Every last penny makes a difference so we’ve got a good variety of rewards depending on how involved you want to get.

Every pound donated will go towards making Gadget as our MA Filmmaking graduation film. Although it's never been easier to make a film - all you need is that phone in your pocket - to do it properly is still as expensive as ever. More money means more resources to cope with all the problems that you inevitably come across when you make a film: bad weather, re-shoots, additional equipment. That’s why we value and appreciate every single donation we get from you guys.

Thanks for getting involved!

Ian Parkin
Producer

story:
Short Summary

  • Mi nombre es Jonathan Lopez, fundador de Clay Cup Pictures Inc. Una compañía netamente puertorriqueña y cristiana que se dedica a realizar corto y largometrajes con enfoque cristocéntrico y de valores crisitanos. Contamos con 5 años de experiencia en el campo de la cinematografía y contamos con equipo de alta calidad .
  • Estamos a punto de terminar de grabar nuestra película titulada "Paralisis" y nos gustaría poder hacer el "Release" en los cines de Puerto Rico para el mes de septiembre del año 2016. 
  • Al aportar a nuestra causa estaría siendo parte de la historia ya que estrenaría en los cines la pimera película de acción/drama cristiana hecha completamente en Puerto Rico. 

What We Need & What You Get

  • Necesitamos 12,000 dolares para poder hacer el release en 7 salas alrededor de la isla y para poder pagar el mercadeo incluyendo billboards, radio y programas de TV. 
  • Cada persona que done recibirá un obsequio, de acuerdo a la donación dada. 
  • Si no recibimos lo propuesto, como quiera vamos a utilizar el dinero para hacer el Release en los cines de Puerto Rico. 

The Impact

  • El impacto que podría causar en la población puertorriqueña sería uno sin precedentes y el evangelismo tecnológico daría un salto agigantado en la manera de llegar a nuestra población. 
  • Ser parte de la historia para que otras personas conozcan del evangelio y de la oportunidad salvadora que ofrece Jesucristo. 

Risks & Challenges

  • Tenemos el "Fan-base" y la calidad de producto necesaria para poder cumplir con las expectativas. 
  • Utilizaremos todos nuestros recursos para promover esta iniciativa y que sea todo un éxito. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Si no puede ayudarnos monetariamente, puede ayudarnos a compartir esta campaña en la redes sociales y así poder llegar al objetivo.
story_txt:
Short Summary 
Mi nombre es Jonathan Lopez, fundador de Clay Cup Pictures Inc. Una compañía netamente puertorriqueña y cristiana que se dedica a realizar corto y largometrajes con enfoque cristocéntrico y de valores crisitanos. Contamos con 5 años de experiencia en el campo de la cinematografía y contamos con equipo de alta calidad . Estamos a punto de terminar de grabar nuestra película titulada "Paralisis" y nos gustaría poder hacer el "Release" en los cines de Puerto Rico para el mes de septiembre del año 2016.  Al aportar a nuestra causa estaría siendo parte de la historia ya que estrenaría en los cines la pimera película de acción/drama cristiana hecha completamente en Puerto Rico. 
   What We Need & What You Get  Necesitamos 12,000 dolares para poder hacer el release en 7 salas alrededor de la isla y para poder pagar el mercadeo incluyendo billboards, radio y programas de TV.  Cada persona que done recibirá un obsequio, de acuerdo a la donación dada.  Si no recibimos lo propuesto, como quiera vamos a utilizar el dinero para hacer el Release en los cines de Puerto Rico.     The Impact  El impacto que podría causar en la población puertorriqueña sería uno sin precedentes y el evangelismo tecnológico daría un salto agigantado en la manera de llegar a nuestra población.  Ser parte de la historia para que otras personas conozcan del evangelio y de la oportunidad salvadora que ofrece Jesucristo.     Risks & Challenges  Tenemos el "Fan-base" y la calidad de producto necesaria para poder cumplir con las expectativas.  Utilizaremos todos nuestros recursos para promover esta iniciativa y que sea todo un éxito.     Other Ways You Can Help Si no puede ayudarnos monetariamente, puede ayudarnos a compartir esta campaña en la redes sociales y así poder llegar al objetivo.

story:
Short Summary

I am Netra Halperin, an American pro-peace feminist filmmaker, working in partnership with Zeeshan Malik Abdullah, a Muslim-Norwegian political scientist. I hold an MA in Feminist Therapy, worked for a Hawaii State legislator, and was a candidate for Hawaii County and State offices.  I hosted an issues-based television talk show. Zeeshan holds a BA in political science, South Asian studies with a minor in Tv and film production.

People want peace and yet they support war. Why? Because politicians and the corporate media tell us that we need to be afraid. They tell us that "A terrorist attack on American soil is imminent", and that "Muslims hate us because of our freedoms". They tell us that Muslims are "extremists", "barbaric", and "terrorists". Since these are the only images we see, we believe them. Peace Films exposes the reality behind the propaganda.

Peace Films will travel to Israel to interview residents of a mixed Jewish-Muslim community, and other groups who are striving to break down the political and ideological barriers that are being used to divide people. 

Back in the United States, we will interview veterans who can speak first-hand about how politics and the "business" of war perpetuate these divisions.  

What We Need & What You Get

Peace Films is currently working on three films:

  1. The Peacemakers. This is a series of short films about people and organizations in war zones who are actively working for peace. 
  2. Egypt's Deep State: This film will document U.S. involvement in the revolution and coup in Egypt.
  3. Promise of Peace: This film will document: 1) The reality of U.S. foreign/war policy, 2) Who profits from these wars, and 3) The people who strive for peace in this incendiary region. 

We need a total of $30,000 for: 

  • Video & editing equipment 
  • Travel expenses for a small crew to travel to Israel and around the U.S. 
  • Film and music rights, stock footage, editing, etc.

All donations to our 501(c)3 nonprofit organization are tax deductible.

All of our supporters (unless anonymity is requested) will be listed in the film credits. 

The Impact

If U.S. foreign policy continues on the same track, there will be more wars, more terrorism, and bigger mass refugee migrations—and the resulting death, trauma and environmental degradation. Because war is so lucrative for the 1%, it will only stop when the American people demand that it stop. 
Promise of Peace will inform Americans as to what our country is doing, and show that peace is possible. This is the first step in creating change—understanding the problem. 
Risks & Challenges

Our biggest risk is NOT speaking out. The military-industrial complex is a multi-trillion dollar industry—however when it becomes evident that "the emperor wears no clothes," than real change can be implemented. Together we are standing up for peace and for humanity. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Whether or not you can contribute, please share with your friends. Use the Indiegogo tools on the left to post on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram and to send out an email—or talk to people individually. Remember, people  of all countries want peace. It is up to us to stand up to those in power who want war.
