story:
This campaign has moved to www.igg.me/at/berningmanbus


THE EARLY BERN

When Bernie Sanders announced his candidacy last May, the first polls showed him over 50 points behind Hillary Clinton -- a lead that many thought was insurmountable.  But as Hillary Clinton began what many thought was a victory lap across the United States, something remarkable began happening -- concerned citizens like you and me started to believe the unbelievable -- that Senator Bernie Sanders will be the next President of the United States.  His message, and the integrity that he communicated it with resonated so strongly that, only nine months later, he's accomplished what most thought impossible -- he's raised over $100 million through donations averaging $27, he's spoken to hundreds of thousands of people, chalked up a near tie in Iowa, won New Hampshire by a landslide, and came from over 40 points behind in Nevada which was considered Clinton's "firewall" to nearly tie with her there.  After racking up four wins and a virtual tie on Super Tuesday, it is now clear that Bernie is a serious contender for the Democratic nomination.

Polls and primaries have shown that when people get to know Bernie, his support increases exponentially.  There is a clear path for victory if Bernie's campaign and his supporters can immediately deploy cost effective and creative strategies that can get Bernie and his message out to the other states quickly.

But Bernie can only be in one place at a time, right?

TURNING UP THE HEAT

One of the most visible elements of Bernie's campaign has been the Nurses United Bus which appears alongside Bernie and has been the focus of countless news stories.  But this bus is mostly about the nurses.  What if there was a bus created that was just about Bernie?

Now there is.

The Berning Man Bus.  Created by the team behind TheWhole9.com (an international social networking site for artists), The Peace Project (a grassroots peace movement engaged in changing lives worldwide) and Out Of Bounds (an experiential marketing company) is slated to hit the road mid-April.  Before we started changing the world, our team created and put dozens of cool experiences on the road for everyone from music-sharing pioneer, Napster, to Elvis Presley, Virgin Atlantic, Got Milk?, the Red Cross and jetBlue.

The Berning Man Bus is branded with the pop art of Kaleo Sallas and boldly proclaims that our people-powered political revolution is rising.  We'll hit the road mid-April to coincide with crucial primary elections including Indiana, New York, Connecticut, Maryland, Delaware, Pennsylvania, Kentucky, Oregon, and Washington.  The Berning Man Bus will begin, end and spend the most time in Oregon, Washington, New Mexico and California where over 16% of the delegates are awarded -- providing critical support and helping to sway votes in  California which holds over 10% of the delegates.

We'll meet up with local Berners, grassroots movements and political organizations at pre-planned stops at universities, public spaces and arts and cultural events.  At each stop, speeches will be given sharing Bernie’s message of a "Future to Believe In", and artists, musicians and well-known Bernie supporters will be invited to join in.  We'll activate and energize new voters to not only vote for Bernie Sanders, but to become involved in the campaign.  The Berning Man Bus will a powerful way to generate media buzz, providing a local angle for media that is hungry for stories about Bernie  and those who support him.

In six weeks, we seek to engage 75,000 - 100,000 people and create a million-strong network of volunteers and donors that will help propel Bernie to The White House. 

The total cost to put the Berning Man Bus on the road for six weeks is $60,000 -- undeniably, one of the most effective, impassioned, boots on ground, Bernie campaigns.

Through this campaign, we will raise the money necessary to get the Berning Man Bus on the road.  We will be securing other funding and selling branded merchandise to keep it berning.

FUEL THE BERN

$40 Perk - Limited Edition Berning Man T-Shirt + Berning Man Button

$35 Perk - Limited Edition BERN ON Windchime by Jendala

$30 Perk - Limited Edition FUEL THE BERN Pewter Keychain

$20 Perk - "Finally a Reason to Vote" Poster by Greg Auerbach

$10 Perk - Two Pack of Limited Edition Berning Man Buttons

story:
A JOURNEY FROM LOSS TO LOVE, LIGHT & LAUGHTER - PART 2

My first campaign: A Journey from Loss to Love, Light & Laughter - Part 1 raised $3,111 -- this should fund my first 3 months in India and Thailand.  To go further with my journey, I am asking for more help.  

Here is the background and the basis for this journey:

BACKGROUND & JOURNEY OVERVIEW

I know loss.  I lost my biological father at 3.  I lost my sense of worth from being molested at age 11.  I lost my belief in dreams when I was rejected by my dream college at 18.  I lost in love from two failed marriages.  I lost my children, all five of them to miscarriages.  These losses affected how I thought about myself and I allowed myself to be pulled down by them. (If you would like to learn more about what led me to this point, see the additional video in the gallery link.) No more.

However, this is not a journey of loss.  At its core, this is a journey of reset and expanding love.  I am resetting my thoughts and my life. I am expanding love in the world by volunteering along my journey and spotlighting others who add light to the world.  And, there will be laughter, playfulness, and dancing along the way.

My campaign is to help support this journey.  I envision this journey as taking 1 year, and leading me to India, Thailand, Peru, Panama, Haiti, France, England, Ireland, and ending with cross-country road trip of the US.  The number of countries I go depends on the amount that I raise through this campaign.  My budget for this complete journey is $42,000, which  allows for the full year to all the countries listed.  

For my volunteer efforts, I will work with organizations dedicated to helping children, the poor, refugees, the environment, and advancing social good.  As of now, I secured my volunteer efforts in India (Missionaries of Charity (founded by Mother Theresa)) and Thailand (English for Engaged Social Service).  From here, it depends on you.   Each place that you send me, I will volunteer and pay it forward through my service.

This campaign is important to me because it is my whole life.  The idea of this journey came to me in one my moments of darkness.  In the early months after the separation, I was lost in sadness. I had already picked myself so many times in the past; I was not sure if I could do it again. Then, one day as I was laying in bed (all day), this journey was a glimmer of light.  As I started to daydream about it, I was looking forward to my future. I could not contain this journey as a simple dream.  I shared this journey with my mastermind group and business coach. They saw my vision.  They empowered me to take this journey that started as a glimmer in darkness.  So, here I am taking a leap of faith and believing in dreams again!

My sincere hope is that this journey adds love, light and laughter for others.  I will have a website and blog to share my journey as it unfolds.  If I can change my negative self-talk to a genuine self-love; if I can shine after loss; if I can create a life of love, light and laughter -- anyone can.  

I do not know where, when, or how it will end or what the next journey will be.  I hope that by sharing my journey with you, you will feel as if you had your own journey too – and we share some smiles, laughter, and make our mark with light and love along the way.

WHAT I NEED & WHAT YOU GET

The $42,000 allows for the full year to all the countries listed and the development of podcast and website to dedicated to spotlight those who are adding light in the world.

If I do not raise all $42,000, I will shorten my country list.  The journey will continue but may adjust to reflect the monies raised.  

What you get:  If you contribute:

 $1.00, you will get a note of appreciation and get an invitation to join a closed Facebook Group where I will post updates of the journey along the way.

$25.00 or more, in addition to the above, you will get a vote on various journey options.  For instance, part of this journey is for me to get out of my comfort zones and simply trust.  Facebook Group members are invited suggest dares and challenges for me.  Those who donate $25 or more will get to vote on which dare or challenge I do.

$100.00 or more, in addition to the above, you will get an e-photobook of the journey.

THE IMPACT

Empower.  Inspire.  Motivate.  Adding Light.  Expanding Love. These are all things that your contribution will do.   Let's add light in the world.  

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

There are other ways to help:

(1)  Pray for me; hold me in a positive space and energy; and visualize a safe and secure journey happening with ease and flow.

(2)  Use the indigogo tools to share this campaign.

(3) Send a personal email to 10 people and ask that they contribute $10 (or more)

(4) Post this campaign on your social media pages for 10 days

Thank you!

In kindness and light,

Kerry

story:
So what on earth are we doing? 

Hello World, 

Our names are James Gould, Jyler Menard and Fred Min and we are aspiring photographers and filmmakers from Grande Prairie, Alberta. Now that formal introduction is done, let's cut to the chase here. Grande Prairie is not known for its "filmmaking" accommodations, it's actually quite the opposite. We are just a group of try hard film go-getters in an adjusting filmmaking and creative art culture. So we asked ourselves, "how do we go big or go home while still maintaining our originality and content creativity?". Well, we decided to travel across Canada to showcase our beautiful nation as well as the people living within it to an audience that may never have, or will never get the chance of knowing. We will not only aim to film the vast landscapes, but we will also base our interviews on a variety of different questions that will give us an idea of what it truly means to be human, as well as Canadian. There are so many amazing untold stories that have yet to be discovered. At times we often take for granted the opportunities ready to be undertaken even in our own country, leading us to take our slumping dollar to nations across the pond or south of the border. Canada is such a diverse country with so many hidden adventures just ready to be discovered. We need to showcase the stories of others within this nation to unite them as one through shared perspectives. Film CAN create unification and change for the better. With your help, we can initiate this plan into action. 

So what on earth do we need? 

Funding and the moral support to make this happen! 

Filmmaking is not a cheap business. To aim for the film grade that we hope to shoot in, we need the proper funds to provide us with the proper equipment and financial flexibility to maximize this production.

Funding for transportation. We need a good solid vehicle to aid us in the physical transportation of our work across the country as well as the protection of our equipment. 

Funding to give back to the communities we visit. We aim to spotlight every place we visit and give exposure to certain social issues without the bias of a media outlet. We aim to give raw information based on the information we get from our interviews from Canadians. This is the backbone and story to our film, 

Funding for food. We are three guys, that's pretty self-explanatory, 

How is this going to impact anything? 

We have experience in commercial photography as well as filmmaking. The most recent one being a full-length testimonial video as well as a promotional video made for the Community Foundation of Northwestern Alberta. We ultimately have the tools and talent to showcase Canada without the filter of media bias. We want to unite Canadians as one independent of race, religion, political perpective, and wealth. 

Risks & Challenges

This is not going to be easy, that's for sure. But, Perseverance is something that is alive and strong within us. Misfortunes may and most likely will happen, but that will not stop us from providing content. We will document it all. 


So, let's make some noise and get this project rolling.

But, Perseverance is something that is alive and strong within us. Misfortunes may and most likely will happen, but that will not stop us from providing content. We will document it all. 

So, let's make some noise and get this project rolling.

story:
Time sentinels is a single player action/rpg video game featured for augmented reality in Play Station Vita.

Hundreds of enemies spawn from time to time to create epic battles where the course of history as we know it is in danger. You must avoid the history changes and preserve the humankind.

The primary goal is to destroy your enemy's armies through a combination of the orbital bombardment capabilities of yout spaceship and the use of the environment to accomplish this task. This will be a combination of both strategy and tactic to accomplish your goals and defend your objective at all matters.

*Play Station Vita full augmented reality experience

*Epic battles against thousands of enemies

*Control of your environment to defeat enemies

*Immersive AI that brings a real challenge

*Discover hidden treasures to unlock special perks

*360° of free roaming

*Real time aumented reality

*Battle through time and space in different scenarios

As an independent studio, our financial resources are limited and we don't have all the budget required to develop a game of this magnitude in the time we want to do it and we think is better to be released. With your help, we will be not only able to develop this game, but add special features and make it better to offer a whole different gaming experience thanks to the AR technology. 

This game will be developed for the PS Vita to maximize the AR functions and provide the best gaming experience in real time with the AR. The purpose of the project is to delivery a game that is 360° playable in each level (scenario), where you will be able to move around the map and see the whole scenario of each level, being more interactive and more important, make you feel inside the battle that you are fighting. We want it to be real, and we can make it possible with your help.

Besides, we want to keep growing and developing more games and this is just a little step to become dreams true. 

Also, we are planning to launch this game for mobile devices so everyone can have the great experience that we offer with Time Sentinels. 

This will be a totally different experience that you won't regret.

Below you will see an example of how the game will look like. Please note that this is just a demo with the work we have now, but we keep improving in everything.

Right now we are working hard in the art and the visual aspects, as you will see in the images below. 


If we reach our goal and keep earning more funding, we will be able to develope and offer more levels and features for your player and why not? More weapons and enemies so the battles are more real (if it is even possible). 


Why this campaign is so important to us?

  • Developing a game for a console like the PS Vita requires a higher budget than the one we expected. We are not talking just about the licenses needed to program, design and create the game, but also more several factors and requirements to make this game successful and known by everyone who is owner of a Vita.

So were is the money going to?

  • The 30% of the amount will be used to acquire licences for design and art. As we already have the professional license for the programming engine, we only need the pro versions of the designing tools. This is what we mainly need and will be acquired with your help. 
  • With the 10% of the budget, we are going to be able to record the music and the FX sounds in a professional studio to offer the best possible quality in this aspect. 
  • We are planning to make a huge marketing campaign to announce the game once it is ready to be launched. This marketing campaign will be worldwide and in all media possible. Since we are an independent studio, we don't have publishers nor sponsors, so we need to make our name and work so the game and the projects we have are known and more gamers can enjoy them and, off course, have this amazing experience of traveling through time and space in real time and in AR. We have already investigated with several marketing companies around the world and we are expecting to consume around the 35% of the budget on this. 
  • So after this, we are left with only the 25% of the budget left and maybe you are wondering, where is that quantity going to? Well, we want to hire more people to develop the game faster and better. Give students the opportunity to work in a project like this, gain experience and earn money for their work and contribution; we are not thinking about us only, but in everyone, gamers included, off course.

We are developing this game right now, working in the art and all what you have seen until now and will keep working to release the game, but with your help, we can be able to release it before and offer more features to make this a better experience. That's the difference you make with your donation and trust in us! You are important to us, and we want to show it. As developers and gamers we are.

If you are not able to donate to our campaign but want to collaborate with us, don't worry, there are many ways you can help.

  • You can share this campaign so more people know about us and the project and support us.
  • Follow us in our official sites and support. 
  • You can collaborate with us and be part of the staff, we want you to feel this is your game too!


                                            


Mindtrick is a small independent game studio building cutting edge technology that allows us to create amazing new gameplay experiences trough play station vita´s augmented reality features.

We are just 4 friends with a vision to offer a good gaming experience and be able to create games that go beyond the common rule and can deliver a different experience. 

We started this dream with the goal to become in a worldwide studio that develops games that bring not only fun, but also unique stories and make the gamer feel part of the adventured played. Right now, we are about accomplishing the first step of this dream and this can be true with your help.

Like us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/MindtrickMX

story:
You may still Pledge!


Check payable to: Bottom Of The Ninth Films, LLC & mai to:

810 Dominican Drive, Nashville TN 37228 

or contribute via Pay Pal at: 

www.scoutingfordiamonds.com

or contact us at:

 info@scoutingfordiamonds.com


Scouting For Diamonds: A Love Story

Scouting for Diamonds is a feature-length documentary film about the invisible heroes of baseball: the scouts. It’s about the men (and women) who are blessed and cursed by an unwavering commitment to their first love: baseball.

In the film we meet dozens of men and women who have given their lives to the game in search of that 'next great player.' Told from the perspective of legendary players and the scouts who discovered them, the film reaches into their hearts, and ours, as we learn what scouts see in players that no one else can. And it is about the ‘art of scouting’ and an era of scouting that is, perhaps facing extinction.  

August Georgia 1956                                                                       Photo credit: Helen Digby


From The Director

Molly Secours & Bottom Of The Ninth Films here in Nashville TN wishing you all a beautiful 2016!

Never in my wildest dreams did I imagine I'd be directing & producing a feature documentary film about baseball scouts. Ever. Up until now most of my work has been in the non-profit world of social justice advocating for the 'under dog'. And after hearing about a guy named George Digby, a Boston Red Sox scout who signed dozens of great players including Hall Of Famer, Wade Boggs, I realized there were hundreds--if not thousands--of scouts who have devoted their lives to combing the bushes in search of that 'next great player'.  And although Mr. Dibgy is honored and recognized by the Boston Red Sox, most scouts remain anonymous. And because of the generosity, sincerity and blessing of Wade Boggs, we pressed forward.

Boston Red Sox scout, George Digby with  HOFer Ted Williams

For the past year and a half we have been interviewing MLB Hall Of Famers, scouts (and their spouses), managers, & executives--all who have helped us in unearthing the untold love story between scouts and the game of baseball. And during this process not only have we fallen in love with scouts ourselves but for some of us, creating this film has rekindled a love for America's favorite pastime.  And we have a feeling that once people meet these gems, a new generation of baseball fans will emerge. We are determined to bring scouts out of the shadows and onto the big screen--where they belong. And that's where you come in. 

Director, Molly Secours with HOFer George Brett & Veteran Scout Art Stewart

How Can You Help?

Obviously, as independent filmmakers, we need money to finish the film. In addition to traveling the US, our story brings us to Cuba, Dominican Republic and perhaps even Japan. And because there is no big Hollywood studio picking up the tab, we must lean on supporters.

Until now, we've relied on a few generous angel investors who helped get us started. With their support we've spent time with some of the greatest living legends in baseball, including  Wade Boggs, Willie Mays, George Brett, Tommy LaSorda, Dusty Baker & more (all whom you will meet in the film) and many others whose names are probably unfamiliar.

The remaining budget needed is $1.1 million but to keep shooting in January, through Spring Training and beyond we are aiming for $550,000. Thus far we have had several teams commit pledges outside of Indiegogo so our goal here is $150,000.  As soon as we are finished with this portion of the show we can that will allow us to focus solely on our story!

So, I guess you could say we need some new Bottom Of The Ninth 'angels' so we can continue filming for the next 9 months.

Interviewing the "Say Hey Kid", Willie Mays with Umpire Ed. Montague Jr.

What Can You Do Right Now?

#1 Watch The Trailer Above & Pledge, of course! And we will love you as much for $5.00 as $5,000 or $25,000 or $100,000. Any amount is welcome!

#2 Help us get the word out. Tweet away!  https://twitter.com/Scouting4Dmnds Go crazy on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/ScoutingForDiamonds/ and send emails to all your peeps! For the next two weeks talk about us like we are your favorite cousin who needs a plane ticket to the Academy Awards!

We only have 14 days.  Share this with everyone you know--whether they are baseball fans or not.  An although this is a documentary, we believe anyone who loved Field Of Dreams, Moneyball or League Of Their Own  will fall in love with Scouting For Diamonds.

Former player and current Washington Nationals Manager, Dusty Baker

What Do You Get?

Hey, it's ok to ask. It's simple. If you pledge we are thrilled to give back.

For any size pledge we "take you on the road with us"-- virtually that is. Spring Training, Cuba, Dominican Republic or Japan. Via social media we'll share photos and funny anecdotes with you.   It'll be like you're in our suitcases but ALOT more comfortable.

For larger pledges you may receive premiere tickets or  Associate Producer credit (and who doesn't love that?). Check out the "Perks" to the right for full details. The more you give, the more we give.

But remember, no matter the size of your pledge, you will be part of the Scouting For Diamonds family and a treasured member of our 'team'.

Former Red Sox Pitcher and legendary coach, David "Boo" Ferris,

The Impact

First and foremost you will be part of creating a legacy film about the hidden treasures of America's favorite pastime. A film of this kind has never been made and the men and women who will be brought to light deserve recognition.

Second, we plan to allocate a portion of the proceeds of Scouting For Diamonds to several non-profit organizations that support scouts and youth baseball.  It is the gift that keeps on giving.

Third, you get to be part of a film that will be treasured for decades and hopefully used by museums, baseball organizations and historical societies to keep fans (and future fans) in touch with baseball's rich history.

Mike Brito, International Scout with Los Angeles Dodgers

    Hurdles and Home runs

    We are committed to keeping this an independent project for many reasons but most importantly, to retain the integrity and soul of the story that needs telling. With many large film studios, this can be challenging. You can help us accomplish this.

    So far we enjoy enthusiastic support from numerous scouts, managers, coaches and Minor & Major League executives as well as team owners. Upon seeing the trailer it seems everyone is convinced we are 'onto something special.' And we are too.

    Although there are never any guarantees about a successful film,  the entire team of Scouting For Diamonds is swinging for the back fence.  And we want you with us for every pitch. And let's be honest,  with guys like Wade Boggs, Willie Mays, George Brett and many others on our side, we feel pretty darn good about our prospects.

    But we can't do this alone and that's why we need your support--all the way to the last inning!

    Founder of Scout of the Year Program, Roberta Mazur and husband Ron.

    At the Risk of Repeating Ourselves:

    1) Pledge, $5.00  $5,000  $25,000 or $100,000. You can pledge the whole thing if you like! We will love you equally!

    2) Help us get the word out. We only have 14 days.  Share this page with everyone you know--whether they are baseball fans or not. 

    3) Follow us: on Twitter and Facebook & our website:

    https://www.twitter.com/Scouting4Dmnds

    https://www.facebook.com/ScoutingForDiamonds/

    http://www.scoutingfordiamonds.com

    SO NOW, please pledge and for the next two weeks, talk about us like we are your favorite cousin who needs a plane ticket to the Academy Awards!

    Note regarding Perks: All perks pertaining to premieres and VIP events are TBD and all pledgers will receive at least 30 days notice before events.

story:
Short Summary

Hi everyone! My name is Kendyl and I am a Film and Media Production student at Arizona State University. I am heading into my final semester of my undergraduate career, but I need a little help in this last stretch.


My Film

One Trip Charlie follows teenage boy Charlie and his obsession with his favorite TV show: How I Killed Your Zombie Mother. However, his mom won't allow him to relax until he completes the list of errands she has left for him. In addition, he has to babysit his little sister, Lila, who is always getting herself into trouble. In this heartfelt comedy, will Charlie learn what is really important?


What We Need & What You Get

Any and all donations will be much appreciated. With the $1,200 I need left to complete this project, I will be able to make my film a reality and share it with all of you guys. 

With each donation, a thank you prize will be given. From behind the scenes footage, to a DVD copy of the film, everyone who contributes will walk away with something. 


Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't have any money to contribute, simply sharing this campaign to everyone you know will be extremely helpful. Let's spread the word about One Trip Charlie and make this dream a reality!

story:
Who's running the show?

My name is Claire Iannelli.  I am a junior film production student at Loyola Marymount University.  I'm currently preparing to shoot my short documentary: Rachel.  It is my junior year thesis film, and I am extremely excited to create and share it! 
Rachel will allow you to peek into the lives of the residents of Rachel, Nevada.  This isolated location is the closest town to Area 51 and has been tagged as the "UFO Capital of the World."  It is also the only town on the entire Extraterrestrial Highway in the Grand Basin Desert.  The residents live with little supervision and have only their imaginations to keep themselves entertained.    

I've always been fascinated by odd and isolated locations in the United States.  Growing up in a small town, I'm intrigued by those who have had similar experiences.  Rachel will allow me to explore this to the most extreme scale.    

Where's this money going?

All contributions received through this campaign will be gratefully spent on transportation, accommodations, meals for the crew, and post production.  It will also allow Rachel  to receive the attention it deserves to be as great as it can be.    

Why should I care? 

In an age where people are constantly being bombarded by distractions, responsibilities, technology, and arguably "too much to do," Rachel  will open our eyes to life without these entities.  It's easy to get caught up in life that's moving a million miles an hour but Rachel will hopefully bring us back to earth and remind us to live simply and use our imaginations to the fullest.     

What else can I do?

Share this campaign wherever you can!  Post it on your favorite social media site, or let people know by word of mouth!  Anything, no matter how small, will bring this documentary closer to becoming a finalized film!

Who's running the show?
My name is Claire Iannelli.  I am a junior film production student at Loyola Marymount University.  I'm currently preparing to shoot my short documentary: Rachel.  It is my junior year thesis film, and I am extremely excited to create and share it! 

Rachel will allow you to peek into the lives of the residents of Rachel, Nevada.  This isolated location is the closest town to Area 51 and has been tagged as the "UFO Capital of the World."  It is also the only town on the entire Extraterrestrial Highway in the Grand Basin Desert.  The residents live with little supervision and have only their imaginations to keep themselves entertained.     I've always been fascinated by odd and isolated locations in the United States.  Growing up in a small town, I'm intrigued by those who have had similar experiences.  Rachel will allow me to explore this to the most extreme scale.       Where's this money going?
All contributions received through this campaign will be gratefully spent on transportation, accommodations, meals for the crew, and post production.  It will also allow Rachel  to receive the attention it deserves to be as great as it can be.       Why should I care?  In an age where people are constantly being bombarded by distractions, responsibilities, technology, and arguably "too much to do," Rachel  will open our eyes to life without these entities.  It's easy to get caught up in life that's moving a million miles an hour but Rachel will hopefully bring us back to earth and remind us to live simply and use our imaginations to the fullest.     

    What else can I do? Share this campaign wherever you can!  Post it on your favorite social media site, or let people know by word of mouth!  Anything, no matter how small, will bring this documentary closer to becoming a finalized film!

story: Coming Fall 2017
story_txt: Coming Fall 2017

story:
Short Summary

This Indiegogo campaign is designed to help get Motor Family on air.

  • Max Grundy - automotive artist, and John Wells - festival promoter, hit the road bringing you the sights, sounds, and individuals that make up the kustom kulture scene-and help bring a positive message to the masses.
  • This campaign is designed to fund the added expenses of getting our episodes on the air.
  • With your help we can get something positive, unique, and entertaining on the airwaves.

The ultimate goal of Motor Family is to make a direct difference in the lives of fellow gearheads in need - and have fun while doing it!

The cars, the cycles, the pin up girls, the music, the art….. It all makes up the scene that we are a part of. Join us on our adventure.

What We Need & What You Get

Here are the details:

  • We need a grand total of $13,450  This cost is to get these episodes transferred to a format that will be broadcast ready, and on air.
  • We have some really cool items that are going to be available to all that help out.  Max Grundy prints, Motor Family exclusive print, stickers, books, coloring books, DVDs, and even a fleece blanket to wrap up in while you watch Motor Family.

  •  We are hoping to reach our goal of $10,000, but if we do not hit that goal we hope that you will still want to see the finished product and keep the Motor Family project alive.  IF (and this is a big if) we receive funding over the $10,000 it will go directly toward the cost of producing the next episode.

The Impact

While flipping through the channels, it is hard to find a family friendly show that is focused on the hot rod scene.  Motor Family is an alternative to the fake drama manufactured by Hollywood executives that feel the only way America will tune in to an automotive show is by showing people yelling at each other.  Motor Family chooses to show real drama that is happening out there in our community everyday.  If you have not watched the pilot episode on YouTube, we encourage you to watch to see what life and death real drama is all about.

  • Motor Family can be a successful venture with the help of anyone that is wanting an alternative to all the cookie cutter television shows that are on air now.  And these shows will benefit real people with real problems.
  • Max Grundy has proven himself as one of the most current and influential auto artists in the world today.  He currently works for SEMA, Disney, Napa, Kicker, and more.  Max Grundy Design has produced some of the best Neo Traditional rides seen on the net, as well as national, and international magazine coverage.  John Wells has taken a grass roots DIY movement and turned it into one of the biggest events in the upper Midwest.  The Vintage Torque Fest has turned into a must attend event bringing cars from both coasts, as well as spectators from Australia and England.  The entire event is focused on the kustom kulture helping out children with congenital heart defects.
  • Your donation will not only get you some nice perks, but make this a reality.  We can't do this without your support.  Max and John have relied on the support of this community for years and are asking for your help to bring this vision to reality.

Risks & Challenges

 Two episodes have been produced.  Now the challenge is to get them on the airwaves.  We are confident that as more people are able to see Motor Family and understand what we are trying to do, we will get more support.....and more episodes will be made.

  • We will be contacting all possible title sponsors to be a partner in the Motor Family production.  If you know a major corporation willing to be a title sponsor, please forward info or contacts so that we can talk details.
  • Even without major sponsorship, we are confident that we can still make this a production that will be available for viewing on the internet. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone has extra $ to help out, but that does not mean that you are not able to help out......

  • We need you to share this info on your Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and other social media.  If you have ANY contacts with potential sponsors, please pass our info to the interested parties.
  • Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

We appreciate your support, and together we will make a difference.

story:
Leggi in italiano

Ler em portugues

Leer en Castellano


The www.storieparalimpiche.com project

Paralympic Stories is a travelling blog, collecting stories of paralympic athletes from Italy, Brazil, Argentina and all over the world.

Through these stories we promote sport as a way to include disabled people into the society. We consider our blog as a meeting place of the differences.

Paralympic Stories means discovering worlds, opening new roads, building networks, connecting people and inspiring them to communicate with the different, the stranger, the weird.

Our project is an indipendent project, carried on by a coordinator and few part-time bloggers, and living thanks to the athletes, the readers, the people we keep meeting everyday.

We rely on humanity more than on technology, and we feel really proud about it.

We speak, and write in, four languages: Italian, Portuguese, Spanish and English. The people involved in the project come from all across the world.

We have a dream: to bring our multicultural and multitasking team to RIO 2016 Paralympics Games, happening in Rio de Janeiro from 7th to 18th September 2016, and to do the media coverage of the games.

Paralympic Games are the ultimate expression of Paralympic sport worldwide.

They are also an important showcase for disabled athletse, who are not as famous as their "normal" collegues. despite the high quality of their performances.

This is why the blog must go to RIO 2016.

And why should you contribute to our crowdfunding campaign?

Until today we have managed to carry on our works thanks to the financing program Torno Subito of Lazio Region, covering the project's coordinating actions.

Bringing our team to Paralympics Games will mean to face extra costs, that will allow us to create an headquarter in Rio De Janeiro for two weeks, to cover the costs of transport, food and lodging for the team and to make some technical improvements for the blog.

We promise you we will do our best with the resources we will get. we promise you as well we will get you into a totally SPECIAL event, full of very SPECIAL people.

Join our campaign! Contribute with the amount you want and...pleeeaseee...spread it as much as you can!!!

Every little gesture is very important for us!

RUN TO RIO WITH PARALYMPIC STORIES

www.storieparalimpiche.com

storie.paralimpiche@gmail.com

Italiano

Il progetto www.storieparalimpiche.com

Storie Paralimpiche è un blog itinerante, che dal 2014 sta viaggiando tra Italia, Brasile e Argentina per raccogliere e raccontare le storie di atleti Paralimpici.

Promuove lo sport come strumento di inclusione delle persone disabili e luogo d'incontro delle differenze.

E' scoprire mondi, aprire strade, costruire reti, è connettere mondi apparentemente distanti e scoprire che ci si può fare le stesse domande.

E'  un progetto indipendente, che vive grazie agli atleti, ai lettori, agli incontri di ogni giorno. I nostri potenti mezzi non hanno a che fare con la tecnica, ma con l'umanità, e questo ci rende orgogliosi.

E' un progetto che parla quattro lingue: italiano, portoghese, spagnolo e inglese, e in cui sono coinvolte persone, disabili e non, italiane, brasiliane e argentine.

Il nostro sogno è riuscire a portare la nostra squadra, multiculturale e multisfaccettata, ai Giochi Paralimpici di Rio 2016, che si terranno dal 7 al 18 settembre 2016 a Rio de Janeiro, per lavorare alla copertura giornalistica dei giochi, raccontandoli da un punto di vista più interno e accessibile, quello delle stesse persone con disabilità.

Le Paralimpiadi sono la massima espressione dello sport paralimpico a livello mondiale, e ne custodiscono lo spirito. Inoltre sono una vetrina importante per questi atleti, che godono di molta meno visibilità rispetto ai loro colleghi "normodotati", nonostante la qualità delle loro prestazioni.

Per questo noi di Storie Paralimpiche ci teniamo a essere presenti a RIO 2016, per raccontarvi quello che succede, a modo nostro. Per farlo abbiamo bisogno del vostro aiuto!

Perché dovreste contribuire alla nostra campagna di crowdfunding

Fino ad oggi siamo riusciti a portare avanti il nostro lavoro grazie al finanziamento del programma Torno Subito della Regione Lazio, che finanzia le azioni di coordinamento del progetto.
Per la fase dei giochi però prevediamo delle spese aggiuntive, che ci consentiranno di creare un quartier generale a Rio de Janeiro per due settimane, di coprire le spese di trasporto, vitto e alloggio per la squadra e di apportare alcune migliorie tecniche al blog, che nei giorni dei giochi sarà la vostra finestra sulle meraviglie che accadranno nella Cidade Maravilhosa.

Noi, come redazione, ci impegnamo a darvi il meglio con le risorse che riusciremo a ottenere, come abbiamo sempre fatto da quando il progetto è iniziato, nel settembre 2014.

Crowdfunding vuol dire finanziamento dal basso. Dal basso vuol dire da chi ci legge, da chi ci segue, da chi ci ha a cuore.

Perché dovreste aiutarci a finanziare il blog, e soprattutto contribuire alla trasferta dei redattori del blog alle Paralimpiadi, vi chiederete voi? Ce lo siamo chiesti anche noi, e abbiamo chiesto a ciascuno degli atleti che hanno partecipato al progetto di raccontare a modo loro cos'è il blog Storie Paralimpiche e perché è importante che continui a narrare le gesta di questi campioni così speciali.

Comunque, dovunque, sempre, le nostre storie siete voi, il blog siete voi, è nostro.

Dal canto nostro vi promettiamo che vi faremo entrare dentro un evento veramente speciale, popolato di persone veramente speciali!

La sfida è riuscirci con mezzi scarsi, con piccoli contributi, con semplicità.

Unitevi alla nostra campagna. Contribuite con la somma che volete, ma anche e soprattutto aiutandoci a divulgarla.
Ogni piccolo gesto è prezioso, ogni passo è una falcata che ci e vi avvicina a RIO.

CORRI VERSO RIO CON STORIE PARALIMPICHE!

www.storieparalimpiche.com

storie.paralimpiche@gmail.com









Português

O projeto www.storieparalimpiche.com

Histórias Paraolímpicas é um blog que viaja, e que, desde 2014, está juntando historias de Atletas Paraolímpicos da Itália, Brasil e Argentina..

O objetivo dele é promover o esporte como meio de inclusão das pessoas com deficiência e ser um ponto de encontro das diferencias.

www.storieparalimpiche.com é descobrir mundos, abrir estradas, construir redes, é ligar mundos aparentemente distantes e descobrir que todos eles vivem das mesmas perguntas.

E 'um projeto independente, que vive graças aos atletas, os leitores, aos encontros de cada dia. Temos mais confiança na humanidade que na tecnologia, e isso nos deixa orgulhosos em relação ao nosso trabalho.

Nosso projeto fala quatro idiomas: italiano, português, espanhol e inglês, e as pessoas que estão envolvidas nele vem de toda parte do mundo.

Nosso sonho é participar, junto com o nosso time, multicultural e multifacetado, aos Jogos Paralímpicos de Rio 2016, que aconteceram de 7 a 18 Setembro de 2016 no Rio de Janeiro, fazendo a cobertura jornalística do evento.

Os Jogos Paraolímpicos são a expressão máxima do esporte paraolímpico no mundo inteiro.. Eles são também uma importante ocasião para esses atletas de ganhar mais visibilidade.

Por isso acreditamos na importância do blog www.storieparalimpiche.com estar presente no evento Paraolimpico do RIO 2016!

Por que você deveria contribuir para a nossa campanha de crowdfunding

Até hoje fomos capazes de desenvolver o nosso trabalho graças ao financiamento do programa Torno Subito da Regione Lazio, que financia as acções de coordenação do projeto.
Para a fase dos jogos, porém, vamos ter uns gastos extra, para cobrir as despesas de transporte, alimentação e hospedagem no Rio De Janeiro por duas semanas para a equipe e fazer algumas melhorias técnicas para o blog, que nos dias dos jogos será a sua janela para as maravilhas que vão acontecer na Cidade Maravilhosa.

Nós, como redação, estamos comprometidos em dar nosso melhor, com os recursos que vamos conseguir. Estamos também comprometidos em traze-los conosco num evento muito ESPECIAL, feito por pessoas ESPECIAIS!!!

Crowdfunding significa financiamento do baixo. Baixo significa nossos leitores, quem nos ama, quem nos ajuda e suporta cada dia. Enfim, significa vocês!

Pois, em qualquer lugar, em qualquer hora, sempre, as nossas histórias são vocês, o blog são vocês, é nosso.

O desafio é ter sucesso com meios limitados, com pequenas contribuições, simplesmente.

Junte-se a nossa campanha. Contribuicom a quantidade que você quer, que você pode, e por favor espalha a campanha quanto mais puder!

Cada pequeno gesto ajuda, cada passo é um passo rumo a RIO 2016 Corra para RIO COM HISTÓRIAS PARAOLÍMPICAS!

www.storieparalimpiche.com

storie.paralimpiche@gmail.com









Castellano


El proyecto www.storieparalimpiche.com

Historias Paralolmpicas es un blog viajero, que a partir de 2014 cuenta historias de los atletas paralímpicos de Italia, Brasil, Argentina y de todo el mundo.

Su finalidad es promover el deporte como una forma de incluir a las personas con discapacidad, y ser un lugar de encuentro de las diferencias.

Es conocer mundos, abrir caminos, construir redes, conectar diferentes realidades y descubrir que son más similares de lo que pensamos.

Es un proyecto independiente, que vive gracias a los atletas, los lectores, los encuentros de cada dia.

Para nosotros es más importante la humanidad que la tecnología, y estamos orgullosos de esto. .

Es un proyecto que habla cuatro idiomas: italiano, portugués, español e inglés, y las personas involucradas son de todo el mundo.

Nuestro sueño es llevar a nuestro equipo, multicultural y multicapaz para los Juegos Paraolimpicos de RIO 2016, que van a ser del 7 al 18 de septiembre de 2016 en la ciudad Río de Janeiro, para trabajar como periodistas dentro de los juegos.

Los Juegos Paralímpicos son la máxima expresión del deporte paralímpico global.

Son también una importante ventana para estos atletas, que son mucho menos conocidos que sus colegas "sin discapacitad", a pesar de la alta calidad de sus gestos atléticos. .

Esta es la razón por la cual el blog www.storieparalimpiche.com debe ir a Río 2016.

¿Por qué vos deberias contribuir a nuestra campaña de crowdfunding?

Hasta ahora hemos podido llevar adelante nuestro trabajo gracias a la beca del programa Torno Subito de la Región Lazio, que financia las acciones de coordinación del proyecto.

Pero, llevar nuestro equipo para los Juegos Paralímpicos, significara gastos adicionales que nos permitirán crear una sede en Río de Janeiro para dos semanas, para cubrir los gastos de transporte, alimentación y alojamiento para el equipo y hacer alguna mejoría técnica en el blog.

Até hoje fomos capazes de desenvolver o nosso trabalho graças ao financiamento do programa Torno Subito da Regione Lazio, que financia as acções de coordenação do projeto. Para a fase dos jogos, porém, vamos ter uns gastos extra, para cobrir as despesas de transporte, alimentação e hospedagem no Rio De Janeiro por duas semanas para a equipe e fazer algumas melhorias técnicas para o blog, que nos dias dos jogos será a sua janela para as maravilhas que vão acontecer na Cidade Maravilhosa. 
Nós, como redação, estamos comprometidos em dar nosso melhor, com os recursos que vamos conseguir. Estamos também comprometidos em traze-los conosco num evento muito ESPECIAL, feito por pessoas ESPECIAIS!!!

Crowdfunding significa financiamento do baixo. Baixo significa nossos leitores, quem nos ama, quem nos ajuda e suporta cada dia. Enfim, significa vocês! 
Pois, em qualquer lugar, em qualquer hora, sempre, as nossas histórias são vocês, o blog são vocês, é nosso.

 
O desafio é ter sucesso com meios limitados, com pequenas contribuições, simplesmente.


Junte-se a nossa campanha. Contribuicom a quantidade que você quer, que você pode, e por favor espalha a campanha quanto mais puder! 
Cada pequeno gesto ajuda, cada passo é um passo rumo a RIO 2016
Corra para RIO COM HISTÓRIAS PARAOLÍMPICAS!

www.storieparalimpiche.com
storie.paralimpiche@gmail.com






 
Castellano


El proyecto www.storieparalimpiche.com

Historias Paralolmpicas es un blog viajero, que a partir de 2014 cuenta historias de los atletas paralímpicos de Italia, Brasil, Argentina y de todo el mundo.
Su finalidad es promover el deporte como una forma de incluir a las personas con discapacidad, y ser un lugar de encuentro de las diferencias.  
Es conocer mundos, abrir caminos, construir redes, conectar diferentes realidades y descubrir que son más similares de lo que pensamos. 


Es un proyecto independiente, que vive gracias a los atletas, los lectores, los encuentros de cada dia. 
 
Para nosotros es más importante la humanidad que la tecnología, y estamos orgullosos de esto. 

.
Es un proyecto que habla cuatro idiomas: italiano, portugués, español e inglés, y las personas involucradas son de todo el mundo.  
Nuestro sueño es llevar a nuestro equipo, multicultural y multicapaz para los Juegos Paraolimpicos de RIO 2016, que van a ser del 7 al 18 de septiembre de 2016 en la ciudad Río de Janeiro, para trabajar como periodistas dentro de los juegos.  
Los Juegos Paralímpicos son la máxima expresión del deporte paralímpico global.  
Son también una importante ventana para estos atletas, que son mucho menos conocidos que sus colegas "sin discapacitad", a pesar de la alta calidad de sus gestos atléticos. .
Esta es la razón por la cual el blog  www.storieparalimpiche.com debe ir a Río 2016.
¿Por qué vos deberias contribuir a nuestra campaña de crowdfunding?
Hasta ahora hemos podido llevar adelante nuestro trabajo gracias a la beca del programa  Torno Subito de la Región Lazio, que financia las acciones de coordinación del proyecto.
Pero, llevar nuestro equipo para los Juegos Paralímpicos, significara gastos adicionales que nos permitirán crear una sede en Río de Janeiro para dos semanas, para cubrir los gastos de transporte, alimentación y alojamiento para el equipo y hacer alguna mejoría técnica en el blog.
campaign_city: Rio de Janeiro, Rome, Bs As, Brazil

story:
Hi my name is Christopher Perkins and I am the founder of my company CP Production Studios and the director of this wonderful film, in the making called Ralphie.
I am a young film director and has been filming for over 5 years.
I have helped and acted in many nationwide projects such as Empire, Shameless (on showtime, Chicago fire (tv show) and Chicago Pd.

Who I am I am one of those guys who loves to have fun and expresses his love for many things, (through the iris of the camera). I love to capture emotions and develop them onto the screen and capture the audience emotions as they watch the films I create.

Number one goal

The film that i want to create is called Ralphie. Now the reason I chose to write film because many of us have questions about the conspiracy of do aliens exist? and if they did how can an human being created from god himself interact with a creature from a different planet.
We do not know but, many would love to figure out.
So i created this wrote this film so i can show the world, what it would truly be like if we connected with an creature deep far away from earth.
So this shows a 3 kids who discovers something amazing and it changes them forever and it reconnects the love in there family that was divided.
(Now in order to see this wonderful film we need to reach our goal) Help make this happen for us)

What are we going to do with funds we receive?
First step 1

We are going to get equipment for the film

Second step

We are going need for the locations we have chosen

Third step

We are going to need to purchase materials for
building this creature also to pull off the visual effects in the film
-Purchases of screens Blue and Green
-VFX make up
-Motion Capture
-Software's
-Publicity such as for media
-Advertisement
-Distributions

Why on Indiegogo?
We fill that Indiegogo is truly one of the best platforms we have seen and we honestly think that this platform is the best for our project.
-Indiegogo is well organized also, Indiegogo can help us be a greater impact to the filming industry.
why do i say that? I say that because, If we do raise our goal it will inspire many other filmmakers and my goal is to create a great film but, to create a powerful film industry as well.

(As you are reading this) SUPPORT NOW so we can make this film, the sooner we get funded the sooner we are closer to making this film and showing it nationwide. Including the awesome perks you get for supporting us some ones that you will never forget.

What do you Get (Perks Oh I love Perks)

$5 Shoutout on social media, thanking you for being a supporter and believing in my film.

$25 Ralphie Tshirt

$50

You get access to our personal website, where the official trailer will be released. (Be the first to see it)

$55

Get the DVD if you want us to ship it to you then you will have to send us your address if you want it autograph by the cast then come to the screen

$100
You get 4 Extra T shirts plus tickets to see it at the screen

$500
Ralphie's Soundtrack

$600
Get a speaking role in the film, You will be seen

$1000 (FORGET AN AUDITION)
Speaking role in the new SYFY film Ralphie, you will have tons of speaking roles

$10,000
Be apart of the film as a Executive producer

MY LIFE STORY(About Me)

 I love to film and I love everything about it. The Creativity of it blows me into a world full of laughter and filled with deep emotion ready to be recorded with a cam and put on screen.
I'm goofy not uptight and loves everyone. I have been hurt, rejected and still i love those you talk about me say i wont be successful and those who hate me just because.

Throughout my childhood i was bullied by students and teachers. I remember my teacher wrote the letter L on my forehead and told me that i wasn't going to be successful and that i would never be like steven speilberg. She did that because at the age of 10 i said, i wanted to be like Steven Spielberg. she raised my hand in front of class (me feeling deep humiliation she called me a loser and everyone laughed.)
That same day i was home alone and i wanted to commit suicide but, all of a sudden the tv came on and it was(UNPLUGGED) i kid you not. The television came on and Steven Spielberg's film came on called Jaws it inspired me to make films and it inspired me to help others in the process.

story:
THE STORY

Hard-partying Ian, struggling musician Lisa, and heartbroken Connor are three friends who find themselves tested in various states of depression: alcohol addiction, financial instability and unrequited emotional attachment.

After major events occur in their lives, Ian's drinking becomes out of control, and Lisa has to decide whether or not to accept a lucrative promotion at her unfulfilling day job- essentially slamming the door on her musical aspirations. Meanwhile, Connor attempts to break free of his codependence & crippling heartbreak while overcoming prejudices of his sexuality.

As time goes by, difficult decisions are made, unexpected realizations are discovered and friendships come to an end.

OUR GOAL

This project's main themes are about struggling with alcohol and addiction, prejudices in the LGBTQ community and fulfilling your dreams that seem impossible to achieve.

Instead of just focusing on one issue, we chose to have three very different characters in order to try and connect with as many people and viewers as possible. 

We believe that films have the ability to inform you, challenge you and often inspire you to make positive changes in your life as well as the lives of others. By shining a light on some of the aforementioned issues as well as others, we want DRY SPELL to serve as story of hope.

WHAT WE NEED

There are a number of resources that are necessary in creating a project like this. We're raising funds for the costs of filming equipment and a professional cast & crew, as well as submitting it to festivals and production companies. Your contribution will help make Dry Spell the best project it can be aesthetically, as well as in content and subject matter. 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Even if you can't contribute financially, you can still join us on this voyage by spreading the word about our campaign and sharing it through Facebook, Twitter, Instagram or any other social media outlet that you love.

We are extremely passionate about this project and want it to inspire positive change, spread peace and get people out of their dry spells of hope.

We hope to begin filming shortly after our campaign closes, for continuous updates and it's release, check out www.dryspellfilm.com.

Thank you so much for your contribution and for supporting independent filmmaking; ones with strong messages about alcohol abuse, music and the LGBTQ community. Thank you for supporting DRY SPELL!

story:
Just in Case you wondered why so many Power Ranger Perks...Nakia Burrise played Tanya, the yellow Power Ranger in Power Ranger Zeo, Power Ranger Turbo, and Power Ranger a Turbo Movie!    


   

                                             Updates



Hi My Dear Friends,

 I just want to begin this campaign by thanking you all from the bottom of my heart for allowing me this chance to share my dreams, create, perform, and make you LAUGH! Laughter can brighten the worse of days. Thank you for this great opportunity to not only to raise money to complete a show I am so passionate about but also for allowing me a platform to build and a encourage a wonderful community of love and support all around! Thank you again for being a part of our journey….

Your support means the world to me! Thank you from the bottom of my soul!

Nakia Burrise



Class Dismissed is a hilarious new comedy web series centered around three grade school friends, one nuisance and the unpredictable Assistant principal... Liz, the sassy tv extra turned teacher's aide, Anne, the easy going, free spirited first grade teacher who uses yoga and ti chi to teach her students Math and English, BJ, the loud-mouthed PE teacher/failed comedian and Nancy the nosy perfectionist teacher round out this crazy cast. After years apart BJ, Liz, and Anne find themselves reunited back at the same grade school...only this time they're in charge. What happens in the teachers lounge, stays in the teachers lounge! Hijinks, laughter, quick-witted banter, and lots of love, make this show the can't miss series.




                                                       The Episodes




We ultimately need $32,000 to make a complete second season of Class Dismissed. Our first season was absolutely amazing and might I say... hilarious! We want nothing less that the best for our audience for season two! We are hoping to raise at least $25,000 of our goal on Indiegogo. The rest of the funds we will seek  through private funding and grants.

We have created some exciting stretch goals for you all! These stretch goals will allow us the opportunity to add and edit additional behind the scenes footage, additional episodes, equipment and services. All the added bonuses to bring our audience the best! 

 
Class Dismissed had an extraordinary first season. We were blessed with a great cast, crew and producers. This is the third successful project that Nakia Burrise has produced. Season one was 99% financed through private donated funds. With season two we are seeking to offer MORE to our audience through perks, MORE celebrity guest stars, MORE quick witted humor, and MORE episodes per season!






                           







                                         


Other Ways You Can Help
We appreciate all of the help we can get. Even if you cannot donate please help by sharing our campaign with your friends and family. We truly appreciate it!

story:
A little bit about us.

Out There is written and directed by Nick Flemens; a film student at Eastern New Mexico University. Helping Nick is his close friend Avery Pelzman who will be producing along with being the Director of Photography. Both Nick and Avery have a deep love for visual storytelling and have been working together on many films together for the past four years. 

The Film

Out There centers on Carrie Ann, a struggling artist, yearning to break away from her small town. Her alien obsessed father however, demands constant attention, keeping her in town. Always by her side is Clark, a well mannered nurse who tries to help as much as he can.

What We Need From You

We are asking for $900. This money will go to feeding the cast and crew for four days along with buying props, set dressing, and equipment. We offer a wide range of incentives for every level of donation, from a personal thank you to being named as the Executive Producer of the film! 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to donate we thank you for your time in checking out our page, and ask that you share this with your friends and family on social media to help get our project out there!

story:
The Story

U.S. Marshal Elise Moore is a tough-as-nails agent of the law in Nevada, circa 1899. After capturing and delivering the leader of the infamous Tuscarora Train Robbers to the gallows, Marshal Moore is captured by the surviving members of the gang.  With the 12,000 dollar bounty and her life on the line, the Marshal will do whatever it takes to make it out alive.

Who We Are

We are film students in the Television and Film Arts program at SUNY Buffalo State College. In the past 2 years we've worked on numerous short films and professional film sets, such as Netflix original film Mercy (2016) and Brandon Slagle's Crossbreed. Much of our crew are members of Buffalo-based short film collaborative Studio 716. 

Our program has students currently working in Hollywood and New York at leading entertainment companies such as: 20th Century Fox, Bravo, Comedy Central, Disney, NBCUniversal, NCIS, Nickelodeon, Warner Bros., and MTV. It is through projects like this that gives us the experience and skill set we need to succeed in our future careers.

What We Need & What You Get

The funding we raise will go towards:

  • Hiring a talented cast and crew to bring our story to life
  • Period props, costumes, and set dressing. Revolvers, hats, spurs, cowboy stuff.
  • Catering for Cast and Crew

All funding raised will go towards bringing The Tuscarora Four to its highest potential!

Through our perks, you can be rewarded for your support:

  • Digital copy of the film, the wave of the future!
  • DVD copy of the film and bonus content! (A fine addition to your collection)
  • Incredible 11x17 One Sheet poster to class up your home!
  • The Tuscarora Four t-shirt for looking rad!
  • An official credit in the film!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Spread the word: Share this page through social media and email!
  • Follow us on twitter and facebook!
  • Check back here for updates on the production!

story:
Short Summary

Contributors to the film:

Konate' Hendricks-Director/Writer/Producer

Michelle Robinson-Director/Writer/Producer

Theron Hamilton-DP/Producer

Tanjanika L. Green-AD/Producer

Campaign

Our goal is to have Blood of The Land featured in various film festivals, by gaining exposure, it will give awareness to South Carolina based filmmakers. We are alumni of Trident Technical College film program, so in part, we feel that it is of great importance for us to reach out to students and have them be apart of our projects. It is of great significance that we tell the black history narrative, which has a direct effect on our lives today. We thank you for your support in partnering with us to bring this short film to life.

 

Funding

Cast/Crew-$24,000

Rental equipment-$7,000

Props and wardrobe -$7,500

Craft services/Meals -$8,500

Petty cash-$4,400

Lodging -$3,500

Insurance -$1,500

Film Fest Fees-$3,500

Total Budget: $60,000

Pre Production

Being that the film is based in South Carolina and it is a timepiece, we have scouted locations and have been given the green light to use various locations to film. We intend on giving you a real story, based on true events that people can relate to. In our pre-production meetings we break down the script in depth scene by scene, set up arrangements with crew members and setup the LLC for Blood Of The Land.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

We ask that you help us spread the word, let your friends and family know!

Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tool! Thanks!

story:
We are making the 4 short films, almost one for each month. We've already started with Zombie (Horror) and George (Comedy). We've already shot it and it is now in post-production. We still have two to go. 

But First, let us tell you about the stories.


(Drama/Horror)

"Zombie tells the story of two Brothers walking through the forest towards their friend’s home.Suddenly they are stopped by the discovery of a dead body. "

Zombie shows us that every action has it consequence and warns us to be careful when playing dangerous games.

(Comedy)

"All George wanted was to get home and eat his Hamburger without any interruption."

GEORGE JAMES, a middle-aged eviction specialist, is hungry after a long day at the office. Like many of us, he doesn't like what he's doing but he just needs to survive another day. George is a satire that shows how far you are willing to go just to feel good about yourself.

(Horror)

"It's Christmas Night. Michael is sleeping in his bed. Suddenly a HUGE MAN enters his room carrying his dead parent's bodies. "

Awoken is an adaptation of a campfire story which you often hear when you are a child. At its core, it's a story about how often you take things for granted and how often you judge a book by it's cover. 

(Horror)

"A young woman arrives at his new home to realize she isn't alone at all. "

Whispers is an adaptation of a campfire story which you often hear when you are a child. At its core is all about how you face your own fears. 

Well, we could tell you more... but then we would be spoiling the whole experience for you. 

Back in September 2016, Director Rui Pedro Sousa came to London with the goal of pursuing his career. Upon arriving, the Scripts of Zombie and George came into Rui's life and he decided to join his scripts Whispers and Awoken to the picture and try to shoot 4 short movies in a row. 

So he started searching for talented people to join him on the projects and make this 4 short-films come to life. We all get-together and we started the pre-production on Zombie. 

Let's face it, we needed money, mainly in a city like London that literally asks you for money to film anywhere. So the director went in touch with a friend from Portugal, with a recently new film company, to help us on the funds to pay for expenses for the team and locations. We did manage to get around 1000£ to make Zombie. We prepared everything, we had casting sessions with kids, we had rehearsals with the kids picked by the Director. 

And next week we would be shooting. We figured out how to handle food, we went to the director's house the previous day of shooting to make sandwiches for the next day shooting. 

And on March 24th we were shooting.

ZOMBIE - STILL FRAME

And, two days and 960£ after we finished the shooting of Zombie. You may ask. What were the 960£ for. And because we want, to be honest with you, we've spent around 350£ on traveling for the team, 150£ on food, 240£ on renting the forest (Yes we have to rent forests),  and everything else went to the renting of some tripods for Pilo boards and a Wireless Follow Focus. 

And 2 days after shooting Zombie and after giving the Files to the Editor, we started prepping George. We were sure about one thing: "We need to make George the cheapest possible". And so we did. The Director decided to shoot the film at his house, the DOP decided to shoot with one of our cameras and LED lights from some crew members. Now for the food, we needed to either cook ourselves or try to take advantage of the theme of George. Since George is all about a Guy trying to eat his hamburger we've decided to contact hamburger shops to see if any of them would support us with hamburgers for Props and to the entire crew. And luckily we found an amazing partnership with KUA 'AINA that gave us all that in exchange for promotion on our facebook and end titles. 

Thank You KUA 'AINA

And you know what? We were able to cast talented, funny, out of this world actors to be part of George.

Alexander Perkins - Alexander is an amazing actor who has worked in all the season of The Office with Ricky Gervais, and also great shows like Law & Order Uk and Call the Midwife.

Adam Shaw - Adam is another amazing actor that has already worked with Steven Spielberg and Tom Hanks on Saving Private Ryan and in many movies more like RED2.

We had an amazing cast and the shooting day came.

And here we are on the lunch break eating the hamburgers from Kua 'Aina :)

GEORGE - Still Frame

And this is it. 

With Love, Passion, Persistence we manage to shoot Zombie and George. 

The hardest are yet to come, and this is where we need you to come in. 

But first things up. Please let us present ourselves to you. 

Rui Pedro Sousa -  "Hello, my name is Rui Pedro Sousa and I am the crazy person who started all this. I was born in Portugal. My career started 6 years ago when I made my first short film "Tsintty". I had the passion for filmmaking all my life, but before that, I just didn't had the courage to make a movie. After going to University to study cinema I gathered a group of friends and made Tsintty. That movie went around the world and allowed me to get the "Rising Star Award" at the Canada International Film Festival. Two years after, in 2014 I started pre-producing my most challenging film to date, "Limbo, A Small Measure of Peace". It took me three years to complete Limbo. Now the film is out at film festivals around the world. Now I am into Zombie, George, Awoken and Whispers. And already have some films in the shelve to make."

Director's Reel

Ewa Habdas - " I always wanted to make movies. In 2008 I started collaborating on short movies as a still photographer: 'Blister', 'Elegance and Romance', 'The Courier', 'Persona'. This made me want to be closer to the production of the movie even more. In 2010 I found myself working as a head of the production of independent movie 'Hichestan'. It was a great eye-opener for me, because I understood that I am pretty good at organising projects and putting things together. After, I decided to produce my first short film: 'A Mime is a Terrible Thing to Waste' . This film was not only amazing adventure but also a great learning experience. A film was shown at the few festivals. Year later, Kirill Proskura and I produced: 'A Shadow of Dara' , which was shown on over 50 different festivals, was nominated for 39 awards and won 19 awards which include the best film at Top Indie Film Awards or Worldfest Houston Film Festival. In 2016, I produced short experimental film: 'Looking for Love'. Currently, I have joined the team of Rui Pedro Sousa and have been working on his four movies. Privately, I am a dreamer, philosopher, photographer (Ewa Habdas Photography) and idealist, person who loves deep conversations and always wants to grow.
 

Maria Cano -  " Hello, my name is Maria Cano and I am the producer of this crazy adventure. I was born in Spain and I came to London eight months ago. All my life I liked projects related to the audiovisual world because since I was young I picked up my father's camera and I started taking pictures like crazy. So I decided to study Visual Arts. After having experience as a producer in some projects at the University (Yours, 2015) and outside of it (Circle, 2016), I decided that what I liked most was organizing and carrying out audiovisual projects. Now I am into Zombie, George, Awoken and Whispers. Please take a look at my webpage! http://mariacano7.wixsite.com/miportfolio "

Please do check the rest of the team under the TEAM section. 

And this is how we shot Zombie and George, The dream is to film two more films Awoken and Whisper and they are far more ambitious than two previous ones.

But, Whispers and Awoken will, indeed, need a lot of budget. For Whispers we need to rent a two Floors House, fill it with boxes, blank sheets, paint cans (The family front the story is just moving into a new house), and we need to rent a Ronin (Stablizer to keep the camera steady) -  Did we already told you the Director is going to shoot Whispers only in ONE SEQUENCE SHOT? 

As for Awoken, the only way to make it right is to build a Kid's Bedroom set (Where the entire movie happens)  from scratch.

Set Sketch

The Director has some crazy shots in mind like a 360º around the camera, that is against the wall. When the camera goes behind the bed we will have a removable wall to take out so the camera can pass through. To accomplish all this we need to buy a lot of wood to build the walls, we need to buy wallpaper to dress the walls, we need to get furniture to make it a kids room (We are trying to ask Disney for permission to use a Toy Story Decoration: Toy Story Blanket for the bed, Toy Story toys on the shelves), we need to rent cinema lights (Fresnel Lights) to light the set, we need to rent a Ronin again, and, the director decided to set the film on Christmas Day so we will lights the scene as if the only source of light comes from the Christmas Light on the outside of the bedroom window (Our DOP is very much excited with all this). 

We will also have to build a small corridor for a shot that will be an homage to one of the Director's favorite film and Director - A.I. Artificial Intelligence by Steven Spielberg.

Artificial Intelligence Original Shot

Our Shot Sketch

We are also doing the design of a Monster for one of the films (We won't tell you what film so we won't spoil you). 

Of course, both movies still have the costs regarding transportation, light equipment renting, food and Post-Production. 

Please take a look at the chart bellow to clearly understand where it all goes:

We are also 

OK. Besides the fun part of being able to watch the movies once they are done you will also have the chance to win some goodies just for you. Please check everything you can get just here to the right.

But we also made a nice preview of what you can get:

Hey, check this PERK EXAMPLE

 

OK, so you can't contribute right now with a payment to us. But hey please know you can help us in many other ways. 

Crowdfunding is all about community, and the bigger the community, the bigger the success of a campaign. 

So please share this campaign page in all of your social media 

 

And send this attached to your friends when you ask them to share our page

 

Thank You isn't saying enough for you to have survived all this text :)

And this is all we need from you. If you were kind enough to support us either by contributing or sharing thank you very much for all of your help. 

If, by another way, you passed through and ignored all this... well...

And even if you are sure you won't go to Hell. Listen to this Guy bellow and take his advice

story:
Fosca is the youngest member of a spoiled family that used all the comforts of their house in the darkness of the woods until the rich mother died. Since then, the father and the two brothers failed every attempt to provide any food to the family leaving all the responsibility on the shoulders of the poor girl. However, Fosca would do anything to be loved, even transform her body through a taxidermy process in order to appear more like the beloved mother. 

Fosca è la figlia più giovane di una famiglia che, fino alla morte della madre, è stata viziata dai confort della loro casa nascosta tra le ombre di una foresta dimenticata. Da allora, il padre e i due fratelli, hanno fallito qualunque tentativo di badare a se stessi, lasciando tutte le responsabilità sulle spalle della povera bambina. Fosca è disposta a fare tutto il necessario per conquistare il loro amore, anche auto-imbalsamarsi per somigliare più alla loro amata mamma. 

 

 

Hi there! My name is Maria Chiara Venturini and I'm an Italian Director based in San Francisco. This is my first short film made in Italy and I'm thrilled to be able to direct in my homeland! My life has been pretty normal, but my mind has been taken over with weird ideas since I was a little girl. I can't wait to share my imagination with all of you and our dear Fosca.

                                                                       

Ciao, mi chiamo Maria Chiara Venturini e sono una regista e vivo a San Francisco. Fosca è il mio primo progetto italiano e non riesco ad esprimere l'emozione che provo nel dirigere un film nella mia stessa patria! La mia vita è stata piuttosto normale ma, fin da piccola, la mia mente è stata spesso occupata da idee piuttosto bizzarre. Non vedo l'ora di condividere la mia immaginazione con tutti voi e con la nostra cara Fosca. 

Moneys don't buy happiness but make movies! 

I soldi non comprano la felicità ma fanno i film! 

Your contribution will go towards // Il tuo contributo andrà:

Check out our Perks List

to see the amazing gifts that you get  ------->

with your contribution!

Scopri i vari premi che

 

We want to make this for the people who don't dream anymore, who have a diminished imagination so when you ask them to tell you a story they don't mumble their grocery list. Allow us to make you a part of a different world where little girls don’t bleed from their cuts, taxidermied squirrels are life problem confessors and tears can be transformed into laughs.

Vogliamo realizzare questo progetto per tutti quelli che non sognano più,  quelli che hanno un immaginazione ridotta così che quando gli domandi di raccontare una storia non ti borbottino la lista della loro spesa. 

Permettici di portarti in un mondo dove i bambini non sanguinano dalle loro ferite, dove uno scoiattolo è il tuo più prezioso confessore e le lacrime possono essere trasformate in grandi risate.

We understand not everyone is able to contribute. That's okay! 

You can still be a huge help by: 

  • Sharing this campaign on Facebook! 
  • Following this campaign and being our audience! 
  • Telling your friends and family about our project!  
  • Finding your inner Fosca!

Capiamo benissimo che non tutti potranno contribuire. Non importa! 

Puoi ancora essere un grande aiuto: 

  • Condividendo questa campagna su Facebook!
  • Seguendo la campagna e essendo parte del nostro pubblico! 
  • Parlando di noi con i tuoi amici e i tuoi familiari! 
  • Trovando la tua Fosca interiore!
