story:
Why should you get into bed with us?

My name is Nyle Cavazos Garcia, the writer, director and producer of THE MAN WHO LOVED WOMEN.  Independent filmmaking to me is storytelling outside of the box, taking risks and attempting to do something, either on film or in your story, that you couldn't do under the thumb of a mainstream moviemaking machine.  THE MAN WHO LOVED WOMEN pulls down the sheets from a traditional Romantic Comedy to reveal the even more hilarious, vulnerable and extremely naked truth below.  This movie is part throwback to raunchy 80's sex comedies, part reconstruction of what a Romantic Comedy is to the modern day moviegoing public, and part flash forward to an uncensored and truthful view of how awkward, messy and all-encompassing casual sex is on a person's journey to finding love and happiness.

We are a small army in this fight to bring THE MAN WHO LOVED WOMEN into the world, and wholeheartedly appreciate all of your support and contributions.  The lead actor Cassidy Durrell, and I have invested all we can out-of-pocket to get this movie going.  I own some film equipment through my production company, Small Town Pictures, and we have more equipment being donated, including HD cameras and lenses.  Most of our film locations are also being donated.  Our tight but experienced crew, and our truly amazing cast is working for a very small day rate (or deferred pay).  The term project-of-passion is thrown around quite a bit in Hollywood, and is usually referring to a "low budget" $30-million dollar "independent film" starring Matthew McConaughey or Channing Tatum.  In our case, this actually is a project-of-passion, and our production budget is only $30-thousand dollars.

What do you get out of this relationship?

This movie is a Summer-long project, shooting 2-days a week for 12-weeks, as opposed to consecutively.  That is 24 shoot-days at approximately $1,250 per day.  We have the first week covered (2 shoot-days), and need your help to keep the production moving toward completion.  Every $1,250 that we raise is another full day of production covered.  Your money is going to paying and feeding the Cast and Crew; buying props, costumes and set dressings (such as various arm casts, a massage table, a lifelike dildo, a spray-tan, a red wig, headstones, a casket, a motorboat, a sports car, a handgun, a shake-weight, nude C-strings, a nude banana hammock, and numerous itsy-bitsy teenie-weenie string bikinis); renting some specialty film equipment (such as a curved dolly track, a hostess tray for mounting the camera on car doors while driving, a car hood mount for the camera, a camera jib arm, underwater camera housing, a split-diopter lens, a Kino Flo mini-light kit for lighting the interior of a car, and various camera lens filters to make the Summer in Los Angeles and all those sex scenes look like a million-bucks); production insurance; and the few hard-to-get-for-free locations that we do need to pay for (massage parlor, coffee shop, bar, television news studio, cemetery, funeral home, Malibu mansion, cabin at Pyramid Lake).  

I'm sure now you have a lot of questions about just how crazy, wild and ambitious this movie is. Worry not, portions of this movie and behind-the-scenes footage and interviews will be released on the film's website (www.themanwholovedwomenmovie.com) throughout the Summer as production continues.

Will this movie give you a happy ending?

Our goal is to give everybody a happy ending with THE MAN WHO LOVED WOMEN.  It's funny, dark, honest, sexy, revealing, fresh, romantic and smart, and that's just the story.  The completed film will both shock and overjoy mainstream audiences across the world, and be a new template for modern independent filmmakers to follow in getting their own micro-budget feature films out of their hearts and onto movie screens.  We plan to excite fans from day one of production online with "leaked" scenes and footage as a promotional "web series", and then premiere this movie at numerous international film festivals, starting with Cannes 2018.  If that doesn't give you a happy ending, maybe this will  We plan to release THE MAN WHO LOVED WOMEN worldwide on DVD/BluRay/Pay-Per-View/OnDemand, while also taking advantage of new and successful distribution platforms for independent films (such as iTunes, Netflix, Amazon, Hulu, Roku, Redbox).  This movie will be in your face, tugging at your heart, with it's taste in your mouth for years to come.  A cult classic.

Is this an open relationship?

THE MAN WHO LOVED WOMEN has enough love to go around, but needs everybody's love in return.  Please contribute what you can, and ask your friends to contribute, and ask your family to contribute.  Not ready to commit yet?  In that case, please share this IndieGoGo campaign on your Facebook, Twitter, Instragram, Snapchat,  Pinterest, etc. and maybe help to make a true love connection between our movie and one of your peeps.

Thank you!  Ready or not, here comes THE MAN WHO LOVED WOMEN.
story_txt:
Why should you get into bed with us?
My name is Nyle Cavazos Garcia, the writer, director and producer of THE MAN WHO LOVED WOMEN.  Independent filmmaking to me is storytelling outside of the box, taking risks and attempting to do something, either on film or in your story, that you couldn't do under the thumb of a mainstream moviemaking machine.  THE MAN WHO LOVED WOMEN pulls down the sheets from a traditional Romantic Comedy to reveal the even more hilarious, vulnerable and extremely naked truth below.  This movie is part throwback to raunchy 80's sex comedies, part reconstruction of what a Romantic Comedy is to the modern day moviegoing public, and part flash forward to an uncensored and truthful view of how awkward, messy and all-encompassing casual sex is on a person's journey to finding love and happiness.
We are a small army in this fight to bring THE MAN WHO LOVED WOMEN into the world, and wholeheartedly appreciate all of your support and contributions.  The lead actor Cassidy Durrell, and I have invested all we can out-of-pocket to get this movie going.  I own some film equipment through my production company, Small Town Pictures, and we have more equipment being donated, including HD cameras and lenses.  Most of our film locations are also being donated.  Our tight but experienced crew, and our truly amazing cast is working for a very small day rate (or deferred pay).  The term project-of-passion is thrown around quite a bit in Hollywood, and is usually referring to a "low budget" $30-million dollar "independent film" starring Matthew McConaughey or Channing Tatum.  In our case, this actually is a project-of-passion, and our production budget is only $30-thousand dollars.

story:
Short Summary

Hello, and thank you for checking out our film project! We're very excited to have you join this Float Trip horror adventure with us--it has been in development for the past year and will be filming July 24th - August 3rd!

We are James Tweedie and Jed Ramsey--we love good stories and have fun sharing them with others. We have been involved in multiple facets of the film industry for many years--in acting, writing and producing. After James was Ben Affleck's stand-in for the entire filming of Gone Girl  (but that was Ben's butt, not James's), he met Jed through Creative Actors Workshop in St. Louis, MO, and began developing, writing and pre-production for this tale that takes place on the Huzzah River in Steelville, Missouri. As producers of this new project, James brings his experience producing and directing The Awakening, and Jed carries over his roles as associate producer from Sophie and On Sight.

Included in our amazingly talented cast and crew, we are lucky to have Emmy Winner and cinematographer, Julius Damenz (Infinite, Scream Queens, Parallel Chords), and social media personality, Carter Reynolds, with his multi-million strong audience from Twitter and Instagram.

With your help, this film will be made at a Hollywood level and shared with you, your family and friends, and millions of people!

What We Need & What You Get

This project has been funded to $35,000 through our own pockets and the generosity of friends and family...but we are a little short and need $5,000 to round out the budget for:

  • FOOD. With 18 people filming 8-12 hour days for 11 days...we gots to eat!
  • Equipment insurance. We have to get insurance for the $50,000 worth of film equipment we are using.
  • Plenty of WATER and SUNSCREEN lotion for cast and crew--it's the hottest time of the summer!
  • A deposit for one filming location which we will use for 1 day.

We have a bunch of cool perks below for those of you who'd like to contribute financially, including a kayak (yes, we said kayak), film props and autographed posters, and even Producer credit with the opportunity to get a percentage of the profits should Float Trip make money.

Even if we don't make our campaign funding goal of 5k, all funds raised will go directly towards our needs listed above. 

The Impact

If you've ever wanted to be involved in the production of a movie, this is your chance. You're teaming up with actors, filmmakers, and producers who have worked or performed on professional film sets.

Any amount you can contribute will add to the success of this film--and when it's shared with an audience, you'll know you were a critical factor for that to happen. And if you want your name as a Producer in the credits, you'll have the chance of possibly making a return for your financial contribution, 

Risks & Challenges

While independent films often get made, very few make any financial gain. Often in these cases, a film may be beautiful to watch but has a limited audience due to a lack of "star" talent attached, or not enough marketing.

Not only will Float Trip look amazing and have high production value with Julius Damenz as the cinematographer, as well as other professional crew and cast, with Carter Reynolds attached as our star, we have a built-in audience. Carter had a huge following on the online video platform, Vine, followed by YouTube, and has almost 3M active followers on Twitter and 3.4M on Instagram, thousands of whom retweet, repost and comment on each of his posts. This is our audience, and Mr. Reynold's has agreed to actively promote the Float Trip film once released.

While we will seek to sell Float Trip outright, with this large of an audience, we are confident this film will be financially viable through online release as well, either through paid downloads or ad revenue.

Other Ways You Can Help

Another way you can be a part and contribute in a HUGE way, is to share this page on social media, such as Facebook. The more views and awareness for our project, the better! 

Thank you again for reading about Float Trip, and thank you for your support!

story:
TO PRODUCE THIS SERIES, WE NEED YOUR HELP!!

This is our second campaign for Curvy Girls Rock. Check out our first campaign here. 

Curvy Girls Rock (CGR), written by Shakesha Williams, was created with the idea that real women should be represented on television. The female leads of CGR are strong, independent, funny and ambitious women. They represent the majority of women around the country. CGR will allow women to see themselves onscreen. 

The Impact

  • The success of Curvy Girls Rock The Series will: 
  • Show Hollywood that it's time to cast size diversity in leading roles more often. 
  • Allow the creators of CGR to create the show with it's intended vision
  • Make it clear to the industry that plus size women are the majority, not the minority and can be sexy, desirable, proud, ambitious and intriguing. 

Jazzy is a beautiful, vivacious, confident , highly successful fashion blogger and plus size model. Self proclaimed fat Beyonce. She is a leader in the plus size fashion industry and speaks out on issues related to fat shaming and beauty in all sizes. She has everything and more. She's not looking for love. She's satisfied and single.

NAIMAH TERRY stars as Jazzy.   She is a NJ native and is studying acting at Shiek Studios and with Coach April Yvette Thompson.  Naimah has been professionally modeling for 3 years.  From national Modeling Campaigns for Ashley Stewart to Fit Modeling in China; Naimah has international fashion experience.   She is a recent graduate from Rutgers University, as well as, a motivational speaker for local non-profit organizations.

Adrienne is a fashion designer. She's cute, quirky, and wears her heart on her sleeve. Adrienne is obsessed with online dating but can't seem to find the one. Her closest friend, Bruce, is in love with her, but stuck in the “friend zone”.

ZOE GOSLIN stars as Adrienne. Zoë came to New York a year ago after graduating from the London Academy of Music and Dramatic Art. In that time, she has done voiceover work and numerous theatrical productions, most recently appearing in "Much Ado About Nothing" at Easy Leap Theatre Company. Curvy Girls Rock marks her first web series, and she is thrilled to be part of a project that champions inclusivity and sisterhood.

Zuri is a museum owner and Reagan's ex-sister-in-law. A lover of art and culture, Zuri is well-educated, down to earth, funny, and has a dry sense of humor. When people see Zuri, the term black is beautiful comes to mind; she is self-confident and sexy.  She just broke things off with her long time love and  not interested in finding love, just growing with her museum. Her potential love interest is a world traveling photographer showing at her gallery.

ELLISHA MARIE stars as Zuri. Ellisha Marie is a New York native and first generation American, born to parents from the Island of Trinidad and Tobago. She attended A.M.D.A, the American Musical and Dramatic Academy, a college and conservatory of the performing arts, where she received training from top instructors from all over the country. After graduating AMDA, Ellisha Marie gained professional experience in singing and stage work opportunities. Ellisha Marie is very excited about making her TV/Film debut as “Zuri”.  She is honored to be a part of a movement that will inspire women to love and value their bodies and their true, authentic self. 

Reagan is Jazzy's assistant and recently divorced. She's not comfortable with herself. She lost her way and wants to reinvent herself. She's smart, creative and wants to start a new life. She's packed on the pounds after her divorce and wants to jump back into the dating world.

ANDREA ILENE SHAPIRO stars as Reagan. Andrea Ilene Shapiro is a comedian, actor, writer and voiceover artist from NYC. She has appeared on “Orange Is the New Black”, “Dr. Oz”, TLC’s “Suddenly Rich", was a finalist in the NBC “Welcome to Sweden” sketch contest, and in a bevy of independent films. As a comedian, Andrea was a finalist for Moveon.org's "Laughter Trumps Hate" stand-up contest & has performed at venues such as UCB, Gotham Comedy Club, Greenwich Village Comedy Club, Broadway Comedy Club and many more. She hosts the monthly all-female stand-up show “Saw Her Stand Up There” and the weekly show "Bunk Bed Time" at QED in Astoria which has been featured in Timeout NY, CBS and NY Times. She has written for XOJane & Slop Sandwich and is currently the host of “Cool Shit…And…Shit” with Missive Behavior Productions.

Ivy is a singer and entertainer. She is strong, but struggling with independence while dealing with her on-again, off-again relationship.

RASHEEDA WALLACE stars as Ivy. Rasheeda has worked and graced the stage with the likes of Chaka Khan, DMX, Talib Kweli, Patti Labelle, and Wyclef just to name a few.  She is also a curvy model.  She has been featured on Good Day New York and a host of other entertainment programs.  She is a business consultant int he (fix) fashion and entertainment industries. Rasheeda's rising star shines brightly is (as) an artist-prenuers.

Shane is Jazzy’s love interest. He’s a music festival programmer who comes back into Jazzy’s life. Will Jazzy and Shane rekindle their romance?

NATHAN M. RAMSEY stars as Shane. Nathan is an actor, singer and songwriter from the Bronx, New York. He served in the U.S. Air Force for eight years before he returned to New York in pursuit of a dream far too long deferred. During his time abroad , he traveled to 14 different countries and experienced a wide variety of cultures, which he channels to give his work a unique life that far extends his Bronx roots. Nathan has appeared on the Bronx's own Lehman Stages in Clifford Odets' "Waiting for Lefty" and Luis Rafael Sánchez's "The Passion of Antígona Perez". His film credits are spread throughout various short films, student films and, most recently, the independent feature film, "In Character" set to debut in 2017.

Bruce is a graphic designer and best friends with Adrienne. He is caring, kind and funny. The question remains is friendship all that Bruce wants from Adrienne?

NICK BOMBICINO stars as Bruce. Nick is an actor and musician based in NYC, born in small town Vermont. He studied at Ithaca College, and then went off to the UK to get his Masters at the Birmingham School of Acting. He hung around England after finishing his degree before moving to NYC. His Film and TV credits include "Totally Patriots" (2016) and "Skeleton Crew" (2016). His Off-Broadway and New York credits include "Delirium’s Daughters" (The Clurman); "The Two Gentlemen of Verona", Becky Shaw (Spicy Witch Productions); and "Hay Fever" (Birmingham Repertory Theatre) and "We Are Three Sisters" (The Old Joint Stock Theatre) in the UK.

Conroy is a photographer who is taken with Zuri. Will these two type A personalities ultimately find joy and comfort in one another?

SJ HANNAH stars as Conroy. SJ Hannah is thrilled to be a part of the cast of Curvy Girls Rock.  Onstage , he has performed in regional productions such as "Blues for an Alabama Sky", "Train is Comin", and most recently "Invisible Life, The Musical", based on the book by E. Lynn Harris at the World Famous Apollo Theatre.  He also toured the country as Simba in "The Lion King".  On the screen, he has been seen in "Mysteries at the Museum", and the award winning indie film, "Sneakers and Soul".    

Max is Reagan’s upstairs neighbor who stirs up a sexual awakening in her after her divorce.

DANTE SHARPE stars as Max. Dante was born and raised in West Palm Beach Florida. He played football and track, but after a major injury he never played the same again. After year of soul searching, he realized his passion for acting and moved to New York City. He feels that being able to create a story that can distract, embody or influence someone’s life in any way is what brings him most joy. This is Dante’s first web series.

WRITER AND CREATOR

Shakesha Williams is an award-winning screenwriter and producer. Her short film "My Story" won BEST SCREENPLAY SHORT at the WIDESCREEN FILM AND MUSIC VIDEO FESTIVAL in 2017. Shakesha has been in the entertainment industry since 2003 where she was an intern for Universal Music Group. In 2006, she started Harlem Fusion Enterprises, a entertainment and was the founder of concert series featuring indie artists in New York City and Atlanta. She was also VP of Publicity for record label Ru1 Records. In 2009, she began her career as a writer, producer,  and director. She has produced a series of short films and worked in various roles on commercials, web series and feature films. 

Challenges To Making The Series

This is considered an ultra low budget project by industry standards. But raising this money will make season one of CGR exactly the way it was envisioned. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute $$$ at this time, you can still help. SPREAD THE WORD! Let everyone you know about the Curvy Girls Rock Campaign.

His film credits are spread throughout various short films, student films and, most recently, the independent feature film, "In Character" set to debut in 2017.

Bruce is a graphic designer and best friends with Adrienne. He is caring, kind and funny. The question remains is friendship all that Bruce wants from Adrienne?
NICK BOMBICINO stars as Bruce. Nick is an actor and musician based in NYC, born in small town Vermont. He studied at Ithaca College, and then went off to the UK to get his Masters at the Birmingham School of Acting. He hung around England after finishing his degree before moving to NYC. His Film and TV credits include "Totally Patriots" (2016) and "Skeleton Crew" (2016). His Off-Broadway and New York credits include "Delirium’s Daughters" (The Clurman); "The Two Gentlemen of Verona", Becky Shaw (Spicy Witch Productions); and "Hay Fever" (Birmingham Repertory Theatre) and "We Are Three Sisters" (The Old Joint Stock Theatre) in the UK.

Conroy is a photographer who is taken with Zuri. Will these two type A personalities ultimately find joy and comfort in one another?
SJ HANNAH stars as Conroy. SJ Hannah is thrilled to be a part of the cast of Curvy Girls Rock.  Onstage , he has performed in regional productions such as "Blues for an Alabama Sky", "Train is Comin", and most recently "Invisible Life, The Musical", based on the book by E. Lynn Harris at the World Famous Apollo Theatre.  He also toured the country as Simba in "The Lion King".  On the screen, he has been seen in "Mysteries at the Museum", and the award winning indie film, "Sneakers and Soul".    

Max is Reagan’s upstairs neighbor who stirs up a sexual awakening in her after her divorce.
DANTE SHARPE stars as Max. Dante was born and raised in West Palm Beach Florida. He played football and track, but after a major injury he never played the same again. After year of soul searching, he realized his passion for acting and moved to New York City. He feels that being able to create a story that can distract, embody or influence someone’s life in any way is what brings him most joy. This is Dante’s first web series.

WRITER AND CREATOR
Shakesha Williams is an award-winning screenwriter and producer. Her short film "My Story" won BEST SCREENPLAY SHORT at the WIDESCREEN FILM AND MUSIC VIDEO FESTIVAL in 2017. Shakesha has been in the entertainment industry since 2003 where she was an intern for Universal Music Group. In 2006, she started Harlem Fusion Enterprises, a entertainment and was the founder of concert series featuring indie artists in New York City and Atlanta. She was also VP of Publicity for record label Ru1 Records. In 2009, she began her career as a writer, producer,  and director. She has produced a series of short films and worked in various roles on commercials, web series and feature films. 
Challenges To Making The Series
This is considered an ultra low budget project by industry standards. But raising this money will make season one of CGR exactly the way it was envisioned. 
Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't contribute $$$ at this time, you can still help. SPREAD THE WORD! Let everyone you know about the Curvy Girls Rock Campaign.

story:
HERE IS A * MINUTE SHORT VERSION OF THE FILM!! 
we managed to film the short on a £700 budget! 9 locations, 1 day! 10 hours! 
hope you enjoy!  VIEW IT HERE!
 


 

 





SEE WHOS INVOLVED IN HOMELESS ASHES 
http://www.imdb.com/title/tt4677134/?ref_=nv_sr_3

HOMELESS ASHES IS A FEATURE FILM
DRAMA/ACTION/ADVENTURE
SHOWING HOMELESSNESS TO IT RAWEST



CANT DONATE??? GET ON OUR REFERRAL SCHEME! BE CREDITED FOR SPREADING THE WORD! 




GET THE FRANKIE GRAM T SHIRT LIMITED OFFER ONLY 12


Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Homeless Ashes was created by Marc Zammit and is very passionate and committed to the film! He will not stop until this film gets made. Marc was raised on a council estate, has been acting for 17 years, after starting acting at the age of 12 he could not afford to go drama school, so worked delivering milk at the age of 12 to help fund his career. When he went to drama school he made a promise to himself that if he were to reach success in his career he would do something to give back to the community and as Marc has gone from strength to strength he has found the path to make a film that he feel will make waves. 

  • The film is hugely important to us at Aptitude Films as we would like this to be our debut film, and make the issues of homelessness shine on screen.

  • with your help we will achieve so much!! i can not explain this is not a candy film! we aim to make a film that is inspiring, jaw dropping, and bring awareness, and hopefully what will win awards, and make the awareness of the issue of homelessness rise, its hard to get funding from a project like this as its hard to sell! and its a massive risk! your contributions will help the film get made from pre-production, filming and Post Production.

     





    THE CINEMATOGRAPHY (FROM HOMELESS ASHES SHORT)






  • INFLUENCES 

    THE ROAD-The depth and Intensity



    Forrest Gump-The Story, The Journey


    Cast Away-The Loneliness


    ONE FLEW OVER THE CUCKOOS NEST-THE CHARACTERS AND RELATIONSHIPS



    DRIVE- THE MOOD AND FEEL




    GET THE VETERAN PERK £60 YOUR NAME ON PERSONAL DOG TAGS OR SOMEONES NAME, WITH DATE OF BIRTH AND BACKERS NUMBER!

     

What We Need & What You Get

 

  • We need £95,000 to make the film, this will pay for things like Filming, Food, Equipment hire, locations, insurance, make up, costume, art department, post production, travel and accommodation, for cast and crew and even things light lighting, sound, transport, stunts, editing. 

  • Unique Perks one i'm excited for is watching the whole Film being made LIVE!! thats pretty awesome i'm excited for people being able to watch the making of the film live start to finish! thats pretty epic, getting to feel like your there with us! asking questions, to the LIVE host, and also some behind the scene interviews. some other awesome perks like Homeless Ashes posters, Being a Homeless Extra, Associate producer, executive producer, screening tickets! there so many!  

  • If we do not reach our entire goal! funds will be remained in a bank to seek the rest of the funding! and we will keep crowdfunding attempts engaging with new audiences! until we reach our goal!! 

WE ARE DEDICATED TO MAKE THIS FILM



The Impact

  • If you Contribute to this project you are not just the only reason for this film being made but you are part of the voice of the film! to bring awareness to Homelessness, you are family not just a contributor! 

  • I was part of a project called Kosmos what was a webseries! and i see the amount of support there was on getting funding for £35,000 and we hit above the target and its amazing how people come together to see a project get made! giving indie films the chance to make a movement! 

  • We need you, you are not just a contributor, we expect nothing! i am just as grateful of someone sharing our campaign as much as someone contributing towards the film! it really touches my heart and some supports of this film have become good friends. we value your time and we value your contribution! i would give a hug to every person who supports this film if i could! 

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Its been so hard to get funding for Homeless Ashes the truth is we was asked to make it more commercial, even change the name, because "Homelessness" was making the film not appealing or attractive enough because it was a hard sale and a massive risk. "I REFUSE to change the name of the film or make it more commercial to make it more appealing and candy on a shelf to sell. the moment i do that just to get the chances to get funding for the film! i turn my head to the homeless! when i'm trying to raise awareness to it, i turn my head to all those who have supported the film! and it means i will be doing the film for me not for the value behind it.   

  • we will make this film and any problems we come across we will solve! 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • as i said before i expect nothing if you can contribute! thats totally fine! you are still family! i hope you manage to get the film when its out! but tell your friends! and family about the film Spread the word!!! 

  • Tweet about the campaign, share with your friends if you can!! help us get the film made!

we will make this film and any problems we come across we will solve!

story:
IMAGINATION...

I have always believed in the power of imagination; how it can be shaped into action and make this world into a better place. My family and I planned to celebrate my grandfather’s 80th birthday with him in the Chinese countryside. He passed away very suddenly, shortly before the celebration. I never got the chance to say goodbye to him. Kintsugi is a tribute to my grandfather. I believe the people we have loved in our lives never truly leave us; they continue to live on in our hearts and our memories. With Kintsugi, I want to tell a story of loss and change but also of hope and acceptance. I want to share this elegy through the innocence and wonderment of a young girl, Siyue, and the dynamism of film. - Jia (writer/director)

 

OUR PROJECT

Our main character, 12-year-old Siyue, is heartbroken after the passing of her grandmother. Siyue and her mother, Mei, travel to the Chinese countryside to clean out grandmother’s house, preparing it to be sold. This is difficult for Siyue. She misses her grandmother dearly. She runs off into a forgotten room in the house and stumbles into a magical world of small creatures. One creature is seemingly hostile at first, but ends up instead in need of Siyue’s help. Siyue briefly enters the creatures’ world and finds an unexpected way to connect to her grandmother’s memory.

We have a team of amazing artists who are eager to bring this project to life. We hope to tell this story with humanity, grace and a touch of wit and we want you to be a part of it.

As a thesis film, our biggest hurdle is financial support. We need your generosity to help us through production, post-production, and the festival circuit. Your support will literally contribute to the entire process of the film! From craft services on set, to prop rentals, to location permits, to camera equipment, to set construction, to VFX, to animation, to promotion... and much, much more...

WE NEED YOU!!!

With this IndieGoGo campaign, we hope to raise 12k. This will take us about half way to our ultimate goal! We have amazing perks in line for donors in the various sponsorship tiers, such as artwork from the film and the chance to be credited as a producer.

There are two ways you can help (though it would be really great if you did both)...

1) You can donate to our IndieGoGo campaign!

2) You can get others involved who may be interested in our story!  Use the IndieGoGo share tools or send our link to your friends, family, co-workers, anyone you think would like to pitch in and be a part of the project.

 

Where The Funds Will Go...

Filmmaking takes time, money, people, and lots of support. To see an ambitious project like this take flight, we need your help! The following is a breakdown of part of our current budget estimate so you can see exactly where your donations will go. 

Camera Department: $4,000

Studio Teacher: $1,500

Make-up and Hair: $500

Set Dressing/Props: $3,000

Animation and Rigging: $4,000

Set Operations: $1,000

Rendering Special Effects: $4,000

Location Fees: $3,000

Post Production: $1,600

Craft Services: $1,100

Meals: $2,100

Truck Rental: $1,000

Music Fees: $300

Compositing: $2,500

Color Correction: $1,000

Marketing and Festivals: $1,500

 

OUR TEAM

Jiayuan Liu – Writer/Director

Jiayuan Liu (Jia) is a filmmaker and 3D artist. Two years ago, she decided to quit her job and pursue film making in Los Angeles. Making this decision requires courage and sacrifice, but she holds deep belief in it.  Jia was born in a Guangzhou, China. As a child, she used drawings to create her own story and secret world. Her skilled drawing technique finally won her an opportunity working for director Wong Kar Wai. As an art assistant in The Grandmaster, she helped design several main movie scenes. In late 2012, a friend asked Jia direct a short documentary for Autistic teenagers in Beijing. After the screening, people reached out to offer help. This event helped Jia witness the power of media and story-telling.  Jia now is student at USC School of Cinematic Arts. Kintsugi is her final project at USC.

Ryan Michael Connolly - Producer

Ryan Michael Connolly is a writer and filmmaker who recently left behind a successful two-decade national security career to pursue the great passions of his life. He earned his bachelor’s degree in political science from the U.S. Naval Academy. He later earned an MA in National Security Affairs (East Asian Security Studies) from the Naval Postgraduate School and an MA in Linguistics from Georgetown University. He is an alumni fellow of Massachusetts Institute of Technology's Seminar XXI. Ryan served 15 years on active duty as a U.S. Marine Corps officer. The highlights of his career include working at the Pentagon on U.S.-Asia political- military affairs, service in China and Japan, and a combat tour in Iraq. He is fluent in Spanish and Mandarin Chinese. Ryan was selected as the first in-resident screenwriter at the Yefe Nof Residency (yefenof.com). He is currently a full-time graduate student in the Film and Television Production MFA Program, School of Cinematic Arts, University of Southern California. His areas of focus are writing, directing, and producing.

 

Rachel Boyajian - Producer

Rachel is a director, choreographer, animator and educator in Los Angeles, CA. Her work has been most notably presented at the National Taiwan University for Arts in Taipei(Taiwan), at PACT Zollverien(Germany), the Teatro Pier Paolo Pasolini Casarsa della Dilizia(Italy), the Teatro Comunale Polcenigo(Italy), the Salon Marbella Manzanillo(Mexico), REDCAT(Los Angeles), the Julia Morgan Theater(Berkeley) and the Orpheum Theater(Kansas). Rachel has created works for three American College Dance Festivals, the Wichita Contemporary Dance Theatre, the Kansas Dance Festival, the Wichita Children’s Festival, the Contemporary Music Festival, the DanceIS Festival, Diavolo Unplugged, the University of Arkansas at Little Rock, the Ruhrtriennale Festival in Germany, and the WCDT tour to Italy. Her choreography has won numerous awards at talent competitions including multiple acknowledgements for Best Choreography and Best in Show. She has taught dance at the California Institute of the Arts, the Los Angeles Ballet School, California State University of Los Angeles, AMDA Los Angeles, Wichita State University, Encore Dance Studios, Poetry in Motion, The Next Step, RenArts Academy and Diavolo Dance Theater. Rachel has her MFA in Choreography/Dance from the California Institute of the Arts, her BFA in Dance from Wichita State University and she is an alum of the USC School of Cinematic Arts MFA program in Film Production.

Xing-Mai Deng – Director of Photography

Xing-Mai Deng, also known as Mai, is an American-trained award-winning cinematographer originally from Beijing. He spent most of his childhood traveling between China and the U.S., consuming cinema from every screen he came across. Eventually, he turned those countless hours of viewing into a lifelong pursuit – making movies. As a storyteller since 2010, Xing-Mai thrives in contributing his unique talents and experience in a collaborative environment. For him, story always comes first. Crafting a specific look in service to the film's story and tone, his ultimate goal is to help realize the director's vision. He has extensive experience in capturing drama, comedy, thrillers, horror, and action; his body of work also includes vast applications of CG animation and visual effects. Based in Los Angeles and Beijing, Xing-Mai holds a Master of Fine Arts degree in Film & TV Production from the USC School of Cinematic Arts; and a Master Class Certificate from American Society of Cinematographers.

Meibei Liu - Editor

Originally from Shanghai, China, Meibei Liu received her Bachelor's Degree in Cinematic Arts from City University of Hong Kong School of Creative Media, as a First-Honor Graduate in 2014. In the same year, her short film Maze was selected and screened at the 38th Hong Kong International Film Festival. After being admitted to USC's School of Cinematic Arts to pursue an MFA degree in Film & Television Production, she began working as an editor on various documentaries, comedies and dramas. Some of the short films she edited went to several film festivals including the Hot Spring Documentary Film Festival and the Next Generation of Filmmakers (NGF) Film Festival.

 

Stephanie Hernandez – VFX Producer

My name is Stephanie Hernandez and I am a third-generation Mexican-American. I am the third daughter of four girls. Growing up in Los Angeles, movie making has always been a part of my life but I never thought for a second that I could make a career out of it. I began my college education at Mt. SAC Community College where I then transferred to UCLA to study Sociology and Film Studies. Since graduating in 2010, I have been working as an analyst at City National Bank for almost 6 years. Since beginning my graduate studies at USC, I have continued to work at the bank part-time. At the bank I analyze the activity of high net worth individuals and film production companies so in a way my work has come full circle with my passion. Entering graduate school, I had no idea what path that I wanted to pursue in the film industry. Now, a year and a half in, I have come to realize that my dreams lie in the field of Visual Effects. I have taken my love for VFX and my knowledge from working at a financial institution and combined the two. I enjoy working hand and hand with the Director and VFX Supervisor to bring the director’s vision to fruition. Working as a VFX Producer allows me to be there from the first version of storyboards to the last sequence delivery. I cannot wait to make movie magic in the years to come. My favorite CGI characters are: Gollum from Lord of the Rings, Davey Jones from Pirates of the Caribbean: Dead Man’s Chest

Yuan Wang - Production Design

Yuan Wang, born in China, is a current student in TV/Film Production MFA program at USC. Yuan is focusing on how to tell powerful stories and how to work efficiently and lead a team; especially on how to work across cultural and language barriers with talented collaborators of the different backgrounds the inevitable trend of the film industry of both America and China in the very near future. In the past 2 years at USC, Yuan worked as producer and production designer for five USC thesis films and produced series of short films both in US and China. Yuan is qualified as an ADOBE China Certified Designer in the digital video field and holds BA and MA degrees from Communication University of China. From January 2010 - January 2012, Yuan worked in SINA.COM, the biggest web portal in China, where she created a Web News program called Hollywood News Express, averaging 420,000 page hits per day.

Jyothi Kalyan Sura - VFX Supervisor

Jyothi Kalyan Sura is an engineer, an artist, and a leader. He hails from Hyderabad, a major city in South India. He enrolled in Computer Science Engineering for undergraduate studies at BITS Pilani, a premier technology institute in India, where ironically, he fell in love with the Arts. He served as the head of the Creative Arts Society. By the end of his senior year, he not only established himself as the best animator in the university but also achieved the rare distinction of being the first student-instructor by teaching a course on ‘Fundamentals of 3D Animation.’

His love for creative and technical storytelling led him to DreamWorks Animations India, where he worked as a Technical Director (TD) for three years on critically and commercially acclaimed films like How To Train Your Dragon 2, among others. He left DreamWorks Animations as the only TD to have an artistic demo-reel. Kalyan spent his spare time developing video games and writing fiction stories - most notably, a 300-page fiction thriller novel, inspired by events in India.

To pursue his love for writing and visual storytelling, Kalyan joined USC. Currently, he is a fifth-semester graduate student, with an emphasis on Writing, Directing and Visual Effects. Over the last two years, Kalyan wrote over 15 short films, 2 features and directed 5 films. He helped over 8 projects as a Visual Effects Supervisor, including three Advanced Production Films and a USC - James Franco feature. He is a Senior Tech at the SCA Help-Desk and the President of SCFX, the VFX community of SCA. Possessing a rare blend of technical and creative skills that he can juggle with sophisticated dexterity at will, Kalyan aims to work at the intersection of storytelling and technology. 

 

Juliet DeVette - Co-Writer

Juliet is a writer, director, and animator born in Taiwan and raised in Malaysia. She graduated from the University of Southern California in 2016 with a Bachelors in Film and TV Production, and recently completed her first crowd funded independent short film, Riptide. In 2014, she was accepted into the Salt Lake Film Society Screenwriters Year-long fellowship to develop her feature screenplay, Jennie's Brain, and in 2015, her short film script for Riptide was a semi-finalist in the Cinequest competition. She is currently in post-production for 2 short live action and animation based films, and is excited to be a part of the Kintsugi team!

His areas of focus are writing, directing, and producing. Rachel Boyajian - ProducerRachel is a director, choreographer, animator and educator in Los Angeles, CA. Her work has been most notably presented at the National Taiwan University for Arts in Taipei(Taiwan), at PACT Zollverien(Germany), the Teatro Pier Paolo Pasolini Casarsa della Dilizia(Italy), the Teatro Comunale Polcenigo(Italy), the Salon Marbella Manzanillo(Mexico), REDCAT(Los Angeles), the Julia Morgan Theater(Berkeley) and the Orpheum Theater(Kansas). Rachel has created works for three American College Dance Festivals, the Wichita Contemporary Dance Theatre, the Kansas Dance Festival, the Wichita Children’s Festival, the Contemporary Music Festival, the DanceIS Festival, Diavolo Unplugged, the University of Arkansas at Little Rock, the Ruhrtriennale Festival in Germany, and the WCDT tour to Italy. Her choreography has won numerous awards at talent competitions including multiple acknowledgements for Best Choreography and Best in Show. She has taught dance at the California Institute of the Arts, the Los Angeles Ballet School, California State University of Los Angeles, AMDA Los Angeles, Wichita State University, Encore Dance Studios, Poetry in Motion, The Next Step, RenArts Academy and Diavolo Dance Theater. Rachel has her MFA in Choreography/Dance from the California Institute of the Arts, her BFA in Dance from Wichita State University and she is an alum of the USC School of Cinematic Arts MFA program in Film Production.Xing-Mai Deng – Director of PhotographyXing-Mai Deng, also known as Mai, is an American-trained award-winning cinematographer originally from Beijing. He spent most of his childhood traveling between China and the U.S., consuming cinema from every screen he came across. Eventually, he turned those countless hours of viewing into a lifelong pursuit – making movies. As a storyteller since 2010, Xing-Mai thrives in contributing his unique talents and experience in a collaborative environment. For him, story always comes first. Crafting a specific look in service to the film's story and tone, his ultimate goal is to help realize the director's vision. He has extensive experience in capturing drama, comedy, thrillers, horror, and action; his body of work also includes vast applications of CG animation and visual effects. Based in Los Angeles and Beijing, Xing-Mai holds a Master of Fine Arts degree in Film & TV Production from the USC School of Cinematic Arts; and a Master Class Certificate from American Society of Cinematographers.Meibei Liu - EditorOriginally from Shanghai, China, Meibei Liu received her Bachelor's Degree in Cinematic Arts from City University of Hong Kong School of Creative Media, as a First-Honor Graduate in 2014. In the same year, her short film Maze was selected and screened at the 38th Hong Kong International Film Festival. After being admitted to USC's School of Cinematic Arts to pursue an MFA degree in Film & Television Production, she began working as an editor on various documentaries, comedies and dramas. Some of the short films she edited went to several film festivals including the Hot Spring Documentary Film Festival and the Next Generation of Filmmakers (NGF) Film Festival. Stephanie Hernandez – VFX ProducerMy name is Stephanie Hernandez and I am a third-generation Mexican-American. I am the third daughter of four girls. Growing up in Los Angeles, movie making has always been a part of my life but I never thought for a second that I could make a career out of it. I began my college education at Mt. SAC Community College where I then transferred to UCLA to study Sociology and Film Studies. Since graduating in 2010, I have been working as an analyst at City National Bank for almost 6 years. Since beginning my graduate studies at USC, I have continued to work at the bank part-time. At the bank I analyze the activity of high net worth individuals and film production companies so in a way my work has come full circle with my passion. Entering graduate school, I had no idea what path that I wanted to pursue in the film industry. Now, a year and a half in, I have come to realize that my dreams lie in the field of Visual Effects. I have taken my love for VFX and my knowledge from working at a financial institution and combined the two. I enjoy working hand and hand with the Director and VFX Supervisor to bring the director’s vision to fruition. Working as a VFX Producer allows me to be there from the first version of storyboards to the last sequence delivery. I cannot wait to make movie magic in the years to come. My favorite CGI characters are: Gollum from Lord of the Rings, Davey Jones from Pirates of the Caribbean: Dead Man’s ChestYuan Wang - Production DesignYuan Wang, born in China, is a current student in TV/Film Production MFA program at USC. Yuan is focusing on how to tell powerful stories and how to work efficiently and lead a team; especially on how to work across cultural and language barriers with talented collaborators of the different backgrounds the inevitable trend of the film industry of both America and China in the very near future. In the past 2 years at USC, Yuan worked as producer and production designer for five USC thesis films and produced series of short films both in US and China. Yuan is qualified as an ADOBE China Certified Designer in the digital video field and holds BA and MA degrees from Communication University of China. From January 2010 - January 2012, Yuan worked in SINA.COM, the biggest web portal in China, where she created a Web News program called Hollywood News Express, averaging 420,000 page hits per day.Jyothi Kalyan Sura - VFX SupervisorJyothi Kalyan Sura is an engineer, an artist, and a leader. He hails from Hyderabad, a major city in South India. He enrolled in Computer Science Engineering for undergraduate studies at BITS Pilani, a premier technology institute in India, where ironically, he fell in love with the Arts. He served as the head of the Creative Arts Society. By the end of his senior year, he not only established himself as the best animator in the university but also achieved the rare distinction of being the first student-instructor by teaching a course on ‘Fundamentals of 3D Animation.’His love for creative and technical storytelling led him to DreamWorks Animations India, where he worked as a Technical Director (TD) for three years on critically and commercially acclaimed films like How To Train Your Dragon 2, among others. He left DreamWorks Animations as the only TD to have an artistic demo-reel. Kalyan spent his spare time developing video games and writing fiction stories - most notably, a 300-page fiction thriller novel, inspired by events in India.To pursue his love for writing and visual storytelling, Kalyan joined USC. Currently, he is a fifth-semester graduate student, with an emphasis on Writing, Directing and Visual Effects. Over the last two years, Kalyan wrote over 15 short films, 2 features and directed 5 films. He helped over 8 projects as a Visual Effects Supervisor, including three Advanced Production Films and a USC - James Franco feature. He is a Senior Tech at the SCA Help-Desk and the President of SCFX, the VFX community of SCA. Possessing a rare blend of technical and creative skills that he can juggle with sophisticated dexterity at will, Kalyan aims to work at the intersection of storytelling and technology.  Juliet DeVette - Co-WriterJuliet is a writer, director, and animator born in Taiwan and raised in Malaysia. She graduated from the University of Southern California in 2016 with a Bachelors in Film and TV Production, and recently completed her first crowd funded independent short film, Riptide. In 2014, she was accepted into the Salt Lake Film Society Screenwriters Year-long fellowship to develop her feature screenplay, Jennie's Brain, and in 2015, her short film script for Riptide was a semi-finalist in the Cinequest competition. She is currently in post-production for 2 short live action and animation based films, and is excited to be a part of the Kintsugi team!

story:
Zee Monsta is Just Another Anti-Christ

Hello, I am Michelle Nessk of Gloomy Sunday Productions and host of the annual Crypticon Seattle showcase Horrors of the PNW. I am an independent filmmaker based out of the Pacific North West. 

Zee Monsta is a character I created as a child when I would horror host for my uncle and his friends when we'd watch scary movies. Zee has since evolved into a profession, where she makes appearances on Horrors of the PNW, as well as other shows including the official Bleedingham Horror Film Festival promotional shorts.

Thus far, all of Zee Monsta's shorts have won awards, and we've gotten to work with various incredible artists such as My Life With The Thrill Kill Kult aka TKK, Syztem7, Huh-Uh, among others.

Your contribution to this campaign will enable us to make the next segment in the series.

 

 

Our Goals are Perky

  • With most of the expenses covered, we are seeking $1,000 to finish funding for this project. This will cover costs for product to create the practical special effects, and feeding our crew during the duration of filming. Catering will be provided via; Foods by Hungry Guy.
  • We will be holding some special features for our perks, not excluding a chance to own one of the sfx props from the film. Real fake guts, in your hand! As well as an option to be murdered by Zee Monsta in a bumper featured in Horrors of the PNW for 2018.
  • If we don't hit our goal, the funds will still be utilized for the film's sfx, but it won't likely be as gory. If we go over our goal, we will take the gore as over the top as we possibly can.

We Want Your Participation

Indie horror films happen with the support of the horror community:

  • We want to gross you out with as much grotesque imagery as we can fit into six minutes without sacrificing narrative.
  • We always finish what we start.
  • Everyone involved is living their dream of creating a film to be proud of.

Risks & Challenges? There are none.

This film is happening even if we only hit zero funding. Your contribution will help us accomplish the imagery without compromise but, being indie filmmakers, we are flexible creatures.

  • We have completed award winning films on zero budget.
  • Our skills only improve with each new film.
  • Your contribution helps us bring a more elaborate sense of imagery to the screen.

It's okay if you cannot contribute financially

We know that not everyone can financially contribute, but that doesn't mean you're no longer special to us. We still love you, and we are always grateful for the support of link sharing.

story:
Let's Start a Cult

"Let's Start a Cult" is a dark comedy following The Cell Commune and its influence on the community as it grows. From its humble inception, stemming from adolescent ambition running amok in a dingy basement, all the way to the final moments, one should expect to be immersed in a world of provocation, debauchery, and of course...the Absurd! 

A word from the Director

With this film, I hope to develop my filmmaking skills all while making as many people laugh as possible. I also would hope this film inspires it's viewers, not to start a cult, but to pick up any camera they can get their hands on, get their friends together, make a movie, and have a great time doing it!

For a young filmmaker, I believe there is nothing more important than to actively and actually make movies and that's exactly what I'm trying to do. For the first half of 2017 I have been planning, writing, and filming for "Let's Start a Cult". I have great friends helping me with this project, some with tremendous amounts of experience and some with none, all creating together in the same space learning new things about the filmmaking process and working to make the best movie possible. The feeling of being on set and working with all of these amazing people is unmatched by anything I've experienced before, no matter how stressful or grueling a set may be at times, I find myself always coming back to it wanting to learn more and become better than I was before. 

Your support of this film means the world to me,

Much appreciated,

Wm. Spencer Tait

 

What We Need & What You Get

Of our funds raised, we plan to use:

  • 30% for Props/Wardrobe
  • 25% for Camera equipment
  • 25% for Lights
  • 10% for Location and transportation 
  • 10% for Post Production

Other ways to help

Aside from contributing to our Indiegogo campaign, the best and most direct way to help the cause is to spread the word. Share all over Facebook, Instagram, Youtube, and Twitter- Those sites all will also include exclusive LSaC content!

This can not happen without your help, we all appreciate your efforts and thank you for your time!

story:
Doing what you love and loving what you do...

Are you doing what you love? Or loving what you do? Or are you in at a place where neither statement is true? I'm going to be 53 years old in December and I'm looking to finally do both. I have a full-time job. It's great with a great company, but my passion is filmmaking. For the better part of the past 5 years, I've been engaged in visual storytelling. It didn't come in the sense of an education or career goal but more so as an avenue that I could release these ideas from my mind to those around me. Filmmaking in essence was the pressure valve that if opened, would allow a flow of ideas to stream freely which in return cleared space to form new creations. You can go to my YouTube channel and see all that I've been a part of. These videos were the building blocks of my craft that have elevated me to the point that I am at today. Still a grasshopper, but nonetheless, a predator looking for his next delicious meal - AND THIS IS IT!

 

Concept Trailer

"Will work for IMDb Credits." - Starving Artist

Five years ago, I decided to take my writing skills, ideas, and stories to the screen! Boy, I didn't know what I was getting into at the time. With a handful of close friends, we started making content. With each video that we made, we gained a vast amount of knowledge which we applied to each project that was to come next. Learning and growing, we continued to march forward falling in love with the craft of visual storytelling. One of our biggest accomplishments was giving people a chance to be in front and behind the camera. Bringing the community together, we gave those hungry to be part of something a chance. Everyone donated their sweat, time, and effort. They did get fed and IMDB credits, but no money. Now, we come to this project. 

Artists are always expected to do what they do for free. Hey, it's art, and you love it. Of course you will do it for free. I want to change that. I want to be able to give back to the community. Pay the actors, crew, editors, composer, locations, and everything that goes into making a film. 

Your contribution will not only help me bring my first feature film to life, but also give back to those artists. You can help all those involved in this project make a part of their dream come true. For me, I really want to be able to continue to make films, give back to the community, make a living full time (someday), and tell important stories. Hollywood has some great movies, actors, directors, and crew out there but Hollywood has also made it hard for that little person to get into the industry. I've never asked anyone to help me fund my film projects. My credit card balance can prove that. HAHAHAHA. I hope you will take the time to invest in this project. Just think for $3 you can say you helped dozens of people make their dreams become a reality. Thank you for taking the time to read this. 

Welcome to Mister Academy

There's this guy named Jack, an almost famous musician, who winds up losing his band, his job, and his wife. Enrolling in a school to learn how to get his woman back, he discovers the seductive powers of manscaping at Mister Academy. 

"Boys, you are here to become men. I won't succeed with all of you. It's not going to be easy. Some of you, are going to lose your family jewels, permanently. The next six weeks are going to test every fiber of your body. You may go insane, BUT, remember why you joined."

Filled with clever innuendos and satire that rings true to modern relationships, Mister Academy embarks on a hilarious yet honest exploration of dating that features a line of ambitious characters determined to swoon a love interest.

 

 "I

 WON'T

 SUCCEED

 WITH

 ALL 

 OF 

 YOU."

 

During the six week program led by the Sorrentino's, a group of brothers with questionable intentions, Jack along with the others who attend the program are tasked with getting as many dates as possible to beat their rivals... The Lady's Place. 

"Who wants to give a man what he thinks he wants?"

Tough. Courageous. COUGH. Manipulators. Or just plain smart? At the women's program we follow Gina, an ambitious and curious woman who's not necessarily sure what she's after. As the opposing forces fight to come out on top... we see that dating is just a game of chess. Or is it?

Dean Ferreira

Writer/Director/Producer

Independent film director, Dean Ferreira, began his career as a stage actor, where his love of acting and the arts was born.  While his other passion was always writing, it was limited to non-published stories until a few years ago, where his passion of writing took center stage.  Dean wrote and directed his first short film, At Your Command, and was immediately hooked.  His writing and directing credits also include, Geek Away, Excalibur Enhancements, Ghost Hunting: Into the Woods and the web series, IguanaMan.  Off The Beaten Path is Dean’s first non-writing directorial short film. In additional to his short films, Dean produced, directed and edited 40 plus videos as part of his weekly series, Third Mind Thursday.

Check out www.youtube.com/thirdmindfilms to see them all. 

 

Silas James Rowland

Director of Photography/Producer

With nearly a hundred different projects under his belt from documentaries such as It’s Just Me and Madworld: Behind the Mask to shorts such as The Z Line and era-piece Dudeman, his range of experience with a variety of genre’s and methods of storytelling have tested his abilities in nearly every aspect. Recently completing his first feature length directorial debut, The Sinful South, Silas also wrote and starred in the film which premiered on his 21st birthday at Camelot Cinemas. Other works include Editor on feature length comedy The Rush Chairman and Producer/Actor in feature length indie thriller Deprivation.

In Front of The Camera

Aaron Brakefield as Jack

Lead

Aaron Brakefield is hyped to be joining Third Mind Films for the filming of Mister Academy! As an actor, director, and musician, his career of stage, musical, and screen performances span nearly 25 years, with time spent in Hollywood and numerous theatres across the country. Aaron holds a BA in Music (Concord University), an MFA in Acting (UNCG), and is an active member of Actor's Equity Association. He currently resides in Greenville, SC, comfortably nestled between Atlanta and Charlotte, with his wife, Miranda and their nine month old, Wilkes. 

 

Lauren Paige Wilson as Gina

Lead

Lauren is stoked to play Gina in Mister Academy after playing the title role in The Wrong Girl.
She has her BA in Theatre Performance from the College of Charleston, and has been acting
professionally for 11 years. She is a teaching artist at the South Carolina Children’s Theatre
where she teaches classes, performs in shows, does the tours, and teaches residencies. Other film credits include: Excalibur Enhancements, IguanaMan, Geek Away, The Wrong Girl, Curtain Call, and Bound.

 

Merritt Vann as Bruno Sorrentino

Supporting

Merritt Vann is making his mark as a gifted & functional entertainer in all facets of the acting world...film, television & theater. He's held principal roles in numerous films and television series. He was the caring father Kurt Longston in Test and the CEO in Housekeeping, both independent films. He brought to life Emmett Tanner in the featured film Curtain Call as a country music star on top of the world forced to deal with a real-life nightmare. He recently had starring roles in Homicide Hunter and Sid Roth's It's Supernatural cable TV series. While appearing in the TV series Revolution, Merritt gained live weapons experience on set. On stage, Merritt has performed in numerous theatre productions. However, he is most proud of his lead role as Harlan Corbett in the world premier of Last Stop Chapin and his portrayal of Clay Spencer in the Christmas Classic The Homecoming.

 

Jasmine 'Jizzy' Wallace as Maya

Supporting

Jasmine Jizzy Wallace is an up and coming actor from South Carolina with over 11 years of experience in various disciplines such as modeling, acting, make-up, education, sales, public relations, and marketing. After exploring an array of career opportunities, Jizzy decided to pursue her dreams. In 2015 she resigned from 2 of her 3 jobs to seriously pursue her acting career. Jizzy is a Lander University Alumni. In 2011, she earned a B.S. in Mass Commun. and Theatre. In her free time, she thoroughly enjoys dancing, karaoke, and talking!

 

 

 

Behind The Camera

Neil Lee Griffin

Composer

Born and raised in Upstate SC, growing up with a stutter wasn't easy. From the teasing in school to struggling to say my own name. As a child I was always fond of music, growing up with a piano and guitar near by, it was never out of reach. In my mid teens I decided that music was something I wanted to learn more about, so I set out to take piano lessons, and did so for a few years. Using the knowledge I gained from piano lessons I taught myself to play guitar. I have always loved movie scores and theme songs from TV, the way you can set up a scenario or convey an emotion in a story without saying a word really resonated with me. Wanting to do more with my music I started incorporating more score and storytelling elements in my writing. 

See works here: https://www.antlerhillarts.com/composing

So... Here's what we need and here's what you'll get. 

The reality is we really need $50,000 to be comfortable in paying everyone on set. I didn't list that because I felt that was asking a lot of people. With $25,000 we can pay people but at a much smaller rate. That's still great - and allows us to achieve a goal of rewarding those who are putting in the time and effort for our common vision of Mister Academy. We set the $15,000 goal as the minimum to get this film done. With that we will be able to feed, pay, and purchase necessary items to increase our production value (set design, props, wardrobe, etc.) If we are to exceed our goal the funds will go toward post-production and marketing which plays an even bigger factor in ensuring this film gets the right distribution.

We've got some really cool perks too! The $3 perk gets you a condom. Why? Well, if you watch the trailer, you will know. It's got "The Lady's Place" written on it which is a school for women in the film. I think one of the coolest perks is having a character named after you. That's cool. Oh and there's t-shirts, hats, posters, copies of the film. Tickets to the premier and other really cool perks. 

 

I really like the perk that gets your photo in the film credits. So, not only does your name appear in the credits but your face does too!

Now, what happens if we don't hit our target? Well, it's simple.

We will make this film, even if we don't hit our target. It may take longer and it will be done on weekends over the course of a few months. The biggest problem with this is losing momentum and energy. I will have to find people that are willing to work for food, IMDb credits, and fun. 

This story must be told. We are at a time in our society where everyone needs to have a reason to laugh more. 

There are too many people out there that need my help. And yours. They need an outlet for their creative gifts. There aren't a lot of people in Greenville, SC that provide that opportunity. I have several local indie filmmakers that do the same thing. We all help each other out. We give our time and effort in exchange for the same on each other's projects. 

Money is tight. So many people recently lost everything from Hurricane Harvey and Irma. I have friends and family that lost EVERYTHING. They have nothing left. So, I understand, if you can't contribute to my campaign - It's OK. It really is. If you can't, please share my campaign with your friends and family. Spread the word. If 5,000 people give $3 we will hit our goal. I know that sounds like a lot but I bet if you added up all the friends your friend have on Facebook and other social media sites it easily 100,000 connections. 

Thank you for taking the time to read this campaign. I hope I get to see your name in the credits! Like and share away!

 OF 
 YOU."
 
During the six week program led by the Sorrentino's, a group of brothers with questionable intentions, Jack along with the others who attend the program are tasked with getting as many dates as possible to beat their rivals... The Lady's Place. 
"Who wants to give a man what he thinks he wants?"
Tough. Courageous. COUGH. Manipulators. Or just plain smart? At the women's program we follow Gina, an ambitious and curious woman who's not necessarily sure what she's after. As the opposing forces fight to come out on top... we see that dating is just a game of chess. Or is it?


Dean Ferreira
Writer/Director/Producer
Independent film director, Dean Ferreira, began his career as a stage actor, where his love of acting and the arts was born.  While his other passion was always writing, it was limited to non-published stories until a few years ago, where his passion of writing took center stage.  Dean wrote and directed his first short film, At Your Command, and was immediately hooked.  His writing and directing credits also include, Geek Away, Excalibur Enhancements, Ghost Hunting: Into the Woods and the web series, IguanaMan.  Off The Beaten Path is Dean’s first non-writing directorial short film. In additional to his short films, Dean produced, directed and edited 40 plus videos as part of his weekly series, Third Mind Thursday.
Check out www.youtube.com/thirdmindfilms to see them all. 
 

Silas James Rowland
Director of Photography/Producer
With nearly a hundred different projects under his belt from documentaries such as It’s Just Me and Madworld: Behind the Mask to shorts such as The Z Line and era-piece Dudeman, his range of experience with a variety of genre’s and methods of storytelling have tested his abilities in nearly every aspect. Recently completing his first feature length directorial debut, The Sinful South, Silas also wrote and starred in the film which premiered on his 21st birthday at Camelot Cinemas. Other works include Editor on feature length comedy The Rush Chairman and Producer/Actor in feature length indie thriller Deprivation.

In Front of The Camera

Aaron Brakefield as Jack
Lead
Aaron Brakefield is hyped to be joining Third Mind Films for the filming of Mister Academy! As an actor, director, and musician, his career of stage, musical, and screen performances span nearly 25 years, with time spent in Hollywood and numerous theatres across the country. Aaron holds a BA in Music (Concord University), an MFA in Acting (UNCG), and is an active member of Actor's Equity Association. He currently resides in Greenville, SC, comfortably nestled between Atlanta and Charlotte, with his wife, Miranda and their nine month old, Wilkes. 
 

Lauren Paige Wilson as Gina
Lead
Lauren is stoked to play Gina in Mister Academy after playing the title role in The Wrong Girl.She has her BA in Theatre Performance from the College of Charleston, and has been actingprofessionally for 11 years. She is a teaching artist at the South Carolina Children’s Theatrewhere she teaches classes, performs in shows, does the tours, and teaches residencies. Other film credits include: Excalibur Enhancements, IguanaMan, Geek Away, The Wrong Girl, Curtain Call, and Bound.
 

Merritt Vann as Bruno Sorrentino
Supporting
Merritt Vann is making his mark as a gifted & functional entertainer in all facets of the acting world...film, television & theater. He's held principal roles in numerous films and television series. He was the caring father Kurt Longston in Test and the CEO in Housekeeping, both independent films. He brought to life Emmett Tanner in the featured film Curtain Call as a country music star on top of the world forced to deal with a real-life nightmare. He recently had starring roles in Homicide Hunter and Sid Roth's It's Supernatural cable TV series. While appearing in the TV series Revolution, Merritt gained live weapons experience on set. On stage, Merritt has performed in numerous theatre productions. However, he is most proud of his lead role as Harlan Corbett in the world premier of Last Stop Chapin and his portrayal of Clay Spencer in the Christmas Classic The Homecoming.
 

Jasmine 'Jizzy' Wallace as Maya
Supporting
Jasmine Jizzy Wallace is an up and coming actor from South Carolina with over 11 years of experience in various disciplines such as modeling, acting, make-up, education, sales, public relations, and marketing. After exploring an array of career opportunities, Jizzy decided to pursue her dreams. In 2015 she resigned from 2 of her 3 jobs to seriously pursue her acting career. Jizzy is a Lander University Alumni. In 2011, she earned a B.S. in Mass Commun. and Theatre. In her free time, she thoroughly enjoys dancing, karaoke, and talking!
 





 
 
Behind The Camera

Neil Lee Griffin
Composer
Born and raised in Upstate SC, growing up with a stutter wasn't easy. From the teasing in school to struggling to say my own name. As a child I was always fond of music, growing up with a piano and guitar near by, it was never out of reach. In my mid teens I decided that music was something I wanted to learn more about, so I set out to take piano lessons, and did so for a few years. Using the knowledge I gained from piano lessons I taught myself to play guitar. I have always loved movie scores and theme songs from TV, the way you can set up a scenario or convey an emotion in a story without saying a word really resonated with me. Wanting to do more with my music I started incorporating more score and storytelling elements in my writing. 
See works here: https://www.antlerhillarts.com/composing

So... Here's what we need and here's what you'll get. 

The reality is we really need $50,000 to be comfortable in paying everyone on set. I didn't list that because I felt that was asking a lot of people. With $25,000 we can pay people but at a much smaller rate. That's still great - and allows us to achieve a goal of rewarding those who are putting in the time and effort for our common vision of Mister Academy. We set the $15,000 goal as the minimum to get this film done. With that we will be able to feed, pay, and purchase necessary items to increase our production value (set design, props, wardrobe, etc.) If we are to exceed our goal the funds will go toward post-production and marketing which plays an even bigger factor in ensuring this film gets the right distribution.
We've got some really cool perks too! The $3 perk gets you a condom. Why? Well, if you watch the trailer, you will know. It's got "The Lady's Place" written on it which is a school for women in the film. I think one of the coolest perks is having a character named after you. That's cool. Oh and there's t-shirts, hats, posters, copies of the film. Tickets to the premier and other really cool perks. 
  
I really like the perk that gets your photo in the film credits. So, not only does your name appear in the credits but your face does too!
Now, what happens if we don't hit our target? Well, it's simple.
We will make this film, even if we don't hit our target. It may take longer and it will be done on weekends over the course of a few months. The biggest problem with this is losing momentum and energy. I will have to find people that are willing to work for food, IMDb credits, and fun. 
This story must be told. We are at a time in our society where everyone needs to have a reason to laugh more. 
There are too many people out there that need my help. And yours. They need an outlet for their creative gifts. There aren't a lot of people in Greenville, SC that provide that opportunity. I have several local indie filmmakers that do the same thing. We all help each other out. We give our time and effort in exchange for the same on each other's projects. 
Money is tight. So many people recently lost everything from Hurricane Harvey and Irma. I have friends and family that lost EVERYTHING. They have nothing left. So, I understand, if you can't contribute to my campaign - It's OK. It really is. If you can't, please share my campaign with your friends and family. Spread the word. If 5,000 people give $3 we will hit our goal. I know that sounds like a lot but I bet if you added up all the friends your friend have on Facebook and other social media sites it easily 100,000 connections. 
Thank you for taking the time to read this campaign. I hope I get to see your name in the credits! Like and share away!

story:
"I trust that England will not forget one who nursed her sick, who sought out her wounded to aid and succour them, and who performed the last offices for some of her illustrious dead."  Sir William Howard Russell, TheTimes newspaper war reporter, on Mary Seacole in 1857.

Hi, I'm Moses Ssebandeke I have worked as a writer and director for the past 6 years. I have directed short films that have been shown on British National television and screened in film festivals in Hollywood. I have extensive experience making short films for the BBC. In 2013 I trained at the BBC Academy . After that I got to work with BBC radio comedy. I shot and edited the promotional video for the 2014 BBC new-comedy award. This was then shown to the BBC trust as an example of what the BBC needs to do more of.  I worked as a visualisation assistant producer at BBC RADIO 1 AND 1XTRA.  I  wrote the treatment, directed and edited an interactive music video with number 1 MOBO award winning artist Stormzy. I was on a contract at BBC children. Where I produced, edited and directed content for the CBBC and Cbeebies Youtube and Iplayer page I Directed the CBBC Halloween video and directed a segment within the Annual CBBC Christmas song. Working on those projects has given me the skills to bring a high-quality short film to the screen.

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

 

  • The money you pledge to our cause will be spent in key area's of the film, like: 

    Location Hire (very important) 

    Costumes 

    Cast wages 

    Travel costs

    Transportation Hire

    Props 

    Make-up 

        Post production costs 

With your involvement in the film, we will be able to create something very important and forward thinking. For that, We have arranged top notch perks for you.

Here is a video that shows you the general feel of the film. Plus it features a monologue from the film!

 

 

Thank you for taking time out to look over my campaign. I understand that in the current climate not everyone can contribute fincially but I hope you can help by spreading the word. Someone on your social media might be able to help this film be made!
