story:
Story

Behind Blue Eyes is a short dark fantasy film following a little girl named Gabrielle. Gabrielle wakes up in a barren and ghostly forest, unlike any forest on earth. 

   Upon waking she finds herself being hunted by a faceless ghoul known as the Gaunt. Quick to action, Gabrielle runs away and seeks refuge in an abandoned greenhouse. There she meets a monstrous-looking man named Gisher. 

   He tells her that her only hope of escaping this land is by completing three tasks. He warns her that the tasks are dangerous and she will likely fail. Gabrielle decides to take on Gisher’s challenge and the two embark on a perilous quest.

  Behind Blue Eyes is a film that deals with themes of self-discovery and finding the truth in the darkness, even if it is a frightening one. We are making a film that will both entertain and test the audience.

The Cast

Kyra Johnson as Gabrielle

 

 

  Kyra is 9-years-old and lives in Central Florida. She has been acting, singing, and dancing for family and friends since she could walk!
   Kyra's on-camera work includes two short films (including the lead role in the horror short "The Man in the Mask"), a commercial, and a children's web series.   In addition to on-camera work, she has been in numerous theater performances over the last three years; her current role as Belle in "Beauty and the Beast".​

  As part of the Magic Curtain Productions performance troupe, she received special recognition as Timon in the troupe's award-winning performance of "Lion King - The Musical" at the 2017 Disney National Performing Arts Festival, where she also received a superior rating for her solo vocal performance.

   Kyra is addicted to the ABC show "Once Upon a Time." She went to the 2017 official convention in Vancouver, where she met many of the stars, toured the sets, and loved spending time with her fellow Oncers!

David McMahon as Gisher

 

 

Two-time Florida Rising Star recipient and 2016 Tampa Bay Actor of the Year, David McMahon has acted in over 50 short films and several features, including a gripping, 0.7-second scene bolting from falling sharks in “Sharknado 3: Oh Hell No!” Perhaps best known for his Funny or Die musical short, “Gynecologist: The Musical", David shares an equal passion for both comedy and drama, and has been recognized and awarded for his work in both genres. 

   David is currently filming the feature-length dramas, “Misty Blue Lane” and “NS404: Provenance.” Horror fans will soon see him as Father Powell alongside scream-queen Jessica Cameron in “The Song of Solomon.” 

  When not filming, David works full-time as an advertising writer and resides in St. Augustine, FL with his film-widow wife, Betsy, and “fur kids” Max and Rufus.

Designing a Dark Fantasy World

  Creating a unique world that is both frightening yet mesmerizing is difficult. But it's all for the right reasons. We took inspiration from author H.P. Lovecraft and from visionary director Guillermo Del Toro to create this beautiful nightmare. 

   Our biggest challenge was creating the world that not only looks corrupted and surreal but that it shows that it used to be a place of great beauty and splendor. 

   We want to be able to tell a story with everything that you see, whether it is the character, creatures, props or set design. 

   Our biggest inspiration was Guillermo Del Toro's Pan's Labyrinth, we wanted to create something that looks strange, scary, dark yet beautiful. 

  Concept artist Tomislav Jagnjic not only understood this concept but he also put his own unique twist to it.

Initial Concept Art

Perspective of Corrupted Land

Initial Concept Designs for Gisher's House

Concept Design of Gisher's House

Creation and Designs of Creatures

  This is probably the most challenging part of the film. Creating unique creatures. The filmmakers were determined to not only create them from the ground up but for the creatures to be able to have a story of their own. 

   When the Gaunts first appear, we want the audience to feel their omnipotent presence versus Gisher who elicits a reaction of horrifying fear of disgust. We want everyone to remember these characters and appreciate not only the way they look but their overall characterizations as well. These are characters that have lived in this hellish landscape for years and are but a shell of what they once were. 

   Fortunately, we had two of the most talented concept artists working today: Tomislav Jagnjić and Srdjan Pavlovic. They both worked long hours with the director and writer to make sure we achieve the perfect designs for each creature. 

  They both faced the challenge of not only making unique creatures but also the challenge designing the creatures to be made practically through special effects make-up. 

 

Gisher

  "Very interesting and complex character to design - outside, Gisher is a horribly disfigured monster, inside he is still a human - capturing that was the main challenge" - Srdjan Pavlovic 

   We all know at least one iconic character from a movie. Whether it is the Xenomorph from Alien, Freddy Kruger, Jason, ET, The Faun, Darth Vader, The Joker, etc. They all have a unique set of traits, we find ourselves getting attached to them and sometimes even rooting for them. 

   That's our goal for one of our main characters: Gisher.

   We want people to create an unusual relationship with him, to remember him, and to connect with him. You might love him or you might hate him but you will definitely remember him.

   Everything that he is, has been thought about: the way he moves, the way he speaks, what he likes to eat, his facial expressions, his interactions with Gabrielle, his former life... Everything has been thought of.

   Kyle Vest, our make-up artist, has estimated that it will take an approximate time of 4 hours to put the make-up on David. (Surprisingly, David is very excited about that). 

First Concepts of Gisher by Srdjan Pavlovic

3D model for Gisher by Srdjan Pavlovic

 

The Weeping Tree

   Before the corruption, The Weeping Tree used to be a place of worship and purity. 

   Every living thing would come and celebrate life. They would harvest its magical sap that would grant immortality.

   Now, coming to this place is asking for death. As the land began to corrupt, The Weeping Tree did as well, thus transforming its worshipers into malevolent creatures called Gaunts.

The Weeping Tree by Srdjan Pavlovic


The Weeping Tree -  more detailed renders by Srdjan Pavlovic

 

Mud Monster

Weeping Tree's protector and loyal minion and servant, creature of tremendous strength called Mud Monster.  
 

Mud Monster - concept render by Srdjan Pavlovic

Mud Monster - medium shot


profile shot

The Gaunts

  The Gaunts are creatures that roam throughout the land. They spend their time looking for something to devour, and they will do anything to get their prey. Their faceless bodies will hunt their prey until they lose their sanity.

   Inspired by the nightmarish creatures called Nightgaunts, created by the one and only H.P. Lovecraft, concept artist Tomislav took a very unique yet faithful approach on The Gaunts and came up with an original look and style.

   There are four Gaunts in total which our characters will face. In this story, the approach we took with them was more of a mythical one.

   Like as mentioned above, we wanted to show the difference between a monster and a creature. All four Gaunts have their own unique personality. 

  Each of the Gaunts has its own unique method of hunting its prey, and they can taste their victim's deepest emotions. 

   Initially, there was only going to be one Gaunt but as we started developing the story and going through concepts, the director came up with background stories for each one of them. Their names are Wrath, Pestilence, Death, and Agony. 

  All of them will be created using special make-up effects. 

Wrath

Wrath will devour you the moment it sees you. 
Favorite Flavor: Piquant Lust

Pestilence

Pestilence follows you and hides within the shadows until he is ready to strike from the shadows.
Favorite Flavor: Pungent Cowardice

Death

Everything withers when Death is near. Death is the truth that everyone tries to escape from.  
Favorite Flavor: Bitter Melancholy.     

Agony

Agony feasts on the victims suffering. There is no escape from it. Favorite Flavor: Tender Innocence. 

 

The Crew

The Director

   Ismael J Orozco is driven by his ambition, love of storytelling and passion for filmmaking. His goal for every film is to be able to teleport the audience into the world he has created.

   From an early age, he has been drawn to the genre of dark fantasy, drama, horror, and sci-fi. His father was a huge Star Wars fan which only helped fuel his passion. Because of his father, Ismael found his passion for film. He saw films as a way to escape reality, which is the same way he feels when he makes a film. 

   Ismael is constantly collaborating with everyone in the productions, especially in the art department, character design and world building are what he loves the most about the process of filmmaking. 

   Ismael comes from an acting background benefiting him when directing actors.

   He also went to Full Sail University and graduated with a Bachelors in Film. 

   Behind Blue Eyes is not only an opportunity to make a unique film but to make a film that he is very passionate about. His biggest influences are Guillermo Del Toro, HP Lovecraft, David Fincher, Ridley Scott, John Carpenter, and Frank Herbert.

The Writers

  Antoni Reina Coppola is a half Italian, half Venezuelan filmmaker and writer who loves to tell stories, giving hugs, and long walks inside someone's psyche. 

  He has directed, written, and produced over a dozen short films that have played at several film festivals across the globe, and is an alumnus of the University of Tampa's Film + Media Art School and the New York Film Academy.

   Ever since an early age, Antoni was drawn to the works of Lovecraft, Poe, Doré, Lynch, Goya, Quiroga, Del Toro, and how they were able to find the beauty in the dark, surreal and macabre aspects of life itself. This same feeling is what Antoni wishes to accomplish with this project. 

   Francis Ford Coppola is The Godfather of Antoni (not really, but that would've been nice).

  Joshua Bachmann is a promising screenwriter from Orlando, Florida. He is currently studying English at Arizona State University and has already written two screenplays that have been made into short films. 

   His forté is in writing emotionally evocative stories with a bit of a supernatural flare. Which makes Behind Blue Eyes a perfect fit for him. 

   He has worked very closely with the director of this project to write a story that is sure to entertain as well as provoke thought.

Director of Photography

   Roberto Hernandez is a cinematographer from Orlando, Florida. At an early age, he discovered the art of filmmaking and started making his own films.

   After graduating high school, he moved from his small hometown in New England to Orlando, Florida to study film at Full Sail University. 

   As a cinematographer, Roberto aims to tell a story in every image. His love for storytelling is what led him to Behind Blue Eyes.

Production Designer

   Christopher "Alex" Reynoso is an aspiring filmmaker from the small town of Grand Saline, Texas. 

   He is an active concert photographer and started recording videos and making short clips when he was in high school. 

   He attended Full Sail University where he attained a BS in Film. His specialty in film is: art direction and set design. 

Special Make Up FX/Make Up Artist

  Kyle Vest started in 1997 in the Haunted House Industry, immersing you in his design over the years, Kyle was discovered by TV Network, “Game Show Network", performed in “Skin Wars” also, which is now featured on Netflix.  

   Kyle was on Season 2 of the competitive body painting show, where he won the “Horror Challenge” and was seen in the final episode. He also won many others including “Ms. Scary Midwest” in 2015, “Monster Make-Up Wars", and “FABRIC” 2015. 

   Kyle wanted to grow in the Industry and gain experiences with bigger projects. He currently works at Universal Studios Resorts Orlando, Florida and has worked on Halloween Horror Nights as an airbrush makeup artist and actor.

   He has played iconic roles such as “Pyramid Head” (Silent Hill). Kyle has built a reputation at Universal as one of the most talented artists.

   Kyle is also known for costume design and has worked a semester for A-List Artists such as Taylor Swift, Sarah Brightman, Katy Perry, Justin Timberlake, Miley Cyrus, and Justin Bieber. 

   Kyle Vest is currently teaching at Vixen Studio as an aerial instructor. He is known as a haunt leader as he teaches every angle of haunted attractions, scenic design, makeup, costuming, and managing.

 

Editor

   Katelyn Wright decided to pursue editing and filmmaking when she was finishing high school. She did a two-year media internship with A291. 

   Through this internship not only did she harnessed skills in videography, photography and post production, but also learned more about who she is as an editor and a content maker. 

   She likes to take on new challenges with each project allowing her to push her creative skills. She has worked in commercials, television, promotions and short films as well.

VFX

   Joseph Adams is a VFX artist that has been working in the Los Angeles area for about 2 years. 

   His passion to excel and produce quality content has been one of his many recognizable traits since the startup of his career in 2015. 

   Joseph has also worked on popular shows that you might know, including but not limited to: The Gifted (Fox), Westworld (HBO), Stranger Things (Netflix), CSI (CBS), Gotham (Fox), Agents of Shield (Fox), Lucifer (Fox), Lethal Weapon (Fox), Pirates of the Caribbean: Dead Men Tell no Tales.

Jason Zimmerman - Unit Production Manager

Benjamin Dessecker - Production Coordinator

Olivia Wukasch - Script Supervisor

Carissa Scott Duzansky - 1st Assistant Director

Srdjan Pavlovic - Gisher's, Mud Monster and The Weeping Tree Concept Artist

Tomislav Jagnjić - Land and Gaunts Concept Artist

Where are the Funds Going?

Behind Blue Eyes Budget Breakdown

In order to bring this beautifully dark world to life, we want to rely heavily on practical effects. As you can see, the majority of the budget will be devoted to making those effects the best they can be. Please, be a part of  creating an existience that has never been experienced before. 

 

 

Risks & Challenges

Creating a unique world that is both frightening yet mesmerizing is difficult. But it's all for the right reasons. We took inspiration from author H.P. Lovecraft and from visionary director Guillermo Del Toro to create this beautiful nightmare. 

   Our biggest challenge was creating the world that not only looks corrupted and surreal but that it shows that it used to be a place of great beauty and splendor. 

  We want to be able to tell a story with everything that you see, whether it is the character, creatures, props or set design. 

   Our biggest inspiration was Guillermo Del Toro's Pan's Labyrinth, we wanted to create something that looks strange, scary, dark yet beautiful. 

  Concept artist Tomislav not only understood this concept but he also put his own unique twist to it. 

The entire film is a huge challenge for the entire team. We set the bar high for us already but we want to set it even higher. We want to captivate the audience and make them wonder.

Practical Effects can be difficult and expensive. They take a long time to put on and to take off.

We are shooting on location and that means we have to keep on a look out for the weather.

We have an intense scene on location that requires us to build and it needs to be shot in time.

The film overall is a huge challenge for everyone involved. Actors have to go through a lot of makeup and a dark emotional journey.

Luckily we are planning for any sort of emergency and backup plans for everything and anything.

We will ship around the world but shipping will only be included for domestic. International shipping will have to be covered separately. We do this so it won't affect the donation.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

She went to the 2017 official convention in Vancouver, where she met many of the stars, toured the sets, and loved spending time with her fellow Oncers!David McMahon as Gisher  Two-time Florida Rising Star recipient and 2016 Tampa Bay Actor of the Year, David McMahon has acted in over 50 short films and several features, including a gripping, 0.7-second scene bolting from falling sharks in “Sharknado 3: Oh Hell No!” Perhaps best known for his Funny or Die musical short, “Gynecologist: The Musical", David shares an equal passion for both comedy and drama, and has been recognized and awarded for his work in both genres.    David is currently filming the feature-length dramas, “Misty Blue Lane” and “NS404: Provenance.” Horror fans will soon see him as Father Powell alongside scream-queen Jessica Cameron in “The Song of Solomon.”   When not filming, David works full-time as an advertising writer and resides in St. Augustine, FL with his film-widow wife, Betsy, and “fur kids” Max and Rufus.Designing a Dark Fantasy World  Creating a unique world that is both frightening yet mesmerizing is difficult. But it's all for the right reasons. We took inspiration from author H.P. Lovecraft and from visionary director Guillermo Del Toro to create this beautiful nightmare.    Our biggest challenge was creating the world that not only looks corrupted and surreal but that it shows that it used to be a place of great beauty and splendor.    We want to be able to tell a story with everything that you see, whether it is the character, creatures, props or set design.    Our biggest inspiration was Guillermo Del Toro's Pan's Labyrinth, we wanted to create something that looks strange, scary, dark yet beautiful.   Concept artist Tomislav Jagnjic not only understood this concept but he also put his own unique twist to it.Initial Concept ArtPerspective of Corrupted LandInitial Concept Designs for Gisher's HouseConcept Design of Gisher's HouseCreation and Designs of Creatures  This is probably the most challenging part of the film. Creating unique creatures. The filmmakers were determined to not only create them from the ground up but for the creatures to be able to have a story of their own.    When the Gaunts first appear, we want the audience to feel their omnipotent presence versus Gisher who elicits a reaction of horrifying fear of disgust. We want everyone to remember these characters and appreciate not only the way they look but their overall characterizations as well. These are characters that have lived in this hellish landscape for years and are but a shell of what they once were.    Fortunately, we had two of the most talented concept artists working today: Tomislav Jagnjić and Srdjan Pavlovic. They both worked long hours with the director and writer to make sure we achieve the perfect designs for each creature.   They both faced the challenge of not only making unique creatures but also the challenge designing the creatures to be made practically through special effects make-up.  Gisher  "Very interesting and complex character to design - outside, Gisher is a horribly disfigured monster, inside he is still a human - capturing that was the main challenge" - Srdjan Pavlovic    We all know at least one iconic character from a movie. Whether it is the Xenomorph from Alien, Freddy Kruger, Jason, ET, The Faun, Darth Vader, The Joker, etc. They all have a unique set of traits, we find ourselves getting attached to them and sometimes even rooting for them.    That's our goal for one of our main characters: Gisher.   We want people to create an unusual relationship with him, to remember him, and to connect with him. You might love him or you might hate him but you will definitely remember him.   Everything that he is, has been thought about: the way he moves, the way he speaks, what he likes to eat, his facial expressions, his interactions with Gabrielle, his former life... Everything has been thought of.   Kyle Vest, our make-up artist, has estimated that it will take an approximate time of 4 hours to put the make-up on David. (Surprisingly, David is very excited about that). First Concepts of Gisher by Srdjan Pavlovic3D model for Gisher by Srdjan Pavlovic The Weeping Tree   Before the corruption, The Weeping Tree used to be a place of worship and purity.    Every living thing would come and celebrate life. They would harvest its magical sap that would grant immortality.   Now, coming to this place is asking for death. As the land began to corrupt, The Weeping Tree did as well, thus transforming its worshipers into malevolent creatures called Gaunts.The Weeping Tree by Srdjan PavlovicThe Weeping Tree -  more detailed renders by Srdjan Pavlovic Mud MonsterWeeping Tree's protector and loyal minion and servant, creature of tremendous strength called Mud Monster.   Mud Monster - concept render by Srdjan PavlovicMud Monster - medium shotprofile shotThe Gaunts  The Gaunts are creatures that roam throughout the land. They spend their time looking for something to devour, and they will do anything to get their prey. Their faceless bodies will hunt their prey until they lose their sanity.   Inspired by the nightmarish creatures called Nightgaunts, created by the one and only H.P. Lovecraft, concept artist Tomislav took a very unique yet faithful approach on The Gaunts and came up with an original look and style.   There are four Gaunts in total which our characters will face. In this story, the approach we took with them was more of a mythical one.   Like as mentioned above, we wanted to show the difference between a monster and a creature. All four Gaunts have their own unique personality.   Each of the Gaunts has its own unique method of hunting its prey, and they can taste their victim's deepest emotions.    Initially, there was only going to be one Gaunt but as we started developing the story and going through concepts, the director came up with background stories for each one of them. Their names are Wrath, Pestilence, Death, and Agony.   All of them will be created using special make-up effects. WrathWrath will devour you the moment it sees you. Favorite Flavor: Piquant LustPestilencePestilence follows you and hides within the shadows until he is ready to strike from the shadows.Favorite Flavor: Pungent CowardiceDeathEverything withers when Death is near. Death is the truth that everyone tries to escape from.  Favorite Flavor: Bitter Melancholy.     AgonyAgony feasts on the victims suffering. There is no escape from it. Favorite Flavor: Tender Innocence.  The CrewThe Director   Ismael J Orozco is driven by his ambition, love of storytelling and passion for filmmaking. His goal for every film is to be able to teleport the audience into the world he has created.   From an early age, he has been drawn to the genre of dark fantasy, drama, horror, and sci-fi. His father was a huge Star Wars fan which only helped fuel his passion. Because of his father, Ismael found his passion for film. He saw films as a way to escape reality, which is the same way he feels when he makes a film.    Ismael is constantly collaborating with everyone in the productions, especially in the art department, character design and world building are what he loves the most about the process of filmmaking.    Ismael comes from an acting background benefiting him when directing actors.   He also went to Full Sail University and graduated with a Bachelors in Film.    Behind Blue Eyes is not only an opportunity to make a unique film but to make a film that he is very passionate about. His biggest influences are Guillermo Del Toro, HP Lovecraft, David Fincher, Ridley Scott, John Carpenter, and Frank Herbert.The Writers  Antoni Reina Coppola is a half Italian, half Venezuelan filmmaker and writer who loves to tell stories, giving hugs, and long walks inside someone's psyche.   He has directed, written, and produced over a dozen short films that have played at several film festivals across the globe, and is an alumnus of the University of Tampa's Film + Media Art School and the New York Film Academy.   Ever since an early age, Antoni was drawn to the works of Lovecraft, Poe, Doré, Lynch, Goya, Quiroga, Del Toro, and how they were able to find the beauty in the dark, surreal and macabre aspects of life itself. This same feeling is what Antoni wishes to accomplish with this project.    Francis Ford Coppola is The Godfather of Antoni (not really, but that would've been nice).  Joshua Bachmann is a promising screenwriter from Orlando, Florida. He is currently studying English at Arizona State University and has already written two screenplays that have been made into short films.    His forté is in writing emotionally evocative stories with a bit of a supernatural flare. Which makes Behind Blue Eyes a perfect fit for him.    He has worked very closely with the director of this project to write a story that is sure to entertain as well as provoke thought.Director of Photography   Roberto Hernandez is a cinematographer from Orlando, Florida. At an early age, he discovered the art of filmmaking and started making his own films.   After graduating high school, he moved from his small hometown in New England to Orlando, Florida to study film at Full Sail University.    As a cinematographer, Roberto aims to tell a story in every image. His love for storytelling is what led him to Behind Blue Eyes.Production Designer   Christopher "Alex" Reynoso is an aspiring filmmaker from the small town of Grand Saline, Texas.    He is an active concert photographer and started recording videos and making short clips when he was in high school.    He attended Full Sail University where he attained a BS in Film. His specialty in film is: art direction and set design. Special Make Up FX/Make Up Artist  Kyle Vest started in 1997 in the Haunted House Industry, immersing you in his design over the years, Kyle was discovered by TV Network, “Game Show Network", performed in “Skin Wars” also, which is now featured on Netflix.     Kyle was on Season 2 of the competitive body painting show, where he won the “Horror Challenge” and was seen in the final episode. He also won many others including “Ms. Scary Midwest” in 2015, “Monster Make-Up Wars", and “FABRIC” 2015.    Kyle wanted to grow in the Industry and gain experiences with bigger projects. He currently works at Universal Studios Resorts Orlando, Florida and has worked on Halloween Horror Nights as an airbrush makeup artist and actor.   He has played iconic roles such as “Pyramid Head” (Silent Hill). Kyle has built a reputation at Universal as one of the most talented artists.   Kyle is also known for costume design and has worked a semester for A-List Artists such as Taylor Swift, Sarah Brightman, Katy Perry, Justin Timberlake, Miley Cyrus, and Justin Bieber.    Kyle Vest is currently teaching at Vixen Studio as an aerial instructor. He is known as a haunt leader as he teaches every angle of haunted attractions, scenic design, makeup, costuming, and managing. Editor   Katelyn Wright decided to pursue editing and filmmaking when she was finishing high school. She did a two-year media internship with A291.    Through this internship not only did she harnessed skills in videography, photography and post production, but also learned more about who she is as an editor and a content maker.    She likes to take on new challenges with each project allowing her to push her creative skills. She has worked in commercials, television, promotions and short films as well.VFX   Joseph Adams is a VFX artist that has been working in the Los Angeles area for about 2 years.    His passion to excel and produce quality content has been one of his many recognizable traits since the startup of his career in 2015.    Joseph has also worked on popular shows that you might know, including but not limited to: The Gifted (Fox), Westworld (HBO), Stranger Things (Netflix), CSI (CBS), Gotham (Fox), Agents of Shield (Fox), Lucifer (Fox), Lethal Weapon (Fox), Pirates of the Caribbean: Dead Men Tell no Tales.Jason Zimmerman - Unit Production ManagerBenjamin Dessecker - Production CoordinatorOlivia Wukasch - Script SupervisorCarissa Scott Duzansky - 1st Assistant DirectorSrdjan Pavlovic - Gisher's, Mud Monster and The Weeping Tree Concept ArtistTomislav Jagnjić - Land and Gaunts Concept ArtistWhere are the Funds Going?Behind Blue Eyes Budget BreakdownIn order to bring this beautifully dark world to life, we want to rely heavily on practical effects. As you can see, the majority of the budget will be devoted to making those effects the best they can be. Please, be a part of  creating an existience that has never been experienced before.   Risks & Challenges
Creating a unique world that is both frightening yet mesmerizing is difficult. But it's all for the right reasons. We took inspiration from author H.P. Lovecraft and from visionary director Guillermo Del Toro to create this beautiful nightmare. 
   Our biggest challenge was creating the world that not only looks corrupted and surreal but that it shows that it used to be a place of great beauty and splendor. 
  We want to be able to tell a story with everything that you see, whether it is the character, creatures, props or set design. 
   Our biggest inspiration was Guillermo Del Toro's Pan's Labyrinth, we wanted to create something that looks strange, scary, dark yet beautiful. 
  Concept artist Tomislav not only understood this concept but he also put his own unique twist to it. 
The entire film is a huge challenge for the entire team. We set the bar high for us already but we want to set it even higher. We want to captivate the audience and make them wonder.
Practical Effects can be difficult and expensive. They take a long time to put on and to take off.
We are shooting on location and that means we have to keep on a look out for the weather.
We have an intense scene on location that requires us to build and it needs to be shot in time.
The film overall is a huge challenge for everyone involved. Actors have to go through a lot of makeup and a dark emotional journey.
Luckily we are planning for any sort of emergency and backup plans for everything and anything.
We will ship around the world but shipping will only be included for domestic. International shipping will have to be covered separately. We do this so it won't affect the donation.
 

Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
:.:.:.:.:.:.:.:.:.:.:.:.:.:.:.:.:.:.:.:.:.:.:.:.:.:.:.:.:.:.:.:.:.:.:.:.:.:.:.:.:.:.:.:.:.:.:.:.:.:.:.:.:.:.:.:.:.:.:.:.:.:.:.:.:.:.:.:.:.:.:.:.:.:.:.:.:.:.:.:


WITCH (We Intend To Cause Havoc) were the biggest rock band in Zambia in the 1970s and spearheaded a new genre dubbed Zamrock, fusing influences that ranged from the Rolling Stones to Black Sabbath and James Brown and mixing them with traditional African rhythms and bush village songs. At the peak of their popularity, the band often needed police to keep fans at bay while their lead singer Jagari - whose name is an Africanisation of Mick Jagger’s - riled up crowds by stage diving from balconies and dancing manically as the WITCH’s blend of psychedelic rock and African rhythms permeated the surrounding atmosphere. 

Jagari is the charismatic sole surviving original member of the band. As Zambia’s economy stagnated and the country buckled under the AIDS crisis, WITCH fell apart. Jagari retreated to a life of quasi-anonymity as a university music professor before being wrongfully arrested during Zambia’s toughest hour. Now a man in his 60s, he spends his time mining gemstones hoping to strike it rich, until very recently the band being just a nostalgic memory of his youth.

Largely unknown outside of their home country, WITCH finally got the exposure they deserved when Now Again Records reissued their entire discography in 2012. This allowed Jagari to play outside Africa for the first time and for a new generation of fans to discover his music. In 2016 he began a collaboration with Dutch musicians Jacco Gardner and Nic Mauskoviç, and together with them, in September 2017 WITCH headed out on its extremely successful first ever European Tour which was captured by our crew.

This was the realisation of Jagari's Rock 'n' Roll dream - to play in front dancing crowds at sold-out shows in Amsterdam, Paris and London (where they also did a live session for Boiler Room) before supporting the headliners at Liverpool Psych Fest in front of about 800 people, was something he'd only have dreamt about in his youth, but has now become a fervent reality. 

(Audience during WITCH's set at Liverpool Psych Fest)

We Intend to Cause Havoc will put a psychedelic spin on the classic rock and roll tale, taking the audience on a journey deep into Zambia, unraveling Jagari's incredible story, following his successes and struggles which have reflected Zambia's own through the years. The documentary will at the same time allow the viewer to discover the country through its vast natural beauty, social history and unique musical movement: Zamrock.

​Archive footage of  1960s and 70s Zambia will be interspersed with beautiful 4K, Super 8mm and VHS footage shot following Jagari's present day story. Animations will bring the energy of Zamrock to life, mixing a Western rock'n'roll aesthetic with African textures and patterns. Combined, these elements give the film a fuzzed-out, psychedelic feel, accentuated by both the music of the WITCH and a soundtrack score especially composed for the film by the "New WITCH".

Beginning its journey in a Zambian mud-hut village in 1951 and ending in front of adoring European crowds in 2017, We Intend To Cause Havoc's goal is to remind the audience to believe that anything is possible if you follow your passion and talent.

 
 

Currently, our most pressing goal is the post-production that will lead us to a rough cut. We have already been getting interest from the Major European Documentary Festivals and once the rough cut is ready we'll be able to get back to them in order to start a strong festival campaign leading to a theatrical release as well as airtime on documentary TV channels.  

We need your support for this critical final phase of production, which will allow us to showcase the film to the distributors and partners who will be able to make this dream a reality. In return, not only you'll be a crucial part of allowing this story to be told, but you’ll also receive some unique perks relating to WITCH, Zambia, and the European tour. These include postcards, tour posters, DVDs, Signed Records, typical Zambian Copper Bracelets, T-Shirts, Concert Prints and the iconic WITCH hats as worn by the band onstage.

The entirety of the film has been kept independent in nature up until now. Thanks to your help, we will keep our independent ethos and maintain creative control while putting the film together and telling the story in the most interesting way possible.

These are the areas of production towards which we will be directing the funds towards:

  • Editing + Sound Mix (40%)
  • Animations + Soundtrack (30%)
  • Project Syncing (15%)
  • Equipment Hire Costs (5%)
  • Perks Fulfilment (10%)

What initially begun as an interview for Gio's experimental music blog Is Your Clam In A Jam? eventually turned into his first feature length documentary after discovering Jagari's groundbreaking music and exceptional life. His knowledge and passion will be easily transmitted to the audience in a way that will allow them to feel the same emotions he felt upon first hearing the story. His experimental approach and close collaboration with Tim Spreng will offer your eyes and heart a unique experience.

 

Tim's ability to capture the unexpected is what will make the film's visuals stand out. His involvement in the project began three years ago, when he started working with Gio and Jagari, and his excitement for the story has been growing ever since. Using a RED camera sensor paired with old Zeiss lenses, he obtained the film's unique photography. Tim's sense for perfection and economic approach helped him produce feature films, ads and music videos through Pantheon Pictures, his Prague based production company. 

Cem Serter - Executive Producer
Former DJ, Record Label A&R (Low Brow Music) and advisor.
With his expertise and network, he has been instrumental in bringing the project from idea to substance, and continues to carry out his role both on and off location.

Pantheon Pictures has been a crucial part in the project's success so far. Involving an experienced production team including Pavlina Zipkova (Production Supervisor) and Anne Lund (Associate Producer), for the previous shoots guaranteed and independent yet well planned and organised production.

 

My Accomplice is a boutique London-based production company led  by Jamie Clark (LCD Soundsystem: Shut Up and Play the Hits, The Libertines: There Are No Innocent Bystanders). The company focuses on producing culture-led and creative documentaries for theatrical release alongside a commercial production arm. My Accomplice's first feature The Quiet One will be released in 2018 through IFC / Sundance Selects.

story:
FILM

The main characters in the movie are Bit and Maja. Bit is a physicist struggling to understand the ultimate nature of reality but is only obssesed with concepts and neglects his instincs and feelings. Maja is a young self-confident photographer, trying to capture beauty and to see beyond human masks. Bit and Maja meet one day in a pub; they fall in love and spend a night together.

The collisions of two enteties, once they meet they are conected forever. A story about selfdiscovery and love. Maja has to let go her attachment to emotions and find the real cause of her suffering. Bit has to experience all the confusion of the mind, the fear of seeing himself as he is, and finally let go of attachment to concepts. 

 

 

 

PHILOSOPHY

The main aim of the movie is not to offer just good entertainment, but also profound introspection into human nature and individual struggle to recognize deeper identity.

We live in a world, which is constantly changing.  Our thoughts, emotions and even physical bodies are changing all the time.  Our happiness seems to depend on our search for love and understanding. We see many possibilities so we think we have to struggle. For the answers we are looking into the mind and emotions, but in this way we find just confusion and  unfulfilled whishes. 

"We are so preoccupied with the waves that we don't feel the obvious; the ocean.  We are so immersed in everyday stories that we don't recognize from what they are made of. "

By trying and searching we come to realization that the nature of reality cannot be understood  by the mind, nor can love be revealed  by identifying with fleeting emotions. By observing our experiences we start to discover the connectivity and sameness of ever-present Presence; we come to understanding that all possibilities are equally valid and made of the same stuff, our Self.  In the process of discovery we are constantly invited to turn our attention into the seer itself.

"Finally, when the seer is found no more, just the seeing remains. "

 

                                               

 

 

MEET THE TEAM

"It's not just my film or my story, I want it to become our story."

 

 

And that is exactly how it happened. It only takes a spark to spread a fire. Žiga had the script, actors Anka and Jure had the talent and enthusiasm, producer Maja and assistant Debora had the skills and the know how, DoP Tadej and sound expert Erik had the time and a vision. The whole crew with other assistants and actors were working with great enthusiasm and with no budget.

 

          

 

 

 

WHAT WE NEED &

WHAT YOU GET

The shooting of the movie “Undulation of the I” lasted one moth and was finished with great dedication and effort. After that it was time for post production.  At this point we decided to collect funds, as we knew that also enthusiasm has its limits and that people who will sit long hours by the computer needed to be payed.  With the help of contributors we will be able to hire the experts for color grading and sound editing and in this way finish the movie in JANUARY 2018.

As a sign of gratitude we are offering some unique perks, check them out ;) ----->

 

 

 

 

 

Other Ways to Be a

PART OF OUR STORY

  • If you can't contribute via pay pal or credit card, or you don't really trust the internet because you watched Citizen Four and you are now just freaking out (psssst so are we), you can contact us also on our super safe and official e-mail: makuprod@gmail.com.

 

  • We will be greateful if you spread the word to your friends on social media, post our campaign on your facebook wall, twitt about us or maybe post an original picture on your instagram. Any kind of support of our project will be super helpful :)

Thank you and that's all there is to it ;)

Bit has to experience all the confusion of the mind, the fear of seeing himself as he is, and finally let go of attachment to concepts.    PHILOSOPHYThe main aim of the movie is not to offer just good entertainment, but also profound introspection into human nature and individual struggle to recognize deeper identity.We live in a world, which is constantly changing.  Our thoughts, emotions and even physical bodies are changing all the time.  Our happiness seems to depend on our search for love and understanding. We see many possibilities so we think we have to struggle. For the answers we are looking into the mind and emotions, but in this way we find just confusion and  unfulfilled whishes. "We are so preoccupied with the waves that we don't feel the obvious; the ocean.  We are so immersed in everyday stories that we don't recognize from what they are made of. "By trying and searching we come to realization that the nature of reality cannot be understood  by the mind, nor can love be revealed  by identifying with fleeting emotions. By observing our experiences we start to discover the connectivity and sameness of ever-present Presence; we come to understanding that all possibilities are equally valid and made of the same stuff, our Self.  In the process of discovery we are constantly invited to turn our attention into the seer itself."Finally, when the seer is found no more, just the seeing remains. "                                                  MEET THE TEAM"It's not just my film or my story, I want it to become our story." &lt;br&gt; And that is exactly how it happened. It only takes a spark to spread a fire. Žiga had the script, actors Anka and Jure had the talent and enthusiasm, producer Maja and assistant Debora had the skills and the know how, DoP Tadej and sound expert Erik had the time and a vision. The whole crew with other assistants and actors were working with great enthusiasm and with no budget.               WHAT WE NEED &WHAT YOU GETThe shooting of the movie “Undulation of the I” lasted one moth and was finished with great dedication and effort. After that it was time for post production.  At this point we decided to collect funds, as we knew that also enthusiasm has its limits and that people who will sit long hours by the computer needed to be payed.  With the help of contributors we will be able to hire the experts for color grading and sound editing and in this way finish the movie in JANUARY 2018.As a sign of gratitude we are offering some unique perks, check them out ;) ----->     Other Ways to Be aPART OF OUR STORYIf you can't contribute via pay pal or credit card, or you don't really trust the internet because you watched Citizen Four and you are now just freaking out (psssst so are we), you can contact us also on our super safe and official e-mail: makuprod@gmail.com. We will be greateful if you spread the word to your friends on social media, post our campaign on your facebook wall, twitt about us or maybe post an original picture on your instagram. Any kind of support of our project will be super helpful :)Thank you and that's all there is to it ;)

story:
SHORT SUMMARY

This project is the pilot of a reggae inspired feature film with mass international appeal. Help us to bring ‘Ital Reign’, and its feature-length successor ‘Shy’ to the big screen!

Born out of a desire to commit Birmingham's rich musical history to film, 'Ital Reign and the Story of the Dangerous Dub', beautifully captures the city's long relationship with reggae music. With an original soundtrack that includes contributions from the pioneers of Birmingham's reggae scene, we are on course to kick start a revival for a new generation of reggae lovers.

Our success so far can be partly attributed to the need to commit this amazing legacy to film‘ but those invested in our project are equally drawn to the positive message at the heart of this family film and our commitment to authenticity.

We are proud to announce a cast and crew that includes some of the West Midland's best known performers.

Amlak Tafari - Steel Pulse Bass Guitarist & Yellow Wall Productions

Cherrelle Skeete - BBC's Ordinary Lies & West End's Harry Potter & the cursed child

Tonia Daley-Campbell - BBC's Danny & the human zoo & Lucid

Catalyst Studios have designed a unique marketing campaign that will capture imaginations across the city and beyond, through our network of national and international film professionals; Rick Elgood - Director of Jamaica's very own 'Dancehall Queen' & 'One Love' starring Kymani Marley & Cherine Anderson.

Partly set on the beautiful island of Jamaica, ‘Ital Reign and the Story of the Dangerous Dub’ will reach thousands, with the intention that our feature film will reach millions.

This pilot film will be privately premiered in Birmingham, London & Jamaica to capture the hearts of our investors & the current reggae revival artists such as: Chronixx, Jah 9, Jesse Royal, Protoje, Kabaka Pyramid and many more we would like to feature in the feature film later on in 2018.

With your support we can see this project through to completion and premiere in February 2018.

THE PROJECT

‘Ital Reign’ tells the story of a man who has to choose fame or fatherhood, friends who have to choose loyalty or desire, and a young woman who has to choose to believe in herself.

Featuring classic reggae DUB tracks alongside original music, ‘Ital Reign’ begins in 90's Birmingham, following a young reggae band aiming to make it big. As events unravel, it takes the viewer across generations and - in the future - across continents as it follows an over-protected young woman on a journey of self-discovery through music, culture and heritage.

From left: Jude Gatiss (Writer), Ukeila Prophet (Casting director), Steffan Zachiyah (Co-Director), Dominic Lofters (Co-Director)

OUR GOAL

We want to raise £25,000 and with your contribution through Indiegogo to cover pre-production, production, distribution & marketing costs we will be able to make this the best film to come out of Birmingham to date. The budget will also include set design, costume design, location hire, rehearsals and filming, travel and transportation costs, equipment hire, catering, and video and sound editing & of course to pay the actors as well as the team!

This relatively small amount will not only allow Catalyst preserve and celebrate this important part of our city’s musical legacy but will help to launch the careers of a number of Black British performers, film and music professionals. We are experiencing an exciting period for young British film makers and we believe our reggae inspired film will cross over into mainstream in a way that has not been witnessed for many years. We hope that you can help us to achieve that.

TO SAY THANK YOU!

We are offering 4 rewards depending on your contribution.

Tier 1 £10: A thank you from us on our social media platforms.

Tier 2 £20: For this contribution you will receive a standard ticket to the UK premiere of your choice in either Birmingham or London.

Tier 3 £50: For this contribution you will receive a standard ticket to the UK premiere of your choice in either Birmingham or London, as well as a limited edition ‘Ital Reign: The Story of a Dangerous DUB’ T-shirt.

Tier 4 £250: For this contribution you will receive a GOLD VIP ticket to the UK premiere of your choice in either Birmingham or London and a limited edition film poster signed by all cast, including Steel Pulse’s Amlak Tafari, Cherrelle Skeete & Tonia Daley-Campbell.

Tier 5 £1000: For this contribution you will receive a PLATINUM VIP ticket to the UK premiere of your choice in either Birmingham or London, a limited edition film poster signed by all cast, including Steel Pulse’s Amlak Tafari, Cherrelle Skeete & Tonia Daley-Campbell. You will also be credited as EXECUTIVE PRODUCER of the film.

PROGRESS

So far we have finished developing the script for the pilot film, written original music for the soundtrack, casted all of the roles, and secured sponsorship and support from numerous companies and organisations.

Next Steps: We will begin recording the music to the soundtrack in September, rehearsals in October and head straight into filming in November. After shooting is complete we will begin post production. We intend to complete post production by December 1st ready & fit for premier release.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you aren’t able to donate, please help us by sharing our campaign with someone who might be interested. If you believe you could support our project in other ways, with sponsorship or in another way, please get in touch!

story:
Desert Sai: The story of a killing is an idea I have long been molding and crafting and I believe there is no better chance to attempt to bring this story to life on screen than right now. The crucial element I believe to make this story pulsates with life on screen is down to keeping the audience teased to the point they are eager to know more but not to overfeed audience with exposition that could potentially harm the viewer's experience or make the plot of the story feel rushed. The script along with the environment encourages a natural and believable performance from actors and actresses., Forcing actors such as Zaid and Jesus to reach into their bag of skills and hopefully produce a performance worthwhile, calling on skills like body language, the use of facial expressions and whatever else can be applied. The message of the story is one that asks questions on the true idea of redemption and how far one must go to fully achieve true redemption.
 

Contributors to this project will be helping with the overall trip into the heart of the desert, including food for the crew and cast, transportation of not only the crew but equipment, hiring of a qualified and polished stunt coordinator and scoring the overall production.

Supporting the project is not only a reward from you to me but in a very small way also a contribution from us to indie cinema and indie filmmaking.

Your contributions get you:

$5  - shout out in the final credits and a special thank you at the end of the film.

$10 - Signed copy of shooting script with Directors notes and a personal mention in the end of the film credits.

$20 - Signed DVD of the film Desert Sai: The story of a killing. This will be signed by major crew and cast. E.g.: Director of photography, Lead actress, actors etc.

$60 -  Desert Sai, T-shirt with the signed copy of Desert Sai: The story of a killing poster. A signed copy of the shooting script. Personal mention in the end of film credits and a signed copy of the DVD.

$100 - An IMDB associate producer credit with the Desert Sai t-shirt, Poster, a signed copy of the storyboards, shooting script and a personal mention in the end of film credits and a signed copy of the DVD.

$200 -  An IMDB producer credit with the Desert Sai t-shirt, Poster, signed copy of the storyboards, shooting script and a personal mention in the end of film credits and a signed copy of the DVD.

$300 - An IMDB Executive producer credit with the Desert Sai t-shirt, Poster, signed copy of the storyboards, shooting script, a personal mention in the end of film credits and a signed copy of the DVD.

$500 -  An IMDB Executive producer credit with the Desert Sai t-shirt, Poster, signed copy of the storyboards, shooting script, a personal mention in the end of film credits, a signed copy of the DVD and for the first five beneficiaries a chance to be present for the first ever screening of the film with the cast, crew and beneficiaries all watching in a highly acclaimed theatre.

Funds, as mentioned above, will go to transporting the crew, cast, and equipment (Red Dragon camera, dolly tracks etc) into the heart of the desert, feeding the set, renting the vehicle used in the film. A quality stunt coordinator, permits, and props.

This film will be able to help not only me but the several others who will help bring this project to life, get work within the industry it will provide a platform for them to springboard off. This is my second short the first being the film Bad Dude but you can rest assured you aided in helping the career of an indie filmmaker and struggling artist get up off the ground. If you are curious to find out a little more about me you can find me on the podcast Creative Underground. The podcast was created to provide inspiration and teach creativity to the youth of Johannesburg, South Africa. I produced the podcast with a friend, Jonas Radunz.

The challenges we're bound to face include finding human moments in an inhumane setting.  Transporting a crew of that size with equipment.

Getting the actors in the ground and safely(this will be done by literally digging a hole into the ground and faking the look of being buried neck-deep).

Getting all the shots necessary under the conditions.

The heat and Lack of shade.

If you, unfortunately, find yourself wanting to help but not able to please like and share posts as many and to as many people as you can. Word of mouth is a great way to get the word out too.

story:
Our short film, American Life, tells the story of two brothers growing up in an area riddled with poverty and violence. Michael, our protagonist, wants to be the next Ali. He loves that dream, but he loves his brother Tray more. Every child needs a childhood free of violence. Every kid needs a childhood where they don’t have to worry about the safety of their family in their neighborhood, where they don’t have to resort to violence themselves in order to survive. The City of Chicago remains one of the most segregated and economically unbalanced cities in the US. Compounding this is rampant gang and gun violence which continues to impact youth coming from the city's Western and Southern parts, mainly Black/African & Brown/Latin American Children. This is not an unheard of narrative, but it is one many choose to ignore. Please help us ignite more conversations, and progressive change.

 

Emily Harmon: Writer / Director

Emily is a filmmaker dedicated to telling stories that explore the human condition and the communities and situations we create that either support or prevent equity and opportunity. She started telling stories as a journalism major in undergrad. After a few years working in non-profits dedicated to empowering communities to take on injustice locally and globally, she took the leap and applied to film school. She is at Columbia College Chicago studying Cinema Directing, figuring out how tell the stories we need to hear in a way that will inspire empathy and action for progressive change.

Calisto Lemashon: Producer

Lemashon is a passionate film producer who has over the years cultured and nurtured the concept of communication and film production and its impact on society. He is currently a Fulbright scholar at Columbia College Chicago mastering in Film Production. He is also a television producer at Nation Media Group, East Africa’s leading media company. He holds a BA degree from Moi University in Film and Television Production. His short term goal is to do as much in the film industry in Chicago and hopefully other parts of the world while creating avenues to enable more creatives to tell their own stories through transmedia.

 

 

We appreciate that this is a topic close to you and/or your organization's path. Our current budget is $8,000. This budget will cover the following:

Locations

Production Design (building the environment)

Transportation

Cast and crew meals

Extra equipment (Our school is providing camera and most of the film gear but our vision calls for some items not available at our school.)

Stunt Coordinator

Music Composer

Post Production

Distribution – sending to film festivals!

These funds will go directly into the production of the film. Working on a shoestring budget and being graduate students, we are determined to make the best use of any amount of cash we receive to enable the quality production of the film.

To show our appreciation, depending on your level of investment, we are offering:

  • Our deepest gratitude
  • A social media shout-out
  • A digital viewing of Am. Life
  • Behind-the-scenes footage
  • Outtakes
  • Recognition on our website
  • Indiegogo Supporter ‘special thanks’ in film credits
  • Thank you video from the cast
  • Curated production photos
  • Set visit
  • Two complimentary screening tickets
  • Associate Producer/Contributor credit
  • Co-Producer credit
  • An iconic gift/prop from the set
  • Autographed iconic gift/prop from the set

The production dates are:

Production: October 9 - 15, 2017

Post Production: November 1, 2017 - March 30, 2018  

 

This narrative is a necessary, emotionally evocative piece that will motivate conversation and action to invest in disenfranchised communities. We owe it to the younger generation, and the next, and the next.

 

Share and get more of your family and friends to invest in this film.

Write to your representative about funding public schools in Chicago! To get you started, we have named all of the Chicago neighborhoods within the perks–please find a school and inspire a generation.

story:
The Story

Businessmen is a coming of age story about an eccentric group of 14-year-old skateboarders who call themselves the Businessmen Skate Crew. The plot centers on Andy, struggling with school and full of self doubt, as he attempts his biggest and most dangerous stunt yet. When he fails, it's up to his misfit friends to teach him what it takes to face your fears and overcome even bigger obstacles in life. 

The Project

This short narrative film project is a large collaboration across many advanced film classes at Columbia College Chicago in Illinois. Most of the crew are students in these classes who have worked their way up to this capstone project. Following the independent filmmaking model, we are tasked with using our own creativity and resources to build this film from the ground up and see it though to the end. 

The Crew

Aaron Legg - Writer & Director

Aaron grew up in Madison, Wisconsin where shooting skate videos and goofy sketches with friends sprouted into a serious passion for filmmaking and telling stories. Aaron pursues directing at Columbia College Chicago, where he'll recieve his BA in Cinema Art & Science this May. His inspiration for Businessmen comes from his skateboarding background, adventures with friends, and films like The Goonies, Stand by Me, and TV show Stranger Things. He's inspired by stories that reach the heart and uncover truths about the human experience, and his love for storytelling and desire to entertain makes him one motivated individual who's incredibly grateful to have the chance to bring Businessmen to life. 

Kyle Rudolph - Producer

Kyle Rudolph was born and raised near Detroit, Michigan. His passion with the entertainment industry, more specifically the music industry, started young and Kyle set out to embark on a journey to find and manage up and coming young talent. With his passion showing through his heart and his mind focused on the goal at hand, Kyle takes serious interest with minor details. Building a team and creating something much larger than himself was the mission when taking on the role of producing Businessmen. Kyle still spends his free time recording and producing music. Kyle strongly believes in talent that drives and provokes emotions and his mission is to find that. 

Natalie Reinholtz - Director of Photography

My name is Natalie Reinholtz and I’m the Director of Photography for Businessmen. I am from Vernon Hills, Illinois. I came to Chicago to study Photography at Columbia College Chicago but ended up falling in love with Cinematography instead after a summer of binging movies. I love Chicago because it feels like home. I enjoy long boarding and playing guitar when I’m not behind a camera. In the next 5 years, I hope to be in LA making movies and doing what I love with the people I love.

Chris Vukasin - Assistant Director

Chris Vukasin is a Senior film student at Columbia College Chicago, graduating this May. Originally from Los Angeles, Chris made the move to Chicago for a change of scenery. He loves Chicago. The brilliant architecture and variety of cultures and areas where there is always something to do really makes it feel like a home away from home. "My brain is in Los Angeles, but my heart is in Chicago," he says. Besides making movies, Chris is a photographer. He loves to shoot anything creative and avant-garde and has a lot of admiration for the visual storyteller. In five years, Chris sees himself back in Los Angeles working as an Assistant Director at a professional level, working his way up the ladder to eventually direct his own features. 

Austin Perez - Production Designer

​

Austin Perez is a junior at Columbia College seeking a bachelors degree in production design. He grew up in Belvidere IL, where he found himself skating with friends and playing football throughout high school. He found his passion for production design working for Starlight Theatre in his hometown where he worked on set designs, set decoration, construction, props, and also acted in couple shows himself. He is ecstatic about his role as production designer for "Businessmen", and can't wait to bring this film to life!

Devon Halliday - Editor

Devon Halliday is a film editor from Boston, Massachusetts.  She moved to Chicago to attend film school and find her creative others.  She fell in love with editing the first time she sat in front of the computer and began putting clips together.  Devon has now made over 15 short films. She hopes one day to edit feature length films and music videos. ​

RJ Redline - Production Manager

RJ Redline; a senior at Columbia College Chicago has spent the majority of his time at the college expressing his interest in music and acting. Never one to stay within the lines; RJ is now experimenting with managing a film production on set as unit production manager for the film "The Businessmen" Directed by Aaron Legg.

Noah Mulgrew - Casting Director 

 

The Need

As you may know, making a movie is expensive, and we want you to know exactly where your money is going. Here is a breakdown of where the funds are needed:

Production Design - $900

The art department is committed to capturing an authentic slice of skateboarding culture from its clothing and music to the actual skateboards and equipment. Additionally, setting the story in 2007 will be a fun way to use props like flip phones and DV tape cameras to add to the warm nostalgia of the film. Production design helps tell the story through props, wardrobe, hair & make-up, and set decoration. 

Craft Services - $800

We have an incredibly hard working cast and crew that we need to keep alive! Shooting for long, 12-hour days will require providing catering and craft to our cast and crew of approximately 40 people. Getting everyone fed will keep us happy, healthy, and energized to get our jobs done on set.

Post Production & Marketing - $300

Besides hard drives, coloring, sound, music, and promotional artwork, we hope to spread the film to wider audiences! This money will go toward festival fees and be reserved as contingency incase there are unexpected expenses and a cushion for if something goes wrong. 

Transportation - $500

Moving and storing all of the camera and lighting equipment will require a truck rental. We also need to make sure our crew and cast have transportation to our 4 different shooting locations, ensuring everyone makes it safely and efficiently. 

Locations - $500

Some locations require certain fees to let us shoot and use their facilities. Outdoor locations will require generators, tents/shelter incase of bad weather, and a stunt coordinator and on-set medic to ensure the safety and security of our actors, stunt doubles, crew and equipment. 

TOTAL - $3000

$3000 is the bare minimum we'll need to make this film, and even with that, we'll be very stretched and limited with what we can do. If we are so lucky as to exceed our goal, every extra dollar donated will be put into the production and help us achieve our full vision. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're unable to contribute monetarily, you can still help out by spreading the word! Share this campaign with your friends and family and help us make some noise! 

Want to be an Extra?

That's right, you can be in the movie! We need extras aged 13-22 to play high school students moving about in the background of the final scene. Contact us if you're interested!

Thank You!

On behalf of the entire crew, we want to thank you so much for taking the time to learn about Businessmen and for helping us in whatever capacity. Don't hesitate to contact us with any questions, comments, or concerns. We can't wait to share the film's success with you all!
story_txt:
The Story
Businessmen is a coming of age story about an eccentric group of 14-year-old skateboarders who call themselves the Businessmen Skate Crew. The plot centers on Andy, struggling with school and full of self doubt, as he attempts his biggest and most dangerous stunt yet. When he fails, it's up to his misfit friends to teach him what it takes to face your fears and overcome even bigger obstacles in life. 
The Project
This short narrative film project is a large collaboration across many advanced film classes at Columbia College Chicago in Illinois. Most of the crew are students in these classes who have worked their way up to this capstone project. Following the independent filmmaking model, we are tasked with using our own creativity and resources to build this film from the ground up and see it though to the end. 


The Crew
Aaron Legg - Writer & Director

Aaron grew up in Madison, Wisconsin where shooting skate videos and goofy sketches with friends sprouted into a serious passion for filmmaking and telling stories. Aaron pursues directing at Columbia College Chicago, where he'll recieve his BA in Cinema Art & Science this May. His inspiration for Businessmen comes from his skateboarding background, adventures with friends, and films like The Goonies, Stand by Me, and TV show Stranger Things. He's inspired by stories that reach the heart and uncover truths about the human experience, and his love for storytelling and desire to entertain makes him one motivated individual who's incredibly grateful to have the chance to bring Businessmen to life. 
Kyle Rudolph - Producer

Kyle Rudolph was born and raised near Detroit, Michigan. His passion with the entertainment industry, more specifically the music industry, started young and Kyle set out to embark on a journey to find and manage up and coming young talent. With his passion showing through his heart and his mind focused on the goal at hand, Kyle takes serious interest with minor details. Building a team and creating something much larger than himself was the mission when taking on the role of producing Businessmen. Kyle still spends his free time recording and producing music. Kyle strongly believes in talent that drives and provokes emotions and his mission is to find that. 
Natalie Reinholtz - Director of Photography

My name is Natalie Reinholtz and I’m the Director of Photography for Businessmen. I am from Vernon Hills, Illinois. I came to Chicago to study Photography at Columbia College Chicago but ended up falling in love with Cinematography instead after a summer of binging movies. I love Chicago because it feels like home. I enjoy long boarding and playing guitar when I’m not behind a camera. In the next 5 years, I hope to be in LA making movies and doing what I love with the people I love.
Chris Vukasin - Assistant Director

Chris Vukasin is a Senior film student at Columbia College Chicago, graduating this May. Originally from Los Angeles, Chris made the move to Chicago for a change of scenery. He loves Chicago. The brilliant architecture and variety of cultures and areas where there is always something to do really makes it feel like a home away from home. "My brain is in Los Angeles, but my heart is in Chicago," he says. Besides making movies, Chris is a photographer. He loves to shoot anything creative and avant-garde and has a lot of admiration for the visual storyteller. In five years, Chris sees himself back in Los Angeles working as an Assistant Director at a professional level, working his way up the ladder to eventually direct his own features. 
Austin Perez - Production Designer
​
Austin Perez is a junior at Columbia College seeking a bachelors degree in production design. He grew up in Belvidere IL, where he found himself skating with friends and playing football throughout high school. He found his passion for production design working for Starlight Theatre in his hometown where he worked on set designs, set decoration, construction, props, and also acted in couple shows himself. He is ecstatic about his role as production designer for "Businessmen", and can't wait to bring this film to life!
Devon Halliday - Editor

Devon Halliday is a film editor from Boston, Massachusetts.  She moved to Chicago to attend film school and find her creative others.  She fell in love with editing the first time she sat in front of the computer and began putting clips together.  Devon has now made over 15 short films. She hopes one day to edit feature length films and music videos. ​
RJ Redline - Production Manager

RJ Redline; a senior at Columbia College Chicago has spent the majority of his time at the college expressing his interest in music and acting. story:
POR

 

Como “UNINTENDED SINS” nasceu?

Desde que era uma estudante de teatro, sempre fui uma grande admiradora de Nelson Rodrigues, um dos maiores dramaturgos Brasileiros. Em 1978 é escrita “A Serpente”, peça que me inspirou a escrever um roteiro sobre religião, pecado e dinâmica familiar. Além disso, Nelson possui um tom único em suas obras, mais conhecido como tragédia carioca, gênero que só pode ser encontrado no Brasil. Meu objetivo com esse projeto é dividir com o mundo um pedaço da cultura Brasileira através do trabalho de Nelson e sua tragédia carioca.  

 

Quem é minha equipe?

A equipe de “UNINTENDED SINS” é formada por 15 pessoas de diversas partes do mundo: Cazaquistão,  Porto Rico, Colômbia, África do Sul, Brasil, entre outros. Somos um time composto por estudantes internacionais que vivem nos E.U.A com o objetivo de fazer um curta metragem que possamos mostrar para o mundo com orgulho!

 

Qual o destino de sua doação?

            

Como mostra o gráfico, o custo do aluguel da locação e alimentação para a equipe e 5 atores, durante os dois dias de gravação, corresponde à mais da metade do orçamento.  Isso acontece devido ao fato de Los Angeles ser o centro internacional do cinema, o que acarreta em leis e taxas mais rigorosas para a produção de um filme.

Tenho a grande sorte de poder trabalhar com pessoas de minha confiança e que conhecem a mim e a meu trabalho a ponto de se colocarem a meu dispor para esse projeto sem nenhum tipo de pagamento, o que já reduz exponencialmente meus custos. Entretanto, há outros gastos necessários para que eu consiga fazer um filme digno de participar em um festival.

 

Se ainda restarem quaisquer dúvidas, por favor não hesite em entrar em contato comigo.

Muito, muito obrigada!

 

 

 ENG

 

How “UNINTENDED SINS” was born?

Ever since I was a theater student, I've been a big fan of Nelson Rodrigues, a really famous Brazilian play writer. In 1978, he wrote "The Serpent", which inspired me to make a film about religion, sins and family dynamic. Rodrigues has a very unique tone that applies to his work: tragédia carioca, a genre that you can only find in Brazil. With this project, I want to share with the world a little bit of my culture through Rodrigues' work and his tragédia carioca writing.

 

Who is our crew?

For “UNINTENDED SINS” we have a 15 people crew from all over the world: Kazakhstan, Puerto Rico, Colombia, South Africa, Brazil, and many more. We are a team conformed by international students living in the U.S., with the goal of making a short film that we can show to the world with proud.

 

Where is your donation heading?

                

As you can see, paying the location fees and catering for 15  members and 5 actors, during the two days of shooting, is more than half of the budget. Since Los Angeles is the Western international entertainment capital, the filming laws are more restrict than other places, so we have to pay higher rates for permits, fees, insurances, etc.

I have the luck to be able to work with people that know me and that are willing to cooperate in this project without pay, which reduces my expenses exponentially. However, there are other necessary costs that we need to pay in order to make a festival-worthy film!

 

If after all, you still have any questions, please do not hesitate on contacting me.

Thank you very much!
