story:
Short Summary

I'm Julianne Neal, director and producer of Karl Mikolka: A Life in Service of the Horse. I have been a follower of Karl's System since the 1990s when I was fortunate enough to participate in a clinic in South Carolina presented by my long-time dressage trainer, Mary Werning. I was able to ride with Karl over the years from time to time and his training methods literally changed the way I rode and viewed dressage. Recently, after producing an equine documentary about Bruce Anderson's work and having great success and opportunities through film festivals and screenings, I was reintroduced to Karl and his work. I truly believe that film is an incredible way to showcase Karl and the importance that his work has, both historically and as the basis for true correct training for the horse. After speaking with Karl about this project and spending some time filming introductory interviews and several short training segments in a clinic setting, we came away in November with a plan to create a short introductory film and trailer for a longer piece. Over the next year, we will work toward gathering the footage for a 60 minute documentary that would delve into his history and the basics of how the System affects both horse and rider, and hopefully in the future to continue with a series of training films based on the exercises in the System.

After several months of work, a short "reality tv" style film (30 minute) introducing Karl through the eyes of Mary and one of her current students participating in the clinic is complete, as well as a 3 minute trailer for the longer doc. Now, it is time to gather the footage of training sessions specifically for the film and to speak more in depth with Karl about his amazing life.

I am so excited to bring the incredible story of Karl Mikolka to you. Your donations will make it possible to finish filming during several upcoming clinics, gather interview footage, purchase the necessary music and vintage footage rights and begin post production on the documentary, as well as to enter the initial short piece and trailer into the EQUUS Film Festival and other appropriate screening venues. Karl has been an influential trainer and rider for 67 years and deserves to have a great amount of recognition for that; but perhaps even more importantly, serious dressage riders and their horses deserve to have access to his complete System of classical training. We hope that this documentary, along with his other promotional materials, will help to spread that information with a  wider audience.

What We Need and What You Get

We need $10,000 to make this project happen:

  • Travel and expenses for filming: I am donating time and filming, but will need help with out of pocket travel expenses. We would like to film at least two upcoming clinics in order to cover a variety of riders in a variety of locations. 
  • Vintage footage and music: There is a small amount of archived footage available through British Pathe and MovieTime that will enhance this project so much (between $2,000 and $2,500). We have access to the original photographs, but the film footage and music just make such a big difference. 
  • Post production: The more funds we are able to raise, the more archived footage and post production assistance we will be able to include. My goal is to make the film as polished as possible with your help!
  • Film Festival Fees: I'll submit at least one of the finished pieces to the EQUUS Film Festival for screening in November. The entry fees are due in June. Screening in New York would give the project a huge amount of exposure, not only in the theatre, but also through their online presence. EQUUS will also begin an online on demand channel and have permanent home at the Kentucky Horse Park which will bring more exposure to Karl and his work. 
  • Distribution: Once we have the doc ready for festival submission, I'll have it preserved through Cinematique and have the DCP file created to facilitate distribution in the future. 
  • If we aren't able to reach the entire funding goal, we will limit filming to one location and provide the necessary fees for festival admission. 

The Impact

Karl Mikolka was born in  1935 in Austria, into the turbulent times of ‘the war generation’ in the heart of a country facing the inevitability of World War II. At the age of 19, Karl was interviewed by Alois Podhajsky and subsequently accepted as an eléve at the Spanish Riding School. Within five years, he was promoted to Assistant Rider and eventually achieved the rank of Oberreiter, or Chief Rider, in 1967. Following the SRS, he traveled to Brazil to coach the Olympic Team and finally arrived in the US, training at Friar's Gate Farm in Massachusetts and Tempel Farms in Illinois. Always remaining loyal to the preservation of Classical training principles, Karl's work is a valuable piece of the equestrian culture, both from the past and continuing into the future.  His System provides a sound foundation for the well-being of horses and their riders, including every aspect of schooling the dressage horse and rider from Training Level to Grand Prix.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge that we face with this project is time and distance. As a full-time educator, I will be arranging travel to at least one location to film and interview Karl about his work as soon as possible, as my time allows. I am committed to entering at least one of the completed projects into this year's film festival in order to provide exposure for Karl and any other project that he may wish to promote within THIS year's festival tour, so finishing as much of the filming as possible soon is important. As long as we are able to film in a good location in a positive environment and capture as much of Karl's personality and stories, we can always add to longer edits later...I just want to make sure to capture as much as possible as soon as possible! There is an upcoming clinic in May, so if the funding allows, I will attend and get a jump start so that the editing can begin as school is slowing down. 

Other Ways You Can Help

I certainly do understand that some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help! If you have a few minutes, please help us spread the word about this project. Karl's website (www.mikolkadressage.com) contains links to purchase his exercises and gives a great amount of information about his life and work, so visit the site to get an idea of the wealth of knowledge that he has to share! Email your friends or share on Facebook~ anything that you can do to help us share the information would be really appreciated!

story:
Questa campagna é finita con successo!! grazie!!

visita la nuova campagna clicca qui!!

 

ITALIANO

Il sogno è di dare un diverso punto di vista della Rotta Balcanica che è oggi famosa come un viaggio pieno di sfide attraverso barriere, campi profughi, esseri umani che cambiano i loro nomi in rifugiati.

Con questo tour noi vogliamo attraversare i Balcani e segnare una mappa che unisce genti e culture attraverso la musica e l'arte.

Attraverseremo Italia, Slovenia, Austria, Ungheria, Romania, Serbia, Bulgaria, Macedonia e alla fine Grecia.

Ad ogni tappa, in circa 30 giorni, incontreremo persone nei campi di rifugiati, persone delle città che visiteremo, faremo loro delle interviste e suoneremo musica con loro, useremo il colore per dipingere il grigiore, la musica per riaccendere sorrisi. Ad ogni tappa registreremo un brano musicale con musicisti del luogo assieme a rifugiati che in quel luogo ci devono stare (la musica è un mezzo potentissimo di dialogo e incontro).

Vogliamo realizzare un documentario su questo viaggio, una testimonianza a futura memoria per tracciare un ritratto dell’Europa dei giorni nostri.

Dobbiamo procurarci un camper, allestirlo come un mini studio di registrazione, con noi 2 videomaker documenteranno il viaggio e successivamente (al nostro ritorno) verrà realizzato il film documentario per poi essere stampato, presentato nei festival e cinema d’Italia e del mondo e stampato in DVD.

Buona parte del budget sarà investito per acquistare macchine fotografiche, pennelli, tele, colori, strumenti musicali da portare e donare alle persone nei campi di rifugiati. Sarà loro insegnato come utilizzarle e saranno loro coinvolti nella realizazione di un libro fotografico. Infatti verrà chiesto di spedire ad AlphaArt (www.alphaart.org) le foto e i video di quello che vedono. Il libro così creato sarà un'importante testimonianza di quest' epoca storica.

Al nostro arrivo in Grecia organizzeremo un grande evento in un campo rifugiati ad Atene, dove persone da tutto il mondo verranno e porteranno con se cibo, vestiti, sorrisi e tanta speranza.

Ad ogni tappa del viaggio pianteremo un albero di mele, un albero forte, e come crescerà starà a segnare una strada di ritorno verso casa nel nome della pace, rinascita e bellezza. Una mappa di speranza, per ricordare che la bellezza non si spegne mai.

Ci puoi aiutare in due modi:

-        raggiungerci durante il viaggio, portare con te del cibo, dei vestiti, delle idee e sogni da condividere con i rifugiati.

-        Fare una donazione sulla nostra campagna crowdfunding per supportare il viaggio (il camper, il gasolio, cibo, la produzione dell’album e del documentario nonché la realizzazione dell’evento in Grecia). In cambio abbiamo pensato a vari modi di ringraziarti (sono i perks nella nostra pagina di crowdfunding).

ENGLISH

Alaa Arsheed (musician and composer, from Siria) had a dream 7 years ago of a tour with music. In 2015 he met with Isaac de Martin (musician and composer, from Italy) and they developed a Tour in the Balkans to meet people, record music with them, make and album, do arts, use colors, bodypaiting and performances and make a documentary!!

The name of the album is SEEDS, at each stage of our journey we will meet with talented and true artists, we will record them playing, we will jam together, and collect a huge repertoire of sounds and samples. Once back in Italy we will produce the music album.

The name of the documentary is I PLAY WITH MOZART: each human has a talent and with the tour we want to discover these talets and do arts with them. Arts will be not only music (and the album SEEDS) but paiting, theater, performances.

We will meet the people in the cities, at the country sides, in monasteries (Kloster), in the refugee camps... everywhere!

With this tour we want to cross the Balkans and mark a map of hope and beauty.

We will go through Italy, Slovenia, Austria, Hungary, Romania, Serbia, Bulgaria, Macedonia and Greece.

Part of the budget will be used to buy photo and video camera, canvas, brushes, colors, musical instrumets to bring to the people in the refugee camps. We will teach them how to use these tools and ask them to send to us photos and videos. AlphaArt will then realize a photo book with the pictures from the refugees.

The journey will take about 30 days heading down to Greece where we will give a big event where artists from all over the world are invited to join.

We want to realize a documentary about this journey, about this period of time, our dreams and about how arts can easily connect people to each others. We will do it with music, paint, dance, poetry and film making.

We need to buy a camper, set up a basic music studio inside for the recordings, with us 2 DOP/videomaker will come and document the journey to then cut the documentary I PLAY WITH MOZART that will be then distribuited in Film Festivals and Cinemas.

At each stage of our journey we will plant an APPLE TREE.

You can support us in 2 ways:

- join us during the tour at any stage on the balkan route

- donate money to the project to support our tour (camper, fuel, food, production of the music album and the documentary).
story_txt: Questa campagna é finita con successo!! grazie!!visita la nuova campagna clicca qui!! ITALIANOIl sogno è di dare un diverso punto di vista della Rotta Balcanica che è oggi famosa come un viaggio pieno di sfide attraverso barriere, campi profughi, esseri umani che cambiano i loro nomi in rifugiati.Con questo tour noi vogliamo attraversare i Balcani e segnare una mappa che unisce genti e culture attraverso la musica e l'arte.Attraverseremo Italia, Slovenia, Austria, Ungheria, Romania, Serbia, Bulgaria, Macedonia e alla fine Grecia. Ad ogni tappa, in circa 30 giorni, incontreremo persone nei campi di rifugiati, persone delle città che visiteremo, faremo loro delle interviste e suoneremo musica con loro, useremo il colore per dipingere il grigiore, la musica per riaccendere sorrisi. story:
Who Am I?

Hello there, I'm Matt Santora and I'm a senior at Brooklyn College.  I'm shooting my thesis film this semester and I need your help!

My story is about a young man, Hank, who can't seem to find "the one". Until one day he stumbles upon a lonely goldfish, thus beginning an awkward and funny love story like never seen before. This story dives into the glorious feelings of a new relationship, and their struggles. 

Comedy is my passion. I've dabbled with stand-up many times.

Over the years, I've been studying comedic films to perfect my own work.  

I guarantee this film will make you laugh. 

With your generous donations, I can bring this short story to life. 

What We Need & What You Get

I'm looking to raise $3,000.

With this money, I'll be able to make this film the way I believe is best.

Filmmaking, unfortunately, is a very expensive process.   

The money raised will go to:

  • Camera Equipment:  Various lenses, a dolly, a tripod, follow focus, and monitors. 
  • Food for cast & crew: I have to make sure my cast and crew have good meals on set. 
  • Transportation: Renting trucks so we can easily transport gear and crew. 
  • Wardrobe & Set Design: This film will play with various colors, so we can evoke emotions. 
  • Paying Actors: I want to be able to pay my actors for their time.

I plan on having various perks for you! 

Such as:

  • Personal thank you email, from yours truly. 
  • Personal thank you video, from yours truly. 
  • A copy of the script.
  • Your name in the credits of the film. 
  • A poster for the film, which is being crafted by a local artist. 

If I don't reach my goal, I would have to cut many things from my budget. I would have to cut out getting better camera equipment. This would make my film seem less cinematic.  

Why This Is Important:

My dream has always been to be a comedian. I'm very passionate about writing and directing films. Which I've done over the years at Brooklyn College studying film production. 

With this film, I plan on sending it to as many festivals as I can. I want this project to jump start my career in the film business. Filmmaking is a very tough business to get into. I'm taking this project very seriously, so this film can be as successful as possible.

With your help, this dream can become a reality. 

Other Ways You Can Help:

Share this link, the more traffic the better!

Thank you so much for your time! I will keep everyone posted once we begin filming in May.

story:
Story:

Even If It Kills Me, is a coming of age fantasy drama about a young man named Daniel, who at a young age discovered that he has the power to revive people and bring that back from the dead. At the beginning of the film we learn that Daniel's mother is dying of cancer and Daniel is struggling with the notion of reviving her or allowing her to die like she requests. 

Inspired by fantastical stories grounded in reality, this film examines the internal and external struggles of a teen juggling much more than social events and high school exams. A successful campaign will allow us to bring to life a story that will explore and provoke one's notions of the bond between parent and child.

Why this Campaign is Important:

This campaign is extremely vital to us being able to tell our story. Without contributions this movie will not being able to exist. Raising these funds to tell this very personal story is so important to everyone on the team because we all believe in the power of film and how one story could affect the lives of another. With our film, we would like to send a clear and loud message that you don’t have to go through life alone. Even when it may feel that way.

Cast

Behind the Scenes

  • Director: Chris Dickerson
  • Writers: Joseph McDaniel and Chris Dickerson
  • Producers: Creshanna Thomas, Joseph McDaniel, and Chris Dickerson
  • Director of Photography: Alex Walker

https://alexwalker.co

Production:

Production will take place in and around Austin, TX at the end of June over the course of 3 days. We know this is a quick shoot and we understand the challenges that come along with it. Fortunately we have assembled an amazing cast and an outstanding production team who are committed to bringing this film to life. 

What We Need 

We have meticulously dedicating every dollar to an area of production for this film. It’s imperative that we raise the money to be able to shoot this movie.

  • CAST and CREW
  • EQUIPMENT
  • GRIP/GAFFER PACKAGE
  • PRODUCTION DESIGN
  • ART DIRECTION
  • MEALS/CRAFT SERVICES
  • LOCATIONS/PERMITS
  • INSURANCE
  • POST PRODUCTION
  • FESTIVAL SUBMISSIONS

Risks & Challenges

With any film project especially one as ambitious as this one there are going to be some risks and challenges associated with it like,  

1. Not being able to get the desired "shot" because of time constraints or budgetary concerns. We have a shot list and are confident in the look and feel of the film and will need every dollar to make this a reality while not compromising on the vision. 

2. We could very well run out of money and be unable to finish the film at the quality that we know this film deserves. This story needs to be told and if we don't hit our goal or run out of money we would end up making a movie that does not live up to the idea's full potential. 

3. Lastly is motivation, this is not solely contingent upon the campaign but does go hand in hand, in that if we don't hit our goal we may have people working harder and longer than they were paid to. While everyone feels passionately about this film you ultimately would like to keep enthusiasm high and hearts in lined to finish the film the right way.  

Shooting a short film on a small budget over the course of 3 days seems like a simple and common task but we can assure that it’s not. It takes dedication and careful thought to achieve a good story in a short amount of time. We can guarantee that with your help, donations, and support, we will get this done. The script is fairly simple and in the writing of it we have tried to make sure this film is easy to shoot given our time table and window of opportunity. The locations are minimal and so is the shot listing. We have assembled a great production team who will work quickly to get what we need on the locations and make it look amazing.

If you would like to donate, please check out the column on the right side of this page for more information, and some cool incentives as a small offering for your generosity. Every dollar towards our goal helps.

Thanks for checking out our campaign and reading our story. Making it this far is truly appreciated.

Other Ways You Can Help

Aside from raising funds this campaign is about building an audience and creating awareness.

The more people we reach - the better chance we have of hitting our campaign goal. This is important because we are all Daniel, people granted with extraordinary power who have to make difficult choices on a daily basis

Please help by sharing our story on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and all social media networks.

https://igg.me/at/evenif

story:
The Go-Girls tells the story of Amelia Beckett, Goddess of Discord, who has tried to hide her immense power from the world. Unfortunately for her, she goes on what she believes is an ordinary job interview, which turns out to be for a super hero team. What ensues is a crazy adventure that pits The Go-Girls against Amelia's evil (or sometimes evil) sister who is on a spree of destruction against Los Angeles. It's up to the Go-Girls to save the day, if they don't end up killing each other first!

Our complete film budget is $200,000 being produced under a SAG-AFTRA Ultra Low Budget Agreement (Not New Media. I was really excited).  The funding goal covers the production costs and we'll need to make over that goal for post-production.  We need to pay all the actors, the crew, the director, the producers, and cover camera equipment, locations and insurance, among many other expenses.  While we plan to approach potential investors, we will probably get most of our funds through crowdfunding.

We will also be showing interviews with the other cast, exclusive on-set footage, and other updates as they happen.

Our production team includes award-winning director and cinematographer, Jose Zambrano Cassella and our cast includes Sierra Kane, Karen Schuback, Victoria Levine, and Sapna Kumar as Pyrotechnic Girl #1, as well as Anna Sahlstrom playing the lead role of Amelia.

story:
Teaser Trailer

What you need to know:

We need your help. To be more exact, we need your support to raise $4,000!!!

 

We called in a lot of favors and cut together the above trailer with what we were able to shoot so far! Imagine what we can do if we had the full $4K! As you can see, we are passionate about filmmaking, so let's make this happen and get Thinking of the West made!

 

Who we are, and why we created Thinking of the West:

Thinking of the West is a project created by New Jersey based filmmakers, Nnamdi Simon and Zerabruk Cavallaro.  The project was originally intended to be part of the AT&T Short Film Challenge, but do to time restraints to tell the best story and running low on funds to support the project;  it was decided to halt production..  The momentary pause will allow fundraising efforts production cost & post-production) to assist in the completion of the project. Thinking of the West, is a roller coaster ride filled with comedy, suspense and drama. In the film, we watch the separate lives of our characters collide in interweaving stories of race, loss and redemption. Thinking of the West, plays as a linear narrative, but on a deeper level, the film draws commentary on current  race and domestic issues surrounding our country.  As African-American filmmakers, Thinking of the West was created out of necessity to use the voice of Nnamdi Simon and Zerabruk Cavallaro to creatively tell the story of the harsh realities that effects many minorities and their personal stories.

( Director Nnamdi Simon checking the frame while on set of TOTW)

Meet the Cast:


Michael Oloyede: is a London born, Southern raised, New York City based actor. Off Broadway credits include: Black Angels Over Tuskegee (St Luke’s Theater), Bella Napoli (Gallery Players), Chokehold (14 St. Y), Their Eyes Were Watching God (Wow Theater). Films and TV credits include Silent Morning, Curtis, and Michael currently stars as the lead in the web-series Brooklyn Blue Sky. Oloyede received training from the Stella Adler Studio of Acting in New York City.

Rasaki Are:  Rasaki B Are Jr. (born October 16,1990) is an American actor, producer, and model. Rasaki first debut was in  "A Criticism” in 2014. In addition, to acting Rasaki has became a Senior sales manager with his tenure with Red Payments, Rasaki has always inspired to become an actor in his journey of life, and now with his preparation, finally meeting the opportunity to work with director Nnamdi Simon he can play a supporting role in "Thinking Of The West".

Don Jenkins: is a classically trained actor, born and raised in Baltimore, MD. He studied acting/theatre history at UMBC (BFA) and at The Chicago College For The Performing Arts (MFA). He starred as the titular character in the stage version of The Wiz with the Eubie Blake Theatre in Baltimore, MD. While in Chicago he appeared in A View From The Bridge with the American Theatre Company, as well as The Legend Of Annie Christmas at ETA. He was proud to land his first tv role in a military commercial that aired overseas. This led to a blockbuster voiceover gig with a popular soft drink company that aired during the NBA all-star game, and it made him a union actor in 2008. During his brief stay in LA he starred in a number of stage plays and indie films. Over the last five years in NYC he has appeared in twelve stage plays, worked on two tv pilots, and starred in five films. He just finished up work on the Indie film, Connected, which is set to hit the festival circuit this year. He is excited to be able to add to his resume the film, Thinking of the West, because of its social awareness. Don would like to thank God, his mother, family, friends, Nnamdi, Z, as well as the rest of the cast and crew from Thinking of the West.

Rob Figueroa: Born Roberto Figueroa II. Born in Riviera, Florida. Has 3 sisters and 1 brother. He's best known for his role on King of The Jungle working along side T.C. Stallings. Graduated from SUNY New Paltz with a BA degree in Performing Arts, the alma mater of John Turturro. Has studied with the William Esper Studios.

Ed Glynn: is a New York City based actor. Off Broadway credits include: The Hour (GetWrite Entertainment), Second Seat (2016 Winner of Best Play at Venus Adonis Film Festival, Hudson Guild Theatre), Victoria Woodhull (Theatre New City-NYC. Thomas Jacoby Applause Applause Vol. X Issue 6 2016 review; "Glynn's (character) is brilliantly portrayed radiating power, charisma & villainy in equal parts."Ed is currently filming "Mandated", a webseries,  feature film, "Missouri Loves Company" and "Thinking of The West". Ed's other film credits include: "Nail In The Coffin", "The Dirty Kind", "Weight of The Pen", "He Belongs To Us", "Everyone Knows McGee", "Stiff" and "Pretty Girl." Ed is in "Shattered", 101 Simmons episode-Discovery Channel-true crimes. Ed has appeared in healthcare & pancreatic cancer commercials. Ed received classical and method acting training from the Royal Shakespeare Company and minored in drama in college.

( Producer & Co-Director Zerabruk Cavallaro rehearsing the scene with actors.)

Synopsis:: A victimized middle-aged woman Mrs. West seeks revenge on her abusive husband. Her murderous plot takes an unexpected turn when she meets a conflicted black male AJ and his friends on a highway gas station. 

What we need:

Our budget goal is $4,000. We passionately believe this story deserves to be displayed at major festivals and a fighting chance to compete globally. With your assistance and pledge today, the sky is truly the limit on what can become of Thinking of the West. We are asking for your help in reaching our budget goal.  Any amount counts and will go along way.  Whether it's a tiny bit to stay in the loop and see the process of what's happening with Thinking of the West, or a few more bucks to flex your producer muscles! Don’t worry we have some cool perks included to show our appreciation. 

Risks & Challenges:

1/3 of the film has been completed with self investments, because as they say the greatest investment is one that you put on yourself.. We are aware of the challenges and the need to grow and adapt during the creative process. The risks of independent filmmaking are lack of funding, minimal resources, and the FAIR compensation of actors and crew. By pledging funds to this project, you will help us get on the way to achieve our goal.

How do we find success?

How do we find success? With originality, proper itemized budgeting, deferring payments to the creative team, utilizing locations we already have access to, and trusting in each others' abilities to get the job done right!

Other Ways You Can Help:

Please share, share, and share our campaign with your friends, family and colleagues! Like us on Facebook, share the trailer, tweet it out, and share this page. You can find us on IMDb and Email us if you have any questions!

IMDb: http://www.imdb.com/title/tt7038896/?ref_=fn_al_tt_1

Link to Trailer: https://vimeo.com/nnamdisimon/totwteaser

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/thinkingofthewest

Instagram: @_thinkingofthewest

Email: morelikethismedia@gmail.com
story_txt: Teaser TrailerWhat you need to know:We need your help. To be more exact, we need your support to raise $4,000!!! We called in a lot of favors and cut together the above trailer with what we were able to shoot so far! Imagine what we can do if we had the full $4K! As you can see, we are passionate about filmmaking, so let's make this happen and get Thinking of the West made! Who we are, and why we created Thinking of the West:Thinking of the West is a project created by New Jersey based filmmakers, Nnamdi Simon and Zerabruk Cavallaro.  The project was originally intended to be part of the AT&T Short Film Challenge, but do to time restraints to tell the best story and running low on funds to support the project;  it was decided to halt production..  The momentary pause will allow fundraising efforts production cost & post-production) to assist in the completion of the project. Thinking of the West, is a roller coaster ride filled with comedy, suspense and drama. In the film, we watch the separate lives of our characters collide in interweaving stories of race, loss and redemption. Thinking of the West, plays as a linear narrative, but on a deeper level, the film draws commentary on current  race and domestic issues surrounding our country.  As African-American filmmakers, Thinking of the West was created out of necessity to use the voice of Nnamdi Simon and Zerabruk Cavallaro to creatively tell the story of the harsh realities that effects many minorities and their personal stories.( Director Nnamdi Simon checking the frame while on set of TOTW)Meet the Cast:Michael Oloyede: is a London born, Southern raised, New York City based actor. Off Broadway credits include: Black Angels Over Tuskegee (St Luke’s Theater), Bella Napoli (Gallery Players), Chokehold (14 St. Y), Their Eyes Were Watching God (Wow Theater). Films and TV credits include Silent Morning, Curtis, and Michael currently stars as the lead in the web-series Brooklyn Blue Sky. Oloyede received training from the Stella Adler Studio of Acting in New York City.Rasaki Are:  Rasaki B Are Jr. (born October 16,1990) is an American actor, producer, and model. Rasaki first debut was in  "A Criticism” in 2014. In addition, to acting Rasaki has became a Senior sales manager with his tenure with Red Payments, Rasaki has always inspired to become an actor in his journey of life, and now with his preparation, finally meeting the opportunity to work with director Nnamdi Simon he can play a supporting role in "Thinking Of The West".Don Jenkins: is a classically trained actor, born and raised in Baltimore, MD. He studied acting/theatre history at UMBC (BFA) and at The Chicago College For The Performing Arts (MFA). He starred as the titular character in the stage version of The Wiz with the Eubie Blake Theatre in Baltimore, MD. While in Chicago he appeared in A View From The Bridge with the American Theatre Company, as well as The Legend Of Annie Christmas at ETA. He was proud to land his first tv role in a military commercial that aired overseas. This led to a blockbuster voiceover gig with a popular soft drink company that aired during the NBA all-star game, and it made him a union actor in 2008. During his brief stay in LA he starred in a number of stage plays and indie films. Over the last five years in NYC he has appeared in twelve stage plays, worked on two tv pilots, and starred in five films. He just finished up work on the Indie film, Connected, which is set to hit the festival circuit this year. He is excited to be able to add to his resume the film, Thinking of the West, because of its social awareness. Don would like to thank God, his mother, family, friends, Nnamdi, Z, as well as the rest of the cast and crew from Thinking of the West.Rob Figueroa: Born Roberto Figueroa II. Born in Riviera, Florida. Has 3 sisters and 1 brother. He's best known for his role on King of The Jungle working along side T.C. Stallings. Graduated from SUNY New Paltz with a BA degree in Performing Arts, the alma mater of John Turturro. Has studied with the William Esper Studios.Ed Glynn: is a New York City based actor. Off Broadway credits include: The Hour (GetWrite Entertainment), Second Seat (2016 Winner of Best Play at Venus Adonis Film Festival, Hudson Guild Theatre), Victoria Woodhull (Theatre New City-NYC. Thomas Jacoby Applause Applause Vol. X Issue 6 2016 review; "Glynn's (character) is brilliantly portrayed radiating power, charisma & villainy in equal parts."Ed is currently filming "Mandated", a webseries,  feature film, "Missouri Loves Company" and "Thinking of The West". Ed's other film credits include: "Nail In The Coffin", "The Dirty Kind", "Weight of The Pen", "He Belongs To Us", "Everyone Knows McGee", "Stiff" and "Pretty Girl." Ed is in "Shattered", 101 Simmons episode-Discovery Channel-true crimes. Ed has appeared in healthcare & pancreatic cancer commercials. Ed received classical and method acting training from the Royal Shakespeare Company and minored in drama in college.( Producer & Co-Director Zerabruk Cavallaro rehearsing the scene with actors.)Synopsis:: A victimized middle-aged woman Mrs. West seeks revenge on her abusive husband. Her murderous plot takes an unexpected turn when she meets a conflicted black male AJ and his friends on a highway gas station. What we need:Our budget goal is $4,000. We passionately believe this story deserves to be displayed at major festivals and a fighting chance to compete globally. With your assistance and pledge today, the sky is truly the limit on what can become of Thinking of the West. We are asking for your help in reaching our budget goal.  Any amount counts and will go along way.  Whether it's a tiny bit to stay in the loop and see the process of what's happening with Thinking of the West, or a few more bucks to flex your producer muscles! Don’t worry we have some cool perks included to show our appreciation. Risks & Challenges:1/3 of the film has been completed with self investments, because as they say the greatest investment is one that you put on yourself.. We are aware of the challenges and the need to grow and adapt during the creative process. The risks of independent filmmaking are lack of funding, minimal resources, and the FAIR compensation of actors and crew. By pledging funds to this project, you will help us get on the way to achieve our goal.How do we find success? How do we find success? With originality, proper itemized budgeting, deferring payments to the creative team, utilizing locations we already have access to, and trusting in each others' abilities to get the job done right!Other Ways You Can Help:Please share, share, and share our campaign with your friends, family and colleagues! Like us on Facebook, share the trailer, tweet it out, and share this page. story:
Short Summary

CALICO QUEENS will be the western "short of shorts". We intend to create a project that is so large in scale, fast in pace, visually stunning, classically entertaining, and fun, that it simply must be turned into a feature. With names such as Danny Trejo and Raphael Sbarge attached to our cast, we are already well on our way to making this happen. 

Our project will target the renown film festivals with hopes of top awards, rotation, and most of all, enough notoriety and traction to spark interest from top tier production companies interested in helping us BRING BACK THE WESTERN -- but with a twist. 

What We Need & What You Get

Thus far, we have been fortunate enough to fund well over half of our film's budget. But now, we need your help for that final push. Westerns ain't cheap- Historically  accurate attire, weapons, VFX, furniture, and the towns themselves are not easy to come by. We have and will be putting an incredible amount of labor into this film! 

Our goal is to raise 12,000 USD to add to our final budget. By donating in any capacity you are helping one of the hungriest teams in Los Angeles bring a new spin to the world of short films and Westerns alike. Your help could be the difference we need to create an award winning short film and realizing our goal of a full feature film. 

Finally, if you're wondering about perks, check out the perks section... Jeez- cool stuff.  I would however like to add, that our emails have been posted, and we welcome ANY personal questions of interest or information needed for clarification. Please do not hesitate. 

If you intend to help us today, your help will not be forgotten tomorrow...

Other Ways You Can Help

If you like what you've seen thus far, but don't currently have the means to donate, there are plenty of other ways to help! Simply sharing this page on your social media or with your close friends and family is invaluable! Don't forget Indiegogo's share tools! These are also a great way to get the word out. 

Thanks again everyone, we truly appreciate your time and energy from the bottom of our hearts,

The Calico Queens team.

story:
My Story

In 2015, I was diagnosed with Hodgkin's Lymphoma. At only 22, my invincible life as I knew it drastically changed. Something people don't tell you when you're sick, is how to navigate "giving the news." When you tell someone you have cancer, people show their kindness in surprising ways. Sometimes people made me laugh, sometimes (unbeknownst to them) they made me more self conscious than I've ever been in my life, and sometimes... sometimes it got weird. In the two years since, I have been writing and planning this film. Memento Mori is my own catalogue of those conversations, and serves as my strange love letter to those who supported me during those trying times.

- Anna

Budget Breakdown

  • Camera Rental: $1500
    • Includes Camera Package ($800), Lenses ($400), Hard drives to record and store footage ($300)
  • Grip and Lighting Gear: $2000
    • Includes rental costs of Dolly & Track ($800), Lights x4 ($300 per light)
  • On set Makeup Specialist/Cancer Costume: $1000
    • Cancer costume to be custom designed and crafted by makeup specialist
  • On Set Art and Blood Effects: $500
    • Includes wardrobe for actors, props
  • Post Production Editor: $1000
  • Post Visual/Special Effects: $2500
    • Covers 1-2 weeks with a SFX artist for post effects
  • Craft Services: $250
  • Promotion/Festival Submission Fees: $1000
  • Honorarium for 30 actors: $1800
  • Honorarium for 9 crew members: $900
  • Location Permit: $200
  • Insurance: $500
  • Contingency Fund (15% of total): $1972

Total Budget: $15 122

The Impact

  • The producers of this film are not taking any profit from the campaign. The proposed budget is created with the sole focus of enhancing the story, and respecting the time of the professionals we hire. All of which will be local artists.
  • Q: Why are there special effects on a film recalling human interactions, and why does it cost so much? A: Without giving too much away, one of the characters is Cancer itself. We felt that in conjunction with a great costume, post production special effects would flesh out the gritty details to make Cancer look the way it feels. Our proposal of $2500 would cover 1-2 weeks with a SFX artist, ensuring the quality of our monster will roll your stomach, not your eyes.
  • 25% of contributions of $250 or more will be donated to the Canadian Cancer Foundation. 
  • The beanie perk is the same type of beanie Anna wore during her treatment. They will be hand crafted by Anna herself, and she will be donating some to the Canadian Cancer Foundation regardless of campaign success. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Thank you for taking the time to be a part of our passion. Please share this page with your friends and family and help us get the word out.

It would mean the world to us.

-Anna, Ryan, Charles

story:
Overview

Over the past three years, I've been immensely blessed with the opportunity to devote myself to the art of filmmaking. In that time, I like to think that I've grown from a headstrong and (from time to time) overly-ambitious kid to a capable and passionate director. It hasn't been an easy journey, and, like any, has its fair share of triumphs and failures- each coming with a new lesson about what it means to be a storyteller. Now, it's time to put all that to the test with my Senior Thesis Film, a project which will serve as the culmination of everything I've learned as a writer and director.

The film itself follows young soldier who's only just returned to the States after being wounded overseas. Hailed by his colleagues as a war hero, he's been assigned to the position of Casualty Notification Offer- a job which, our hero soon finds, is the most difficult on Earth. Charged with delivering the worst news imaginable to families of fallen soldiers, the young veteran finds himself in over his head, and utterly fails in his first attempt. Now, his job and reputation on the line, he must find a way to cope with the horrors of his job. When one fallen soldier's story hits especially close to home, the newly appointed- and soon to be demoted- CNO realizes that there may yet be a way to continue his duties.

A roughly 25 minute drama, "Private Barry" does not feature any grand setpieces or complex moving  shots. Rather, most of the action takes place on an emotional level- as characters grapple with the sheer terror of learning of a loved one's demise. Over the past few months, I've worked tirelessly to develop a screenplay that I think will do this story justice, as well as assemble a cast capable of handling such difficult emotions. Well, the time has finally come to commence full scale production on the film- but I cannot do it alone.

Like any film worth watching, "Private Barry" is set to be an expensive endeavor. With more talented actors comes the need to pay them properly, and procuring authentic military costumes is no cheap task. Most of the money that I raise will go toward these two categories- both of which are essential to maintaining the authenticity and drama of the film. The rest will go towards typical film expenses- food for the cast and crew, location costs, and the purchase of props. 

As a college student, there is simply no way that I can pay for these expenses on my own... which is why I need your help. A donation of any level goes farther than you can possibly imagine, and I promise to deliver a final product that is worthy of every cent. With your help, "Private Barry," will make its festival debut in the summer of 2018, where I sincerely hope it will move and inspire audiences, and perhaps open a conversation about what it truly means to be a hero.

 

Thank you!

story:
CHECK OUT OUR TEASER NOW!!

 

Los Angeles, Come Hang Out With Us!

On July 29th, Tony Moran, Genevieve Graves(Writer/Actress), Matthew Vinaja(Director/ Co-Writer), Nadia Nosferatu(Hair & Make Up/ SPFX Assistant), Allie Arsenic and Sabrina Seance("Creature" Characters) will be signing FREE movie posters!

 

The Budget:

The funds will be going to is paying our actors, camera operator, gaffer, producers, crafty, post production, location and marketing. As we all know, making a good quality film isn't cheap and so we are hiring the BEST OF THE BEST!

Why Donate With Us:

One aspect about this film that makes it special is its made by fans for fans. Everybody involved in this project is a huge Horror fan and understand what is to be expected, which offers the viewers a great experience!

The Perks:

What we are offering in return for your donations are items that movie lovers will really appreciate! Not only are we offering stickers, shirts, signed posters and producer credits, but also actual props, wardrobe from the film and a walk on "Creature" role as well!!

The Future:

Our first film "Toothless"is currently successfully going through the film festival circuit. So far with 3 film festival acceptances, 1 finalist award and "Best Costume" award, we are a proven production company that puts 100% in everything we do. Our films are passion projects and we love every second of what we do. Our crew is giving everything they have to put this film together. We hope the future of this film is more Film Festival acceptances and will bring us to a city near you for a screening! 

Closing Statement:

The main reason we are having this campaign go for the full 60 days is for you to take this journey step by step with us. We shoot this film on August 12th so we will be showing you every step of the way. From Pre Production, On Set Production to Post Production. We are going to show you exactly what the money is going to! Please take a chance on us, I promise we wont let you down! Please use the indiegogo share tools to help spread the word! We look forward to showing you our film!

Thank you!

story:
The opening scene of 'All In' is now available to watch on this page.

 

Please watch the scene, share the campaign and donate what you can to support our project. 

 

All In is a short film about a gambling addict called Ash. Based on a true story and set over the course of a night at a private poker game, the film tells the story of a man whose addiction has left him at rock bottom, in a web of lies too deep to maintain. The aim of the project is to raise awareness for the plight of gambling addiction in a country and era in which problem gamblers are endlessly encouraged to continue their habit. We're aiming to raise £3,000 to tell this story as effectively as possible.

 

All In

Based on a true story and set over a single night, All In, revolves around Ash (Tony Fadil), a gambling addict, taking the last of his money to a late night private poker game. Ash is in his early forties; he's been married for ten years and has two children, aged nine and seven. Over the course of his marriage, his addiction to gambling has grown exponentially and drastically effected his personal life. Over the years, he’s lost tens of thousands at bookies, casinos and poker games. A year ago, after Ash lost his job in sales due to poor attendance, he vowed to overcome his addiction after his wife issued an ultimatum and threatened to leave him and take the kids. For a while, Ash managed to stay away from temptation through a job on an off-shore oil rig, but began secretly gambling again, quitting his job in the process due to unpaid debts to several colleagues. To maintain his wife’s perceptions of his new lifestyle, Ash has recently been sleeping in his car during the weeks she expects him to be working. He spends his days at various bookies and attends a private poker game a few nights a week hosted by a man name Aaron (Alan Calton). In the five years that Ash has been attending Aaron’s game, he’s lost thousands to him. Aaron regularly calls Ash and jovially invites him along to the games, informing him about supposedly poor players likely to be in attendance. Ash knows that Aaron perceives him as easy money but is ever-determined to win against his rival, willing, even, to risk everything to attempt to do so.

 

The Team

Writer, Director and Producer

Oliver James Spalding

Oliver James Spalding is a Norwich-based filmmaker whose work focuses on people on the outskirts of society. Oliver studied Film at Kingston University, graduating in 2014 with a First Class bachelor’s degree. His most recent film ‘Positive’ garnered favourable reviews and feedback, appearing in film festivals in the UK, USA and India. Passionate about the practice of filmmaking, Oliver writes, directs and produces fiction and documentary films, and works as a freelance videographer, providing content for a variety of clients across East Anglia and beyond.

 

Cast 

Tony Fadil (Ash)

Tony Fadil is an actor and producer from Essex. He is best known for his roles in I Am Hooligan, Rise of The Footsoldier 3 and TV series Burnt Toast. In 2016 he appeared alongside Stevi Ritchie in his TV show Stevi Ritchie Takes On Essex. Throughout the last ten years, Tony has been involved in corporate work, live and interactive television, and short and feature films, as both an actor and a producer. Tony views his work in film and television as a passion and is completely dedicated to the lifestyle it brings.

Alan Calton (Aaron)

Alan Calton is an actor from Norfolk, best known for his roles in Austenland (2013), In the Name of Ben Hur (2016) and The Pugilist (2017). Alan’s focus has always been on acting for film and television and he has experience in both feature length and short films. Committed to the art of performance, Alan describes himself as happiest when reading interesting scripts and developing a character.

Ryan Enever (Stones)

Ryan Enever is an actor and writer who originates from East London. After years of different career paths, Ryan found his passion in the entertainment industry after auditioning at The Liverpool Institute of Performing Arts, where he later received a degree. Ryan is the co-owner of award-winning production company, 3 Takes Productions and has written, produced and acted in several of their projects.  

Andy Turner (Tony)

Andy Turner is an actor, producer and director who originates from Derbyshire. Andy became involved in acting and directing in his early 40's after careers that included the Royal Air Force, a police officer and self-employment within the media industry. He is best known for The Guardian, The Last Day and the award-winning comedy web-series Stragglers. Andy is also co-owner of award-winning production company, 3 Takes Productions.

Rob Backhouse (Barry)

Rob Backhouse has been performing in amateur theatre for thirty years, appearing in drama, comedy, Shakespeare adaptations and pantomime. In 2015, Rob made his on-screen acting debut in the music video for the single, ‘Fear’ by indie rock group, Keep Up. Rob has recently taken early retirement and is very keen to extend his acting experience to include roles in films.

Adrian Annis (Mark)

Adrian Annis is an actor from Camden Town, London, known for his roles in Survivors (2015), Art of Darkness (2012) and Incorporated (2010). Adrian also played a Death Eater in Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part One (2010) and has appeared in over eighty films over the past twelve years.

Hollie Harrington-Ball (Ash’s wife)

Hollie Harrington studied Drama and Media at Queen Mary's University, London, and enrolled in film production courses after graduating. She has been working full time in freelance video production and photography since 2008, working with non-profits and NGOs to help them to promote their important work. Hollie has recently decided to return to acting and has appeared in a handful of projects for the stage and screen.

 

Director of Photography and Camera Operator

Phil Rhodes

Phil Rhodes is a camera operator from Suffolk who has previously worked for the BBC and ITV. He has made a number of short films and has a degree in Film Production from Norwich University of the Arts. As well as producing moving images Phil is a keen landscape photographer and when he’s not working he’s kept busy with his three young children.

Editor and Colourist 

Michal Zak

A Computing Science graduate whose inner drive for crafting narratives and audio-visual experiences has found him editing pretty much every possible type of video content. As Head of Editing, Graphics and Workflow at UEA:TV, Michal worked on award-winning music videos, documentaries and factual pieces. As well as cutting short films, Michal has also created numerous intro sequences, trailers and promotional videos. He is interested in motion graphics and audio/video post-production and has worked as an editor on previous FreshFix Pictures projects including Unpacked  and Positive. In his limited spare time Michal rambles online and produces short videos on film analysis. 

Production Sound Mixers 

Freya Clarke

After studying sound at degree level, Freya Clarke began working as a boom operator for a professional sound recordist. From there she received the relevant training to become a freelance sound recordist. She has worked on a multitude of productions within the film industry, particularly short film, commercial and corporate productions. Freya takes pride in her attention to detail and precision when recording sound for film and consistently ensures that she records over and above what is required for post-production.

Sebastian Jansen

Sebastian has over 25 years of sound engineering experience working within radio television and film. He has worked on various types of production including music, drama, factual and large scale outside broadcast events. He has a MA in Moving Image and Sound from Norwich University of the Arts.

Chief Lighting Technician and Key Grip

Moyses Gomes

Moyses Gomes is an artist from Rio de Janiero, Brazil who works with a variety of visual media. He studied Fine Art with specialisation in Artistic Painting but became increasingly interested in photography and filmmaking during his time at university. Moyses has made several short films in Brazil and worked as the cinematographer on Positive.

Production Designer and Location Manager

Will Spalding

Will Spalding graduated from City College Norwich in 2014 with a Foundation Diploma in Media and Art. Will worked as Co-producer and Casting Director on Positive  and has previously worked on multiple independent documentary projects. 

Score Composer

Sergei Istrati 

Sergei Istrati, a recent graduate of the Royal College of Music, is a Latvian composer and musician, best known for his work in the Sergei Istrati trio. As a young boy, Sergei studied classical music at P.Jurjana Music School. After graduation, he moved to the UK and continued his studies at Leeds College of Music where he received his diploma in Jazz Piano. During that time, he created his first jazz band with whom he performs, across the UK. Sergei also composed a wonderfully moving score for Positive  which cleverly mirrored the visual tone and themes of the film.

 

How you can help

  • We’re looking to raise £3000 to tell this story as effectively as possible.
  • We want All In to look and sound great which requires an array of talented individuals and professional equipment.
  • We also want to ensure that we’ve got funding to distribute the film prior to its completion as festival entries can be very costly.
  • Be sure to spread the word about our campaign and check out the variety of perks on offer to see how you can get involved and help us reach our goal.
  • All donations are highly appreciated so thank you very much in advance.

 

The breakdown below outlines exactly how your donations will be spent.

 

Equipment and crew

Approximately a third of our budget will be spent on professional filmmaking equipment and a crew to operate it. This is key to achieving the desired look and feel of All In.

Travel expenses

£250 will be spent on reimbursing the transport costs of the cast and crew, who are based all over the East Anglia region, as they travel to and from set.

Refreshments

£150 to provide the cast and crew with food, water and hot drinks while on set.

Locations

Roughly £350 is required to hire out some of the shooting locations and create authentic-looking sets within them.

Post-production

£450 will be reserved for a variety of post-production requirements.

Festival submissions

£650 will be used to enter All In into the festival circuit and seek distribution.

Premiere screening

£150 will be reserved for a premiere screening event at a cinema, tickets for which are available as donation perks.

 

If, by the end of the Indiegogo crowdfunding campaign, we have not met our target of £3,000, we will still divide the funds in close accordance with the pie chart, hence the inclusion of percentages within the graphic.

 

Perks for donating

We have a series of perks for different amounts donated. They include:

 

£5: A download file of All In after completion.

£10: A download file of All In after completion and a Special Thanks credit.

£25: A ticket to the premiere screening of All In and all other above perks.

£50: A chance to be involved in the film. Contribute dialogue to the film or appear as an extra. Plus, all other above perks.

£100: A credit in the film as an Indiegogo Producer. Plus, all other above perks.

£200: Executive Producer role, with film and IMDB credit. Plus, all other above perks.

£400: Producer, with film and IMDB credit. Plus, all other above perks.

 

The impact

By donating to this campaign, you will not only help a group of independent and ambitious creatives realise a vision, but will also help raise awareness for problem gambling, an issue that is severely underrepresented in the media’s discourse about addiction. The aim of the film is to provoke thought and discussion about this issue.

Gambling addiction

  • Most people gamble at some point in their lives, but for some gambling can become a serious addiction
  • For approximately 1% of UK gamblers, betting and playing games to win money can become a serious addiction, which can spiral out of control and affect their professional and social lives.
  • Around 350,000 people in the UK are suffering from a gambling addiction.
  • In recent years, the number of people experiencing problems with gambling has increased due to economic troubles associated with the global recession and an increase in the number of gambling outlets.
  • It is now easier than ever before to gamble, with a huge number of online betting shops and games sites enabling people to gamble 24 hours a day. Every year, over 7 billion pounds is spent on gambling.
  • The clear majority of people who could be classed as problem gamblers do not seek help for their addiction.
  • NHS statistics show that only around 5 percent of people seek help and only 1 percent get treatment for their gambling problem.
  • If a gambling problem is left to develop, debts can spiral out of control and people can become withdrawn and depressed, which can affect their professional lives and relationships with other people.
  • Gambling is very addictive; the adrenaline rush associated with the possibility of pulling off a big win is often described by gamblers as an unbeatable feeling.
  • The possibility of a win is extremely enticing to problem gamblers and they will carry on until they win, regardless of how much money they lose along the way.

 

FreshFix Pictures and Oliver James Spalding

FreshFix Pictures is a film and video production company based in Norwich. Its founder, Oliver James Spalding, writes, directs and produces both short films and videos. FreshFix Pictures’ first short film, ‘Positive’ fared well on the festival circuit, receiving recognition from and being screened at various film festivals in the UK, USA and India. Aside from Oliver James Spalding, a handful of the cast and crew of Positive are also involved in All In,including actor, Alan Calton, editor, Michal Zak and key grip and lighting technician, Moyses Gomes.

The film, set in Great Yarmouth, Norfolk, tells a day-in-the-life story of Gemma, a single mother, and her two boys, Danny, 6 and Nathan, 9. When Gemma discovers that she's pregnant one Saturday morning, she tries desperately to get in touch with the guy she slept with weeks before. Unable to reach him and starting to panic, Gemma decides that she'll look for him in his local pub and leave the kids at a nearby amusement arcade. Upon finding the guy in the pub, however, she discovers something that complicates matters even further.

Feel free to check out Positive on Vimeo:

 

Alternatively, check out the trailer on YouTube:

 

 

Other ways you can help

SHARE, SHARE, SHARE!!!

Please donate what you can to help us get this film made but, if you can’t, be sure to share this campaign via email, Facebook, Twitter and any other social media platforms. All support is very much appreciated by the entire team behind All In.

The opening scene of 'All In' is now available to watch on this page. Please watch the scene, share the campaign and donate what you can to support our project.  All In is a short film about a gambling addict called Ash. Based on a true story and set over the course of a night at a private poker game, the film tells the story of a man whose addiction has left him at rock bottom, in a web of lies too deep to maintain. The aim of the project is to raise awareness for the plight of gambling addiction in a country and era in which problem gamblers are endlessly encouraged to continue their habit. We're aiming to raise £3,000 to tell this story as effectively as possible. All InBased on a true story and set over a single night, All In, revolves around Ash (Tony Fadil), a gambling addict, taking the last of his money to a late night private poker game. Ash is in his early forties; he's been married for ten years and has two children, aged nine and seven. Over the course of his marriage, his addiction to gambling has grown exponentially and drastically effected his personal life. Over the years, he’s lost tens of thousands at bookies, casinos and poker games. A year ago, after Ash lost his job in sales due to poor attendance, he vowed to overcome his addiction after his wife issued an ultimatum and threatened to leave him and take the kids. For a while, Ash managed to stay away from temptation through a job on an off-shore oil rig, but began secretly gambling again, quitting his job in the process due to unpaid debts to several colleagues. To maintain his wife’s perceptions of his new lifestyle, Ash has recently been sleeping in his car during the weeks she expects him to be working. He spends his days at various bookies and attends a private poker game a few nights a week hosted by a man name Aaron (Alan Calton). In the five years that Ash has been attending Aaron’s game, he’s lost thousands to him. Aaron regularly calls Ash and jovially invites him along to the games, informing him about supposedly poor players likely to be in attendance. Ash knows that Aaron perceives him as easy money but is ever-determined to win against his rival, willing, even, to risk everything to attempt to do so. The TeamWriter, Director and ProducerOliver James SpaldingOliver James Spalding is a Norwich-based filmmaker whose work focuses on people on the outskirts of society. Oliver studied Film at Kingston University, graduating in 2014 with a First Class bachelor’s degree. His most recent film ‘Positive’ garnered favourable reviews and feedback, appearing in film festivals in the UK, USA and India. Passionate about the practice of filmmaking, Oliver writes, directs and produces fiction and documentary films, and works as a freelance videographer, providing content for a variety of clients across East Anglia and beyond. Cast Tony Fadil (Ash)Tony Fadil is an actor and producer from Essex. He is best known for his roles in I Am Hooligan, Rise of The Footsoldier 3 and TV series Burnt Toast. In 2016 he appeared alongside Stevi Ritchie in his TV show Stevi Ritchie Takes On Essex. Throughout the last ten years, Tony has been involved in corporate work, live and interactive television, and short and feature films, as both an actor and a producer. Tony views his work in film and television as a passion and is completely dedicated to the lifestyle it brings.Alan Calton (Aaron)Alan Calton is an actor from Norfolk, best known for his roles in Austenland (2013), In the Name of Ben Hur (2016) and The Pugilist (2017). Alan’s focus has always been on acting for film and television and he has experience in both feature length and short films. Committed to the art of performance, Alan describes himself as happiest when reading interesting scripts and developing a character.Ryan Enever (Stones)Ryan Enever is an actor and writer who originates from East London. After years of different career paths, Ryan found his passion in the entertainment industry after auditioning at The Liverpool Institute of Performing Arts, where he later received a degree. Ryan is the co-owner of award-winning production company, 3 Takes Productions and has written, produced and acted in several of their projects.  Andy Turner (Tony)Andy Turner is an actor, producer and director who originates from Derbyshire. story:
80-86: Reigning in Spain and Beyond

Many of you may well be aware of the work of myself, Evan Marshall, as producer/director of Spirit of '58 for Clackity Films. In that feature length film we told the story of the largely forgotten exploits of the Northern Ireland team who reached the quarter finals of the World Cup in 1958. If you have seen the film you will know that we left no stone unturned in our search for moving archive and photographic records of the team, even discovering footage of Northern Ireland's first game at the World Cup, unseen for over fifty years, which FIFA told us didn't exist. The film was turned by myself into an even more detailed book of the same name which was shortlisted for the eir Sports Book of the Year 2016. Well researched documentary-making and sports writing is what I do. Now I want to do it all over again but for the 1980s.

I was eleven years old when Gerry Armstrong walked into immortality by scoring the winning goal against host nation Spain in the 1982 World Cup to send Northern Ireland into the quarter final groups. It is a night forever burned into my memories and during the years of 1980 to 1986 there were others along with it. Already the smallest team to ever qualify for the World Cup in 1958, Northern Ireland went on to qualify for two more in the 1980s while also being crowned British Champions outright in 1980 for the first time since 1918. They would also win the final ever British Championship in 1984 to keep the trophy forever and memorably beat the then-current European Champions and World Cup runners-up West Germany home and away during the qualifying for the 1984 Euros. This was a purple patch of success which has never been equalled before or since.

It is all the stranger then that no one has ever made a documentary which covered these glorious years in full. But that's about to change. The same team behind Spirit of '58 has been beavering away on the research for this period and will bring it alive in the spring of 2018 with a wide range of new interviews with the key players from this period, archive interviews from the vault, match footage from the British Championships, qualifying games and the World Cups in Spain and Mexico. You'll see the programmes, souvenirs, sticker albums, teams songs and the progress of the fans who followed the team all represented on screen. In short, if you've seen Spirit of '58, you'll know that we'll do this right and bring it all to life with a soundtrack representing those early years of the 80s.

If you contributed to Spirit of '58 two years ago, first of all, thank you. Secondly, you will know that clearing the archive for a film like this, which gives all the due respect to its subject matter, is expensive. 80-86 will be more expensive to clear the rights for than Spirit of '58. This time the team went to two World Cups and not one and the BBC and ITV footage will be a lot more expensive to clear than the Pathe and Movietone clips we previously used. We are confident though of raising more funds down the line for the clearances this time around so what we are looking for now is simply our start-up money. We envisage interviewing up to ten players from the team of this period and quite a few of these will be based on the mainland. Currently, we foresee a week of shooting and travelling with a crew to pay for outside of Northern Ireland with a number of days interviewing those who live locally in Northern Ireland.

On top of this we will then need to pay for previews of all the footage available and to pay for our sound studio work with a voice artist. Then there is the editing of the film later this year. We're happy to pay for the final clearances next year from future funding when post production costs will need to be factored in on the sound and grading of colour but, to cover what we need up front, and to make this film as good as it can possibly be, we will require £10,000. If we get more than that, brilliant. We'll be able to do more and do it better, but £10,000 is what we need to get a good head start and get the film into some sort of shape.

As before, there are a range of perks available to those who contribute certain amounts. The writing of the book version has already commenced and we plan a simultaneous release of film and book this time around rather than the year long gap which there was for Spirit of '58. Therefore you can opt to get a copy of the book for your donation. The full transcript book of all the interviews was a popular option last time around and we're offering it again with over double the number of interviewees this time. Donations to this fundraiser, just as with Spirit of '58, will be the only way of receiving this fully illustrated A4 book. We also aim to invite as many players as possible to the premiere next year so our top perk is a VIP ticket into the player zone with complimentary drinks before the screening.

You've seen what we've done before and now we want to do it again. Please help us make it possible so that this glorious period of Northern Irish footballing history can be documented fully in the way it so richly deserves.

If the phrase, "Arconada... Armstrong!" means as much to you as it does to me then I hope you'll join us in helping to create a fantastic record of those times.

Therefore you can opt to get a copy of the book for your donation. The full transcript book of all the interviews was a popular option last time around and we're offering it again with over double the number of interviewees this time. Donations to this fundraiser, just as with Spirit of '58, will be the only way of receiving this fully illustrated A4 book. We also aim to invite as many players as possible to the premiere next year so our top perk is a VIP ticket into the player zone with complimentary drinks before the screening.
You've seen what we've done before and now we want to do it again. Please help us make it possible so that this glorious period of Northern Irish footballing history can be documented fully in the way it so richly deserves.
If the phrase, "Arconada... Armstrong!" means as much to you as it does to me then I hope you'll join us in helping to create a fantastic record of those times.

story:
Watch this excerpt from The Devil We Know, examining DuPont's awareness of the toxic chemical that contaminated West Virginia's drinking water.

 

 

Tucked in the rolling hills of West Virginia, the idyllic town of Parkersburg is home to a sprawling DuPont chemical plant that manufactures Teflon.  The Devil We Know tells the incredibly compelling story of how C8, a chemical the company used for more than 60 years to make Teflon, ended up in the drinking water supply of more than 70,000 people living near the factory.  

"That water shouldn't look like that.  There's something really wrong with this water." - Wilbur Tennant, West Virginia cattle farmer

Shocking internal documents reveal DuPont suspected decades ago that C8 had toxic health effects, but continued to leave its workers and an entire community exposed.

“They knew they were doing it and they thought they would get away with it.  15 pennies per pound is what they saved by dumping it into everybody’s water.” - Mike Papantonio, trial attorney

The heroes who brought this contamination out of the darkness help the filmmakers expose a complex, decades-long coverup by one of the world's largest chemical corporations.  

“When they removed the women from Teflon, it was a big shock to me... I was in the recovery room and the doctor came by and said your son has a deformity.  They hadn’t seen anything or any baby like that before.” - Sue Bailey, former Dupont employee

As the story continues to unfold to this day, plaintiffs in an historic class action lawsuit break their silence about the suffering they’ve endured at the hands of the chemical giant in their backyard.

This story must be told.  But we need your help! 

 

C8, also called PFOA, is a manmade chemical long used in the making of DuPont's Teflon, as well as countless other common consumer products.  

How did C8 find its way into the blood of 99.7% of Americans?  In addition to exposure through household products, it has been dumped into our drinking water and pumped out of factory smokestacks into the air.  It has been detected in groundwater, on a variety of food staples, and in household dust.

According to the Environmental Working Group, at least 6.5 million Americans in 27 states are currently drinking water tainted by C8, including high-profile cases in Hoosick Falls, New York, Decatur, Alabama, and on military bases in Pennsylvania.  The majority of public water supplies in the U.S. have yet to be tested.         

C8 is one of the most persistent chemicals known to man - it is completely resistant to biodegradation and it accumulates in the blood.

It has been scientifically linked to a number of serious illnesses, including certain types of cancers.

 

After exposing the hidden dangers of processed sugar in FED UP and confronting gun violence in UNDER THE GUN, Atlas Films, director Stephanie Soechtig and co-director Jeremy Seifert (GMO OMG), are now tackling the broken system that has allowed more than 80,000 synthetic chemicals to go to market without any significant outside testing for health risks.

   

 

This is not about one place or even one chemical:  in telling the story of C8 in Parkersburg, the filmmakers are bringing attention to a larger, urgent social issue.  Because of the power of the chemical lobby and antiquated legislation, C8 is one of more than 80,000+ untested chemicals that have been released onto the market, their dangers unknown. Together, we have the power to inform and affect change on both the personal and policy level.

With the Trump administration's open hostility towards the EPA, the federal agency charged with overseeing chemical safety, the issues of chemical regulation and clean drinking water at the heart of this film are now more timely than ever.

 

We are wrapping up production, but the expensive part of making a documentary is still ahead.  Your contribution will be used for the following crucial components of the film:

 

We are happy to offer our supporters some great rewards that come with contributions!  These include a visit to the set of It's Always Sunny in Philadelphia to watch the filming, eat lunch, meet the cast, and potentially even be an extra.  We also have 2 tickets to attend a taping of Late Night with Seth Meyers and get your photo taken with Seth, tickets to Real Time with Bill Maher and tapings of E! News.

Just Added! SOMA filtered water pitchers, Full Circle travel drink bottles, Come Clean home cleaning kits, Sub_Urban Riot T-Shirts and beautiful baskets of organic products from Earth Mama Angel Baby! 

  

  

   

  

  

  

  

  

    

  

  

  

  

    

  

  

 

Please help us reach our goal by sharing The Devil We Know campaign! http://igg.me/at/thedevilweknow

 

I have a question about how this works? Email us at info@thedevilweknow.com and we will respond right away!

My perk came with a download of the film. When will I get this?  You will receive the film as soon as it comes out. However, it is impossible for us to know yet exactly when that will be. We will be sure to keep you updated as the release plans develop!

When will I get my other rewards?  We want you to have everything as soon as possible, but we need to finish the film first. You will definitely be notified as soon as we have this information.

Is shipping included?  There is an additional charge for shipping, depending on the country where you are located. Please note import taxes are not covered.

What T-Shirt sizes are available? When you purchase the perk, you will be asked to select a size - Small, Medium, Large, X-Large, XX-Large.  

When and where is the premiere mentioned in the perks?  It is most likely there will be a premiere at a major film festival sometime in early 2018, as well as other screenings in New York, Los Angeles and Parkersburg, West Virginia. You will be notified of the details and get to choose which to attend.

Is travel to the premiere provided? No, travel is not included. However, if we end up planning an after party, you will be invited!

How can I schedule the community screening, film consultations or other rewards that need to be booked for specific dates?  As soon as the campaign ends, we will contact you with specific instructions on how to schedule a date and time.

I can’t contribute much but how else can I help?  We understand not everyone can contribute. But you can help us reach the campaign goal by sharing news about the film and the campaign link on social media.

Be sure to follow us on Facebook and tag @thedevilweknow, Twitter @devilweknowfilm and Instagram @thedevilweknow.

We are grateful for all of your support! Thank you!

SUPPORT THE PERSECUTED CHRISTIANS IN IRAQ as 100% of the profits will go to the persecuted church in Iraq via Christian Aid - EVERY $1 COUNTS!

                     

SUPPORT CHRISTIAN AID AND GET 'DAVID AND GOLIATH' and/or 'EPIC JOURNEY' with your donation for FREE!  'David and Goliath' was the #1 Independent Film in theaters last month - NOT AVAILABLE ON AMAZON, WALMART, OR ANYWHERE!


In August, we will tour the country showing 'EPIC JOURNEY' in theaters and churches. GET 'DAVID AND GOLIATH' (#1 Independent Film in Theaters) as our GIFT to you with a donation.

__________________________________________________

TRUE STORY #12

See how a Yakuza Gangmember Found Christ in Tokyo and what the Yakuza did to him. (See more on the official site: http://EpicJourneyMovie.com)


____________________________________________________________________________

                          

'Epic Journey' has been submitted to the Guinness World Records for most countries traveled by a film crew! The filmmakers have been supported by staff from YWAM, Youth for Christ, CRU, Greg Laurie, Kay Arthur, Philip Yancey, Hillsong, Billy Graham Association, Alive Music, Rebecca St. James, Stephen Baldwin, K-LOVE, The Fish Radio, TBN, Christian Post, Family Christian Stores, Lifeway, and churches of all denominations.

_________________________________________________________________________

TRUE STORY #19

See How A Multi-Millionaire Lost $26 Million and Found Christ (See more on the official site: http://EpicJourneyMovie.com)


36 COUNTRIES.  25 STORIES.  1 AMAZING GOD.

____________________________________________________________________________

Watch the OFFICIAL TRAILER AGAIN:

TRUE STORY #21

See how a Muslim woman came to Christ and how she escaped to the underground church.

(See more on the official site: http://EpicJourneyMovie.com)

________________________________________________________________________

TRUE STORY #9

See What Happened to an African Woman Who Had No More Food On Christmas Day (See more on the official site: http://EpicJourneyMovie.com) 


_______________________________________________________________________________

"These are profound, tear-jerking stories that will shake the most hardened, cynical atheist," says Director Tim Chey, who is also the co-host along with Annie Sims.


GET COPIES OF 'DAVID AND GOLIATH' and 'EPIC JOURNEY' with your donation!  'David and Goliath' was the #1 Independent Film in theaters last month (April 2015)!
