story:
INTRO TO THE STORY, THIS IS...

A Jedi's path is not an easy one: when fear leads to hate and hate leads to darkness, you must closely guard your emotions. But how then do you cope with death and despair? 

Enter Rieko Stryder, years after a personal encounter with the Dark Lord himself, tucked away in the shadows of a Correlian bar where he encounters an old friend, the former Jedi may have a chance for redemption.

"We shall double our efforts" - Moff Jerijerrod 


For the 20 minute film, $50,000 is only the beginning. Each dollar that takes us closer to our goal is just another step to bring the community of professionals, filmmakers, and materials needed to create the Star Wars film you want to see.
Here's a breakdown of what the $50,000 will allow us to do:

Department  

Est.  Cost

Costume

 $10,000.00

Props

 $1,000.00

Rentals

 $500.00

Food

 $1,200.00

Editing and Special Effects

 $3,000.00

Make Up

 $2,000.00

Insurance

 $2,000.00

Locations, Permits, and Sets   

 $8,000.00

Crew 

 $18,000.00

Cast

 $1,600.00

Miscellaneous

 $2,700.00


If we, the Force be with us, make beyond our goal of $50,000, there are so many things we will be able to do and here is a small break down of that:

$60,000 - A bigger budget for better quality.

$75,000 - We will extend the film another 5 to 10 minutes and add story to characters you will only briefly meet but will play major roles in the sequel we would love to create next.

$150,000 and Up - We will work on bringing you the full story.  We will shoot and deliver Shadows Within but also begin producing its sequel Star Wars: Light in the Darkness.

"Do or do not, there is no try" - Master Yoda


The more people who become a part of the film, the bigger and the better it gets.

For those of you who are donating, you'll find various levels of participation that we believe will bring those who cannot physically be apart of the filming a small piece of the magic we are trying to create.  Not to mention that we will be posting updates to all of those apart from the campaign, including:

Never before seen photos of the cast and crew taken from on set of the promo. Featuring members of the 501st who have donated their time to the project and will be helping and appearing in the film when we shoot in the fall. 
Interviews from some of the cast, crew, and future audience members who are not officially part of the project. 



"Never tell me the odds!" - Han Solo

We have enjoyed every step of this journey, and we hope to exceed even our own expectations.  Even now, we are looking into building standing sets for our more prominent scene locations to fully capture the true essence of Star Wars.

We already have great things going for us. We are fortunate enough to have the support of Clayton State University's Film Technician program and the use of their studio in Atlanta, where we filmed the promo.  They, too, look forward to seeing what we are able to do with this franchise.

We have had great support from the 501st Legion. Several members have enlisted their talents to help make this as authentic as the original. Without their time and effort, none of this would be possible.

"Yeah, I'm responsible now, the price you pay for being successful." - Lando Calrissian


Now that the campaign has begun, don't think that we are just sitting back waiting for the money to roll in.  We are still hard at work making sure all the t's are crossed and i's are dotted and everything is ready for shooting.  

We will be having a few meetings with all the heads of our film crew going over designs, locations, costumes, sets, props, etc.  In the mean time, we will be putting out more interviews and photos and if we get enough support maybe even another teaser. 

"It surrounds us and penetrates us; it binds the galaxy together " - Obi Wan Kenobi


We understand that not everyone can donate to the film. Even if you can't donate, that doesn't mean you can't be a part of making our dream a reality. Just by spreading the word through social media you can help us reach more and more people, bringing the entire Star Wars fan community together. 

Keep track of our social media to see what else is happening with Star Wars: Shadows Within, and to see more pictures and videos from our promo shoot.

From all of us to all of you: thank you, and may the Force be with you... always.

story:
This campaign is get funds together so I officially produce and release my exisiting documentary on the making of George A. Romero's CREEPSHOW called

JUST DESSERTS: THE MAKING OF "CREEPSHOW"

Only available overseas, this documentary will finally be made available for North American viewers on BluRay with a host of new extra features as well.

Look for more details and announcements as the campaign progresses.

The goal is to have this out before Christmas of 2015!

story:
Do you love Sci Fi movies?  Well, we've secured the rights to the best selling US book series "Star of the Guardians" by author Margaret Weis and have a quality script ready to go.  Our vision for this epic story could be best described as "Battlestar Galactica"  meets "Game of Thrones" in space.   Check out this trailer which explains more about this cool project and then please help us by buying our merchandise!



Margaret Weis is a best-selling science fiction and fantasy writer, well known for co-authoring the famed DragonLance series used in the Dungeons and Dragons worlds.   Her novels have graced the New York Times Best-Seller lists on numerous occasions. 

                                                     

Alongside DragonLance and Star of the Guardians, Margaret's extensive work includes the following best-selling fantasy series; The Death Gate Cycle, The Sovereign Stone, Rose of the Prophet, and Darksword. Her books have been translated into numerous languages worldwide and has sold over 35 million books. Margaret is a beloved author among fantasy and science fiction enthusiasts, and her novels continue to enthrall her readers with her great characters and storylines.

Check out our range of cool Star of the Guardians perks.
Signed Bookplates
Personally signed by Margaret Weis, these self-adhesive bookplates are a must-have!

Posters
Deck out your pad with these awesome  Star of the Guardians Scimitar posters.


Concept Art
Stunning conceptual artwork, of your favourite characters and scenes from the upcoming Star of the Guardians film.


Limited Edition T-Shirts. 

Feel like a true Guardian with our exclusive Scimitar T-shirts. Available in sizes S, M, L, XL, XXL, XXXL.


Illustrated Film Storyboards. 

Experience the world of Star of the Guardians with our illustrated storyboard book featuring keys scenes from the film.



Dee Kitcher founded Filmscope Entertainment with her partner John V. Soto in 2008 and has produced three feature films since that time, Crush (2009), Black Magic (aka Needle) (2011), and The Reckoning (2013).  Our company focuses on the production of genre films for worldwide audiences.  You can find out more about Filmscope at: www.filmscope.com.au

 

Reaching our goal of $55,000 will provide us with enough funding to create development materials that include storyboards of key scenes and conceptual artwork created to a professional level that can help convince major film investors to fund our film. Hi quality, professional artwork and storyboarding is expensive and will take up the majority of the funds raised.  




When will my perks be delivered?

All perks up to and including $125 will be delivered no later than by the end of December 2015.  Perks above $125 will be delivered by February 2016.
For Associate Producer and Executive Producer perks we will contact you via email.
How do we keep up to date with Star of the Guardians during and after the campaign?
All contributors will receive the e-newsletter via email.  You can also check us out on Facebook and Twitter, where will be posting regular updates.
                                      With your support this film can be made!
story_txt:
Do you love Sci Fi movies?  Well, we've secured the rights to the best selling US book series "Star of the Guardians" by author Margaret Weis and have a quality script ready to go.  Our vision for this epic story could be best described as "Battlestar Galactica"  meets "Game of Thrones" in space.   Check out this trailer which explains more about this cool project and then please help us by buying our merchandise!


Margaret Weis is a best-selling science fiction and fantasy writer, well known for co-authoring the famed DragonLance series used in the Dungeons and Dragons worlds.   Her novels have graced the New York Times Best-Seller lists on numerous occasions. 
                                                     
Alongside DragonLance and Star of the Guardians, Margaret's extensive work includes the following best-selling fantasy series; The Death Gate Cycle, The Sovereign Stone, Rose of the Prophet, and Darksword. Her books have been translated into numerous languages worldwide and has sold over 35 million books. Margaret is a beloved author among fantasy and science fiction enthusiasts, and her novels continue to enthrall her readers with her great characters and storylines.




Check out our range of cool Star of the Guardians perks.

Signed Bookplates

Personally signed by Margaret Weis, these self-adhesive bookplates are a must-have!




Posters

Deck out your pad with these awesome  Star of the Guardians Scimitar posters.


Concept Art
Stunning conceptual artwork, of your favourite characters and scenes from the upcoming Star of the Guardians film.





Limited Edition T-Shirts. 

Feel like a true Guardian with our exclusive Scimitar T-shirts. Available in sizes S, M, L, XL, XXL, XXXL.




Illustrated Film Storyboards. 
Experience the world of Star of the Guardians with our illustrated storyboard book featuring keys scenes from the film.






Dee Kitcher founded Filmscope Entertainment with her partner John V. Soto in 2008 and has produced three feature films since that time, Crush (2009), Black Magic (aka Needle) (2011), and The Reckoning (2013).  Our company focuses on the production of genre films for worldwide
audiences.  You can find out more about
Filmscope at: www.filmscope.com.au




 

Reaching our goal of $55,000 will provide us
with enough funding to create development materials that include storyboards of key scenes and conceptual artwork created to a professional level that can help convince major film investors to fund our film. Hi quality, professional artwork and storyboarding is expensive and will take up the majority of the funds raised.  












When will my perks be delivered?

All perks up to and including $125 will be delivered no later than by the end of December 2015.  Perks above $125 will be delivered by February 2016.
For Associate Producer and Executive Producer perks we will contact you via email.

How do we keep up to date with Star of the Guardians during and after the campaign?

All contributors will receive the e-newsletter via email.  You can also check us out on Facebook and Twitter, where will be posting regular updates.

                                      With your support this film can be made!

story:
www.DisillusionedFilm.com

Like us on Facebook

www.Facebook.com/DisillusionedFilmProject

Check out cast interviews on our website 

www.DisillusionedFilm.Com

This film and this journey over the past several years are very dear to me and my team's heart. There have already been countless hours spent making this story be one of the most incredible, powerful, and entertaining film you will see.  From the first word ever written on the script, it has been my dream that everyone gets to experience this world as intimately as I have, to delve into the riches of the playground we have created and to immerse yourself into the creative layout of the "Disillusioned" experience. AND THE GREATEST part of this film is it will be completed with the spirit of unity, team, and a beautiful partnership between myself, my team, and YOU!! This film will happen because of YOU and YOUR INCREDIBLE LOVE AND SUPPORT for our vision. You will be the reason that this story gets to be shared with the world and I already cannot thank you enough! - Josh Marble (Creator/Director)

Disillusioned Logline

A group of young adults enjoying a fun camping get away become exposed to an experimental drug that make one’s deepest fantasies temporarily come to life. But when the drugs real purpose takes effect, they all have to fight to retain their sanity as they try and decipher what is real and what is fantasy.


Interview with Disillusioned Creator/Director Josh Marble

Interview with Disillusioned Producer/Cinematographer Chris Alexander

Interview with Disillusioned Producer Chris Roach


Disillusioned Storyline (WARNING: SPOILERS)

When Emma, a college-aged girl with a broken past, is coerced by her older sister Heidi and her friend Natalie to take some time away from school and a non-existent social life, they escape away to a camping trip for what will literarily the trip of their lives. 

Joined by Heidi's long time friend Andrew, his best friend Issac, and a socially awkward Peter, the group enjoy the beauty and freedom that the solitude of the woods provide. When supplies run low, the group travels to a lonely general store to restock. While there, Peter encounters a curious old man who invites Peter to partake in a special drug he claims he concocted himself; a private remedy that will allow ones deepest fantasies to temporarily come to life. Desiring to experience his fantasy and to escape the isolation he feels in his life, Peter accepts the offer and returns back to the group. Unbeknownst to Peter, both the substance and the old man are a much darker mystery than Peter would have thought to believe, and the group has just become a new set of test subjects in a twisted scientist's game.

Once back at the campsite, the group retire around their campfire for a relaxing evening, their intent solely focused on enjoying each others company. However, when it is discovered that Peter now posses such a unique gift, some of them give in to the curiosity of what it would be like to live out their deepest fantasy, while others resist the fear of the unknown. When a small skirmish breaks out over whether or not the group should be party to this unknown substance, an accidental spill causes the entire group to be exposed to the drug and victim to its effects.

Knowing there is no other option but to ride out the effects of the drugs, the group continues to explore the world of each other’s fantasies.  As the fantasies continue however, the group begin to notice that the longer the fantasies go on, the more demented and twisted they turn. After a fantasy involving a reunion of some dearly departed loved ones turns into a violent recreation of their initial death, the group fully realizes this drug is not what they thought it was.

Trapped under the influence of the drug, the group find it harder and harder to break away from these evil and demented nightmares that are now encompassing all of the fantasies. When Peter is tormented into madness by the power of his nightmare, the repercussions on the rest of the group cause them all to understand that one or many of them could die if they can’t find a solution to escaping these nightmares soon.

Film Duration:

Feature Length - Estimated 90-100 minutes run time.

Words from Creator/Director Josh Marble

Disillusioned is a story many years in the making that I am very excited to share.  Packed with action, suspense, and hair-raising moments of uncertainty, this story takes the viewers imagination to a plane of possibility where both the impossible and the possible co-exist. The line between reality and imagination, of factual and fictional, blend together in a cacophony of possibility for anything, and everything. And all it takes to get us there is one simple drug.  Inspired by films such as “The Hunger Games,” “Cabin in the Woods,” “Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows,” “The Last House on the Left,” and “Inception,” and by the direction of some of my favorite directors such as “Bryan Singer,” “Gary Ross,” “David Yates,” and “Joss Whedon”, I found myself creating this film.

This style of film provides the freedom to play in such a capacity where the story is able to come to life in a powerful and believable way. In a genre that allows for so much possibility, Disillusioned is allowed the freedom to expand all horizons and create a world where even the farthest possibilities are still possible, all the while keeping the entirety of the story in a world that does not exceed the point of believability.

“Disillusioned is a sure success filled with twists, turns, heart, soul, and romance. Just when you think you know where it’s going, it surprises you in a different direction. I love movies that make me think, and I love movies where I am on the edge of my seat. This is that movie! I am so excited to be a part of this project!” 

“Disillusioned is so unique, it really doesn't fit the mold of any particular genre I've seen before - it has something to say on a number of different levels and through completely unexpected means, which is why I'm so excited to be a part of this film. At any point, if you think you know where it's going...think again.” 

Confirmed Cast

Natalie - Robin Sydney

Peter - Mitch Field

Issac - Zo Johnson

Leah - Daniella Ruiz

Negotiations are currently in process for other Disillusioned Roles. 

Director: Josh Marble

Producers: Joshua Marble/Chris S. Alexander/Chris Roach/Alex Spear

Writers: 

Andy Freedman/Josh Marble

Cinematographer: Chris S. Alexander

Camera Operator: Kyle Fallon

Stunt Coordinator: Anthony Martins

Editor: Mauricio Perez

Composer: Vince Garbarino

FOR IMDB INFO ON EACH CAST AND CREW MEMBER VISIT OUR WEBSITE:

www.DisillusionedFilm.com

“Disillusioned is an a extremely unique and captivating story! My favorite thing about this story is seeing the completely different sides of the characters that come out throughout the fantasies, nightmares, and life or death situations.” 

"I'm excited for the opportunity to work with Josh Marble not only as a writer, but a director who has the eye of a DP and a unique way to tell a story” 

“I'm excited to work on a project that starts out with a familiar concept then quickly deviates from it and breathes fresh life into a great genre.”  

Information about Long Board Productions

Long Board Productions, a narrative and commercial production company in Southern California, was founded on the mission to produce captivating and compelling  films with the highest possible production value. Our passion for story combined with our ever growing creative vision, as well as our constant strive for excellence in all that we do is nestled right at the core of our content and is the force the drives us to create and share our content across a broad variety of multimedia platforms. Our passion for excellent narrative films is what brought us to “Disillusioned” and through the spirit of collaboration and the hard work of our team we look forward to bringing this story to the big screen and to audiences everywhere. 

“…I appreciate Disillusioned’s quick departure from the norm which offers a rare twist that extends far beyond your average teen slasher. It carries with it an inherent reach across a range of genres that expands the stories influence to a wider audience. It's a one-of-a-kind trip through the torments of adolescence and the cruelties of growing up in a world that's filled with unknowns, all of which, have the potential to push ones character to it's limits.” 

Disillusioned will be filmed using the RED Epic or RED Scarlett Camera which was used for filming the preview trailer. Shooting on either the Red Epic or Red Scarlett will allow for the option to film between 4-5K resolution which has become a standard resolution for domestic and international markets.

“What I love about ‘Disillusioned’ is that it takes a classic scenario and turns it on its head. The classic ‘Cabin in the Woods,’ sub-genre has never seen a story that plays so deeply in the mind rather than in the physical. Most films of this nature tend to emphasize the random misfortune of a group of young adults stumbling upon an evil monster ready to kill them. ‘Disillusioned’ instead plays up the concept of the drug-obsessed youth’s desires to experiment leading to dangerous, fascinating and often depressing hypnagogic hallucinations.”

The projected film schedule is being set up to prepare for a 18-day shoot spread over three weeks. Projected starting date for principle photography is Late 2015. 

We will be utilizing the funding from IndieGoGo to begin principle photography and to secure additional capital from other interested investors and match funding organizations to raise our complete budget of $100,000. 

The Disillusioned team has created some amazing rewards for our contributors ranging from signed original scripts, to a digital copy of movie, cast and crew personalized thank you videos, premiere tickets, and all the way up to being a featured extra in the film and  spending a day on set with the cast and crew. Additionally, those who really want to experience the world of filmmaking have the option to join our "Executive Producers" team. More info on our "Executive Producers" option and rewards will be provided for those interested in joining our team. 

How will the funding be used?

All received funds from IndieGoGo will be spread across all aspect of production covering essential costs such as:

Cast and Crew Expenses

Camera/Production Equipment

Food Services

Locations

Permits

Housing for on location filming

Production Design

Stunts

Special Effects

Hair and Make Up

Post Production Expenses

To support the film and become one of our backers, look for the big "Contribute Now" button on the right hand side of the campaign page. Clicking on this button will bring you to the Contribution Check Out page. IndieGoGo will ask you for your pledge and which reward you want. That's it! 


We have two main challenges. As a team who values the time, energy, and contribution of all of our cast and crew on this project, we want to honor them by paying them fairly. Our opinion is that too many films often cheat the cast and crew out of what they are due for their hard, relentless work. So our main challenge is raising the budget needed so that we can fairly compensate our team for all of their rigor and effort spent on making this film happen. We believe that a happy cast and crew equates to an even more amazing film, which in turns makes everything greater! 
Our other challenge is weather as much of this film will be filmed outdoors. We will however be creating alternative production schedules should this become an issue.

THANK YOU FOR TAKING THE TIME TO CHECK OUT DISILLUSIONED AND THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT! YOU ARE NOW AND FOREVER A PIECE OF THIS FILM AND YOU ARE HELPING MAKE OUR DREAMS COME TRUE!

Additional Notes:

• For those of you visiting our set during filming, we anticipate shooting in late 2015 in the Los Angeles area. However, this has the potential to change and we will keep you updated so you can plan ahead to visit us.

• You must be over 18 or accompanied by a parent or legal guardian (who will count as your plus one) to attend the premiere or visit the set. Extras must also be over 18.

• Some rewards may require additional paperwork.

• The final cut of the film may have to be further edited in certain cases to adhere to the laws in the country which it is being viewed, or for different types of media.

• All shooting locations are subject to change for a variety of reasons, including the amount of money we are able to raise and the particular locations giving us the right to shoot.

• For higher level donors, receiving rewards from lower levels can be dependent on availability of items with limited quantities. If a conflict arises with rewards with limited quantities we will work with those parties to find suitable replacements.

• This fundraising campaign is all subject to applicable Indie-GoGo rules/regulations, movie guild rules and applicable law. If any of this conflicts, we will work with you in good faith to give you a substitute reward. 

If you have any question or comments please feel free to contact us via our facebook fan page!

www.Facebook.com/DisillusionedFilmProject

THANK YOU AGAIN!!!

story:
My name is Jill. I am a registered veterinary technician currently living in Toronto Ontario. In November 2014 I had the amazing opportunity to travel to Nepal where I stayed for one month in the ancient city of Bhaktapur volunteering with the Bhaktapur Animal Welfare Society. 

The Bhaktapur Animal Welfare Society or BAWS is run by Dr Pranav Joshi, a veterinarian with a huge heart. He started BAWS to help with the overpopulation of street dogs in the Kathmandu Valley. Funded solely on donations Dr Joshi works to keep the current street dog population healthy by providing vaccinations and treatment for any sick or injured dogs and works to control the population through trap-neuter-return. 

Following the massive earhquake on April 25th and the aftershocks that lasted for days afterward many people and animals lost their lives and many more were injured and displaced from their homes while much of Bhaktapur was left in ruins. 

The need for financial assistance in Bhaktapur is immense for people and animals alike. My hope is to raise money for both. Half of the money raised will go to BAWS to help animals that were injured and displaced from their families and homes, the other half to the people of Bhaktapur with Dr Joshi helping me to get it to those who need it most. 

Please donate whatever you can, every little bit helps. The people of Nepal are without a doubt the warmest and kindest people I have ever met and they desperately need our help. 

Thank you for taking the time to read my story. If you're looking for more information on the current situation in Nepal please check out the link posted below for an article from the LA Times featuring Dr Joshi of BAWS. 

http://www.latimes.com/world/asia/la-fg-nepal-quake-animals-20150503-story.html#page=1

story:
George Lucas and Steven Spielberg said that there needs to be some major changes made in Hollywood otherwise the film industry is going to implode! 


SCRIPTANK.COM IS THAT MAJOR CHANGE THAT'S NEEDED!


SCRIPTANK.COM IS CHANGING THE GLOBAL FILM INDUSTRY BY EMPOWERING THE AUDIENCE TO CHOOSE THE MOVIES 'THEY' WANT MADE INSTEAD OF THE STUDIO BEAN-COUNTERS.


HURRAY! WE'RE HALF WAY THERE!

SCRIPTANK HAS JUST RECEIVED AN INVESTMENT OF $100,000 FROM A PRIVATE PARTY WHO SAW OUR INDIEGOGO CAMPAIGN AND OUR WEBSITE. 

NOW WE ONLY NEED TO FINALIZE THE LAST PORTION AND WE'RE HERE TO HELP YOU MAKE MORE MOVIES!


PLUS! WE'RE ADDING A NEW INCENTIVE!

My ebook about identifying 10 product placement tips or opportunities within your novel or script will help incentivize a deal and is available for the 

"Writer's Block" token only! 


This is a token with a total value of $140.00!

(Annual upload fee is $50 per book/script!)



ABOUT SCRIPTANK

Scriptank is an Internet social/business networking platform that is completely disrupting the global film industry and opening up possibilities for everyone from the movie audience to Industry professionals that were never available before. 


Scriptank is the first 'free-membership' platform ever to empower you, the movie audience, with controlling what scripts that 'you' want made into movies instead of the Hollywood 'bean-counters! 


Also, scriptwriters, FOR THE FIRST TIME, can make more than a million dollars with their scripts on Scriptank!

and your only investment is a $50 annual upload fee.



Scriptank gives actors a head-start on auditions by being able to attach their profile link directly to individual script characters.


  

Some Benefits:

1. Membership is 'free' to the general movie audience.

2. You, the movie audience now control what movies get made.

3. Scriptwriters can potentially make as much as one million dollars by the time their script is ready for Optioning. 

4. Scripts get completely pre-packaged in the Audience Choice List with talent, audience market research, co-production funding (at least $1,000,000), product placement, and more by the time the script is ready for Optioning. 

5.  An Option bidding-war is created for all pre-packaged scripts within the Audience Choice List.

6. Once a script gets Optioned, it goes into the Production Section where the producers and filmmakers keep the audience's interest through daily blogs and updates via the scripts profile page.

7. Then on to the Digital Distribution Section where it's released to digital theaters, VOD, and streaming to mobile devices, Smart TV's, and other 3rd party digital content providers.

8. Scriptank is destined to become the go-to place for pre-packaged movie content for all 3rd party content providers, such as Netflix, Amazon, and others.


I know Scriptank will be successful! I just need your help to launch Scriptank with your financial support!  Invest in any Token that you feel comfortable with.


Scriptank is an amazingly wide and deep platform. I have already had several people want to buy my business plan out from under me.  One was a university professor with a doctorates degree in business and her venture capital partner offered me a very large sum of money...several million dollars.  

But, I want Scriptank to be free from venture capital influence.  Your support will keep Scriptank on track for the people and not the "bean-counters".

Please participate at whatever level of sponsorship that you feel comfortable with.  

Funding Chart


*22.5% ($45,000) of the funding will go to the actual Front and Back End developing of Scriptank.


*25% ($50,000) of the funding will go to a combination of Demogrphic, Geographic, Psychographic, and Neurographic questionaires and surveys for creating accurate film Industry statistics, product placement assessments for funding production, and more.


*25% ($50,000) of the funding will go to attorney fees for developing website terms and agreements, entertainment agreements, and many other types of protections for members, writers, and others.


*12.5 ($25,000) of the funding will go to Hosting and Maintaining the actual website platform on a daily basis to make sure that it stays stable for you, the members, in your daily use and Scriptank's growth. 


*7.5% ($15,000) of the funding will go to Operations for such things as an office, computers, etc.


*5% ($10,000) of the funding will go to Marketing Scriptank to the general audience and the film industry professionals throughout the world once we launch.


*2.5% ($5,000) of the funding will go to Contingency, or taking care of unknown events or unforeseen problems.


PLEASE SPREAD THE SCRIPTANK WORD!

Share our Indiegogo link with everyone you know...and even those you don't.   :)   Thank you!


Andrew Carnegie once said, "If you want to dine with the classes, you have to sell to the masses."

Scriptank will Serve the Global Masses!


ABOUT ME

I'm a Disabled American Veteran working hard to bring something great to the masses!

I'm Roger D. Mortimer and the Founder and CEO of Scriptank...

...and like you a member of the masses.


I have a degree in filmmaking and I have more than 30 years of experience in the film industry. This experience includes working in front and behind the camera, as well as, in the business side of the Industry.  I have been the Director of Marketing and Sales for production companies, graphics and animation companies, and distribution companies.

I have given lectures about film techniques, marketing strategies, and more in Italy, Japan, and throughout the United States.

I'm also a product developer and entrepreneur.


I have been honored with being invited in 2006 as an awards presenter of an incredible International event that travels for almost 45 days throughout Southern Italy called CinemadaMare Film Festival.


       


SCRIPTANK!

Now will be Serving the Global Masses!



A LITTLE BIT ABOUT THE FILM INDUSTRY

* On average 25,000 movie scripts are submitted to Hollywood alone every year, yet less than 5% makes it to the theaters...and some are Box Office Bombs!

* Filmmakers around the world agree that many good, even great scripts go unread, unproduced, and undistributed because of the bottleneck that has been created in Hollywood! 

  

WHY I NEED YOUR SUPPORT

A typical social networking website will cost more than a million dollars to develop, launch, and host. I have designed Scriptank in sections and the first section, the Script Section, will fund or pay for all the subsequent section to be launched and so on. That's why we only need $200,000 to launch Scriptank.


I have already invested  thousands of dollars into Scriptank for things such as the initial flowchart concept, wireframes, research and development, trademarks, initial attorneys fees, and other work.


But, now the time is ripe!


It's time to build the actual website that will make this all happen. It will only take a few months from the point we are at now to launch Scriptank and make it all happen.

We want our official launch to be at the American Film Market 2015 in Santa Monica. 

Your financial support will help us accomplish this goal.


 Your sponsorship does not pay for me or my wages.  I have an income that covers my expenses until Scriptank is launched and successfully running.


NEW PERKS! 

Every sponsor $20 and above receives a coffee mug! Adding more perks as we go. Sponsor now and still receive new perks.

Every sponsor $25 and above receives a t-shirt! Adding more perks as we go. Sponsor now and still receive new perks.

New Super Cool t-shirt perk: Super Scriptank!

Scriptank Logo t-shirt

story:
~ THANK YOU TO ALL OUR CONTRIBUTORS! ~
Although our campaign has closed, you can continue to contribute to our cause by visiting www.TheBodyBeloved.com. 



~ THE MESSAGE ~

Imagine using love, not shame, to heal painful habits and addictions that no longer serve you. Imagine having kindness and compassion be the primary voices in your head rather than criticism. Imagine loving yourself with all of your "flaws" rather than hiding them from others in the hopes that you will never be found out.   It seems inconceivable, doesn't it? And yet, it is exactly what happened for me, when I understood that even with my head down the toilet, all of me was Divine.  

This is the story I invite you to say YES to, a story lovingly crafted to creates change for our generation, for our children's generation and beyond.  Rather than waiting for perfection to happen, we see our imperfections as sacred.  This quiets the critical voice inside and helps us live the life we’ve always wanted.

I already know that my story heals.  As an eating disorder therapist for more than twenty years, I am told almost daily that it saves lives.  And now, I am ready to take this story to a bigger stage.   More than 30 million people struggle with eating disorders in this country alone.   Many others struggle with similar issues of pursuing the holy grail of perfection, only to find more pain and more addiction.  

Whether you struggle with food and body image issues, addictions, or just being human, this story can help you find peace and love no matter what you struggle with.   As Martin Luther King said, BE the peace you wish to see in the world.  It all starts with me and you. 

To bring this story to life, I am presenting a one-woman show this December, in NYC.  Do you remember the Vagina Monologues and the impact Eve Ensler's message had for all of us?  This is the impact I intend my show to have.  The show is being fully produced by The Power of One team, who spreads the message that one story, my story, your story, can change the world.  



~ MY VISION ~

I know, without any doubt, that performing this show in December is only the beginning of this vision. Once created, I plan on taking the show around the world, performing it wherever it’s needed be it eating disorder treatment centers, conferences or universities.

I intend on pairing workshops and panel discussions with the show so as to deepen the viewers’ engagement with the message in their own lives. I also foresee (because I’ve already been asked this), that others will want to perform the show, including recovering eating disorder clients who are now committed to spreading the message that saved their lives.

My vision doesn’t stop here! I plan on creating the most extraordinary multisensory-multimedia online magazine to celebrate what it means to be “a spiritual being learning to be human” and to host exquisite programs and retreats to more personally support people in connecting to their bodies, minds, and spirits. 

 


~ THE IMPACT ~

My show is about more than eating disorders and my story is about more than just me. It is for anyone who is human, who experiences shame about who they are, who wants liberation from their pain.

Because we are all made up of light and dark, the way we relate to our darkness is the key to whether we live a joyful, loving life. When we reject our darkest parts, we ALL suffer. When we embrace our darkness as divine, we transform and alchemize our hidden, shadowed parts.

My story touches into the universality of the human experience and reminds us that change can only happen through love, not fear or shame.



~ WHERE YOUR FUNDING GOES ~

Beyond crowdfunding fees, taxes and the costs of the delicious perks we’re designing for you, here is an overview of anticipated expenses:

Your contribution will fund a fully-produced show which includes:

  • 9 months of show development guided by Monica Day and the team of The Power of One
  • The booking of the Cell theatre in NYC booked for 3 days from December 4th to the 6th
  • A director as well as a full production crew
  • A full video crew to create a professionally edited video
  • Travel and lodging
About the Power of One:



~ WHAT YOU RECEIVE ~

We picked two sacred numbers to inspire you to contribute: $111 and $1,111. But of course, if you are so inspired and want to contribute more or less, please follow your inspiration and do what’s right for you (by simply clicking the pink Contribute Now button above the perks).

We also specifically picked perks to remind you every day that your body is your beloved and that all of who you are is perfect.


$111 – The Power of Ones

  • A beautiful, gold, self-loving temporary tattoo
  • The professionally-produced video of my show
  • A “My Body Is My Beloved” shirt (our intent is to offer you a range of shapes and sizes that make you feel good in your body)
  • A subscription to the first issue of Quintessence Quarterly, our multi-media, online magazine, coming December 22nd on the winter solstice

$1,111 – You Are The Beloved

  • All of the above
  • A 1 day/1 night retreat at the Cloud 9 Sanctuary in Boulder, CO (includes 1 energy healing with me).  You get to actually practice bringing your human and your divine self into communion, liberating the shame from its center stage in your life.  Magic happens at Cloud 9 –some even call it the feminine Hogwarts (see a sliver of it below)!



~ THE RISKS ~

I’m taking a huge risk with my personal and professional reputation as my story is very raw and has rarely been shared even with family or close friends. Yet I trust so fully in the power of story to heal that I feel irresponsible in not speaking my truth in this way, at this time.

If even one person experiences themselves and their darkness as divine, it’s been worth every risk I’ve taken.

And… the show is happening whether it gets crowdfunded or not, so the risks are all my own.

I also anticipate that there might be backlash about the message that eating disorders are sacred, as eating disorders have the highest death rate of any mental illness. I never ever underestimate how serious eating disorders are and always insist on proper medical and nutritional support for anyone going through the recovery process. And… I believe that perceiving our struggle as divine has been the key to my recovery and the recovery of countless others I have helped. 



~ PLEASE SHARE ~

I hope this message spreads far and wide. The video was created first and foremost to impact people’s lives. Whether you choose to contribute financially or not, please share it! The kind of change that’s required can only occur when we work together.

story:
The Synopsis

A creature from another world imprisons a woman inside her house and breeds her for food. It's 'Alien' meets 'Misery' but much darker and more sinister than either. 

Our Goal

We are a small team from the North West of England  and with our funding (supplied by you incredibly wonderful human beings!) we will create a genuinely frightening and original full length horror feature film.  

Everyone on the team is a huge horror fan, but few of us can remember a recent horror film that actually left us wanting to hide under our bed covers at night with the lights on! We want to change that and make a film that really gets under your skin and leaves you terrified and shaken to the core.

We will  craft an original horror film that leaves much unexplained. We are not going to hand hold you and explain our alien or it's motives. It's alien. It want's to eat it's offspring. How could we explain the thought processes or motivations behind such an horrific thing? Much better that the film creep you out and leaves unanswered questions that terrify for many more nights to come!

 We want the film to fuel your own imagination and leave you thoroughly disturbed...


 We're not looking for cheap shocks. We are aiming for gritty realism filmed with as much  practical special effects as possible. We want to create the most realistic and believable terror that you've ever seen.

The trailer we've made is to give you an idea of the tone we're going for. None of the footage in the trailer will be re-used and the final film will look even more incredible.


(On set with our incredible make-up artist Blaise Gresley!)

Our Influences

Mostly horror and sci-fi! Some of our favourite films include:  Imprint, Alien, Xtro, The Shining, The Fly, Hellraiser, Nightbreed, Cannibal Holocaust, Antichrist, The Babadook, The Thing, Tenebrae.


The Team

We are David aiming to make a movie that can compete with the Goliath that is the big studio system. A system which spawns endless remakes and sequels: unoriginal garbage. As independent filmmakers we aim to offer you quality film-making with an original story that doesn’t insult your intelligence with a cheap cash in. 

Simon M Riley: Director/Writer

Simon's  work encompass music videos, shorts, commercials and photography with an emphasis on strongly cinematic visuals often with a dark and surreal undertone. 


Simon has always been passionate about filmmaking and shot his first short film (House of Evil) when he was 12:

"Making those films as a kid was so much fun! House of Evil involved pulling an all nighter with my cousin (and co-star) and probably used up the north of England's entire supply of tomato ketchup. We performed all our own stunts too. I think I pushed Chris down the stairs multiple times because I wasn't convinced he was injured on the descent the first couple of tumbles. Thinking back that must've hurt but it was hey it was funny at the time!"


Portia Victoria: Producer/Actress

Portia regularly helps to produce Simon's music videos and short films. She has a diploma in performing arts and has experience organising large, live, theatrical events. She has worked in the entertainment industry as a stage manager, performer and model. Her previous clients include: HBO Entertainment, L'Oreal, BBC, ITV, Vidal Sassoon and Wella.


Colin Grist: Pathway Studios Executive

Colin is an invaluable member of the team as he is onboard in his capacity to help us with some of the shooting space as well as his skills as a cameraman and equipment specialist. He also looks and acts like 'The Dude' from The Big Lebowski so his place on the team is pretty much like er mandatory, dude.



The Cast

Aside from the absolutely amazing Alex Walton (who plays the alien) the main cast is yet to be finalised. We plan on hiring the best actors out there for the remaining roles.



... And this is where YOU come in!


Your contribution will provide us with funds for locations, transport, post production services including editing and colour grading, musical compositions, make-up, costumes and practical effects. We promise you that every £  you contribute will end up on-screen and the more you help us surpass our £10K goal, the better our film will be. Together we can make something truly incredible that you can be proud of knowing you've helped create an awesome horror film! 

As if being involved in the best horror ever isn't enough we have lots of cool goodies for you as a token of our gratitude including:  exclusive merchandise, cast and crew meet and greets, VIP tickets to the premiere and opportunities to be featured in the film or get an executive producer credit!


Check out our latest Perk, the incomparable:  The Alien Impregnation Kit carefully crafted and custom made to look like our alien's penis by the insanely talented folks at Primal Hardwere.


Follow us on Facebook/Twitter/Social media and share this campaign with all your friends and family! 

Everyone who donates will also receive regular updates as well as access to our secret facebook group!

Again, this is a real passion project: we'd like to thank any and all who donate or share our campaign to help get 'The Spawning' made. 

We look forward to unleashing this very unique and horrific tale of terror on the world!

Simon & Portia

DarkHeart Films
story_txt:
The SynopsisA creature from another world imprisons a woman inside her house and breeds her for food. It's 'Alien' meets 'Misery' but much darker and more sinister than either. Our GoalWe are a small team from the North West of England  and with our funding (supplied by you incredibly wonderful human beings!) we will create a genuinely frightening and original full length horror feature film.  Everyone on the team is a huge horror fan, but few of us can remember a recent horror film that actually left us wanting to hide under our bed covers at night with the lights on! We want to change that and make a film that really gets under your skin and leaves you terrified and shaken to the core. We will  craft an original horror film that leaves much unexplained. We are not going to hand hold you and explain our alien or it's motives. It's alien. It want's to eat it's offspring. How could we explain the thought processes or motivations behind such an horrific thing? Much better that the film creep you out and leaves unanswered questions that terrify for many more nights to come! We want the film to fuel your own imagination and leave you thoroughly disturbed... We're not looking for cheap shocks. We are aiming for gritty realism filmed with as much  practical special effects as possible. We want to create the most realistic and believable terror that you've ever seen.The trailer we've made is to give you an idea of the tone we're going for. None of the footage in the trailer will be re-used and the final film will look even more incredible.(On set with our incredible make-up artist Blaise Gresley!)
Our Influences
Mostly horror and sci-fi! Some of our favourite films include:  Imprint, Alien, Xtro, The Shining, The Fly, Hellraiser, Nightbreed, Cannibal Holocaust, Antichrist, The Babadook, The Thing, Tenebrae.

The Team
We are David aiming to make a movie that can compete with the Goliath that is the big studio system. A system which spawns endless remakes and sequels: unoriginal garbage. As independent filmmakers we aim to offer you quality film-making with an original story that doesn’t insult your intelligence with a cheap cash in. 
Simon M Riley: Director/Writer

Simon's  work encompass music videos, shorts, commercials and 
photography with an emphasis on strongly cinematic visuals often with a 
dark and surreal undertone. 

Simon has always been passionate about filmmaking and shot his first short film (House of Evil) when he was 12:
"Making those films as a kid was so much fun! House of Evil involved pulling an all nighter with my cousin (and co-star) and probably used up the north of England's entire supply of tomato ketchup. We performed all our own stunts too. I think I pushed Chris down the stairs multiple times because I wasn't convinced he was injured on the descent the first couple of tumbles. Thinking back that must've hurt but it was hey it was funny at the time!"


Portia Victoria: Producer/Actress
Portia regularly helps to produce Simon's music videos and short films. She has a diploma in performing arts and has experience organising large, live, theatrical events. She has worked in the entertainment industry as a stage manager, performer and model. Her previous clients include: HBO Entertainment, L'Oreal, BBC, ITV, Vidal Sassoon and Wella.





Colin Grist: Pathway Studios Executive
Colin is an invaluable member of the team as he is onboard in his capacity to help us with some of the shooting space as well as his skills as a cameraman and equipment specialist. He also looks and acts like 'The Dude' from The Big Lebowski so his place on the team is pretty much like er mandatory, dude.





The Cast

Aside from the absolutely amazing Alex Walton (who plays the alien) the main cast is yet to be finalised. We plan on hiring the best actors out there for the remaining roles.




... And this is where YOU come in!



Your contribution will provide us with funds for locations, transport, post production services including editing and colour grading, musical compositions, make-up, costumes and practical effects. We promise you that every £  you contribute will end up on-screen and the more you help us surpass our £10K goal, the better our film will be. Together we can make something truly incredible that you can be proud of knowing you've helped create an awesome horror film! 


As if being involved in the best horror ever isn't enough we have lots of cool goodies for you as a token of our gratitude including:  exclusive merchandise, cast and crew meet and greets, VIP tickets to the premiere and opportunities to be featured in the film or get an executive producer credit! 




Check out our latest Perk, the incomparable:  The Alien Impregnation Kit carefully crafted and custom made to look like our alien's penis by the insanely talented folks at Primal Hardwere.


Follow us on Facebook/Twitter/Social media and share this campaign with all your friends and family! 
Everyone who donates will also receive regular updates as well as access to our secret facebook group!
Again, this is a real passion project: we'd like to thank any and all who donate or share our campaign to help get 'The Spawning' made. 
We look forward to unleashing this very unique and horrific tale of terror on the world!
Simon & Portia
DarkHeart Films
